8Q4qjpgccvz6uj3XjBVqTQ.text: It was a perfect evening. We got a table on the patio overlooking Las Vegas, a fantastic steak, even better appetizers and sides and excellent service. The sangria was a perfect starter and everyone in the party loved their wines. The selection of appetizers and sides was stunning and creative, we had a vegetarian in the group, who was delighted the the choices. Please keep up the great work!!!!!

vgygKd2JFI3DPOTlIpmlrw.text: My husband and I have returned to Echo & Rig several times. The consistency of great food, service, and atmosphere have upped the rating to five stars! It is tough to find a restaurant that always provides top notch service, great food quality, and a relaxing atmosphere. This place hits all three marks every time!

WnrqA-UPL2PQz07nUv6Zjw.text: My goodness!!  Where to begin. This restaurant is AMAZING!!  Hands down the very best steak I have had in the country.  I've been to many of the famous steakhouses across the US, including Charlie's in Orlando and Gibson's in Chicago.  The Ribeye Cap was spectacular!  So flavorful and bursting with melt in your mouth tenderness.  What a unique cut of meat.  Everyone at our table had something great.  We stared with Caesar salad and the Fried Spinach salads. Then had the Ribeye Cap, the traditional Ribeye and the Sea Bass.  We finished general with an incredible turtle sundae.  The whole experience was 5-star!  The ambiance was great the service was exceptional and the food was incredible.  The manager came to great us at our table and stopped by a few times which was impressive.  The wait staff constantly made sure we were taken care of.  At one point we had 5 wait staff  at our table taking care of a party of four.  We cants wait to be back!!  (Oh, and for those who like a little extra flair, don't miss a trip to the restrooms to use the salt scrub!)

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing meals!
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye Cap
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Choice of cut.

H50ASge3d7hJ5ODpB-KZwA.text: Las Vegas is full of fabulous chefs. I conducted a breakfast interview with a famous chef at MGM Resorts who asked to meet me for breakfast at Cafe Leone in Tivoli Village. The time was early. As soon as Echo & Rig opened up across the street from Cafe Leone, the chef jumped up saying, "Come with me." They took me inside Echo & Rig. They said, "It is the best!" The best chefs and bakers in Las Vegas enjoy eating at Echo & Rig. Yesterday the professionals on Dancing with the Stars opened their new dance studio named Dance with Me Summerlin across the street. All the people went to eat dinner at Echo & Rigs. The place was so packed that they had to put out tables and chairs for people to sit on as they waited. Each diner beamed with a smile. The place is gorgeous. The food delicious. Tivoli Village is masterful. Dining in Tivoli Village gives each bite the impression on the brain that you are dining in Europe. Combine the atmosphere with the taste at Echo & Rig and your experience is similar to traveling outside of Las Vegas for a weekend vacation in an exotic city separated from the gambling gaming town full of casinos.

The mushroom fries are a must try for sure. We got rib eyes and the flavor was just simply out of this world, Along with mashed potatoes, it was out of this world. I would highly recommend

nG3UItPa25R5wGJiAxueXA.text: One of the best dining experiences I've had under the service of Alpheous(spelling might be off). He encouraged us to try a variety of dishes to get the full experience. The service was top notch and the food matched it. Since we love trying new dishes, he guided to try a few that he thought we would enjoy and man, was he spot on. I can't thank him enough for his service, but more importantly, the food is to die for here.

PFmDjH4RbDUg8JNzlhHsIA.text: Steak is average but sides are what you need to go for! Portobello fries, BBQ bacon and cauliflower are just a FEW of their best.

fmocZRB3_4mvQLMc1WW_Ew.text: To clarify the hours, the restaurant upstairs is open until 11. There is a bar downstairs with only a few late night  food specials that is open until 1am.  This place is carnivore heaven. With an in-house butcher shop supplying the restaurant, you can get pretty much any cut of meat you want.  I appreciate that Echo & Rig proudly displays what farm their meat comes from. This is huge, I wish all restaurants had this level of transparency.  Echo seems to source meat from smaller organic or all natural farms, something I am very happy to see and happy to pay a premium for.  On my first visit here I opted to share a massive 48oz porterhouse with my friend. When it came out pre-sliced I was worried, but all was good when I took a bite. It was properly rested before cutting, and so much easier to eat that way. I'm now a fan of this style.  The steak was perfectly cooked, well seasoned, and good enough that it has brought me back to Echo & Rig many times.  This is now the place I crave after too many visits to Veggie House or when I need a little more (ok, a lot more) protein in my diet.   All the main dishes I have tried here have been excellent, I have not been disappointed with a single one. Notable highlights include the Lamb Porterhouse Chops, Summertime Steak Salad, Horseradish Crusted Butterfish, and of course all the steaks. You can't go wrong with any piece of meat here, but the Spencer Steak takes the crown - it's lean but very tender and always cooks to an even, perfect medium rare.  One minor complaint, the potato chips and stuffed mushroom that come with the steaks seem more like lunch items. These sides are not fit for dinner steaks and certainly don't add anything to the amazing steaks they are served with. I would prefer a choice of vegetable, roast or mashed potatoes, or even fries instead of the dry underwhelming chips.  Some of my favorite sides are the Portobello Fries & Herb Aioli, Grilled Octopus, Charcuterie Platter, Fried Spinach Salad (perfect to share, ask for it to be split in half), and roast potatoes.  The no corkage policy is awesome, I hope it is here to stay.

4RwbQjsqjJo9-V3zw7vQGg.text: Went here for our pre New Year's Eve dinner with my family. The oysters were divine. I'm sorry I waited so long to post this review and can't totally remember everything we had, and we tried a lot, salads, sides, steak, and dessert. We will be back for sure.

lHv8m1zN7qP_ENQ7LqTR3A.text: Let's begin with a shout out to the excellent manager, Xavier, who made no excuses for the poor, neglectful service of our waiter who was no where to be found except on 2 occasions...to quickly take our order and then to throw our check on the table without asking if we wanted anything else...a courtesy that he didn't mind extending to the neighboring table. We couldn't help but notice every other table received much more attentive service and the standard bone-in meat display choices to which we were not privy to. Could it be that 2 women out to dinner couldn't possible eat a large cut of beef? Or was there a passive discrimination towards 2 women who are a couple who dared to dine at this Snobberlin locale? We just couldn't figure it out. But on the merits of food alone, we would not return to Echo & Rig. Steak Tartare - Good and enjoyed caper berries. Tuna steak frites - Meh seared tuna swimming in a sea of sauce. Garlic mash was good. Jumping Beef - Beef tips in a stew-like sauce dubbed as Peruvian Demi-glass...it was ok but nothing to rave about. The only Echo we'll be dealing with is our Amazon Echo.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumping Beef - I did not jump for this

2HOPRvY0B-x-qXLKhYjoAw.text: Authentic farm to table concept.  Creative cuts and offerings. They keep things relatively simple and focus on execution and consistency.  Very nice.  Sit out on the balcony if you can.  Downstairs offers fresh butcher items and some delicious looking bone broth.  Definitely worth a visit.

U5NIcykrqTAHefURUF6N9w.text: Meat Meat Meat  The Echo experience is one that is a must try. Tivoli has had its fair share of unique eateries that have all had some sort of cool new age fusion or a gimmick thats tried to separate itself from the rest and failed. Echo & Rig has also gone down this path but has succeeded.  The layout is a bar and butchery with a outside seating area downstairs. Upstairs has your dining area.  There are plenty of reviews of echo & rig so I won't spend all day writing a review telling you the ins and outs but you must know this.  1) It's a steakhouse with a butchery, this means the cuts of meat are pretty decent.   2) The service is 9.5 out of 10  And   3) Its kinda of an upscale kinda place, dress nicely. It isn't a flip flops and singlet kinda of place.  Ok yelp said it was a $$, but it's a nice steakhouse, I'd probably say it's a $$$ And not the $$ given.

naNcn2Vn6lNyzZNN44O5IQ.text: Quite nice, a big step up from restaurants I had been trying thus far off the strip.  And located i na really nice shopping area, and great outdoor seating!  Food was good, most of what we ordered was pretty great, loved the gigantic capers, but disappointed they had no cheese board.  Anyway, overall pretty good experience!

xlZJ1be4ve0MYZVJVHrswg.text: Absolutely the best steakhouse in Las Vegas. But they're so much more, as they also have a full service butcher downstairs.   Service was the absolute best I've had in Vegas in 6 years. We were greeted by the manager who introduced himself and who the server would be, Jackson. Jackson probably could be a butcher himself with the extent of knowledge he possessed with the cuts and textures. Very friendly and always offered an opinion on the best choices to make.   I should also add the I drink a large amount of water. Most places have a hard time keeping up with my refills. Echo & Rig appeared to have a dedicated busser/drink runner that never disappointed.   Not kidding when I say the service and good was top notch.   For the food, we had a rib eye cap (8oz), portabella fries, bone marrow asada. All of which were exquisite. Let me put it this way, I will NOT waste my money on a steak from another place for as long as I love in Las Vegas.   Epic.

a4QA16T11KKsJI8aBuPU8A.text: We are locals and finally got to the west side of town! Originally they couldn't accommodate online until 8:45 but we walked in at 7:30 and they could seat us right away on the patio. Ambiance was very nice. Comfortable not too hot or loud. Our server Jesse was friendly and very knowledgeable. We had the lamb cigars, burger, and rib cap. All very good. I only give 4 stars bc The burger was very undercooked and I had mentioned I'm pregnant and weirdly afraid of E.coli but they remade as quickly as they could to perfection. Very nice place and if we can get back to this side of town we'll be back!

71thsdu5iag9h5ZH_oTTWQ.text: Brand new restaurant in Summerlin. Venture of the strip and try something new. I had Dinner with my son and we had a great overall experience.   It's very reasonable priced for the quality of the food and great service. It's a creative menu built around fresh ingredients and quality meets (review all the pictures). We both had big stakes (they also have a butcher shop in the place downstairs) - they were very tender and had amazing flavour.

XArmm66-vAberFVAX6aTHQ.text: So, I have to say my expectations were pretty high following the hype about this place from my husband.    When we arrived, I felt like the restaurant was HEAVILY occupied my males. Which I get, being a steak house. I guess.   I thought the menu was a little odd in that the sides you order with your meat come out before the meat, as an appetizer. Maybe we were doing it wrong and nobody explained it differently to us.  Aside from not fully understanding that, the food was top notch. Seriously could not complain about any of the sides (we had the portobello fries, cauliflower, and sweet potato), and my filet, which I ordered well done, was cooked perfectly without them having to butterfly it.  Overall, I'd say this is a very masculine driver establishment. Great for a guys night, business meeting, or bachelor hang, but not so much a date night or place for the ladies. Atleast that was my experience.

d18qatjTg5MVYMAfU-mFxA.text: Oh.My.God. Must eat here! Everything we ate and drank was fab. The steaks amazing. The service was perfect, attentive. I would give 10 stars if I could.

aam7PG8JYdxKh9LwhUm_ng.text: Finally stopped had lunch at this place after many failed attempts to go. I really wanted to try their HH but everytime I would try it was a fail but I decided to just not worry about that and just come for lunch. And btw HH is everyday from 3-6pm. $1.99 steak and eggs I hear it's really tiny about 2 oz of steak but hey you can get 8oz steak for $8 if you think about it.   My favorites were the calamari and the fried cauliflower. Omg I never thought I would die over cauliflower but it is just so addicting. It has a great crunch with a nice little kick to it. So freaking good. The Calamari was cooked very well and not at all chewy and it had a great spice to it.   The MAC and cheese was also delicious. It wasn't too cheesy and they used the perfect macaroni size.    We also got the grass fed filet mignon. I loved how they explain how their meats are grass fed, no preservatives, no steroids, all natural meats! It was cooked to absolute perfection and was cut for us when it came out. It came out with a awesome sauce.   The staff are incredibly helpful and really know their menu. The bartender even hooked it up with a shot! Awesome fella.   I will be returning for that happy hour tho! I just can't wait.

JeROZ4XlxBwifLTSW6xqFw.text: The brunch was awesome.  My husband and I went for our Anniversary dinner on the 4th of July.  It was a completely different experience.  I think I need to go one more time before totally taking this place off our to go place.

yELmb5FOS41fXeBzvxBMYw.text: Great food! Specialty drink great! Although I have been warned they didnt have good customer service my experience was perfect!

G6-hEFuqjpBe_t5In4JXHQ.text: Love this place, steaks are amazing and drink specials to die for!!Weekend Brunch you will not believe!!! If you dont know your cuts of meat have a conversation with the in house butchers, I am a professional chef and eat here often!!

b7CLuZmPqOIDpbPYbF6QzA.text: Wow, rather unreal that at any given moment at dinner time you have at least 3 managers on the floor...probably necessary to please all the Yelpers... still that is always the case at Echo & Rig. Today we had Derek and Xavier visit us, along with their team featuring our server Nicholas and Master Oyster shucker Leone.  While we prefer Other Mama for oysters...having a great bottle of wine without corkage fee, it was a rational choice for us to dine at Echo & Rig tonight and as fortune would have it, it was one of the best among my dining experiences here. Good thing for no corkage fee, right?   Our table wasn't immediately ready, so we waited a little in front of the oyster raw bar area on the first floor where we got to talk to Leone...the French gentleman who knows everything about the Oysters that Echo & Rig have to offer. Kushi being sold out for the night, he kindly explained to us the rest of the evenings offerings...he was very fun and informative...say hello to him if you get the chance...after all, he is directly across from all those beautiful and friendly hostesses.  We ordered a dozen of oysters, Cauliflower, Arugula Salad, Hawaiian Tuna Poke and Maryland Lump Crab Cake.  Most of Items we regularly order since they are always on point for flavor. The Crab Cake was new to us...sometime you have to keep poking to look for the actual Crab Meat, but not at Echo & Rig...it was meaty, juicy...yummy.  Not having to pay extra for your favorite bottle of wine for two is nice, but receiving excellent service from the aforementioned staff is a very good thing...especially when Leone goes beyond merely shucking our oysters and paused to educate me...a very good thing indeed.  Echo & Rig can get crowded and a little loud on the weekends...you may prefer to come during the week or early/late on the weekend...but even during their rush you'll find it's well worth the time and money.

RMiyskrwV0kBxnSBobp-Ig.text: I was so pleasantly surprised by this steakhouse. I usually dislike going to Vegas steakhouses because I can cook pretty well myself and the price/value isn't there. I feel the exact opposite about this place. If I could get the char on my steak the way they do on theirs, I would only eat red meat.   We took my mom here when she visited and had the most pleasant time treating her to a fun, nice meal. Loved the servers, food was incredible, sides were amazing and reasonably priced, cocktails were fantastic. Just trying to figure out more reasons to go...

tRDSCGvUVALyRP7nkPiHOw.text: Oh, Echo & Rig - how I love you.  What can I say? It was just that good. I must admit, I was a little thrown off in the beginning with the hanging cow head that was on display from the outside. You know, the little things that make you regret being a carnivore inside?   I dined here with my family of four for my mother's birthday dinner. Let me start off by saying that every employee we had the opportunity to interact with was beyond amazing. From the hostess at the front to the manager who personally wished my mom a happy birthday. Hugo was our server; and he was incredible!  Appetizers started out with the bone marrow carne asada and maryland lump crab cake. Let me tell you, that bone marrow was amazing; it made that hanging cow head a little less depressing. For our main course we were a little sad to hear that the restaurant was out of rib-eye cap. However, we opted for the family style tomahawk steak. Cooked to medium-rare perfection and served with house-made garlic chips & mushroom Rockefeller.  The mushroom was not the greatest part of the meal, but eh whatever. It was served with all of the specialty sauces; some of which were not all that great. If you have to choose one - definitely take the brandied mushroom! Along with our main course, we opted for garlic mashed potatoes and a caesar salad. Both delicious, but lets be honest...how do you mess those up?  Following the main course, we shared a caramel turtle sundae. It was so yummy I almost cried. Seriously! I'm not really a sundae type of lady but I'll be back for that little guy again!

Kq8jbqTm-Mdy1Sxo3Q7oHA.text: My favorite part of the day is happy hour! I am in the habit of checking a restaurant out for HH before I commit to a full meal. This place rocks! Located in the beautiful Tivoli Village it has a great vibe at the bar. Here's what we got.  4 buck premium vodka cocktails, Hanger 1, yes!  2 buck, steak and egg app. The steak was perfectly seasoned and tender. A bit over cooked for my taste but made me want to return and try the full size version rare. The egg was perfect cooked as well. Really solid app.   2 buck shrimp cocktail app. Tiny little cutie shrimps tossed in cocktail sauce. I prefer my sauce a bit more spiced with horseradish but it was good. It came on a little bed of good quality salad greens. Over all this was good but I'd probably skip it next time.  1 buck hot dog with in house made sauerkraut. Man, I love me some meat, always skip the bun and this was good. Nice and charred with classic wiener flavor, takes me right back to pigtails and the park. The kraut was solid and the spicy mustard right on the money. I'd order this again for sure.     Echo and Rig, I'll be back.

1_YiKxkAE-7tXK7Lxygrjg.text: Came in with a group of friends for a Bday dinner on a Tuesday night. It was busy, but we were seated fairly fast and close to the reservation time. Our waiter was amazing! With 11 in our party, drink orders were taken quickly and water was poured. I missed the presentation part, but knew what I wanted, so no big deal. I had the Spencer Steak with a baked sweet potato & the asparagus/egg sides. My steak was cooked perfectly to my taste & was larger than I expected. The baked sweet potato was great as was the asparagus & egg. Over all, for my 1st time here, my dinner and experience were both great & plan to return.

6tujTSEtrDlKvfMuQnBaQg.text: Echo and Rig is phenomenal! My wife and I went here for our 8 year anniversary dinner, and the food and service surpassed our expectations! I made a reso for 7pm and  we were seated immediately. Our server was very friendly, knowledgeable, and energetic. The rest of the wait staff is right on it refilling your water glass, and clearing dirty plates.  I ordered the8oz filet with bearnaise sauce, that came with a side of home made potato chips, are were excellent. The filet melted in my mouth as I anticipated it would have. We shared the caesar salad, and fried calamari. Both were excellent as well. My wife had the organic salmon,  with a side of mashed potatoes with white cheddar cheese, and she was pleased.  Overall our experience was top notch. The entire staff that dealt with us, and the manager, all wished us a very happy anniversary which we thought was a nice touch!  I would and will come back in a heartbeat to try some different cuts of steak!

M-nxMpojcl7aOxLhtbjD5w.text: Another Saturday night at one of our favorite places. Food and service spectacular...Nick (Mgr) and behind the bar...Bryan, Carlos, and Josh are the greatest!!!! You can't go wrong here with great food and even greater prices....until next Saturday night!!

87w77tCN4f_Q2gCWF6-btA.text: Amazing spot to eat! very clean and relaxing environment with very delicious food! their salmon dish is to die for! and fried spinach salad! If you haven't gone you, you must! and you'll be a returning customer thereafter, guaranteed!

AD-MN5Kai09hItyIOo5V-Q.text: Teamwork! These guys are great, from the moment you walk in the door to the way they attend to your questions and desires that you have for any your cuisines. Nicholas and his crew made our visit one that left a great impression on my wife and I, one that out-beats most, if not all, steakhouses that we've been to on the west coast from L.A. to Vegas to the Northern California Bay Area, which includes SF's Bob's Steakhouse. i ordered the Porterhouse Lamb and my wife had the Filet Mignon, both cooked to perfection and accompanied by some awesome sauces. Not only did our server, Shane, know the menu like the back of his hand, he made some changes to the dishes to accommodate our unique requests, making our dishes the best that we've tasted. He also brought out a presentation tray of the cuts of meat, which you may want to ask for if you are filling brave enough to tackle one of these giant sized portions on. The busboy was also very courteous and polite and we didn't even know he was there until we needed something, which wasn't often as Shane had our needs meet promptly and precise. We can't say enough about this place, but only that we will be back on Friday to finish out our Vegas trip with another great dinner. PS, order the Portobello Mushroom Fries, delicious!

ZlRS2DhqxUA4fNbVaSkyew.text: My husband and I came here the weekend after Valentine's day. We're seated right away and the manager warmly welcomed us. Our waiter is the best! We told him it was our first time and he explained everything and made suggestions. Service is definitely 5 stars!  Now the food! For the appetizer we had the Portobello Fries and the Bone Marrow Carne Asada. The Portobello Fries was SO GOOD!! It comes with the perfect sauce, the herb aioli. This is definitely a must try!  For our main course, we decided to share the 35oz Tomahawk steak. It comes with potato chips and the Mushroom Rockefeller and 4 different types of sauces. The Steak was done just as we wanted, it was really good and having different sauces to try it with is a nice experience.  Overall, we had a nice time and we enjoyed the food at Echo and Rig! We will be back for sure!

0r0c81Q7PQb8kUsb-35x1Q.text: A very very expensive place. I wouldnt even bother eating there when there are so many other places to eat. Service was terrible and takes a long time to be served. Very disappointing. For the prices they charge the food is not that great or tasty either. I wouldnt waste my time over there.

wFyyh1g-r0CzFQSi2y7XbQ.text: Was craving steaks for dinner last night-So went on yelp to find a local place in Summerlin .( My husband and I are new to Las Vegas. Go Knights!)  Food- the only great dish we found was the avocado toast with fresh burata and cherry tomatoes. The rib eye was cold and under cooked. I ordered medium rare and it came out mooing. Had to send it back.  The night start off with 1/2 hr delay for our reserved table. We had reservation for 7:45 , didn't get seated until 8:15. Can't read the menu cause it's like number 2 font and in very dim light . Many customers have to use their flashlight on their phones to read. Our waiter , Oscar was horrible. He hovered over the table and talk to us. I was afraid he would spit into our food on the table. When my steak needed to sent back to be recooked, my husband flagged him over . He approached our table, he beelined for the table next to us to answer a question then we had to flag him down for our request again. When we finished with our dinner, Oscar approached us for dessert , my husband said yes! We sat for 10 minutes waiting for the dessert menu. I just looked at our waiter to see if he's typing up the dessert menu. He went to the kitchen, then head to the computer station to put in an order, came over to 2 tables to get their orders, then went back to put their orders in.  Get the check for the table next door.. realized he had forgotten about us.  We didn't even look at the dessert. Was given him another chance to see if he will come over to ask about dessert, waited another 3-4 minutes.. nope no Oscar. I flagged down the manager and request for our check. It's disappointing that we won't be coming back.  Had much better food and service at Oscar's steakhouse, Gordon Ramsey Steakhouse, heck even Outback Steakhouse have better quality service!

GSRGSzvkG3x7lxCMlDSKwQ.text: Whoop whoop!  Love this place!  The meat is so darn good!  Service is excellent!  Make sure to make a reservation!!!!

LbWJ9GTK__Czqjm-2ABD9w.text: This is a very good eat place. My salad was great, and there meat is top notch. Service was good except the second half my waiter disappeared, but Caryn the restaurant manager was great and stepped up to help us out the door. If not for the disappearance of the waiter this would be a 5.

g40vy0_0BPj9woPzpHiEjg.text: I've been to Echo & Rig many times and don't have a single complaint! I usually sit at the bar where the team is always welcoming and pleasant to chat with. Whether having a meal or a couple of the small bites, the food is always amazing! Highly recommend the bone marrow, squash, or tartare. Zero complaints on E&R. Highly recommend if you're in Tivoli Village / Summerlin Area.

rQCR3ctkIewIVB5V3iTU7w.text: Decided to have dinner with my gf at the restaurant. We got seated etc. It took our server to take our order 30mins only for him to tell us he was trying to get an off menu list of food they had but didn't have it to begin then on him for him to show us. Soon after taking our order we'd expected to receive our main course after receiving our appetizers which were the oysters we ordered. Only for us to wait a full hour for our main course to arrive. Which also I may add we were ahead of another couple that which we got seated before them. As I paid attention closely they received their appetizers and then main course. Finished their food, paid, and then left. Which in this entire time we still have yet to receive our food. We then had to resort to speaking to another server and letting him know that it took our server appointed to us from the beginning to take our order 30mins and we were well within an hour to receive our main dish we ordered. Figuring out later  our main server had disappeared on us then for a totally different server to come with our food. Soon as our main dish arrived that's when suddenly our main server appeared out of nowhere. I'm not one to really complain about poor service but having to wait a full 30mins just too have our order taken and then another full hour for our main dish to be taken to our table is rather ridiculous. Which left a bad taste in my mouth and left me with no longer an appetite to eat and enjoy the food I ordered. Therefore I will not be returning to this place. Sadly I had high hopes for it seeing how it was indeed a very nice restaurant but I honestly won't be returning and would not recommend this restaurant too anyone who seeks to dine there in their quest to find a nice place to eat. Unless, you are willing to wait about an hour and a half to have your order taken then received..

Cy_wW-KgrDwFiWBHdreNKA.text: Always a family fav!  We love to come here for brunch and dinner.  Friendly staff and amazing steaks.   Service is always top notch.

T4jfMlXGjO4ccZqZthAphg.text: First time dining at Echo & Rig. Gorgeous restaurant, decor is clean and classy. The staff, was very warm and inviting, so friendly and also called you by your name as if you were family. My girlfriends and I shared the pork chop and Spencer steak as our main dishes. We started with the portobello mushroom fries and avocado toast. Sides were brussel sprouts and mac and cheese. The combo was delish. I wish we had one in L.A. I will definitely be coming back next time I'm in town. I'm sorry it took me so long to get to this gem. Thank you Chef Sam and staff for treating us like VIP's.

n9DO0nE_7s1uxRqVSkO-ow.text: My friends and I had one of the best experiences here at echo&rig. Our server was amazing (forgot his name!!) and the food was delicious. We were celebrating our birthdays and our server even surprised each of us with some ice cream. We will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hWKCiAFXHHQxOOkaMxCniQ.text: Hands down my favorite steak/brunch restaurant in Las Vegas. The quality food, service and ambiance at Echo & Rig makes every penny spent worth it. BOttomless mimosas Sundays till 3pm for $16 ! They generously  keep your glass full, offering different mixers such as white cranberry,orange juice, and grapefruit. Portobello fries are my favorite and you can't go wrong with the Blue crab cakes. The Crab cakes are nice and chunky pieces of crab. The aioli sauce is a bit heavy and i would prefer it on the side, but has a nice siracha kick to it. The steaks are amazing just ask what special cuts they have in, enough to split with another person. Ryan and Josh at the bar downstairs are on point with their service, consistently refilling our drinks, while juggling 10 plus customers at the bar and having genuine conversations with everyone.

g1CFSGINb_nuDsvRFQuhdQ.text: I've been to this amazing restaurant once before,which deserved my review then! However, I have a really good friend that helps run the place and I would like to compliment everyone from walking in the door. Everyone had a good attitude, greetings made you feel welcome. Everyone seemed to be having a good time..we got met with a three course meal. Which was really fabulous..you can't come here and not order a piece of meat! Anywho  it's a great place to come and hang out and relax..the ambiance is just right if your looking for a casual/chill night. Keep in mind they are often busy on weekends as this village is such a beautiful place. Keep it classy Echo&Rig :)

oqVpeBxr9r6DygaPtZ3aJw.text: Staple of summerlin. Great dinner, lunch and a strong pour during brunch. Whenever I have clients in town, I take them here!

17FC2QwwUEVYH0lLKapDcg.text: Was invited here for a birthday dinner. We had a large party and to my surprise we were seated outside. It was a tad chilly outside, but they had heat lamps so it wasn't too bad. Not too fancy and big menu selection with decent prices. (Small salads: $9.30 & $11.40, soups $5.90, sandwiches $12.40, seafood dishes $21.70, entrees $19.60, side dishes $5.90/8.20/9.80, and various steak prices from $25.70-34.80)   Started out with the first thing that caught our eye on the menu: PORTABELLO FRIES & HERB AIOLI. So incredibly delicious! Deep fried giant slices of mushrooms that were to die! If they weren't about 10$ an order, I think we would have gladly ordered 5 of those alone!   FOR HIM: He ordered the COLORADO LAMB PORTERHOUSE CHOPS that came with peewee potatoes, dried apricots and violet mustard. Well cooked and flavored, okay size for a $20 steak. He asked if there was a way to get a side of rice and they said no... even though I swear I saw rice included with a few of the entrees. But he devoured the whole thing easily and was overall satisified.  FOR HER: I ordered the JUMPING BEEF which were filet mignon tips, roasted tomatoes, red onions, crispy potatoes and peruvian demi-glace. Very flavorful I must say, but was a little disappointed with only 4 little pieces of meat and the "crispy potatoes" it was topped with were french fries. I did enjoy the roasted tomatoes! Luckily I wasn't too hungry from already eating the portobello fries and bread with butter, otherwise I don't think this meal would have filled me up ordinarily.   Overall, a good dining experience. Wasn't too happy about being outdoors in the cold weather (and I would complain about that more if I wasn't dressed warmly that day with a long sleeve sweater & thigh high boots) and would have loved to dine inside, but the service was excellent and food was flavorful! Wouldn't say it's a place I would want to eat at often, but definitely nothing negative to say either. Definitely a place to try if you are a steak enthusiast!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumping beef.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb porterhouse.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portabello fries.

3s6I5B2CciDTG7EXxATqJQ.text: Hubby and I came to Vegas to celebrate our anniversary. I chose Echo & Rig as our anniversary dinner based on Yelpers reviews. It was super easy to make a reservation, the woman on the phone was very nice. Other than that, I have to say I am very disappointed.  First, the restaurant was VERY loud. I understand it was VD and the restaurant was crowded, but the restaurant is all hard surfaces - glass and tile. The noise echoed throughout, making it very hard to have a conversation. Additionally, there was what sounded like dance or some sort of techno music playing (in the bar area directly below us, I presume. The bar area appeared to be small too, not for dancing) which made it even louder. I love me some techno, but in a restaurant where the main focus is a nice steak dinner? Not so much.  Second, the service was slow. In spite of what appeared to be 3 employees for every table, it seemed like everyone was moving at a snail's pace. Especially our server. Man, she was incredibly slow. She even spoke slowly. "I'll let you...relax...and then I'll guide you...through the menu." Cue her meandering away.  Third, the steak was just slightly better than ok. I've had much much better steak at many other places, even right here in Portland. I was so looking forward to this, since they cut all the steaks in-house, but while that may sound special, it didn't seem to make any difference.  Fourth, the sides. They were either mediocre (mashed potatoes I am looking at you) or they were bad. The brussel sprouts were burned in places. We could have sent them back I guess, but at this point we had been there so long all I wanted was to get out of that noisy place.  Over all, I cannot recommend this place at all.  For the money, there are lots of other (presumably better) options. (And NOT those on the Strip.)

KJpht6c6s4kpXWf6hses-Q.text: I was looking for a nice restaurant to go to with my family because we haven't been together in almost two years. So, about a month in advance, I sent an e-mail to ask some general questions and ended up being able to reserve a table for 4 a month in advance! Felicia, their Office Manager, was wonderful to work with.  When we checked in for our reservation, we were seated within minutes, even though we did arrive a little late (I was worried we'd lost our reservation!). I even took a few pictures downstairs because I thought their meat fridge had a funny quote on it ("To Beef or Not To Beef?"). Once we were seated, they came by with a huge tray of their meats. We ultimately decided on the 43oz Tomahawk steak because I had read reviews about how it was a must-try. To go with that, we ordered small dishes only: Butternut Squash, Pepitas, Strachatella & Honey ($6.40), Lamb Cigars & Tzatziki Sauce ($8.60), Pork Belly & Spicy Slaw ($9.80), Portobello Fries & Herb Aioli ($9.80), Grilled Thick-Cut Bacon & Barbecue Sauce ($8.60), and Mac & Cheese ($8.60).  Our server recommended we get the Tomahawk steak medium even though we as a family usually eat our steak medium rare. We trusted him on that one and we're glad we did! That was one of the best steaks I've had in my life. The outside was crispy and the inside was juicy and it had the perfect doneness for our taste. I even picked up the bone and started eating around it, it was that good. The small dishes were all good as well. Our favorite was definitely the Portobello Fries, followed by the Butter Squash and Mac & Cheese. The Lamb Cigars, Pork Belly Slaw, and Thick-Cut Bacon we probably could've skipped.  Service was excellent. Like I said, our server recommended that we get the medium even though we told him we usually like medium rare, but he was right on the money. They cleaned our table and set it up between the small plates and the steak. They also brought us all seven steak sauces so we didn't have to choose! I loved that. And they also came by to refill our drinks frequently and to check and see how we were doing. Between bites of food, I think we might have uttered out a "great, thank you."  Super pleasant experience from even a month in advance to getting the check. I would love to bring my family back here next time we're all together.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello fries, lamb cigars, thick-cut bacon, butternut squash, pork belly and slaw
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk steak with stuffed mushrooms and housemade chips
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly with slaw

k5geID038fk45fWRKAG4Nw.text: This restaurant on a friday night did not deliver a fine dining experience.  It was very casual in attire and service. When I asked about the "Wagyu" beef selection, the famous waiter seemed foreign about it and expressed a little arrogance. Check out my pic of the spelling on their showcase of meats and it explains why. The matre'd Xavier  was awesome in delivering great service. This place is too loud on the inside so I would suggest outside balcony seating for a more enjoyable visit. We started out with a napa cab recommended by Xavier then with my steak I ordered a different blend. Both were good and pricey at $22/glass. I couldn't enjoy it as I didn't feel I was in a fine dining experience. We ordered the portabello fries which was complemented with a delicious pesto sauce. This was excellent!  We also ordered the onion soup which was okay.  The southern fried chicken salad was so tasty and yet it was light. We ordered a burger and a rib eye cap for our entree selection.  Both were excellent in taste and quality. I didn't like the dessert menu because there was no variety except for ice cream sundaes.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly cooked,  medium rare. It was excellent in taste and quality.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger, very good.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Weird shape of a ribeye cap, but it was excellent and perfectly cooked to my medium rare liking.

Opu2dvN6K2QEPtLbycu_Tw.text: This is a nice restaurant/ butcher shop...perfect for a date or a romantic dinner. The food is wonderful. Everything we ordered was fantastic! The skirt steak melted in your mouth. The shrimp and artichoke was superb. Drinks delicious! I loved the dining upstairs, bar downstairs. Plus you can buy meat there and cook at home if you want. Restrooms clean. Prices decent for the quality of food.  Parking not so good..only had 2 parking spaces in front of the restaurant. But all else was great.

G69I-VwHXrrfnL_qUwSogw.text: Celebration for my husband's birthday was a wonderful experience all the way from my initial phone call for the reservation. The Yelp reviews had me wanting to eat here since May 2017 when we moved here from San Diego. We had a party of 13 for Doug's Birthday. Doug chose a Tomahawk Ribeye  41 oz. steak, chopped salad & Mac and cheese for our dining pleasure. Absolutely Delicious & On point. Our wait staff Beth was remarkable throughout the evening. She explained the farm to table menu, and answered all of our questions. She hustled and delivered the best service I have ever witnessed. This is also True for the entire staff AMAZING TEAM! David the manager greeted us early on as we were seating. He asked for feedback from 2 of our guests on issues with their entrees and made it right on their separate checks. As if this isn't enough, happy hour M-F  best deal and excellent staff to embibe as your guests arrive. Wonderful 1st Time here for all of us and from the entry station with friendly welcoming staff to the salt rub in the lavatory ... I am your tallest Fan! Thank you again BETH for a much needed night of enjoyment with our family.  Echo & Rig is my #1 steakhouse! Thank you David, you run a good ship! Excellent Staff! Deliciousness .

nfPKcqblVL93HSF_LpZBrw.text: Very very nice and chill ambient. Very nice weather today, so we sat on the patio.  My dad had filet mignon. It wa Avery soft.  I had brisket. It was surprising good. The brisket was flaky and juicy.  We loved our dishes.

rOtuxDzFu3PD_JK01NJ6jw.text: Amazing food and 5 star service. This restaurant is our family favorite! We also get all out meats from the butcher. You are missing out if you stick to strip steak houses!!!

KF6wrgXSqEMXM_sqj02G-g.text: Nom nom nom nom! Delicioso! I had to drive 25 mins from the strip but it was perfect! Bottomless mimosas for $16 and the meal was about $15 for nice size portions. I had a steak scramble that was surprisingly good! The staff was very attentive and so was the manager! I will definitely be back. It looks kind of posh but very down to earth atmosphere.

bXppqtCBQg7pR_6p6q4FHA.text: Wow. This is easily in my top 5 meals of life. We had the calamari which was pretty good. Then we had the butchers sausage, this great meaty smiley lamb sausage with a nice cool minty Greek yogurt sauce.   The mac n cheese had great texture and layers of flavor. The mashed potatoes were pretty good too.  The steaks were cooked perfectly and the char and crust you get from the red oak is PHENOMENAL.  NO CORKAGE FEE. This alone is a great reason to come. Also their service was stellar.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye mac n cheese mashed potatoes

fs6N4juSKvmUJCVFHGKNjA.text: This restaurant is beautiful and the service is excellent... Add to that incredibly delicious food! What more could you ask in a steak house?

X8mXTUwFOrlsSIU3aV68Ug.text: First things first: I love this place. I love the food here, because it's consistently awesome.   Tip: make reservations, always.   My beef--we came here Saturday night for a lovely dinner with friends. It was SO HOT. Seriously. I'm always cold. I'm running a heater on my legs as we speak, and the temp in my building at work is set at 74 degrees. It's cold to me. And it's 104 outside. That's how ridiculous I am. But when we came here Saturday, I think their air broke or something. It was nicer on the patio with their misters.  We asked the waiter about it a few times, and he just kept telling us it was because they wouldn't shut the door. Honestly, we were here so long that I went to the bathroom 3 times and each time, a breeze would come in from the outside patio. It had to be over 80 degrees in there. Maybe even over 85. Even our wine was really warm. It made it not so pleasant to drink.   Our waiter was good. He was really slow to come around and take our orders. But once we placed the order, he was very attentive. We got there at 7:30 and we didn't leave until after 10pm. There was only 4 of us. I think he was very overwhellemed at first, and they seemed short staffed. He did bring us some icecream because he knew we were really hot, and fanning ourselves most of the night. It was nice of him...and because I'm sure he didn't want us to complain any further. ;)  The food was amazing, as always though. I had the Bavette cut, which was insaney better than I was expecting. Crazy tender and so flavorful. I LOVE a really well prepared and cooked steak.   I really do love this place, and I highly recommend when it's not crazy hot in there. But it was pretty shitty that we spent a good amount of money on being miserably hot, and drinking hot wine with our dinner.

zCTXoZm6sTiet06TmLhd3g.text: Echo and Rig has become my all time favorite restaurant. We love coming here to eat. The food is amazing along with the staff. The prices are much more reasonable then anywhere on the strip and better food in my opinion.  Highly Recommend!

adNsHDsnj6SvU7IqAB9Cqg.text: Echo & Rig is our go to for brunch. The food is fabulous. The endless mimosas definitely help!   However, our most amazing times are when Raelynda is our server.   When your server knows you to the point of stopping everything just to run up and give you a hug ... that's not just service.  That describes a place of inclusion, going above and beyond no matter what, and gratitude.   One of the managers always comes to check on us. We even have our special table we sit at.  Come. Join friends.  Enjoy. Ask for Raelynda. Always.

LBIUKcd8o17LGU3TPvnUAg.text: This is hands down my favorite place to have brunch. There's so many places to have brunch but Echos service is amazing, from the hostess to the bussers and servers, they're all great. They have good food and my favorite, bottomless mimosas! My friends and I love celebrating our birthday there. Our last 2 servers were Adam and Jesse and we absolutely loved them, all our others servers have been great as well. I ordered the butcher blend burger and it came out exactly how I wanted it, on my previous visit I had the ultimate BLT and that was good as well.

0LFwP5fVPz72obZyNQJxNA.text: Located about 15 minutes from the strip, Tivoli Village had a charming Italian feel. We had watched a movie at the Regal theatre (with the luxury loungers) and wanted to grab a late dinner. Echo and Rig was a wonderful surprise. Their butcher shop is on the main floor and the restaurant is one flight up. Great vibe. Service was as stellar as the food. Every dish was well thought out. We started with the fried spinach salad (ask for the dressing on the side) that was like a good intro to other awesome things to come. The mushroom fries was delightful. We decided to split our entrees. He got the steak with homemade chips while I got the shrimp with artichoke hearts and together, they made for an excellent surf and turf dish! Everything about our dinner was just perfect! I even enjoyed using the salt scrub in the ladies room on my hands! The only negative was having to listen to the manager flirt with female customers in the next table, it was kinda off-putting we decided to skip dessert. But overall, a really great find and would recommend this place to anyone!

RQDRZL20A_pZzD50Kn3kyg.text: Came for dinner with friends and as a vegetarian I was so full when I left I practical had to roll out. They serve family style so it wasn't obvious I didn't have a True entree. We came around 7 on a Wednesday evening and they were already sold out of a lot of their featured dishes which was disappointing to my friends. Especially since our waiter (who was otherwise amazing!) was not quite up to date on what they had or didn't have so he had to return to the table twice with bad news. They have a host who is comes to the table and is a little socially uncomfortable and the staff is incredibly rehearsed when chatting about the menu sounding forced. But we were there for the food and it was outstanding.  It is super loud so if you are going for a quiet romantic dinner this is not the place.  Will absolutely go back soon!

WaWSP_Ql4Bh_m4GwwnweHg.text: This place is amazing! We went here to celebrate a friend's birthday and I've been meaning to come back again. We were seated outside and was attended to right away.   I am not a big fan of steak but I have learned to love it after having steak here. So trust me when I say, it's really good.  Also, order the bone marrow appetizer. You won't regret it!

zcydMKIw7xykeNaBqq5hiA.text: Very disappointed last night.   Salad was full of watermelon. (I guess because watermelon was the cheapest ingredient among them all???)  I ordered  the red wine demi sauce never arrived at my table along my Tomahawk steak.  My Tomahawk steak was 49 OZ.   It was over seasoned. (Too salty) I had to drank 5 bottle of the water.  I asked for medium- rare, ended up, my steak was served half well done and half was rare. So I assume they have no idea how to cook a steak over above 18 OZ.  Nevertheless, never going to show up again here.
