5BZnz-73VAw5FdLdqDAf_g.text: Had lunch here for the first time today and I was disappointed with the food. I ordered the steak salad and although I had taken a few bites I decided to take a picture to share. The steak was very good but that was it. There was about 3 slices of steak. It was romaine lettuce, red onion, mango and steak. The salad was very bland and was missing vegetables or something...anything. Wish we just went across the street to Brio or Cheesecake Factory where they have amazing salads. My friend had the quinoa salad and she had to add salt, pepper and lemon on her salad because it had no flavor.   What we did enjoy were the French fries and portobello fries. Those were both great. He bread and butter served was also very good but hoped the bread would have been warm.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak salad...blah.

zEz573eD9GaMWVPRO3GNlA.text: I went there for brunch on a Sunday. The spacious and bright entrance with the aroma of food was very welcoming. Hostesses were friendly and seated us right away. Dining area was nice and comfy. They were pretty busy at the time, but our order still came in a timely manner. Food was nothing wow, nothing fancy, but relatively legit. We ordered some portobello mushroom sticks, steaks and short rib hash. No complaints.   Would come back again. Great place to spend an afternoon in a nice atmosphere with decent food. Recommended!

SUVVwP__8KWbQB_jkIsLow.text: If you want a seriously good steak without the seriously high Las Vegas Strip prices, go to Echo & Rig. Admittedly, it's well out of the way given it's location in Summerlin. Clearly, the place caters to upscale locals. But you should take an Uber, taxi or drive your rental car to this restaurant. I ordered a different cut called the "bavette." It was amazing. Timothy, our server, was knowledgeable and very helpful. I will go back to this restaurant!

e6P6hhEs8EliliqXHxvCRg.text: Amazing HAPPY HOUR!!! Bartenders are awesome and always giving great customer service. Can't go wrong with $5 kettle martinis and $1.99 steak and egg. :)

SMlT5njsA0PBs70N3tl5Kg.text: Can't wait to try , we've ordered a few things for thanksgiving... I hear they have great quality meat ..

S-1Dok2JA5iAGiCCepJpkg.text: Have been ordering meat there in butcher shop. They always can get you what you want. Delicious calves liver as an example. Great service and they call you in about two days after you order. Restaurant is great too.

IwtTMKKm-o6htW95hcVjmA.text: Yes, we went there at lunch time on a Saturday, but I still expect the establishment to have enough staff on, to do a good job for the customers.  I'm celiac and should have walked out as soon as I looked at the menu but we were close to a half hour before even seeing a menu and we just wanted to eat!  Almost everything was something I couldn't eat.  For the price one pays, it seems like places could keep gluten free bread in the freezer so that everyone could enjoy the menu.  We waited between 20 & 25 minutes for a table and as it was finally our turn to go upstairs to eat, we were told there was one table available for us right in the middle of the place.  No rugs so it was VERY noisy.  At around 100 degrees, but overcast and with a slight breeze, we opted to sit outside.  Got our tea within a few minutes along with the menu, and then waited another 20 minutes for a waiter.  We were just about to walk out when the waiter came back.  He said "how are you" and I said "Hangry."  No apology or concern for the time we spent waiting since we got there.  45 minutes to finally have our order put in.  The food was fine, but mine was quite limited as I couldn't eat much on the menu.  I don't write many reviews, and I admit we were older than most of the patrons there, but can't help wondering if that's how they keep out us older folks who expect good service and food from the place.  And, no matter what, I always leave a healthy tip.  If I want to go get something from a limited menu with loud ambience again, I'll stop in at McDonalds for some fries.  And I'll get served faster too.  By the way, I worked several years as a chef in different high end restaurants, and when things worked well, it was because there was enough staff to do the job effectively.

dYYWbg-uh0977ViWcenmzg.text: Came here for my Birthday.  Was looking forward to "picking" my cut of meat. After all, it's a butchery.    I asked for a nice New York, 26oz or so.  The Waiter came back saying they only had a 20 - 21oz.  OK, I guess. Turns out they make cuts ahead of time, bring them around on platters, and you pick from that.   My Wife ordered the Rib Eye Cap.  Waiter comes back 5 minutes later saying they ran out of Caps.  Ordered a Tomahawk Rib eye (much more than she wanted) to get the cap from that.  Wow, so far 0-2, and it was only 6PM. Made me wonder what the choices would be available at 8PM.  Onward.  Drinks come, Appetizers come, Wine comes, all very good.  Then....  My New York Steak.   Impossible to cut with the supplied steak knife.  The reason? Gristle.  1/3 of the steak was inedible gristle and fat.  When the waiter came by to check on our status, I pointed that out, he apologized, but that was that.  No manager to come by and at least check the plate of Gristle and perhaps replace the steak.  Her Tomahawk Rib Eye. Cooked to perfection.  She enjoyed the cap part and gave me the rest since my steak was all but unedible.  Being local, and living in the area we like trying different restaurants available to us.  We expect to pay premium prices for "high end" restaurants.  We never mind spending $$$$ when we get the value.   The waiter was good, bus service good.  But really, if you're a butchery, the steaks should be flawless, you should be able to pick the size cut you want.  This one clearly was not, nor did I have much of a choice.  Will never go here again.  Too bad really.

7esh_atLZLLtFD0brxA2jA.text: Love love love this place. I bring all my friends here when they come. I love the fact it's a butcher too. Amazing beef, steak tartar.... soup, steaks,.... BACON.... omg.... I need to eat there tonight.

9GN7IZ0WG_VwI6JAiBSPyQ.text: First time eating there this evening.  Incredible service and food!  One of new favorite places to go.  Perfect spot for date nights, business meals and dinner and drinks with friends.  Tonight ordered many of the small plates to share and a bottle of wine, perfect portions. Can't wait to go back and try their full dinner selections.  Our waiter Dylan was spot on.  Will always request him every time I go from now on.

QSvadzLbAtrlhx2NPqvxfw.text: Fantastic! Service, food, everything was great and very reasonably priced. I live in Henderson but will definitely make the drive back here. Try it!

IkWNh_t8OJJtjnnjgF6Iuw.text: Visiting the area and staying at the JW Marriott, we were seeking a unique place to enjoy a birthday dinner. On a suggestion, we decided on Echo & Rig and so very glad we did!   Conveniently located with valet service, this butcher shop/restaurant was an instant hit when we walked in the door. An open concept with a trendy feel, the immediate impression from the receptionists were warm and welcoming!  We sat at the bar for pre dinner drinks and enjoyed a sampling of the homemade beef jerky! It was fantastic!   We requested a balcony table because the inside seating was rather loud. We hoped to hear each other throughout the dining experience and it would be a challenge inside.  Because we asked for balcony, we had to wait a bit longer but we didn't care. The bar drinks, jerky and conversation were keeping a smile on all of our faces. Nevertheless, the manager approached us to apologize and presented us with complementary appetizers - tuna poke and watermelon & cucumber salad. Both were so light, fresh, and awesome!   Now I was even more excited about dinner!  We sat down and our waiters were attentive, funny, and professional - we could tell things were only going to get better.   Then, the waiter did it. He brought a wooden tray that held the massive cuts of beef available for purchase and boy, were they pretty!  The menu was loaded with so many tasty looking things we decided to make a buffer between the 4 of us.   We ordered a 40oz steak which arrived on the bone and was cooked perfectly! Our table also held all of the following: bone marrow, risotto, grilled cheese, crab cake, Brussels sprouts, stuffed mushrooms, grilled corn, and bottles of wine. Everything was fantastic!  I would definitely return! What a fun dining experience with a great view and table setting. Awesome service from everyone we met as soon as we walked in the door.  Only downfall - noise level inside, but that won't keep me away if we are in the area again. That grilled cheese with braised short ribs is calling my name!!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything is for sale and the charcuterie items are a great way to kick off the night!
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A view of the butcher shop from the sidewalk!

ZvvoeTSE9NH0TUQV-tgQBA.text: Unless you're sleeping under a rock, you know that Echo & Rig is one of THE best places on the west side. Let's start with their cocktails - every single one I've had (most recently the Cucumber Cooler & the Tequiling Me Softly) is well-balanced and shockingly NOT overpriced.   On to the food.  While there are many reasons to come here for brunch (the bottomless mimosas, the excellent selection, the quality of the food, etc), there is ONE reason that beats them all and that, my friends, is the bacon. Order a side of their thick-cut bacon and then, moments later, order another. Trust me on this.  Their dinner menu is out of this world as well. They have a huge selection of small plates that are excellent for sharing. Last night we had the steak tartare (TBH this was my least favorite item though - was a little bland), the bone marrow carne asada (inventive!), the octopus (tender), and a few other things. We also ordered the bacon (twice), obviously.  I'll be back, I'm sure, and SOON.  PS On a scale of 1-10 for ease of eating keto here, it's an 8.8 - the menu doesn't list what has gluten and what doesn't and there are many mystery sauces, but it's super easy to modify.

A2s977KaaQkYtkF-r9hAkw.text: My 3rd Time here I am obsessed. This restaurant is better than any restaurant in LA and is somehow less money. Their steaks are amazing and their service is on point. All of their small dishes are amazing highly recommend the portobello fries, avocado toast, Brussels, pretty much anything. All the servers are beyond helpful and gracious. Oh and let's not forget the bathroom is equipped with some yummy smelling sea salts that make your hands smell and feel oh so good. Please open one in Southern California.

nbQcKC7gfSDvJZt6HeVCkQ.text: Food and service were excellent. Fried spinach salad was light and tasty. Caesar Salad was great. Steaks were fabulous. I had a ribeye, my companion had a NY strip. Staff was attentive without being distracting. Not cheap, but still I'd say it was a good value.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat cooler in the downstairs butcher shop.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Various meats ageing in the cooler.

txrJTgqNafemjlVbatr2kA.text: What a great happy hour experience! Ryan is by far one of the best bartenders we have ever experienced! Totally enjoyed the steak and eggs for happy hour plus their delicious filet mignon!

sLOP7GgLVggwr53yopNamA.text: I wasn't sure what to expect. I came here with several friends from LA. The restaurant is located at the beautiful Tivoli Village. We got to the restaurant and were greeted with a couple hostess. They lead us past the bar area and upstairs to the dining area parallel to the outside balcony eating are.   What a beautiful restaurant! We were seated and sparkling water was offered. Bread came out. We were celebrating my friend who was newly engaged so it was nice that they brought out free portobello fries for us to try. OH BOY- they were heavenly.   We all ordered the Spencer steak with horse radish cream. I got the medium rare. We each got a side. We had kennebec salt/pepper fries, brussell sprouts, creamed kale and a beef tartare.   Everything came out so perfectly delicious. The spencer steak was about 8oz and it was plenty big. It came out with chips with the steak.   We all tried various creams and sauces. I enjoyed the horseradish cream and the bbq one. But to be honest, they were all delicious. The service was perfect. The staff was friendly, very informative and then provided us with a delicious dessert at the end to share. It was absolutely perfect. I was told you could also bring your own bottle of wine to the restaurant. So I will definitely have to do that next time. Also, I will need to try their brunch!

APBWn_7cIWCz-bnfZmMIRg.text: Solid food, great ambiance and location. Enjoyed the service as well. Definitely worth the drive away from the strips. Prices were excellent for what u get!!! I'll come back for sure.

kRrX6nBBGJqDOCcoBOSZ8Q.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. Service is top notch and the food is amazing. Mushroom aoli fries is my favorite mushroom dish in the entire world!! I can't get enough of it! And their tomahawk steaks are cooked to perfection with different sauces to choose from.

8vGeAFxUC8vPQcPXs69OMw.text: Huge value for steak away from the strip's high prices.  Tip, ask to see the beef tray and pick a larger cut, worth it.   For bacon versus burn ends - get the Bacon!   Mac and cheese wasn't special, probably try potato next time.  Veggies and salads were good.  Disappointed they only have sundaes for dessert, but was too full anyway.  Great bottles of wine for $40 on the list.  Lots of good beers on tap.  I can see why this is a well-reviewed locals place.

M50hHwz0NdFo62r4hnui4g.text: Great steakhouse and I always sit outside in the upstairs terrace. The servers are very knowledgeable and helpful if you have any dietary restrictions. The food has always been delicious and I've had several different cuts of steak, all of them were very enjoyable. I try to always bring friends or family here when they are visiting Vegas.

Cl6SrhZi_5iWcNPeaN2Vzw.text: Echo and Rig was amazing. They took amazing care of my boyfriend and I. Our waters were always full, the appetizers came out quickly, and our main courses were amazing. We made reservations and I had mentioned it was for our anniversary. When we were seated, multiple people came up to us and wished us a happy anniversary! We even got a free dessert! We will 100% be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel Turtle
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese and Grilled Thick - Cut Bacon &amp; Barbecue Sauce

Vj5rqxV3GsTabloWLXnbdA.text: Our experience was sensational we were greated by a lovely hostess who then had us seated by another hostess who couldnt have been more lovelier she asked us how our day was and told us to enjoy the food. The staff is amazing . The manager Beth came over and told us alana would be our server and she would be right with us. Alana comes over and gave us great suggestions.  We ordered the short rob hash which was phenomenal and the salmon Benedict and steak frites. We also did bottomless mimosas which are $16 and alana and the back server Reuben kept them flowing. We were seated next to a table who clearly had to much to drink and ended up trying to walk out on their tab when they did end up paying they stiff the server who was just as excellent and us being the service industry rustled up some cash to tip her (pay it forward).  Alana recommended us the cinnamon toast crunch french toast which we loved and beth sent us over a salted caramel ice cream complimentary for our good dead which paired amazing with our french toast. Honestly this was the best brunch experience I've had and I will def come back and ask for alana she was so fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak frites, salmon Benedict, short rib hash

4smBcJEfiOIekwjPJ-6Esg.text: This place continues to impress me. The service, food quality, food presentation, and surroundings say your gonna spend $500+ on 2 people but the prices are very reasonable. I maybe a little off with my basis of comparison since im from Honolulu where a comparable place is double the price, but still looking at Micheal Mina prices at the Bellagio make this place a bargain. Ive been 3 times and every single time was excellent nothing short. The Tomahawks that they present are almost perfectly done (I say almost because it wasnt sousvide and I make my own Wagu Tomahawks at home sousvide and of course mine are the best). The porkchop is so good id rather have that.  Ive taken a bunch of different friends and they all loved the place. I love all the sides and the special sauces...getting hungry just thinking about it.

s52Zn2qPzAbjE0nr7FSpuQ.text: Overall: It was ok.   This came highly recommended from friends and family so perhaps they had a better experience than tonight. So highly recommended that we drove from the strip all the way to Tivoli Village (30 min drive approx).  The ambiance is very nice, we received a very warm greeting upon arrival and were seated promptly on a busy night without a reservation. Upon being seated we were greeted by the manager and addressed by name.  We sat on the patio which overlooks a beautifully lit water fountain, enclosed by soft lighting and warm architecture. Chairs were very comfortable and the patio was nice and warm, even though it was a little on the chilly side outdoors.  The service overall was decent but not the top-notch attentiveness that we noticed other guests receiving (perhaps they're regulars, who knows).   I wasn't expecting a Michelin level of service, however, friends and family raved about how awesome this place was so I had high hopes. The prices are very reasonable, $25-36 for a steak and wine options starting about $40/ bottle.  Upon ordering, we were promptly served fresh bread, smooth butter & sparkling water. We placed our orders, and management sent us a tomato watermelon plate in advance as their apologies for the delay in the arrival of our food (I wasn't bothered by the wait, it felt like an acceptable length of time.)   After receiving our food, the level of service we were receiving faded.   We didn't have a large appetite so we went with tapas and sandwiches. Neither the burger nor steak chimichurri arugula sandwich met our hopes but the mac n cheese was absolutely DELICIOUS. The steak on the sandwich was (medium) was burned, maybe cooked in a hurry, but burned. I didn't want to look like an ass going to a steakhouse and asking for a sauce to drown it in. The burger wasn't bad but far from amazing... let's compromise with "ok".   As the night continued, refills were promptly refilled by the attendants, just the overall level of service from our actual waiter fell flat as he gave nearly all of his attention to the party next to us.   I was very pleased with the presentation and plating that they received, I especially loved the part where they brought out their steak cuts prior to cooking and then brought out delicious juicy steaks. I wish we could've had whatever experience they received because everything seemed to be delightful at that table.  Perhaps our problem was going the wrong night, with the wrong appetites, ordering the wrong thing.   We ate 1/2 of our food, still left a reasonable tip, and just called it a night.  The waiter offered to give a comp, but we value your efforts (not those people who complain just to get free stuff) and what it takes to run a restaurant.   Nevertheless, I really really wanted to love it, but unfortunately, the best steak I've eaten in this town wasn't served here.

5X2-7wKilhnLTo2BVsiw4A.text: Very bad experience the past 2 times here. Was a few Sundays ago.  1st time received raw chicken oysters. They didn't separate it well enough before frying. fries where undercooked as well and not hot- like they came from the fry bowl set on the side  2nd time I came here, salad had soo much sand, they didn't wash their greens before serving. Also my rib eye was overcooked. I give up. I don't even see a chef watching what comes out of the kitchen. Food like this should never hit a table.   Our whole table ordered a drinks as well. My girl never received her wine. She was the first to order. They forgot.  We came here right after lunch before dinner.   Menu is great if executed correctly. Fast food places are more consistent. Group of 5- spent about $250 including tip. $50 check average for a nice ambiance. Would just buy a steak downstairs and grill it at home

f7avYLVQx2uTZF1Xf63v2w.text: I am not sure how this place has such good reviews... unless we just came on a bad day. We had reservations for our group of about 12-16 people for our friend's bday on a Saturday for brunch.   So where do we start....  1. They were trying to seat us at 2 different tables where 3 of us would be at a separate table. They decided to put tables together so we can sit at one table but then half the group sitting on the booth side weren't able to get out..  2. We had several different workers come to the table getting the birthday girl wrong when we already told them who the birthday girl was.   3. Some of us sitting on the other side of the table had sun in their eyes from the window and I believe it was the manager who decided to get a large napkin type thing with scotch tape to cover it up. Asked one of us in the booth to move so the waiter can stand up on it to put it up. Classy...  4. After ordering, we were told that some of us would get our entrees before others and we asked that we get it all at once... Half of our table got their orders about 40 mins before the other half. They said that some orders take longer than others but some of us had ordered the same exact thing but still received our food at almost an hour apart.... so half the table were already done eating when the other half just began.   5. Also, when they brought out the food, they were handing it to the wrong person. Everyone at the table were switching their dishes and drinks. Smh.  6. Mimosas are a ratio of Champagne and juice, they kept pouring our glasses all the way to the top with Champagne and kept forgetting to bring out the juice.  7. They brought out 3 different sundaes for what they thought were 3 people's bday lol. And then a few moments later, another waitress brought out 3 more sundaes... and ended up just giving it to us. Not complaining about that but for the fact they they are so unorganized and confused.   I can keep on going but i'll leave it at that. We had so many different people waiting our table and I'm not sure if this was training day for the workers or what but every single worker looked confused or like it was their first day of work. It was a busy afternoon but I'd think they'd have some better service and should be used to busy days since they are considered a fancy steakhouse.  Although their food was really great and maybe they were just having a bad day, I'm not sure I will ever come back...

V6495SdXUd5FdfoO61Xh8Q.text: Celebrated my husband bday so called ahead for reservation and explained it was my husbands bday. We had a early dinner so probably don't need reservation unless you go for dinner at peak hour. We were greeted right away and escorted to stairs to go to our dinner table. I feel that hostess  should of asked us if we were able to walk up stairs and offer alternative as a courtesy even if can't see physical ailment  ( I have a knee issue). Seemed more of casual atmosphere which I wasn't expecting due to moderate price of menu. Tables were all together and not much privacy. The music piped in seemed more like we were at party then nice dinner. I We were greeted by server Luke who was friendly and knowledgeable about menu, he spoke a little fast though. I had skirt steak and potato chips came with it, which I would encourage chef to change that item  offered with steak( chips) The steak was tasty with red wine Demi sauce. I usually have mine MR but server recommended Medium which I did enjoy. I had kale salad with tasty citrus dressing. I prefer no stems on the kale. My husband ordered the lamb chop which he rated fair "too chewy". The manager ( I think, he didn't introduce himself) did come around and ask us how was Everything. Appreciated The spanish waiter who brought us ice cream with toppings with candle and had a BEAUTIFUL voice!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skirt steak and chips
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Echo  &amp; Rig entrance
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steaks

dzvD1M1_5JVaDKVeVq1DFQ.text: Came to this place for our friends bday (party of 8). Good location and the ambiance was really nice. When we got seated, we were greeted by our server. At first, he seems nice. He took our order for drinks. Drinks came, and all of us looking at the menu. A few minutes later, he asked what the kids are going to be eating. We ordered the kids food. Half an hour later, the kids food came and then he showed us the types of meat and cut that they're serving. He asked the bday boy what kind of meat he likes to eat. Our friend ordered his food. An hour later, our server still hasn't taken ALL of our order. We started getting annoyed cause he was catering to the tables around us (4 tables to be exact. 2 ea. On 3 and our party of 8). We had to asked another person if they can take our order, he eventually came and took all our order.  Our 645 reservation, our food didn't arrive until almost 9pm.  We weren't really sure if our server was having a bad day but the way we were treated, I'm for sure not coming back to this establishment.

I56We3KMYy9Qzggdro5rlA.text: We absolutely loved our dining experience here! I made a reservation per other reviews which I'd also highly recommend because it does get pretty busy. We were seated within 5 minutes of arriving, just in time to get a drink at the bar. We came for my husbands birthday. I subtly mentioned this to the hostess because she asked what brought us in.   She must've told the manager because they made sure our whole dining experience was phenomenal! The manager checked in on us a few times making sure we were satisfied etc. All while being super friendly and getting to know us a bit. Our waiter was also friendly and very prompt with water refills because my husband drinks A LOT of water with meals ha.   We chose to sit in the outdoor patio. Absolutely loved the ambience and it was more than warm enough with the heaters as well.   I had the scallops and my husband had the NY strip. Both were amazing!! They surprised my husband with the caramel turtle dessert. Which was superb and very thoughtful!   Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our visit and I'd say it's an absolute must try when in LV.

WqmW89ioDIvP9RwkPLpHlQ.text: It was my first visit here today and I can't even explain how great it was. It's such an excellent place for brunch!   First, the food. I ordered the steakhouse scramble. I believe it consisted of filet mignon, potatoes, egg scramble, bell peppers, onion, etc.. it was so delicious, light and filling! I ordered coffee on as well and it was so good (I had 4 cups). We also ordered the bacon and avocado which was also amazing. To finish off, we ordered the dark chocolate cherry sundae and the berry sundae which were both so good. My cherry sundae consisted of chocolate ice cream, cherries, walnuts, and some type of cherry candy. I can't say enough good things about the food, you must go and try it yourself!!  Second, the service was amazing. The waiters were constantly checking up on us and they were very attentive. I wish I got their names but they were in the bar area. Another thing is that we walked in there (around 11ish) and they said that the next available table would be at 1:00. However, the bar area is first come first serve so luckily we got a little spot over there. I would recommend making reservations ahead of time.   Overall, it was such a great experience. The waiters were so friendly and the food was so good. I really would like to come back for dinner one day. And also, on the price range list I'd say it's in between $$-$$$. Can't wait to come back one of these days!  P.S. they offer Yelp cash back!!  **also just wanted to add that the restrooms were immaculate and so boujee. They had a complimentary hand scrub which was a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cherry sundae
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steakhouse scramble
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry sundae

1ZJbwll3c6bev9hfDh3pvA.text: Been here a few times and usually for a celebration.  Service can be a hit or miss type of deal. However, food is always excellent (except for the desserts which I'll get to later).   So why 3 stars? It was my friend's birthday and she had a reservation for 8:30pm for a group of 20. Tell me why we didn't get seated until 9:20pm? I understand it's a large group but don't promise us a reservation for a certain time if you can't accommodate. I consider myself a pretty patient person but even I was getting hangry having to wait that long. That knocked off 1 star for me. Onto the food.  Appetizer: Mussels with shoestring frites in lobster broth - Mussels on the smaller size but they were sweet and perfectly cooked. You get a good size portion for the price. I thought the shoestring frites were actual fries but they're more like the ones you ate as a kid from the yellow can, except these were fresh.   I also had some of my friend's portobello fries and they were fried perfectly and texture was perfect.   Entree: Flat iron steak sandwich: this was so good! The steak was cooked perfectly (medium rare) and was so tender. It came with a side or crispy potato chips.   I tried my friend's grilled cheese with short rib and that was bomb! I would get that next time. The Drunken Goat is another great option if you're going for meat-free.   I knocked down another star because of the dessert. I was so disappointed! My friends and I ordered the apple pie and berry shortcake. I could've made these at home. The "apple pie" was literally 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream, 2 sugar cookies, and topped with cold apples with cinnamon. How the heck is this apple pie? Same for the berry shortcake (2 scoops vanilla topped with berry mixture and shortcake cubes). No effort at all into the dessert. I was still mad about the "Apple pie" when I got home that night.

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels in lobster broth with shoestring frites
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Apple pie&#34; and &#34;berry shortcake&#34;

qRYdTi_zdRsHDkkehZd8GA.text: What's not to like about this place?! Friendly outgoing staff. Tasty well prepared dishes. Very reasonably priced for the amount of food. Beautiful outdoor balcony overlooking the city lights. We had an absolutely delightful dining experience. Don't miss the cauliflower small plate or the caramel turtle sundae. Delicious. Already looking at my calendar to see when I can come again!

SeofpJ1yc04yO8at7e3JDQ.text: Hands down the best place i've been to in Las Vegas. Great food and the best service I have ever had. Recommend this place to all!

ktCDZ719Mqc0DwHlpX_jvw.text: I have never had better service in my life. One of the best meals I have ever had. The meat is ridiculous and so is every other dish served. Well done chef Sam Marvin!

Td5cq8OaIOVosANl0c96zw.text: First off I'll start by saying as a chef of 6 years this was the most delicious and all around amazing dining experience i have ever had! My mom sister and I went while visiting Vegas for my birthday celebration everything from our waiter ari who was awesome made me feel comfortable and at home and the manager whose name I forgot kept checking on us and engaging in conversation. my lamb porterhouse was delicious my mom's filet mignon perfect and my sister's hangar steak spectacular there meat is all butchered in house grass fed and all around delicious they bring u a slab of meat to ur table so u can see what ur getting the marbilazation and size and cut of the meat. Being a chef I obviously asked alot of questions about there menu and the waiter and manager answered all my questions with exact and knowledgeable responses. I had inquired about the pork belly but did not order it and the manager saw that on our ticket and brought it over for us to try and also brought us a couple different sauces to try and everything was spectacular! they also brought me a completely hand made desert they're ice cream all made in house along with the candied peanuts house made carmel and shaved chocolate was absolutly delicious I can not even begin to express how perfect that was. They also have a salt scrub in the bathroom to leave ur hands feeling brand new! The drinks were perfect as well we asked for an off the menu drink and it was made to perfection along with they're wine selection being quite delicious! All around a perfect dining and entertaining experience! They are very apriciated!

mnCsnl1ydYf-LGZGjXI2Gg.text: Absolutely magnificent. I love this place. Family took me here for fathers day and have been back three times since. And best of all the price is right.

z7J6a-DAjp0VZrHMdl4iPQ.text: Wow! We finally ventured off the strip and couldn't have been more impressed.  Staff here bent over backwards to serve a delicious and memorable meal. Kudos to Xavier and Kendra as well as the other servers that made our finale meal in Las Vegas one to remember.  My husband said it was one of the best steaks he has  ever had and my butterfish was excellent. We will be back.

tyfvsCQwlY1qxemHw4vYHg.text: Echo and Rig is now THE best place in town for us. The Steak Tartare is not only wonderfully prepared, it is an excellent value.

bMEOZacy59_x7NCtKffs-A.text: Nothing beats an intuitive bartender that knows his craft, well done Jeff. It's so rare to find an establishment that has great staff, good food and comfortable environment. First time here although we live right around the corner, and I have to say, Echo & Rig nailed it. We shall return often:)

3sYn2wMRuDifmdPM8E_skQ.text: Echo & Rig is great. The service  was good. The food was cooked to our request and the butcher shop staff were helpful. Will Return.

jYreFlz6ICW5XgjIiaMeGg.text: So sad that we had an awful experience. I am giving 2 stars because the menu is wonderful, prices seem fair but we never got our food! We were bombarded with people the minute we walked in and had a hard time finding a nice atmosphere due to the blinding lighting (it was 7 pm) and it looked like broad daylight. We got our starter within 10 minutes but after 45 minutes and watching other, newer bar mates receive their food we asked about ours.The bartender said "do you want me to check on it?"... That should have been the first warning. He came back and waited  on other guests and we finally got his attention to ask if he found out about our food and he said yes, 10 more minutes, when we said it it had a long time so he said the kitchen was backed up ( there were 2 others at the bar and 2 other 2 tops in site). We then waited more than 10 with no word or apology so we asked for the check (twice). We couldn't pay until the bartender got his manager and he came over saying our food was coming but we were literally trying to leave at this point. I am most sad that I wanted so badly to eat here, the food looked great and other than the horrible lighting in an otherwise nice atmosphere the restaurant was just a compete miss, we won't be back and really hope they can get it together so others can enjoy a potentially great restaurant. Shame, shame. Summerlin needs a good restaurant that can stick around. Unfortunately, I don't think they can cut the mustard. This is bad for all of us.

3zaPXLHuDDb6RV4xHgU_Cw.text: My Wife and I are self professed foodies and frequently dine out in this incredible culinary Mecca of Las Vegas.  After all the rave reviews about Echo & Rig, we were looking forward to another Sin City delight. We had our chance last night and first impressions did not disappoint.  The atmosphere is airy and the host staff was courteous and polished.  After seating, the Manager personally greeted us and welcomed us as first timers and introduced his waiter who gave us a splendid review of the menu and the trimmings.  After the menu introduction, he brought an up sell meat board to our table to present large share steaks.  When asked if all steaks presented were prime cut quality, we were told that some were Japanese wagyu and others from a prestigious cattle ranch.  Game on!  We ordered the 44 oz tomahawk rib eye with garlic cheddar mashed potatoes, fried egg asparagus and a crab cake appetizer.  The bus staff was efficient close to the point of annoyance but a welcome reprieve from being ignored in some reputable eateries.  From this point forward things turned around a bit.  The waiter told us ahead of time that our large rib eye would take a bit longer to cook and would be served to us medium.  We fully understand the extended wait time and eagerly waited for the monster Dino bone to arrive.  The steak arrived sliced tight on the bone by one of the support staff along with our side dishes all looking fabulous.  The waiter very briefly glanced by the table to ask about satisfaction before being given the opportunity to inspect.  A quick okay and on his way. We separated the steak and found most of the expensive meat to be nearly raw.  A bite of the end piece was chewy and not the superior quality we expected.  The potatoes were cold and pasty and the fried egg asparagus was little more than a cold fried egg on overly al dente asparagus.  We waited for some time for the waiter to respond to us for a satisfaction check without luck.  The efficient bus crew arrived at the table before being able to speak with the waiter to ask if we were saving the meal.  At that point we decided to box up the uneaten steak to slice up for sandwiches later.  After sitting for some time with our carry out back at our side, the waiter finally stopped by for the glowing review and was shocked to learn of our dissatisfaction.  He asked if we would like to speak with the manager which felt like a bit of an insult.  An establishment with a glowing reputation would send the manager without question for resolution. To further the insult, the waiter whisked away and reviewed  our signed bill while we were gathering our belongings at the table presumably to make sure his gratuity had been added. At this point, we felt our review and the loss of our future business would be most appropriate.  On to the next adventure.

sPeI4AcqJz2q66xUZ3ZRuQ.text: With all the good steak house in Vegas, I will not be returning. My Filet was over cooked & bland. Server brought me the wrong coctail twice. My sides were cold & atmosphere feels like a cafeteria.

n2ByB01hUvWMYv-NgpwzUA.text: From Happy Hour at the bar to dinner upstairs, service was outstanding.  We had the Spencer steak. Delicious. We also enjoyed the cauliflower, calamari, and onion soup. Thank you, Mr. Flores, for your attention to detail.

2bi_9Y36sZIvA8XPqGEPow.text: This steakhouse was okay-good.  Not great, not spectacular, just okay-good.  The martinis are amazing and the portobello mushroom fries are spectacular.  But the service is ok.  We had a manager come over and greet us after we had sat for about 12 minutes.  He was the same manager we had just seen at the bar finishing off a half glass of wine.  Pretty unprofessional if you ask me.  The waiter we had was again ok.  Nice guy but really had no sense of urgency.  I will say the water guy and bus guy was on it.  Made sure we had full glasses of water at all times.  Really the only people working hard.  Everyone else in suits just walked from one side of the restaurant to the other trying to look important but did very little the improve the experience.  The waiters follow suit.  Steak was good but nothing spectacular especially for the price.  This is one of those places that sides do not come with a steak.  Mac and cheese was terrible and dry.  Stuffed mushroom was gross and dry.  And you can't order a salad without ordering it like a meal at $13.  I will probably never return.

wUGexnAR-bhLSn1FFkMy5A.text: Love everything about it. Never had a menu item that I didn't like!!! This place I'd the real deal.

1-CrIy2y7EUDaLc0DvINBw.text: Amazeballs! The portobello fries are the best! We also had the sweet potato and rib eye. Everything was delish! Cleaned off my plate!

pKPW6eOKV6KekeK7h6lA1Q.text: Man, oh man. I ate dinner here last Wednesday (before Thursday) with my family and I am so pleased we made that choice. First, this place is beautiful but classy with a sweeping staircase taking you from the large and well provisioned bar to the dining room upstairs. Having heard the volume can be somewhat loud and wanting a more intimate experience, we asked for the terrace. Even though it is outside, the heaters were great! It was the perfect balance of being able to look over the beautiful Tivoli and feel warm too. On to the service; it was perfect. We were given the "spiel" and the wine we brought was opened (with no corkage fee!!) and poured like we had just gotten the most expensive wine on the menu. After we ordered, it was like the water and wine fairy just kept our glasses filled without us even noticing. The food was also stellar, especially the pork belly and grits, the bacon and the brussels sprouts. We each had a different steak and they were all cooked perfectly and had lots of flavor which was just enhanced by the little sauces they serve on the side. Overall, a great experience and I will be stopping by every time I am in Vegas from now on.

lmF11aMT5qYqv-hksut6Ig.text: Purchased your turkey feast for our thanksgiving dinner, everything was wonderful. Directions easy to follow and the turkey came out just right. Sides were just not the ordinary....simply delicious and did not  have to spend hours preparing! Highly recommend it .

hndHiyFOXUzn5HaCMWOnsg.text: Great premise, beautiful concept but lacking in so many ways. The servers are woefully unprepared. Some of the food was excellent but several dishes spent too much time under the heat lamps turning med rare into med well. Needs work. Hope it lasts long enough to work out the kinks.

yZqrtqO-5T3k8i66e8DJhw.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a month now. I saw a lot of great reviews in both facebook and yelp. I looked over the menu about 5 times. We finally went to eat there tonight since we got a sitter. The place looked amazing. The hostess takes you passed the butcher area up the stairs to the restaurant. When we got there she sat us in the corner which I thought was nice since I was on a date with my wife. We were greeted right away by someone offering us our choice of sparkling or still water. After that it went down hill. The server took about 15 minutes to come over to even talk to us. Then he gave me a hard time when I asked about the menu. He said he was going to get us bread and would be right back. He didn't show up until after our small plate of garlic shrimp showed up...which by the way is not what it sounds like. It's shrimp chunks and a crouton. Then he disappeared for another 20 minutes until they were serving the steaks. When dropping the entree off he asked if we would like anything else. I asked for the drink menu... He forgot the menu.  Then he didn't show up until we were almost done with our food and I asked again. He leaves right away and comes back. I ordered a beer and it didn't come until we were done. Then we realized he never brought the Mac and cheese we ordered that we saw such great reviews about. He did at least apologize and told is he failed us. The only saving grace was how perfectly cooked the steak was. Also the mushroom stuffed with bacon and garlic chips were good. The chimichurri was straight up oil... But the horseradish sauce was delicious. I wish this experience would of been better, the location and potential for this place is great. I honestly would give this a worse review based on the service if I didn't like the steak so much.

FhwiSpDXH9lBCAFcygmw1A.text: I've been here twice and both times the wait has been crappy. The first time the server forgot about our table after we were seated. He sat another group after us, took their orders before us, and of course they got their food before us. Anyway, the second time around was ridiculous. We had reservations at 8:30pm for a friend's birthday dinner. Tell me why we didn't get seated until about 9:20pm!! Everyone was already there waiting so it's not like they were waiting for everyone to arrive. I'm pretty sure if we showed up 50 min. late we would have lost our reservations. Definitely 1 star down for that!  As for the food it was pretty good. I ordered the Maryland lump crab cake for an appetizer and it was yummy!! Lots of crabmeat!!! My friends ordered the portobello fries and the mussels with shoestring fries for appetizers. The portobello fries were really good especially with the aioli sauce. The mussels were okay in my book. For the main course I ordered the grilled cheese with short ribs. It was amazing!! I ordered that the first time I went also and I think this time around it was even better! One of my friends ordered the drunken goat sandwich, that was actually pretty good also.  But let's talk about the dessert, I was totally disappointed in their desserts!!! We ordered the apple pie & berry shortcake sundaes. They were both just sad, sad desserts. The apple pie was just a scoop of ice cream with dry ass apples & a sugar cookie stuck in it. They lost another star for these crappy desserts. They need to redo their dessert menu!!! I probably won't be back for awhile unless someone decides to come here for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels in Lobster Sauce with Shoestring Fries
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple Pie Sundae
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Short Ribs

VoIZOikcRZ0ace8tMIVwaQ.text: Hands down best service restaurant in Las Vegas that's consistent! Whoever the manager is that trained the staff did a great job...there's a lot of fine dining restaurants out there that should learn from them. The food choices are good during brunch and the atmosphere is perfect with just the right amount of acoustic resonance that is bearable when the place is at full capacity.

MMz2v-BTNC4u-tYDYDYATw.text: Never go on a Saturday.  Had to wait 40 minutes for our table and we had a reservation!  Service wasn't great, extremely noisy environment.  Prices were pretty good, food was average.  Had to confront the manager and she comped is a small order of French fries as a concession for the wait!  Lol There are way too many restaurants here in Las Vegas that offer better food and service.  Never again.

zHSaBSUGfxn8CP5cMvSP5A.text: I let the quality of the food prepared here speak for itself! Tivoli Village is a great atmosphere to begin with, and the ambiance of the restaurant helps keep that feeling of luxury and style afloat without being pretentious or stifling.   It was by chance that my family first found Echo & Rig and we were sooo happily surprised by what we  found. The servers are well versed in the menus and can tell you all about the origins of the kitchens ingredients.  They have a good list of  bone-out steak options in the 8 to 12 oz portions, but what steaks the show are the a la cart bone-in cuts!  Ask your server to see the bone-in steaks and out comes a tray with monster cuts of beef. New York, T-bone, or tomahawk ribeye, the quality of the meat is visible from the other side of the table! And cut to feed the table, 39 oz tomahawk is nothing but jaw dropping.  Served with a variety of different sauces to please your palate, as well as a host of small plate appetizer/sides to choose from, Echo and Rig the dining experience fun and full of tasty morsels.  I highly recommend coming in and experiencing the fancy food in a casual and contemporary dining atmosphere. It's not cheap, but for the quality you find on your plate, the price is quite reasonable.

UkkpoQMvC_D3Dk727VwfGQ.text: 52 mins in...and we're still waiting on appetizers...womp womp..I sooo wanted to love this place

nB5WodImwOVH17A2d8N-dA.text: What a great evening with our friends. We all had steak Rib eye and Spencer steaks. For starters we had the portobello fries, they were fantastic. Caesar salad was prepared well and lets not forget the crab cake. We had a bottle of red and white, which went perfectly. The turtle dessert was the kicker as we rolled out full and happy.  We love this place!

B0G6XbGlXVodW6XYOiaqog.text: The staff were super attentive. From the receptionist to the barman, to the lady who showed us to our table to the manager who greeted us to the junior greeter to the waitress to the food servers to the wine server to the suited man who just patrols through the tables tapping them until you are ready to pay and he runs your check. Everyone asks multiple times if you are OK.   But after we left we thought about what we were actually there for and realized the massive service roll out masks the fact that this place is terrible at the basics.  We had to wait 35 minutes for our reserved table. One of the side dishes to our mains came to the table 20 minutes before all other dishes and got cold in isolation. The medium steak had to be sent back. We are not fussy but it was so rare it was cold. The steaks were not anything special.  I will not go back. It was exhausting having a dozen different people ask how you are when the failure to deliver the basics shows they dont really care.

YnlePv1cBnXi9HW8sftL1Q.text: Best steak I've ever had. I was skeptical of the menu, as it seemed a bit "trendy," but now I'm convinced.  We went off the menu to order a 40 oz. Tomahawk Ribeye and a 38 oz. Porterhouse for six. Four or five vegetable sides. Sides were all delicious. Steaks were out of this world. Sauces too, especially the Red Wine Reduction.  Shout out to our server, Ryan. Knowledgeable and competent, guided us through everything. I'm one who's willing to pay for this kind of service.  Romantic night out? Get on the balcony.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fP6G4DFYgovzYLy_xoRNeA.text: Outstanding find in Las Vegas. The food is so good - a level higher than most strip restaurants. The chef here takes great pride and creativity in his food choices and preparations. The food has been consistently good, great tasting, seasoned and delicious. All staff are excellent and the quality of care and service is reminiscent of a Michelin star eatery.

gkriHUdqedWEmxkICAoWmg.text: This place was fantastic. I came into town for a trade show and heard about this place. It is off strip a ways, but certainly worth the drive. The food quality and service were impeccable and surprisingly had very reasonable prices. Especially for Las Vegas. We had the portobello fries, bacon, burnt pork ends, watermelon tomato salad, awesome steaks and an off the hook caramel ice cream dessert. Will definitely be back next time in town! Thanks echo and rig. Rumor has it you are coming to SoCal. Can't wait to try it out back home!

VlFCSnynymHj9KkCqMpnpQ.text: An absolute lovely restaurant that with its dim' lighting truly sets the romantic mood. Even if you don't like Steak' please ask them to show you their Steak-Menu! Wait to be surprised!!!

jqYRXguDfag94qszXHyDpQ.text: I've been here too many times to count, and I will continue to come back. The food is great, the ambiance is beautiful, prime location and excellent customer service. All the staff (for the most part) is attentive, friendly and professional- but Augustine, the busser, really stood out. He went above and beyond and it motivated me to write this review. Out of all of my visits, I remember Lauren and Oscar also- they are amazing servers. I highly recommend their brunch: Short Rib Hash, Breakfast Sandwich, bottomless mimosas (and you get to pour the amount of champagne vs orange juice which I loooove!)  For dinner, the lasagna is really good, Portobello Mushroom fries are a must, all the steaks are incredible and you can grab your own cuts of meat to cook at home  at the butcher shop on the 1st floor. I also enjoy the corn and Mac & cheese for sides.   All of the cocktails are yummy but I'm personally a fan of their Bourbon Cassowary cocktail- it's very booze forward. Whether it's brunch or dinner, you will definitely be impressed!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib Hash and bottomless mimosas- My go to!

i84Af6Z7In6VbzEOVCq7DQ.text: Just had the best meal we've had in a long time. I made a reservation one week in advance to come here for my husband's birthday (not sure if we had to reserve that early, but when we arrived they were not taking walk-ins). The parking is super easy - there is a parking garage and valet is also available. From the beginning to the end the service was amazing. Our waiter, Rich, was so patient with us and explained everything on the menu with such passion that it made me want to order everything. We ended up sharing a tomahawk steak, caesars salad, and several small plates. Everything was so delicious! And they even gave my husband a birthday dessert which was also delicious. THANK YOU Echo & Rig for the amazing dinner experience! We hope to come back soon! (The steak tartare was AMAZING ) (the salted caramel turtle ice cream was to die for). I'll be dreaming about this meal tonight.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak tartare
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 36 oz. Tomahawk ribeye &amp; garlic mashed potatoes
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato gnocchi with mint-pea pesto

olPYHxHuzd9mynlvc27o2g.text: FOOD RECOMMENDATION: YOU CANT COME HERE AND NOT TRY THE PORTOBELLO FRIES! The aioli dipping sauce is amazing!   EXPERIENCE:  I've come here several times for brunch and loved it. I often sit on the patio when the weather is nice. Service has always been great. Except once. I came for my birthday with my mom and wanted to order a glass of wine from the HH menu. My server told me I would need to go downstairs and order it from the bar myself as they couldn't honor happy hour prices anywhere but the bar. Went to order my drink and the bartender was a jerk. I mentioned I wanted Chardonnay and he named off all brands that they had, never mentioning that it was happy hour and they had a Chardonnay on there (which was actually very good). The person next to me at the bar actually passed me their happy hour menu.  The bartender seemed bothered that I wanted to order from that menu instead. It just sucks b/c you choose a place to celebrate a special event/day then you're treated poorly. ANNOYING! I didn't let his dry attitude didn't ruin my birthday dinner.   My server was amazing and brought a birthday dessert and a sang HBD! Food was amazing. No complaint on my meal or my mom's. I will be back for sure. I just know not to go for happy hour when I have to deal with the crummy bartender. Will probably only come for brunch.

-8O85N5qWqvSXJnv_0WKLw.text: Luis our server du jour was beyond brilliant in his service, attention to detail, and overall experience.  He was pleasant at every turn and made our special night ever so memorable.  We loved his recommended Spencer Steak.  We will be back. Ask for Luis!!!

UluVekqEd-Wpq18BQIThLg.text: Good food, great area. We've been to Echo and Rig several times. We love that you can bring your own wine...and the food is great. It can get VERY busy, loud and crowded...be selective about choosing your seat and you'll enjoy the experience more.

MNDnTV6OYsJnX3J137Gpjg.text: This is one of my favorite steakhouses! Super nice place in Tivoli village, great service and amazinnng food. You usually get seated right away unless its a big party or during holidays.  We tried going on New Years Eve and it was packed with a long wait. I went on a Sunday and did not have to wait, also they do reservations for big parties. The Mac n Cheese and the Portobello fries are a must in this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye steak!

MDTQS1pr0kFUSTUeAKFVUQ.text: Came (way out) here for brunch based on the great reviews. Ultimately brunch was decent, but I was a bit disappointed at the disparity between the reviews and our experience.  We ordered the Short Rib Hash based on the recommendation of the super friendly butcher downstairs before being seated. We also ordered the Farmer's Market Breakfast and the Blueberry Buttermilk Pancakes  In order, I'd rank them #1 Farmer's Market Breakfast, #2 (tie) Short Rib Hash, #2 (tie) Blueberry Buttermilk Pankcakes. The problem with the hash was that it was bland. The potatoes were cooked to perfection, they just weren't very flavorful. I also wish there was a bit more meat in the dish. I really liked the vegetables in the Farmer's breakfast. The pancakes were good, and I appreciated the real maple syrup.  Our server was attentive, if a bit matter-of-fact. The water server was nice, but unfortunately had just started and hadn't yet tried any of the menu to give any recommendations. I'd recommend to management that they allow all employees to sample the menu so they can offer recommendations to guests.  If I lived in the area, I'd come back to sample the dinner menu, but not sure I'd make the trip out from the strip again.

xVmA5kzi3ctqDCYtJlmXYw.text: Love this place always recommend it to family and friends that come in town and are willing to get off the strip to go eat some delicious food.

EMSOa36hf2xIDezvBecdYw.text: Came here on a Monday night and we had to wait a few minutes for our table. It was worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello Fries
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad

mcCKh9ALji0PjDtiLsLt2A.text: Love this place!! My boyfriend and I went in August for his birthday and they treated us so great!! It was such a great experience and since we were first timers they gave us a whole explanation on meats and our server even gave us a taste of various types of sauces. He was amazing! During the summer time the outside seating is amazing! I definitely recommend going.

zXojJXMfAMkVJZOnQVLkiA.text: Went in on a Saturday evening WITH a reservation. Waited at the bar for at least a half an hour (not a problem) had some champagne while waiting for our table. This was our first visit, we tend to like T-Bones, SW Steakhouse, Prime....but since we recently moved into One Queensridge, we decided to support our neighbors. Well what a disaster! We were led upstairs and sat at the most embarrassing "bistro" type table that was not only unstable but was meant for either children or the smallest humans on earth. I can't imagine spending several hundred dollars on a bottle of wine and at least that much on dinner just to sit at a pathetic cafeteria style tin table. For such a pricey restaurant one would think they would invest in better seating for their high paying customers. Needless to say, we declined to stay, told them no thank you and we wouldn't be back. We had better service and were very comfortable at Brio. Don't waste your money here, drive up the street to the awesome T-Bones...you'll thank me!

2LcXlH0hluRfwunr1S9a7g.text: I at first thought this place had a lot of promise, but inconsistencies are occurring too often, the wait is always ridiculous and the service has been hot and cold.   First incident was a dinner with my parents a few months ago. I chose not to do a review and maybe try to see if this was a exceptionally bad moment for them and that they can resurrect it. I probably shouldn't have as I completely forgot that the reason why dinner with friends was exceptional and we had some comped items was because they messed something up on the groups check the week prior they dined without me.  Anyways back to dinner with my parents The wait was 90 minutes, but then the food service was so slow and full of mistakes we were stuck there another 2 hours. I will spare the details but basically it was long wait to order something...appetizers came eventually...i was told that they didn't have what I ordered so I changed my entree....waiting...waiting...waiting....then we had to send back food multiple times. I am one of those people who don't send back small errors... We dine out a lot and asked for a refire twice this entire year, one of them being this. All of my vegetables were raw, my fish not cooked right. My fiance's steak was sent back THREE times because medium rare wasn't a possibility. A ribeye shouldn't be half a inch thin to where they can't get a steak to anything but well done. I have not been to a place where the staff knew how bad it was and comped the entire meal and gave me a card and asked to let them know when I will be back for dinner so they can ensure it went well. Unfortunately, it was the 1 day my parents were in town and did not bode well for me as a host. I'm now stuck to chain restaurants because I am not trusted to take them to small businesses now. They rather go to PF Changs.  I havent dined for dinner since and tried instead to do cocktails and snacks to ease into this place again.   I went with drinks with friends and it was just OK in terms of food and drink. We sat in the tiny tables downstairs against the snack station which wasn't comfy and feels more suited to being used as seating for those waiting to dine in, than any sort of service. Service wasn't attentive.   Went with friends most recently and I was just done with the long waits for a place to sit and not being able to handle the crunch with a backed up kitchen again. Good thing I overheard people complaining and some frustrated looking tables so that I got a headsup. I didn't want to sit for hours so I decided to opt out of getting food at all. Got a drink and left.   This place will keep being busy because of location alone. There's few places worth the wait and this is not it.

IIPcroP9VRA5ZN1nF4M4Zw.text: We came here for a birthday party. From the beginning the staff was amazing. At first our guest of honor was super cold so they moved us quickly without issue. Then came the appetizers. The portabella mushroom fries were to die for and the green sauce was super good. The pork belly and beef sausage were the best the table had ever had. Then the real meal. I had the spencer and it came out perfectly cooked. Their homemade chips were tasty and a great accent to the dish. We also got Brussel sprouts with the meal. Normally brussels are super bitter, but these ones were amazing! Super good and will come back

sbapMi5TwlduAvr2TQRpGg.text: The service kicks some serious ass. They were all over us with recommendations, information on how they select food, asking where we were from and if we had any time restrictions. The drinks were on point (I had a "seascape" with Kettle One and a glass of house Cabernet with the main course.) and the menu selection had a nice range. The fried spinach salad was probably one of the best salads I've ever had. Period. The mac n cheese was cheesy and delicious. The chips that were served with the steak were flavorful and crispy and the mushroom cap was a nice touch to the plate. The wait staff were awesome. They were close by and made sure the table was always cleared and the water was topped off. The fresh cut lemons on the table were a nice touch as well. The steaks were cooked to perfection. I had the Spenser Cut and Mrs C had the Rib Eye Cap. Trust me. You want to try all of the sauces and they will let you. We recommend the blue cheese and the horseradish sauces the most but all were great. Unbelievably they comped us dessert (which we didn't ask for but it was exactly what we were going to order anyway)! It was the Caramel Turtle and it was seriously ridiculously good. I asked my wife what the name of the dessert was and she said "wait a second while I finish having sex with this ice cream in my mouth". Enough said. Eat here. You will be happy you did.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spencer Cut and rib eye cap.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel Turtle.

Yumojjge4m9RhXtFiMYz5g.text: OMG!  This is the place to go if you are a local here!  Located in Tivoli Village, recently open (meaning less than a year old), this place is amazing!  I was first introduce to this place because my fiance heard about this place being raved about by his colleagues.  We came here for lunch and received the best service for a fine dining experience.  Usually when you go to a fine dining establishment during their "non-busy" hours, service has a tendency to be lacking but not this place!  Our server, Alex I believe was wonderful!  And everything he recommended was excellent.  He checked up on us when needed and wasn't to overbearing on attention.  It was just right.  The first thing he suggested was the Portobello Fries with Herb Aioli; it was battered lightly and when you take your first bite, you crunch and then you chew.  The mushroom is just soft and tender.  As our main course, we ordered the Hanger: Herb Marinade, grass fed and Skirt Steak: Hawaiian Cowboy, Wyoming Wagyu.  My entree was the Skirt steak, marinaded in a sweet soy sauce with a bit of a kick in spice.  So it was sweet & spicy.  The steak was tender and melted in your mouth.  As for the Hanger, wow, the flavor was just right!  The herbs that marinaded the steak was smokey and tantalizing in your mouth.  You can taste the smoke wood that the steak was grilled on with hints of simply seasoning of salt & pepper and herbs.  For the side we ordered the bloomsdale spinach, unlike regular spinach that wilt & shrink when cooked, they were crisp and mouth full!  The taste was sweetly bitter that you want to keep eating!  Unfortunately by the time we where done with our meal, we didn't have room for dessert.  So this would mean that we would go back and repeat the same thing again.  Now before I finish this review, I forgot the most uniquely important thing about this place...it's the butcher shop, the deli, smoothie counter and the bar!  When you first enter, you see a nicely set-up freezer that house all the meat you can possibly dream of!  From steak, to pork, to lamb...sausage...your mouth will drool!  To the deli station where if you are on the go, they make your sandwiches there while you watch.  With cured ham and all the deli meats that are "hangable" to lust after.  It also shares it's space with a smoothie counter where they literally take real fruit and make your smoothie or fruit juices in front of you.  You see all that goes into your healthy beverage!  Now if you are in the mood to be a little bit of an adult, the bar is conveniently located downstairs.  So while you wait for your table, you have ample space to sit at the bar or the lounge and enjoy a cocktail.  Overall the ambiance of the place is magnificent and greatly needed on this side of town!  I know where I will be going to get my meat when I am making pot roast or steak dinner.  I know where to go hang out with the girls for a low-key girls night out and enjoy gossiping!  This is definitely the place to be and so happy to have something like this on my side of town!  Better than Town Square!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X6q5Ywr9w8Sp3Q765zbelQ.text: I Ate here yesterday and had the Ribeye and the Spencer Steak (Craving more as I write this). We finished lunch off with a turtle Sunday (equivalent to culinary crack). Beautiful restaurant with excellent service. We went around 1pm and on a Thursday afternoon there was plenty of seating. The only thing that I would do is revalidate the cook on your steaks with the server. Our server/cook may have mixed ours up but in the end it didn't matter because the food was excellent and our server was helpful and kind. I asked for my ribeye to be medium rare and for my wife's Spencer steak to be medium, they accidentally swapped that up. Still 5 from me and we will be back hopefully 20 times or more.

F76KIveXJxpDnz68lc6Jqg.text: Happy Hour Meal is OK if you only order the steak and eggs, but portions are for the calorie conscious.

Gx2pp1TPYWkE60KTM7EMmw.text: Great Food, Cocktails,Beer and Service! The lady at the door was very friendly and accommodating to us. Our server, Ricky also took very good care of us! We had the perfect assortment of dishes! The onion soup play was excellent but the Kale salad was simple perfection for us! As expected the steak was delicious and prepared perfectly! Next time we will leave the baby at home and stay for dessert! The tables were a little on the small side besides the  the giant round one in the center which was in an awkward location, but the decor was simple, modern and not overdone! Cheers Echo & Rig'

Y1-Inc8gS-R3cE1O0VBdCg.text: This restaurant is flawless. They host an especially personalized experience with each and every visit. Great for a romantic dinner or a whole group of friends. We're so thankful for you and your incredible service!

2G5FQGduJauKVibOQOVUIQ.text: Fantastic off strip dinner. Lovely environment. Amazing food!! Perfect evening with my husband. The next time we are in Vegas we will definitely return.

8dcPuWuhkdHHcZLp6l2U-g.text: This one is for the butcher shop. No disrespect to the restaurant. But the house made sausage, bacon. As well as the rarely found cuts of beef, lamb pork. Veggies and more at the farmers market, meat at echo.

xSqiOzDOu4ogn441mSkN_A.text: Awesome meal! Will definitely return whenever I visit Vegas. So nice to be away from the strip for the night

HK0EIDX4g48xvjlDAJa-qA.text: This is definitely the place to cheat! They have great food and stiff drinks. Mmmm And the customer service is always great.

81pRD3mC8jZou8o-KCXQkQ.text: I've been in Vegas 6 years now and this is the best restaurant I've eaten at. The food was amazing. We had a tapas style meal and ordered the spinach salad, portobellos fries, cauliflower, garlic mash, broccoli, skirt steak and jumping beef. Everything was devoured.  Service was excellent but I have to give credit to Aaron. He works at the butcher section downstairs and the guy is skilled, passionate and dedicated to his job. He makes time to give you a lesson on something every time I go in. Definitely sad to see him leave soon but I wish him the best on his new adventure.  He's the reason we kept going every week but I can see us eating there a lot more frequently now. Once again, absolutely fantastic and cheers Aaron.

hrFupnpvmbqHsbZNvY9hJg.text: This is a definite A plus!!! The waiters,  the management the chefs...superb!!! I ate here 3 days per week it taste so good.  They tre a time me sooo well. The presentation everything is devine!!

J_On1gpB5qNM6d3HBQ0wAQ.text: Just f'n delicious!! Not only did Chef Sam and his crew whip up scrumptious food, management was on point,  but most importantly, the service was top notch. Ask for Alpheus! He will make you feel at home and his knowledge and passion permeate through his work ethic!

6EJ3tSE4nXAte5lANoskvA.text: Amazing dinner! Carrots were delicious, fried portabella's, delicious! Steak perfectly cooked! ONLY negative was the octopus was over cooked and over seasoned. Great service and tasty wine

FqYLsw4dx9dL99ocj1A3vQ.text: I've been here twice, and had an excellent experience both times! Food was good, and you can bring wine with no corkage fee. What I was most impressed with though, was the experience. The staff really works together to make sure that every need is met, and I left both times feeling like a million bucks. I can't wait to go back!

hMftYv0PoNjjktWVv_Sptg.text: Been here twice really enjoyed both times. Nice cocktails and bar on the bottom floor while you wait for a table or friends. Servers have a great attitude and really know their beef. They don't charge corkage for wine which is cool. I recommend the pork belly and grits!

SwaCWVBbb7qZ-vWhnHTGhw.text: Was in town and my wife took me here for my birthday and we both had a wonderful meal. Thank you for making my day special. See you in March when we come back for my daughters 21st birthday.

0xCtGqikXugYDnFiru7jVQ.text: Brunch was really nice. I was visiting from NY and while enjoying the weather sitting outside, the staff was really nice and the food was good. Definitely a nice brunch spot

heFe63QQl-RoxDFXqE0hOA.text: Wonderful filets.  Nice ambiance and prompt courteous service.  Prefect for business meetings or the casual date.

rXUMR4JdLXfpRQuAerMxDA.text: Such a cool restaurant!! This is a perfect collision of class and fun.  They have a great happy hour and unique menu items that are reasonably priced. I highly recommend the portobello mushroom fries.  There are a number of different seating options that give the restaurant a new feel depending on where you request to be seated.

2NhJRkhFHI0rDITcaYYh6A.text: The best steak house in Las Vegas!!!! The food and service is Amazing!!! You do not need to go to the Strip for a good Steak!

M7UfP_ljIcAa8BawbevVCA.text: These guys are on point!! From the hostess, to Ricky our waiter to Derrick he manager, they made our 3 yr anniversary fantastic!! Derrick  caught up to us on our way our and personally gave us his card and invited us back! Food was fantastic! We had the tomahawk for dinner. We also had the bone marrow and carne asada, the steak tar tare, and the pork belly and grits! ALL FANTASTIC!! For dessert we had the caramel turtle for dessert with a candle!! Thanks for making our anniversary fantastic!!!

R0b-E3Gvpeg5yH04Z_mAEg.text: Went with a large group and most of the beef dishes were bland, tough or had to be sent back. Cocktails were nothing special, either. They had so many employees and management of all types swarming the restaurant, yet it took forever for us to be served and then for the finished plates to be removed. Though  our waitress was exceptional. Total waste of money on an over rated restaurant.

D9SgF0Dc6PRng0Hqbo13RQ.text: It was my first time here. Nice ambience.  The food were delicious food.  They are known for their meat. Love their small plates especially the bone marrow carne asada. We ordered so many dishes.  They were all wonderful and the wait was not long at all.  Great service. Would definitely go back.
