LmSZJzIYrOq_MqnH7IEBZQ.text: Came here on a Saturday 7/21/18. Brunch menu was very limited. Quite disappointed. Food was marginal. But we ordered some steaks, which is what they're known for. Steaks were delicious!!!  The waiter (Filipino dude from California & with tattoos) & customer service was excellent. Loved the moisturizing hand scrubs in the bathroom!   The two younger Caucasian women at the front in charge of reservations/seating could smile more.

ACUD2o1ReNiBcn_P23YegQ.text: Very good quality of the cuts of steak here. Price was cheaper than expected for a steak house. Will definitely come back again. Oh and the most important thing to put......The food was excellent and very tasty!

NHRfg1liQvL_Mp1Frfoz8w.text: I love watching foodie shows but never thought I'd ever truly understand what depth of flavor meant. I do now! Jumping beef was incredible and the portobello fries so good we had to order more. Will be an absolute must visit on every future trip to Vegas. Without doubt the most enjoyable meal and dining experience I've had in a long long time

THnujfKcJPlHKWNXMyFroA.text: My girlfriends and I had dinner here on Saturday night. None of us had been before and were so pleased to have our awesome waiter walk us through the favorites and must-trys! We ended up sampling most of his recommendations and just sharing platters in the middle of the table until we were stuffed! Food was great, service was great, and the bathroom had a lovely sugar scrub!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_GDiLfMZb4TKbawdcInntA.text: I'm on the fence about this place.  My first visit, our little group of 3 got seated immediately at around 9pm on a Friday.  We ordered a few appetizers and ribeyes off the menu.  Stand out appetizer was the portobello fries, as many other reviewers attest.  The steaks were cooked to perfection, cut like butter, and tasted great.  The next time I went alone with the husband.  We arrived around 8:15 on a Saturday and had to wait about 20 minutes, which was fine.  Wait staff was quick to get our drink orders.  This time we decided to take the advice of others and selected a bone-in rib eye to share. Appetizers came out quickly, but our steak took near 45 minutes to make its way from the kitchen.  Apparently, our expectation that a steakhouse should never mess up steaks was asking too much.  We asked for medium rare and got well done instead.  For whatever reason, I don't like to send food back.  We ate a few bites, and even at well done, it wasn't bad, which is a testament to their cuts, but our ribeye's pre-cooked weight was 26oz and cost ~$2.50/oz ($65).  I couldn't sit still for a $65 piece of meat, so we called our waiter over.  He saw our plate, instantly recognized that our meat was overcooked, and called the manager to come over.  While we were waiting, the couple next to us sent back their salmon for the same problem.  The waiter's reaction seemed to indicate that this was happening all night long.    The manager was professional about the situation.  He told us that he would comp the steak and asked if we would like another.  We were already running late for a movie, so we opted for just the comp.   We ended up missing the movie.  Although the manager handled the overcooked steak in a most appropriate way, I do think it is a sin for the kitchen staff to mess up, what seemed to be, multiple orders.  It's a relatively new restaurant, so I'll give them one more chance, but if they screw up steak again, there is no way I could recommend this place to anyone.

qaK1EE_Sl0RW1ESpM5ZAwg.text: While visiting from NY I went here for dinner - then brunch, then lunch!  The food is so fresh, organic and delicious!  I miss it!  The service was also outstanding.  Doesn't get much better than Echo and Rig!

Fa7Jk5SCHPcSFUE6L6A80g.text: Tried this place for the first time a few days ago and I must say it was a great experience. Customer service was excellent. I had the lamb shops, and it was the best I ever had. We sat outside and the set up is very nice and cozy. We will definitely be back!

1pUSsA9UR72iApKGQlfMxA.text: I can say positively, I've never had a better steak in my life, ever. 26 oz of amazingness.

VbC49f6WU4p9A17vhh1SoA.text: Everything about this place is excellent. The service was outstanding and the food was even better. We had a large party and we order a lot from the menu. No complaints with anything we ordered. We will be back for dinner.

0UhyDWSD9Md1QbzLDfJCxg.text: My husband and I Love this place. we went las week for brunch on a Sunday, We sat at the bar..Bad choice the bartender was to busy chatting to acknowledge us. finally a Second bartender  arrived and helped us. however he gave me my orange juice in a dirty glass. after the bartender served he ran back upstairs to get food. I literally had to wave my hands to get the other bartenders attention. I told him my juice was in a dirty glass..He looked at it and started to pour it in a clean glass. How gross is that, When I said tell me your really not doing that, He said what's wrong with that. My husband and I walked away and told the hostess to please seat us. After we were seated we told our waitress and she said the hostess made her aware of the problem, but that she was not surprised at all:(  We went on to have great food and great service. our waitress said management was aware of what happened but neither manager spoke with us our waitress apologized for the dirty bartender. I thought that was odd . In a upscale place like this, there bartenders should be better trained they could learn something from the waiters and waitresses. steer clear of the bar:(

25hrm_rQ0Q9PLbvKdm0qlA.text: I wish I could give this place 5 stars.... I came here right after they opened. Ate at the bar and had the steak sandwich which was AWESOME. Next time, I brought a friend and decided to try some pasta dish. It SUCKED. In fact they burnt the pasta and it had to go back. This is after I waited 45 minutes for the dish.   What this has going for it is very good quality meats. The downside is the INCONSISTENCY. Some of the waiters and bartenders are good, and others horrible.   Last time I sat down at the bar, hungry and thirsty after a long day, the c*nt bartender ignored me because gossiping with a waitress was more important for her. When a customer comes in, your job is to give them a menu and take a drink order ASAP. Get it?   This is not a place I would consider for any important date or business dinner again.  They have a good idea, but execution is clearly a problem here.   I have a suggestion for management: you are a f*cking steak house. So hire some REAL waiters. Not bimbos based on looks. And get your kitchen in order. Try to be a real steakhouse like Peter Luger etc. You have the potential, and this town needs it.

IaO_6ZJMpbJ9lKIe18GMVw.text: I was excited to check out E&R for the first time. I read excellent reviews, which we found be be partially True the night we went for dinner. They do not take reservations so the wait was an hour and a half.  Our server was very friendly and helpful. We let her order our meal. We has a little of everything. The owner Sam was expediting dishes and the food came up pretty fast.  The negatives were it was extremely noisy. My steak was a little over cooked. We ordered wine and it was  served in the cheap small glasses vs the larger wine glasses that they use when ordering full bottles. I asked for a new glass and was accommodated quickly.  They haven't been open long and are still getting some of the bugs out. I will be returning as we really did enjoy our meal

hxQ4TUhXlKCONqmGddTOHw.text: I have been reading about this place for a few months now, and tonight I finally had a chance to experience what everyone has been talking about. Everything we had from the drinks, the food and the service were out of this world! My only regret was that I didn't try this place sooner. I can't wait to go back and try more things on the menu!

9AM5lhh2SLfONWSeqmpxOw.text: Good atmosphere and great location. The prices are very reasonable. If this were on the strip it would be Gordon Ramsey expensive but out here it's very reasonable. The service is great and the steaks are fantastic. Try the "mushroom" fries. Amazing.

rCFDbt_GZqXJ-M_RI4RYAw.text: Have you ever wanted someone to just notice you?  I went to Echo &Rig and felt like I was the a Queen!  Service= check Hospitality= check Food= check / fantastic  Everything is great- please just try it all!!!!!!!!  Everyone treated me like a Queen and I felt great! Thank you, thank you, Thank you!!!!!!!

b-27FDX1ubcmVxdwsyd53g.text: great food, excellent service and can I say, probably one of the best rye manhattan's I've had here in Las Vegas!

bpuu9S6RJMhnDzz_f4ZTew.text: My husband and I recently moved to Las Vegas.  Easily, Echo and Rig became our favorite fine dining restaurant in the Summerlin area.  The steaks are consistently excellent, the small plates/ side dishes are creative and tasty, and the menu selection is extensive. But we will be remiss if we do not write about the excellent customer care the whole staff has demonstrated each time we visited.  Ricky, our waiter, was not only attentive in an unobtrusive way, he also had great timing (the food came just-in-time)!  Our special thanks to Sheryl Best and Derek Scharadin, members of the  management team, who gave a personal touch to their welcome!  Excellent demonstration of leadership!  We strongly recommend Echo and Rig -- truly a 5-star steakhouse!

2J6M2A8ENJ8zzt0LSW23RA.text: When you are having a lunch with your dear friend, looking for the right place. We found the perfect place today. Delicious food, excellent service and love this place!

dBg3-acoZz5RPomcr7ag_g.text: We ate here on Christmas Eve and both the food and the service was excellent. Christopher was our server and provided us with excellent drink and food suggestions. Try the duck, it is excellent. The strawberry dream and French kiss martins are also very good.   We wanted to grab some fresh meat from the first floor butcher but it was closed when we were finished eating. Everything looked very tasty though. Stuff for everyone though since there was a good amount of fish and vegetarian options on the menu.

qeva7vv3J1UFDrA8qTGHjg.text: Will give Echo & Rig another try because our steaks were amazing, perfectly cooked and flavored. Unfortunately, the service was not up to par. We dined downstairs, early dinner. We watched as one couple left because there was no server in sight. When  one popped up, we seemed to haven disturb her. Took our order, no follow up, just the check.

1DR1MYazj0crSYcFHotKog.text: Great food, impeccable service, and best sides dishes compared to other steak places. I go to the butcher downstairs almost every other week. I buy all my meat at Echo & Rig: hanger steak, skirt steak, short ribs, bavette, Italian sausages, whole chicken, pork chop, etc..  Aaron's short rib recipe was fool proof. I am planning  to try a pork belly recipe next.

CFSb4aP98G1wNVm6TCHPZQ.text: First time here and would definitely come back for the hospitality alone! I would highly recommend their Tomato Watermelon salad,Short rib hash and they take a BLT to another level! Thank you Molly and Arrianna for your impeccable service!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2xWzEPYL7VqRnd6arkPrFA.text: It was yelp family night checking out new spot although for Suzy H already been but thankfully had someone too guide us. Mahalos! The best thing about eating with yelpers is its buffet of food samples on table. Yay!! Between the four of us ordered bunch of apps too start just about ran out of room for my pasta course. It would take too long too mention all the apps but the bone marrow app was amazing (loved the fact something that hardly see on any restaurants menu, the bone marrow cooked perfection spread it like butter on the bread came with or straight up bone marrow heaven on spoon), oyster slider (mini po boy), portabello fries (truly all its HYPED too be! It nice crispy on the outside and the aioli comes with its tasty more so order more till the last fries), mac and cheese (another solid solid dish), and forgot order bunch more stuff. Those things stood for me.   My entree order the bolognese. Honest all the things I tried it was average. I know asked for it not getting STEAK the thing most known or trademark dish. I not in steak mood. The process if you where too order one is pretty interesting. They literally show you the cut of meat that going too cook for you on really nice sliver platter and ALSO literally butchered that day or hell if I know maybe that minute. In the front of the restaurant they have open butcher shop that can see all the cuts of meat. One of the things known for is fact they get in whole carcass and break everything down. No joke it comes too getting fresh cut of meat here at Echo and RIg. Maybe the next time I come in will get my steak onnnn.  The service was good. Although sharing long family style table with another group of four seem odd too me. The hostess told us before and had no problems with the idea. Not sure great way too get repeat customers knowing another party literally on the same table. They had our servers all out of whack thinking which side of the community table does this go too.  It interesting that the restaurant is upstairs but yet the bar is located downstairs/butcher shop. I love the fact they have little patio area on the first floor and second floor. It great place too people walking around trivolli village. It pricey but could be lot worst if you went steakhouse on the strip. If looking for high end steakhouse not on the strip Echo & Rig is awesome spot! Now only if I could afford too eat like this everyday. Dam it.

WcONXPsG6SZQxKNb15foaw.text: I usually will wait until a 2nd visit to review a place, however if the place is really bad or amazingly good I'll write a review when I get home from the place. This is one of those reviews.  I don't often make it up to Tivoli Village but on the trips I did I would always peek in the windows and see how things were going at Echo & Rig. Tonight I finally got into the place and it was great.  When we entered they walked us through the lower level, we got to check out the butcher shop, the deli/charcuterie counter, and the bar before heading upstairs to the dining room.  The layout is a little random with the bar/butcher shop downstairs, and the dining room & kitchen upstairs. The dining room is very open and there's some room between the tables. There is a patio off the dining room and an exhibition kitchen along the entire south wall of the dining room.  The servers were attentive, the hosts were friendly, the bussers were quick to refill the water glasses (complimentary sparkling or still water), and bringing the proper weapons(utensils) to make sure we could properly enjoy our meals.  The food was really, really damn good. We had several things off of their expansive (Over 90 item) Menu. The hardest part of the entire meal was selecting which items on the menu to try and which to keep for another visit.  The meal started with a bread basket, it was a pretty basic looking basket with 3 slices of bread and no butter, at first I thought it was odd, but after trying the bread I realized butter wasn't needed.  Next up was our small plate "appetizers". First up was the Thick Cut Bacon and BBQ Sauce. The Bacon was grilled which added a great flavor, the BBQ sauce was ok, but I mainly ate the bacon plain and it was good. We also had the Bone Marrow Carne Asada, yes you read that right it's not only "Gods Butter" Bone Marrow it also comes with carne asada as well a perfect combo on the toast.  After that was the Charcuterie Plate, Prosciutto, 3 different Salamis, Pate, and Head Cheese all were delish, but the Prosciutto was my favorite.  Next was Grilled Octopus, now I myself am not an octopus guy, but this dish was amazing and made me rethink my hatred for octopus. We also had the Mushroom soup, it was creamy and delish.  Next was the Entree Course, I had the Butcher's Cut Ribeye which was a 14oz steak cooked medium rare (possibly a touch over), served with Garlic Chips and Mushroom Rockefeller. This would have been enough on it's own, but not for us. We also added Portobello Fries, Mashed Potatoes, and Heirloom Carrots for bonus eats. The Potatoes and Carrots were amazing, but the Steak was the stand out item of the meal. I'm not a fan of steak sauces, but if you are, unlike most places that charge $5-7 for a sauce, Echo & Rig includes one free sauce with your steak, which is a nice touch.  As if all this food wasn't enough the waiter told us about the dessert menu. They  only serve Ice Cream Sundaes. And after hearing him say "salted caramel ice cream" I was getting the turtle sundae. It was the perfect end to an amazing meal.  I can't wait to get back and try the rest of their menu. I really am looking forward to their late night menu for a late bite before heading to La Casa down the road for the a Cigar.  Also the have free wifi for all your food porn posting needs which is a great added bonus

cUfV6FPL1f8gzfwddLFDAw.text: Echo & Rig is a priceless undiscovered gem in the gold city for food that is Las Vegas.  Food  5/5 The food here is fantastic with everything well seasoned and super flavorful.   We had : * Rainbow salad 5 flavorful * Watermelon cucumber salad 5 * Spencer 4.5 cooked perfectly great mushroom sauce * Caramel ice cream 5  Service 5/5 To say service is a 5 of possible 5 is an understatement.  The service in this restaurant is leaps and bounds of what one would expect at this price point. During my stays over the last 20 years in Vegas, I have visited dozens of high end expensive restaurants and this is by far the best experience I've had.  Some highlights:  * Everyone was acutely aware it was our first visit - It REALLY mattered to them. * Communication was high between the wait team and with us as well. * Full court press was in full swing - everyone was REALLY working to impress * Teamwork was excellent: waiters working together in a way I hadn't seen before. * Warm and friendly by everyone.   * Structured system in kitchen w pass & Quality checks. * Wait team anticipated needs and was ahead of it before I even asked. * Energetic everywhere - Lots of synergy in the dining area * They remembered my special request from my Open Table reservation which most of the time gets forgotten.  * Manager was very active with handshakes hello and goodbye along with some really nice conversation.  Value 5/5 Our bill was about $105 which if you are used to the Las Vegas strip is a deal and a half.   I've had way worse experiences for double the price.  That included drinks and dessert.  Ambiance 4.5/5. Nice vibe; attractively lit; big windows.  Cleanliness 5/5 Chefs all wore hats in the open and visible kitchen. Clean eating area.  Restrooms 5/5 Perfectly clean.  Attractive. Smelled good. Moisturizing butter rocks left my hands clean moist and smelling great  Parking 2.5 The garage for the shopping center that this establishment is in is awkward but that is of no fault of the restaurant.  Overall 5/5 I take my "5 star" ratings seriously (as you can see by the spread on my profile) and in this case a 5 is a slam dunk.  All things said, this is probably the best dining experience I've ever had. It wasn't just the food that was a winner.  The service exceeded my expectations and was in the "stunning" category.  There is no doubt I will return to this place on my next visit to Vegas.  You should too.  it's worth the 30 minute excursion.

z9s3frtng4AXtj1wqN4E1w.text: This place is excellent! Food was amazing and service was outstanding. Must try the portabella mushroom fries.

4yeq-nc9d18EhjfyLAJaww.text: Went here for a special celebration for dinner.  The food, experience, and service was 5 stars!  Recommendations:  1. The hanger steak. Three people out of my party got this steak and it was very yummy!  2. Portobello fries. Good for sharing and flavorful.  3. Dessert! I split the turtle sundae with my husband. Good for sharing. Get this!!

Uidn5TTeo-KfG_jnddc3tg.text: Reviewing as a vegetarian- a couple good veg options. I had the farmers scramble. Came without the goat cheese, asked the server if there should be goat cheese she said yes it is there, it was not. After asking again she then brought out the goat cheese for me. Not a big deal, just annoying. Service staff was very friendly overall and very attentive to refill the bottomless mimosas. Our group really enjoyed that you add your own orange juice to your mimosa.

g8MX763Zw66oiB6jzFyU_Q.text: Made reservations for 6 plus 2 babies...last minute and had to cancel out for 2 adults and 1 baby...no problem with the staff.  First time here as we live in San Diego..celebrating granddaughter's birthday.  Staff was outstanding...special SHOUT OUT to our waiter Nicholaus (Nick) and his assistant Enrique as they were some of the best, most attentive servers I've had.  We had great steaks but chose to salads or appetizers so rather than let us hang out til the steaks were ready, Nick brought us a complimentary Caesar salad and lots of bread.  Steaks were very good, excellent preparation and the sides of mashed potatoes, macaroni and corn were outstanding!  Will come back again when we are in Las Vegas!

Rsl31HUhjXS0VPyg9Tdo5Q.text: After having searched the yelp prospects for a good steakhouse, we came upon this estabishment.  The environment was very warm and upscale. We ordered from an obviously proud attitude about the value of their product menu.  Then... They served a steak that was a kids portion size Ribeye..  I venture to estimate approximately 4 to 6 ozs.  What in the world has happened to Las Vegas? What school of Steak Houses did these owners go to to offer this presentation.  Never again.

e9DwRzP65Xa_io7XV2-mcw.text: Kinda disappointing last night. Service was just way off, out of sync. A side ordered to be served with our meal came out with the salads. My steak ordered medium rare came out blue, sent it back and it took a long time to come back out. We felt like they were in a rush, bussers were hovering, trying to take away glasses and plates right at the last swallow. Food was really good, though, and my steak was fine once it came back out.

rYxkbY1xRqoQaLSSEONI6g.text: Fabulous steak house. Several cuts to choose from with different sauces too. The potato chips are house made, yum! Recommend the garlic mashed and cheddar potatoes are great! Service was stellar. Highly recommend this place!!!

JZ6lbkWp6ji0mx4joM3JLQ.text: The Hostess was VERY courteous! and friendly, BUT the service not good, drinks took too long!! they brought salad out before cocktails & cocktail was bad!! food NOT as good as it should be, waiter & food runner not on same page.

V0zb5NAAfDvC9cgSXLeqeg.text: My husband and I have been regulars here for a couple years now and it's by far our favorite place to dine! The service is always top notch and the food is phenomenal. When family and friends are in town this is a MUST for dinner (per their request) once you've tried this place it's easy to see why. I've been a GM for a chain of restaurants in town and even taken my CEO and COO here several times.  Some of our favorites are the rib eye cap, the butterfish is amazing! Can't go wrong with the filet. Even the Blt is to die for. Portobello mushroom fries, bbq bacon, ahi poke is fresh! There's not anything I've had here that wasn't truly a winner.  We try to stay away from the strip and we love this tucked away gem. They always make you feel important and you'll never leave hungry. Can't wait for dinner. We'll be there again tonight!

HN2Bh76HFwSwqSXk_9pQSQ.text: In a nutshell, this place was ok, both in food and service. I travel to Vegas weekly for work, so alone at the bar is normal for me. While the waiters/bartenders were nice, they certainly were not stellar in terms of service. Hardly saw them. The avo toast was good, but needed salt. Cauliflower was good, but not great. Steak was ordered medium, came out rare and food was warm, at best. I will say the beef was high quality and tasty. All in all, worth a go, but my experience did not match their current star rating. Maybe it was an off night.

K3UPDmYVBgkJmOyhdy0Jjw.text: Went here for Valentine's Day. Got a couple glasses of wine the portobello mushroom fries the skirt steak and the spencer steak. This place was great the food and the service were great. It wasn't until later that we got food poisoning from it that we had to think twice about this place. It was terrible and it ruined our weekend. It took awhile to get the matter resolved but ultimately seemed like they really cared about my experience and gave me credit back to my account and invited me in to eat again. So updates will be needed later on. But aside from the side effects the food was great recommend getting the skirt steak in medium and spencer medium rare. Get the onion sauce for your steak. Also the portobello fries are a must if you like mushrooms the dip for it is unique and great too. Also if it's a nice day try to request a seat on the balcony!

Server was not too attentive, asked for additional tips after we already being charged percentage. I was a little disappointed when he came to asked me. I think as a big group, we will leave additional tips if the service was decent. Food was not too bad, lots of sharing items which makes it more interesting.

Bv5aphUvrQeP8hWLNNJDAA.text: My 17 year old son and I visited here and had the best steaks in a long time!! They were brought to our table before hand! Pretty cool. The atmosphere is nice, but casual clothes are OK. The waiters were attentive and quick for any service.  The price is a little higher than you're usual steakhouses, i.e, Outback.  Located in the Tivoli center, across from the Suncoast hotel, it's not overrun with tourists and kids in strollers. That's not a bad thing, but away from the hustle and bustle of the Vegas strip, it's a nice locals place for steaks and drinks. Will definitely go there again soon.

WBHpb0b6yqTQ7UPkjIXVww.text: Omg best meal we've ever had!  Had the 32 oz tomahawk steak with Mac and cheese and portobello mushroom fries and herb aioli.  The steak was cooked to perfection and the Mac and cheese was really cheesiest and creamy.  All the sauce came with the steak, our favorite was the mushroom and balsamic.  Must try, better than Texas de Brazil.

d367Ji6GujhxKperDsdN7g.text: Brought a family of 14 + infant to Echo and Rig. Definitely don't regret it! Worth the drive out from the strip. The overall value: price, quality, service would be great anywhere.   The parking can be a bit far but they have valet and actually seems to have plenty of parking on a Sunday night. Well lit and designed exterior of the entire complex as well as interior of the restaurant. We didn't dress business casual but it sure felt like we should have!   You don't have to worry about selection either. There are a wide range of foods and of course be ready to eat their cuts of steak! I had their bone marrow carne asada and portobello mushroom fries, both of which I wasn't sure what to expect but you should expect deliciousness! We also shared the calamari, vegetable appetizer, and mushroom soup. One thing that wasn't to my liking was the mushroom soup. I felt it could have been thicker with more rich flavor, but to each their own.  I had the filet mignon cooked medium with mushroom sauce and their home cooked potato chips. I would have preferred a different side because the consensus seemed to not favor those too much. I felt they could have been more crispier with maybe a different oil. That's just my preference.  One very nice thing was that the server noticed my wife was gone and helped to keep her food warm while she was gone. No utensils given when taken to go :( Didn't ask though.   Would definitely come again to another location and recommend coming here. Again, the whole experience does validate their overall 4.5 star rating.

-CK3BLJLaO-1eV9f4_z3wg.text: I fell in love with this place immediately after my 1st visit.  It's a beautiful place, with wonderful food and astounding service!!! A perfect spot for an occasion.   We made reservations ( highly recommend) for 4 pm on a Saturday. We arrived 10 min before and we were asked to wait while the got our table ready. We waited in the Butcher Shop and perused the cuts of meats that they offered. Everything looked so enticing!   Our table was ready and the hostess took us up the stairs to our table. The dining room is stunning! They even have outdoor seating, which I personally prefer, but it was a chilly Vegas night, so inside was perfect.   They brought out bread, butter and water and said our server would be right with us. Hugo introduced himself as our server, asked us if we've been there before and asked if we needed him to go over the menu. He was very knowledgeable if everything that was on the menu and that's how it should be.   As a starter we ordered the Arugula Steak salad and we split that into 2. My husband and I were taken back as how good the salad was. We have officially claimed is as one of the top 5 salads we've ever had. My husband ordered the Santa Maria Tri Tip with a Lemon Chimichurri sauce, to be cooked Medium Well and I ordered the Spencer Steak with the Brandied Mushroom sauce, was to be cooked the same. These steaks were so juicy and tender. The knife would cut thru the steak as it was going thru butter!!! These steaks were definitely cooked to perfection. Now if you're not in the mood for steak... let me recommend the Grilled Cheese Sandwich!!! Yes, I know, a grilled cheese sandwich at a steakhouse? Y'all this isn't an ordinary grilled cheese! This sandwich is made with short ribs, gruyere, parmesan & white cheddar. We ordered it and my husband and I split it.. because we ordered a lot of food, I ended up taking it home and eating it afterwards. It tasted fantastic when it came out fresh and the taste stayed the same even when I reheated it.   Over all it was a very pleasant dinning experience. From the beginning all the way till the end, I would rate it a 10/10.

OEeCKagLkOH1m_ypbFufxg.text: The place is incredibly busy. Made reservations and they were too busy to seat us for 20 minutes after are reservation time. Almost left but I'm glad we didn't.  Louis took great care of us and explained the menu well. The food was absolutely incredible. Avocado Toast and/or Portobello Mushroom Fries are a new favorite for the wife and I. Nice atmosphere when you go upstairs to the dining area. My New York steak was very good. For simply a steak house, I've had better from Hanks but the overall experience and small platters are fantastic.

JkocY0mbLP9W9ouE-_894w.text: Want a great upscale place for lunch or dinner?  Echo & Rig should fit the bill.  Amazing steaks and seafood.  At lunch they have smaller plates available for some items, salads, soups, and lots of great entrees to pick from.  The entry way has the hostess stand and bar.  They also have a butcher and cases of different cuts of meat available.  Fascinating to see what's in the cases!  Service is impeccable and I highly recommend this place!

19_39aMIQxx1-QARRjOLBQ.text: My grandmother wouldn't stop raving about this place. I knew we had to stop by while I'm visiting from LA and wow. The service is amazing. Everyone was so kind and genuine. Our main server Shane was absolutely the sweetest. He and the management ensured our good spirits. I simply drank a vodka with white cranberry juice, making the experience super unique with my drink choice. The food was incredible. Fried Calamari and Bone Marrow to start and if you come here and don't get steak you're just wrong. Their sauces were great as well. Dessert was legendary. Screw anything on the strip, come here instead.

lSjkCwhWBKzaQKBDK5oFzw.text: Raucously loud, solid food. We had the steakhouse scramble, watermelon salad, and French toast. The French toast was especially good. The brunch really is worth the time.   I did however have an issue with service. I think it may have been isolated to our waiter. Everyone certainly seemed to be busy, running back and forth. Everyone was very pleasant when we spoke to them. However, we only rarely got the opportunity to speak to them. Someone would speak to us and then our waiter would swoop in and say something waitery. Otherwise, utterly absentee.

pjP3xn1iUmD6ljP1WLeRxg.text: It was a miss for my group and I. We decided to go with the recommendation from our waiter, the Steakhouse scrambled.... we were disappointed from our first bite, no flavor, very bland, had more potatoes than anything else........... slow service... had to ask a different waiter for some hot sauce because my waiter was to busy chit chatting...  overall super disappointed... but the water was great, super refreshing. I wanted to give it a 3 because three backwards turns to an E and E for effort, but I wanted to be honest.

n3OfMSHlSI1fH_PmdqAJKg.text: Definitely one of my top 10 favorite steakhouses in Vegas. It may be a far ways off the strip and the southwest but it's worth the drive for me every time. Echo & Rig is located in Tivoli Village off of 95 & Rampart/Fort Apache. Service is always EXCELLENT every time we go here. I suggest you make reservations well in advance bc they do get pretty busy. If you're having trouble like we did trying to book a reservation online or on OpenTable try calling them. They tend to accommodate us every time we call.   Came here this past weekend for a friend's birthday birthday dinner. Party of 11. Everything we ordered was pretty good. Believe most of the table ordered the Ribeye Cap for their main entree  Ribeye Cap x10 - Excellent. Definitely he best part of the ribeye. Inside was a perfect med rare but our only compliant on most of them was the over char they had going on. Served with kettle chips and a garlic mushroom   White fish? - ok. Server recommended a white fish that wasn't the sea bass that was on the menu. Went with his recommendation but I should've gotten the sea bass instead. Believe it pan seared but dry and bland. A little salt goes a long way. Served with parsnips. I wouldn't recommend this dish (It was the fish dish above the sea bass)  Beef Tartar - delicious. One of my favorites.   Portabella Fries - good served with a yummy pesto like sauce  Calamari - good  Crispy spinach salad - great loved the crispy texture and dressing   Caesar salad - good  Pork belly appetizer - great. Perfectly seasoned and cooked  Cauliflower - good   Mac&Cheese - good  Fruit sorbet - good and refreshing   Salted caramel ice cream - delish  My go to place for a really good affordable steak and drinks. So many good appetizers on their menu and I just love coming back to try them all. This place will definitely not disappoint you. Always leave here satisfied. Don't forget to make reservations in advance. You won't want to miss your chance of eating here bc it's booked out.   P.S. You MUST use their salt hand scrub in the restrooms!! It's the best thing ever! Leaves your hands feeling super soft and smelling awesome. If you love it they sell it by the bottle. Ask your server lol

UMVRcxgg_C4C63Ra8BAqyg.text: Sorry for the poor lighting with these photos. We ordered the short rib hash and the steakhouse scramble. With the hash--the short rib was tender, the potatoes were crispy, and overall, it was pretty flavorful. The scramble tasted like something I could [and do] make pretty easily. There wasn't anything special to it.  The reason for 3 stars is because the scramble was very average, and the service was poor. The kitchen was slow, but our waiter was slower. He rarely checked on us and was slow to bring out requested items. The busboy was more on top of his game, for sure. I would give the hash 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z9AmLC9aW1DNVA53iQ_2yA.text: Love this place...  When you're craving a great steak, makes this place part of your plan. This place is swanky enough for any gathering or just a plain old date night...  Go early enough where you can browse the 'butcher shop' and have a drink downstairs AND don't forget to grab some of the amazing cuts or definitely grab a pound or two of the awesome bacon to take home.  Great atmosphere  When you head up for dinner (sit outside of you can) the patio is beautiful and you don't feel like you're on Vegas.  The appetizers I love are the burnt pork ends, the steak tartare and freak shucked oysters...  The servers will explain the cuts of meat to you and even though you think you know what you want, the presentation makes me change my mind every time.  This is definitely a must for great steaks and really laid back atmosphere.  Thanks to the entire staff... Another home run!

87pJj1RjdIu7_ayGhIGCEA.text: This is my go to spot for Sunday brunch! Bottomless mimosas for $16 and they have a variety of juices including white cran, pineapple, grapefruit, etc. Get the white cranberry, tastes like Capri sun.  Food wise, I always get their avocado toast. It comes with shishito peppers and is spread with creme fraiche. The brunch entrees are okay as well nothing too special there (Benedict's, short rib hash, etc.)   They're not stingy with the champagne either. Don't get rowdy thought cause the lady manager is quick to cut you off.   Make sure you use the scrub in the bathroom, it will change your life. I think they sell it downstairs.

6vX7XLQ1W9CVaBrEOGUPcg.text: Been here twice. The first time was average. The second time was above-average. The thing that sets it apart is the service.   I sat at the bar to watch Thursday night NFL, have a drink or two and enjoy a good steak.  Here is my rundown:  DRINKS: I only had beer, but they had a few locals on tap which I love. The $3 pints at Happy Hour is a steal. The drinks leaving the bar for the restaurant looked good for what that's worth.   FOOD: My salad was average. I had the kale salad. Expensive at $12, but fresh and no complaints. The rib eye cap was a little more jab the medium-rare I requested, but it was good and the brandy mushroom sauce was solid. The Brussels sprout side was way too salty and otherwise a little boring. I'd go with something else next time.   SERVICE: The bartenders were awesome. Friendly. Knowledgeable. No attitude when I took my time and enjoyed my meal while watching the game. This is what made this place better than a Morton's or a Ruth Chris.

70E1MRZ2pkAY8hXwYxNUFw.text: We chose this as our dinner spot for our 14 year wedding anniversary. What an amazing choice!! We were greeted by Augustin and Nicholas. Augustin was an AWESOME waiter! We started with a Maryland Crab Cake and some Wild Mushroom Soup. Both were exquisite! The wife said it was the best crab cake she'd ever had and the depth of flavor in the soup was unreal.   For our main course we chose the bone-in tomahawk steak (37oz) to share and the garlic mashed potatoes as well as the brussel sprouts with pistachios and lemon. The steak came with 6 sauces, 2 stuffed mushroom caps and bowl of homemade garlic chips.  We loved all of the sauces but the mushroom sauce and the bearnaise sauce were our favorites. Both of our sides were amazing and didn't disappoint.   Finally, when we could eat no more, they surprised us with a carmel turtle sundae for our anniversary!  What an amazing experience! We can't wait to go back and try some lunch options!!!

Q0ZeqCAIxZwCzDveZGCZ0g.text: So good. Great happy hour. Awesome service at the bar. Make sure you wash your hands with the salt scrub. Every sandwich was killer. Check out their awesome food and beer and wine specials. Premium liquor at the bar for happy hour too. $4. Um. Yes.

oyEUl1UqORq7PjR2FfT7Dw.text: I guess it is one of the best steakhouse in town. The waiter gave us great suggestion-portablello fries(made of mushroom, very specicial). The steak is enlarged to 12 oz, which is perfect for two. It is juicy and fresh.

no0KONSLhtwYjlAqUsOCAg.text: Ordered a spencer steak which is a boneless ribeye. It seemed to be a sirloin that was sous vided because there was no fat with very little flavor. It was supposed to be cook over oak wood like Jockos. It wasnt. Disappointing. I would have sent it back but we would be late for a show.1 The service though was impeccable. My wife's NY was perfect.

jk9IST3jOzDfIftPajOtxg.text: My husband and I enjoyed our dinner here. The chopped salad was nicely done with crunchy vegetables and a mild dressing- great in our opinion. We also had two large steaks a t-bone and ribeye along with a side of octopus and shrimp and fries. Took some left-overs with us, as we knew we ordered a lot. Our server was Luke who really did an awesome job explaining the menu and giving recommendations. I ordered carrots as a side that were a bit charred and over cooked but didn't want to complain about that. My mojito was good with blackberries muddled in. There was a little constructive things I noticed and wanted to share. One was the lighting in the bathroom is too bright (maybe lower lighting a tad) and there was a leak in the faucet wasting water. Maybe a few pictures could be added to give a softer feel for ambiance too in the upstairs seating area. Overall, It is a nice spot for eating with outdoor seating as well. We will come back and try it again.

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mojito

LMyAAd7BKKE7TtguElvUYw.text: Located in Tivoli Village, this gem fits in with the luxury feel you get from the outdoor plaza. Right when you walk in, you see the butcher shop to the right, oyster bar in front, and a large bar area to the left with a staircase in the middle taking you up to the main dining area. A very boutique, modern ambiance.  The service was amazing, starting from the hostess to the very attentive waiting staff. Food was awesome. We got the portobello fries, which were lightly battered, still had great taste, juicy mushrooms. I've had these at Bottega Louie and feel like Echo & Rig do these much better! I also got the flat iron sandwich. The steak was perfectly prepared, very tender and full of flavor.  Overall, very impressed. It's about 10 minutes from the strip, but well worth the venture!

BX52sijwCzg8EPzXynSj2g.text: Wow!  Not sure why it took so long for us to try this restaurant. The environment, service and food were absolutely remarkable!  Not sure we have been to a place with such an attentive staff! It started with a very polite Hostess, then one of the floor Managers, Celine approached our table and welcomed us, she was very nice and very professional. Then we met our waiter, Luke, this guy should give classes on how to provide outstanding service, he was very knowledgeable and what really stood out to me is that he didn't try to sell us on the most expensive items on the menu. Luke came across very Honest and sincere, and he was absolutely right.  We ordered the portobello fries and calamari to start. The basil aioli is so delicious and we could not get over the great flavor of the portobello fries. We ordered the cowboy skirt steak and the roasted chicken sandwich in addition to the mashed potatoes and cauliflower. The cauliflower was delicious and had a great balance of sweet, salty and spicy. Our drinks were always topped off and the service by all was outstanding.  Can't wait to have another " Date Night" with my wife and once again enjoy the wonderful food and atmosphere at echo & Rig.

chK-paFOjqQ54JSO1aG8rg.text: Pros: nice place for any dining occasion  Food was good  They accidentally kept bringing out way too much birthday sundaes   Cons: I waited for my steak salad that I ordered for about 45 mins  My coffee was the wrong order Waitress/bussers seemed very confused of people's orders (maybe it was a training day or a bad day for them)   I was super excited to come here for a very long time and when I finally went, It def did not meet my expectations of the big fuss over echo and rig. :(   I gave it a 3 because my favorite part of the whole experience was their avocado toast... (at that point I was starving and trying my girlfriends food)

cJOaqCclvDa4shFA8J1s1w.text: Service is impeccable. When you are seated, the manager welcomes you (by name) to your table and promptly you are waited on. It's truly awesome. My only minor complaint is that even when I make a reservation, I still have to wait. But it's well worth it!

7CEcrNpk4UX3EdNKCL2KhA.text: Love this place. The service is definitely unmatched. The servers are super well versed on the menu and can describe items to you if you're super stuck on what to get. Every visit I've had a manager stop by the table to ask how everything was. Not to mention my boyfriend proposed here with help from the staff which was nice. It was really special how they accommodated his request and my family surprising us. I highly recommend the skirt steak, which is usually a cut of beef I'm not a fan of. Every server has recommended this to me and I never felt like trying it. So happy I did because it is one of the most delicious steaks I've ever had. Their bacon with BBQ sauce is so amazing, the only downside is it does not come with a huge portion. We usually get a side of mashed potatoes which is very creamy and flavorful. Highly recommend this place!

C3l1AbnXyMyMFSsPD0zS2g.text: If you're a fan of Old Fashion's, you might want to make a trip to Echo & Rig while they're making this special version during their Seasonal Specials. It's spiced just right.

PPfhvqY8WXchvr2xK44ZZg.text: What can you say about this place? Food has always been on point service is great and do we need to talk about happy hour... steak and egg for $1.99 how do you go wrong with that. I love the 4 oz of steak you get to try all cuts of meet. Its a must do i  vegas.

bD-YMHhpFB5YeR2WApYKdg.text: So I've only been here for dinner once, and I felt like it was okay but I expected more for what I paid. This review is mostly to say that their BRUNCH is the BEST!!!!! I've been here several times now for brunch, and their unlimited mimosas deal is amazing. I love that unlike most places that offer bottomless mimosas, Echo & Rig gives you several different juices, not just the traditional orange. My favorite is the pineapple juice with the champagne. Yum! Their brunch food menu is also pretty great, they have a really nice variety and almost everything I've tried is delicious.   PS- If you have room for dessert, get the Cappuccino sundae! DELICIOUS.

R21zsHRxV_DPI0dE9VLetg.text: I absolutely love this place! I've been here for dinner and brunch and left completely satisfied every time!  To start-- the service is amazing from when you first walk in to the door until you leave. Each time I've came I've had reservations set and got outside seating which is probably the best seating in the house especially on a nice day!  I love how you are able to bring in your OWN wine which is also served to you by the waiter. The food is amazing whether you're coming for dinner and ordering a nice steak or even for brunch with their bottomless mimosas.   I'll definitely be back.. over and over and over again!

Kgdy6AxE53Fq5k5II6QLrw.text: I am a local and loyal Las Vegas resident.  I love my city therefore try to give all restaurants in Las Vegas at least 2 or 3 dining experiences before I make a judgement call.  That being said Echo and Rig is THE WORST .  I have dined here more than 5 times (usually by the other couple or guests making the reservation) with each experience being worse than the past one.  Friday was my last time.  Let's talk about the service first. It's a Friday night of a 3 day weekend so you would think Echo and Rig would be prepared for the long weekend.  Not so.  We order drinks after we have been seated.  After about a good 25 mins, the waiter, Nick, brings 2 of the 4 drinks.  The men had ordered scotch with a large cube of ice.  He tells us they are out of large cubes already and they are out of that particular brand of scotch.  (Its 6:30 pm and Glenfiddich was the scotch) The guys order another brand and they wait ANOTHER 20 mins for that scotch to arrive.  (you simply pour some scotch in a glass . There is no mixing).  As you can now guess, the other lady and myself are almost finished with our drinks.   Fast forward.  We order soup and salad .  I had the mushroom soup . It was ok.  Nothing either here or there.  My husband orders the Caesar salad which was so soggy from sitting in its dressing that it looked wet.  He barely ate the salad.  We also tried the portabella fries which were slightly cold but do have a nice flavor.  After the soup and salad course, we order another round of drinks prior to dinner being served as to enjoy the wine with dinner .  AGAIN, literally pour the wine in a glass and serve it .  Nothing fancy or mixed.   Dinner comes.  One steak, 2 fish dishes and I have linguine and clams.  The steak was under cooked and served looking horrid.  It tasted just ok but was so chewy it ruined the desire for a quality piece of meat.  Echo and Rig is a steak house btw.   The fish dishes , salmon and the sea bass were prepared nicely and our friends said they tasted good.  My dish the linguine and clams had so much garlic in it that when it was placed on the table, all of us said " Wow that is strong".  The stench of the garlic was overwhelming.  I go ahead and try the dish anyway.  The garlic was so heavy, I could not eat it.  No white wine or clam flavor at all just garlic.  Huge chunks of garlic.  To the point of burning your mouth slightly from the garlic taste.   I called the manager over and politely told her this dish was not able to be eaten.  She took it away.  At this point, I have no meal and everyone else is about done with their meals and guess what?? Our drinks come .  That's right , the whole time we had 3 of the 4 dinners, we had no wine.  Ridiculous.   We asked for a check. Decided we didn't need any dessert.  No one apologized for the service or the meal.  No one offered anything like a dessert or after dinner drink.  The manager didn't even apologize.  Nick just said we took the linguine off since it was not to your liking.  It was a terrible experience from beginning to end.   Just to share that we were not the only ones, we ran into 2 separate groups of friends on the way out.  One group of 4 had been waiting for 45 mins for their reservation that still wasn't ready.   The second group had a worse experience then we did.  They got there at 7 pm brought their own bottle of wine. The manager opened it (for a charge of course) dropped the bottle, it broke all over the floor and the guests.  Echo and Rig "gave" them another bottle which was about 100 dollars less in value than the one they brought in.  Offered them no discount.   The waiter never  brought them their oysters and after being asked twice for said oysters, they came 45 mins later with no forks, napkins or lemon.   They finally walked out about 945 being fed up with the horrid service and the waiter ran after them with the full bill.  Not even the wine corkage fee removed .   Truly, I could go on and on.  Suffice it to say DO NOT DINE HERE.  You will regret giving them your money, you will not have had an enjoyable meal and in my case you will be hungry.    No where near the standards of so many great steak houses in Las Vegas.  Thanks for reading !!!!

bPG1J5hu5Ll-tgH-u5Zvfw.text: Wow! I heard good things about Echo & Rig and this definitely lived up to my expectations. My husband was right when he said we should have eaten here sooner.  I really enjoy a good steak so we typically eat at steakhouses on the Strip and that is really my main comparison. How does Echo & Rig compare to steakhouses on the Strip? The food is at least as good, service is possibly better, and the atmosphere/dress is much more casual. The pricing is shockingly reasonable considering the top notch service and quality of the food.  The first floor is actually the butcher shop where meats are available to purchase and take home. The restaurant is upstairs with a large indoor dining room and an outdoor patio overlooking Tivoli. The decor is clean and minimal. The atmosphere is very laid back, it's not a steakhouse where you have to get really dressed up. We even saw a few tables with children.   Our waiter and the entire staff were on their game. Everyone was very attentive. We didn't have a long wait between courses, every food item was explained upon arrival, waters were constantly refilled, and any crumb on the table was removed immediately.   We started with two cocktails that were both delicious. After ordering I noticed that they even offer half glasses of wine. I would probably take advantage of that option next time since I'm not a huge drinker. Our appetizer of choice was the Lamb Cigars, my husband's pick. Delicious! Think Greek eggrolls. The filling inside was so flavorful, they weren't too greasy, and the dipping sauces were great. We would definitely order this again. The bread basket is a basic French bread with butter.  My steak of choice was the Spencer Steak. I loved the flavor and tenderness of this steak. The homemade chips on the side were abundant and pretty good. The mushroom Rockefeller was a highlight on the plate. I loved the mushroom and took my husband's too. My sauce of choice was the Red Wine Demi and it was delicious. My husband went with the Bavette Steak and loved it. He had the Charred Onion sauce and it was out of this world delicious. We both varied from our usual steak choices and were glad that we did.   Our shared sides were Mashed Potatoes and Butternut Squash. The butternut squash was well prepared, but was probably not the most exciting of what they offer so I'd pass on this next time. The mashed potatoes were flavorful and a good choice. The dessert menu is all sundaes. We shared the Chocolate Cherry Sundae and loved it. The sundae is definitely large enough for two.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Thick-Cut Bacon &amp; Barbecue Sauce
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Tenderloin
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus &amp; Fried Egg

Zv0ogcqdNle6pxFBhamKtQ.text: So I went here on a date recently.. the atmosphere was perfect for a romantic date! the host was very friendly and sweet. We walked up the stairs to a nice table by the windows. its far enough from other tables that you feel like you can have a nice conversation with the person you're with. The overall feel of the place is classy yet relaxing feel to it as well. The waiter we got was very attentive and was awesome. He was an older bald gentleman.. don't remember his name though. He seemed like he worked there for a while and knows his stuff. My date brought a couple of bottle of wines and the waiter was awesome at making sure the wine was poured into the glass decanter to bring out the flavor of the wine and he even poured it back into the bottle when we couldn't finish it all before we left. Service was amazing! top notch  So for starters we ordered the bone marrow carne asada.. my dates favorite dish! It was alright for me.. we also had Maryland lump crab cake as well.. which was tasty but nothing amazing. Just a normal crab cake.   So for dinner my date ordered the ribeye cap for $30 and I ordered the bavette which is supposed to be american kobe.. for $28. Price point for steaks is not bad.. the sauces they have for the steaks are pretty tasty too! So.. as far as my steak goes.. I was expecting a soft filet type of kobe steak... the steak I got was on the chewy side and definitely can't be cut with a fork.. I was not blown away by this steak.. I was expecting a better tasting steak with a better cut for what it was... maybe I should have ordered a the ribeye cap??.. which might of been more flavorful.. we also ordered sides too.. the mac and cheese.. was so good! as well as broccolini i believe...   Overall.. I would like to come back again.. this is a perfect date spot or a nice restaurant to come to with friends.. Service is great.. and food is good. I would recommend!

G_OPiYtIIDGhIcCoVAh8vw.text: Amazing!  Everything!  Weekend brunch with bottomless mimosas and Dinner with great oysters, steak, and the best dirty martini I've ever had.

htfNzhNzKVpoH7KaTiWqaA.text: My dad had made reservations to surprise my mom for her birthday.  I flew in ahead of time and came to the restaurant.  The staff was kind enough to coordinate with me to have our seating on the patio and to help surprise my mom by telling her that my dad's "clients," were waiting for them on the patio.  They also let me pick dessert before she arrived!  The staff was all very kind and continuously wished her a happy birthday.  The food was good, but I think I'll do a fattier cut than the Spencer steak next time.  I did enjoy the portobello mushroom fries a lot though!

Dk_k43NdnHMqRJ6rOg3sHQ.text: Gave this place a second chance and it was great. Just celebrated my birthday and the food was amazing. I highly recommend the portobello fries and the gnocchi for appetizer. The Ribeye was great and the garlic mashed potatoes were awesome. The caramel and coffee desert really hit the spot. The service was top notch and I had a great time. Much better than the last time I was there. Highly recommend you go. It really was amazing.

ZKK8pXA0Pq5e_aoxeyMZlA.text: Was here approx 5 pm Mon/10 Sep for happy hour: - $2 for steak & egg, such a great deal that I re-ordered it as a triple. - $3 draft beer, I made that a double. - $2 shrimp cocktail was a lot, just not my cup of tea. - $1 Echo dog was out, will have to be back to try it out.  At these prices, with the quality and fair portions in food/beverages, fancy dining setting and gracious service, it's the best happy hour I've been to in Vegas. //// My rating system for value: 5-Stars = Great, 4-Stars = Good, 3-Stars = Ok, 2-Stars = Overpriced for what I'm getting, 1-Star = I feel cheated :/ ////////////////////// My Top 9 West-Side Value Eats (great food + great price). - As of 21 Sep 2018.  No particular order.  Bonus brownie points to places close to me, mom & pop shops, minimal wait times to get seated. a) KoMex - Korean-Mexican b) Sin Citys Taco China (near DI & Decatur) - Mexican c) Big Wong (near DI & Decatur) - Chinese d) Flock & Fowl or anything by Chef Sheridan's family (eg Fat Choy) e) Sushi Neko - AYCE sushi and fish portions are huge f) Jackson's Bar & Grill - about $15 for 16 oz ribeye meal available 24/7 g) Chuchote - Thai h) Estiatorio Milos (Strip) - Mediterranean, $29 three-course lunch i) Echo & Rig, best happy hour - $2 steak & egg from the restaurant's butcher shop

xx3ceLltn-qQ4WUWMCM-Lg.text: My husband took me here for my birthday last night and wow! Service was impeccable ( I work for 5 star hotel in town so I know great service). Food was amazing as well.  The blueberry mojito (?) was delicious! Drunken goat was amazing all the flavors together went so well and it's HUGE. I took half home. My husband had the filet mignon and he said it was better than STK. we also got a crab cake, macaroni and cheese and the garlic mashed potatoes. All were so delicious.   Got the chocolate cherry desert for by birthday and also so good. This place is a must!   Only downside was its LOUD inside. Although we did have a party of 8 with two very loud drunk guys right next to us so maybe that's why but if you want quiet I'd sit outdoors.

lpeEbzbyj9RwzIQYCU0ZLg.text: This has to be one of my top 3 brunch spots in Vegas. The view, beautiful. The food, great. The service, excellent. Where can you go wrong?  A group of about 10 of us came for a Sunday brunch. We were easily about to put in a reservation beforehand to ensure our spot. We ended up sitting in the inside dining room which was equally as nice as the patio.  As for food I had the smoked salmon. They gave me more than enough salmon along with the usual toppings of capers, onions, tomatoes and a bagel with cream cheese. This was probably one of the best salmon platters I've had. 5/5 Of course I also had to do a bottomless mimosa. I kind of liked that they present the champagne and the orange juice separately to ensure each person enjoys as much or as little of a mix as they want. They also don't skimp on the bottomless part. They were constantly coming around for refills.   So glad I finally tried this place and will most certainly be back again.

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon

qPwXrOFx4kfk4L0FL-h3Rg.text: We had a delectable lunch here! From the start, our server Rae was a doll with great energy and smart suggestions. My cocktail, the Duck Duck Goose was delicious, made with mandarin vodka juices and mint bitters. For starters we had the spicy cauliflower (ah-MAZ-ing!!!) And the thick cut bacon....Devine! We shared a steak, which we ordered medium rare, though to my opinion was verging on medium well, so overcooked. My boyfriend didn't want to send it back, so we ate it. That was just so so. It was my birthday and Rae brought out a delicious apple sundae, again YUM! We will be back!

PvFs1bVuNgKLl-1PzEp2xQ.text: We just had THE most AMAZING meal at Echo & Rig. . . Everything from the chopped salad to the appetizers (portobello mushroom fries and calamari) to the steaks, sandwiches and linguine to the final ice cream sundaes were phenomenal!!!   On top of that, the service was the most efficient and impeccable service I've ever had . . Friendly, efficient and attentive. . . We were right by the kitchen and chef Goose entertained us with his banter and comical one liners . . . It was by far the best dining experience we've had in a long time and on New Year's Eve to have that kind of service is just amazing! Chef Goose also posed for a picture and we were told he never does that!!! We will definitely be back!

fTEKHFQd_uSm1oY1da3k5w.text: This restaurant is Located in Tivoli Village, I recently came here with friends for brunch. We didn't have to wait long for a seat since we made reservations which you might want to consider doing since the place was busy when we arrived. The restaurant has a nice classy look to it and a balcony where you can eat also. The one thing they have is bottomless mimosas which is a benefit.now the food is good also. Now for the service it wasn't good at all are server came and took our order and it took about 30 minutes to get our food. After we received our food our server didn't come by to check on us ask if we needed anything else. Finally a busser came by to clear our plates from the table still no server. As we sat there waiting for our server to bring us the bill he never came by, we finally just had to waive someone over to bring us the bill. This was the worst service I ever received.

PiSQtWBoNf7nH6S38Rc74Q.text: What can you say about perfection. We are so happy that place like tivoli is around for locals to enjoy fine food and great atmosphere without having to go down to the strip. Echo and rig is excellent. I've been here several times every single time it's fabulous. The service is second to none and the food is very good. It's not the most expensive meal either... It's priced spot on in my opinion

DDRptbxY5Of1TfjAdf9Weg.text: Their service is good, and they make a good steak. I've tried a few appetizers all have been very tasty so far. Whenever I feel like eating a steak I come here.

n_iMt2X8BnAlDZ11c0S3UQ.text: We make a point of going here for brunch at least once a month! Definitely an incredible spot, great food, great mimosas, and top of the line service! Avocado toast is some of the best in town and all their food has been exceptional every time we go! Highly recommend going here for brunch!!

x86QsHpyJD7PhCOAIVecRg.text: AN UPDATE  I was out of town for half a year in 2016. So, I was pleasantly surprised when we cane back to Echo and Rigs for a great dinner with our out of town friends a week ago, to see its newly reconfigured, inviting first floor! Our guests were impressed with its locale; the high-ceiling entrance, facing the grand stair case; the charming bar and lounge on the left and the stylish butchery on the right! The butchery shop now looks more stylish with its glass display meat lockers and an attractive demo area.  The friendly, charming hostess greeted us warmly and seated in the gorgeous balcony upstairs (elevator accessible). As expected, we enjoyed our scrumptious dishes, drinks and the impeccable service from Sam and his crew, which was attentive, friendly, yet not overbearing! The nice Mgr, Xavior, also came by our table to say hello, and helped out when the restaurant got super busy.   OUR DINNER:   APPS - all 5*  1. Broccolini - crunchy freshly and flavorful  2. Avocado toast - Buttery and tasty!  3.  Fried spinach salad - uncommonly crispy good! We ordered an extra!   4. Portobello fries - Simply must have! Yes, we ordered extra, too!    MAINS   1. Butcher cut - Skirt steak, with chips and mushroom, 4.0* - Juicy, flavorful; a bit tough to cut  2. Butter Fish, 5* - Flaky, tasty, buttery!  3. Steakhouse Cut- Filet mignon with chips and Rockefeller mushroom, 5* - Melts in mouth tender, juicy and flavorful!  We had 2 orders, BOTH mouthwatering good! Two of us ordered the same.   Over the years, my wife and I have enjoyed lunch, happy hour and dinner here, and we often entertain our guests here. By the way, their specialty Tomahawk steaks continue to wow us!  The waiter would make an impressive presentation of the huge tomahawk steaks on a ginormous tray. We actually had them in 2 occasions and found them superb! But, their menu offer so many other delicious selections!   I also like its happy hour ("HAPPIEST" hour as they call it), 3-6 DAILY & 10p-1a M-Sat, featuring draft @$3, wine and well drinks @4; selected drinks FREE to LADIES! The bar dishes are $2+.  BOTTOM LINE:   The quality of their dishes and service, and the casual yet almost elegant ambiance make us keep going back there for more. Our out of town guests like it so much that they even go back there by themselves!   June 2016

D6b9r-32Mu-vWjxLozz-Rw.text: Echo & Rig - The atmosphere is very enjoyable with a smaller menu for lunch. Great location @ tivoli village- Summerlin.  Echo & Rig has an added bonus - A Great butcher shop! Today I purchased some amazing prosciutto along with two types of salami (so yummy). This isn't your grocery store deli....Do yourself a favor and Check it out!

kgDayp0APqTeQGmHLvUi8w.text: Hospitality here is amazing! Really memorable experience, and the food was excellent.  The location is a few miles off the strip which is great, because it gives you a chance to drive out and forget you're in one of the most touristy destination places in the Western world.  It's a newly developed plaza, so it may not show up on older GPS maps as I found out.  Better to use your phone instead.    So you pull up to this sprawling Italian influenced shopping center, Tivoli Village, complete with huge center fountain.  The restaurant is prominently located at the entrance across from a popular Italian restaurant and sports bar, near the fountain.  There is plenty of free parking if you don't want to valet.  When you enter Echo & Rig, it looks like an upscale butcher's, with fresh meat and sausages on display.  The hostess is extremely friendly, and got to know our party a little before selecting our table (where we were from, if it was our first time, etc).  They had tables out on the patio and a larger, beautiful dining area inside, next to the kitchen.  We sat inside, which was perfect.  The hostess took us upstairs via the elevator although there is a winding grand staircase, and she really makes us feel at home.  Once seated, we were greeted by I think the M'aitre d, Derrick, who welcomes us and thanks us for coming.  Our waiter, Raoul, then walked us through the menu and the specialty items, going through the ala carte menu as well which you can also order as appetizers.  There are so many small tapa like items to order, we got the lamb cigars and crab cakes which I highly recommend.  The small dishes range from $6, $8, and $10.  I also ordered a baked potato, which wasn't on the menu (although there is a baked sweet potato) but they happily made anyway that came with the steak.  For the main entrees, they have surprisingly a large variety of choices besides steaks.  There's several chicken dishes, seafood, pork, and even duck.  Of course, they are known as a steak house and their choice of cuts is superb.  I got the Rib Eye Cap (the best part of the ribeye) and was not disappointed.  Each entree came with homemade chips and potato cakes.  Every cut is, I believe, 10 ounces and was plenty big.  Grilled to perfection too, of course.  You can't go here without noticing the excellent service and modern technology implemented.  Derrick who I think is the M'aitre d again came out to chat with us after our appetizers came out to make sure everything was to our satisfaction and asked if there was anything we needed.  I ordered a beer and then less than a minute later someone from downstairs comes up and delivers my beer.  How did that happen so fast?  Also, we noticed that there were a couple of people with iPads just walking around making sure and double checking that everything was being done, which was somewhat surreal.  The level of communication and service here was extraordinary and worth another visit just to observe!    Finally, the GM of the restaurant came out to visit after the meal to invite us back and make sure everything was exceptional, which it was.  He even mentioned that they were planning to open another Echo & Rig in Los Angeles by next year and that the owner already owned a popular Italian steakhouse in DTLA, Botega Louie which I now want to try.  We were too full for dessert, but I would have to assume it would have been awesome.

IQRCHsDcZsahNs8XLx38Uw.text: My all time favorite since I moved here in 2014. The fact that they have no corkage on any wine you bring, staff is amazing, ambiance is great and food is superb from Bone Marrow to other sides. Pricey but worth it. I love its location, close to home and have always returned here on special occasions. Great place for people you'd love to have conversations with. Amazeeeeeeballz

7sCg8aavkvb94zAhoY-7TA.text: We went for Happy Hour on a Saturday. The service was amazing! We were served immediately by a bartender/waiter who was super attentive! His recommendations on their taps were on point! The only reason I am hesitant to give this place a 5 star is due to the steak we ordered was SOOO overdone! I couldn't believe they would even serve it - it was dry and Burned AF!  We just didn't expect a nice, fancy steakhouse like this one would serve such. The 4 star is for the impeccable service. Our bartender/waiter saw how burned the steak was...and did replace it.  The replacement was way better than burnt...but still was not medium rare. We recommend the place for Happy Hour on Saturday which goes from4-6pm

oKypgKeFpIMFeBQFMtcatQ.text: Can't go wrong with echo and rig. Everything is top notch when it comes to the food and service. Brunch is delicious, steaks are delicious, price is right.

Z3fyIO2l6pY2T_mZYj6BkQ.text: My husband and i went here for our Anniversary dinner. It's absolutely amazing. Food presentation was wonderful and the the service was phenomenal. We will definitely be going back !!

DOVIFE6LwiaNHE8RLXO9Rw.text: Ate there for the first time this evening.  Sat on the balcony which had a very nice view of the seasons lighting in Tivoli.  Balcony was heated so it was very comfortable. Had steak, hmm-delicious treat for me, with spinach on the side.  Mushrooms on the side were very good.  WIll go back, highly recommended.

RiVI_uqn8yyDXp6fH2F8YQ.text: The food is amazing but the design of the room amplifies the sound and everyone tends to be yelling.  I enjoyed brunch more on the outside balcony than inside.  The short rib hash was heavenly.

All three of us in our party had the strip steak which was reasonably priced and one of the best steaks of any quality I've ever had. uQWZWf_QMuUMeIXEQlQyaw.text: The hostesses were extremely rude and completely wrote off my party when we informed them that we did not have a reservation for brunch. One hostess thought it was appropriate to roll her eyes and turn the other way, which obviously that is not. This restaurant does NOT require a reservation, and they had an opening if we wanted to wait 50 minutes, which we would have had they not been so rude. Awesome brunch, horrible customer service.

nr6mq-OUPQ32WUZlLQ99qw.text: The lunch I here was just okay.  I had the bolognese which was okay but not memorable. The pasta was cooked just right is the best I can say.  I had a truffle bread appetizer that was tasty. The coffee was mediocre.  Pasta bolognese, bread & coffee cost $35.00 before tip. Hf_KqukpcxTQ2JrxPjvnyQ.text: Went AGAIN to echo and rig,.. as expected the service was above beyond. Exquisite personal and first class professionalism. Prices are right and the food is AMAZING! Kevin wasn't even my server but he made SURE that my and my company were WELL taken care of!!! Honestly I love this place!! If you ever in question on what to order...just ask KEVIN

mQMxyPMbvPZcNnKPLapGZQ.text: A diamond in the rough.  Everything about this place is 5 stars.  Service, food quality, price, originality.  My wife and i are picky foodies and we go about once a week here.

DfdpJli1fgdNunsyow0sng.text: Amazing brunch! And I'm talking unlimited mimosas on the weekends!  You'll get your money's worth with the endless mimosas....they'll come around and fill your glass until you have to say "okay, no more!"  The service here is remarkable.  Each time I've been here the manager stops by my table (and other patron's tables) to ensure that the dining experience has been nothing short of the best.  Make sure you call ahead and make a reservation because this place gets packed! As for the menu, I have yet to have a brunch meal I've been disappointed with, and the grilled cheese is to die for!  I haven't tried the dinner menu...yet. Echo and arid has gluten free options for those on special diets. Be prepared to spend about 35-50$ here, but I promise it's worth it.

wUU-tH4bahwWAF6_n1u3jg.text: I've been dying to try this place and finally had the opportunity to! Absolutely phenomenal! Phenomenal food and phenomenal service, you will NOT be disappointed! See Roland, he's a wonderful waiter!

CkFdRW6DeYRK5qnuBhAMSQ.text: Let me start by saying I'm not a fan and I doubt I will ever be back to Echo & Rig.  We came here late afternoon and there was one other party in the restaurant.  We were brought our iced tea quickly and it was refilled frequently while we were there.  I had looked at the menu online and I took some time to decide once there.  For a starter, we ordered their portobello fries which were served with an herb aioli.  This was the first I noticed that anything that stated garlic or should have had garlic (herb aioli) had no garlic taste at all.  The herb aioli was good but missing the garlic flavor.  My wife ordered the tri-tip steak--medium--even though I suggested she get medium rare and I ordered the hanger steak blue.  She was drawn to the tri-tip because the menu said lemon and garlic neither of which was evident in any way.  Garlic fail number 2.  All their steaks come with garlic chips (no garlic flavor here either--garlic fail #3) and a mushroom Rockefeller, a breadcrumb stuffed mushroom cap.  The portobello mushroom was wonderful with the light coating and the cheese shreds.  Then we waited.  We saved some of the mushrooms fries for our steak, and then we waited some more.  Approximately 20 minutes later, our server said the steaks would be right out.  He took our small plates and silver away.  About 5 minutes went by and he stopped by once again and said the steaks would be right there.  About 5 minutes later, he stopped by to say they'd be out in about a minute.  This time, he was right.  When the steaks arrived, I noticed that both had been cut in slices and I just cringed.  I absolutely hate it when this is done.  Maybe that's why so FEW places do it.  I asked if there was a culinary reason and the server said he'd ask.  When he came back he told us that the chefs said it was to make the steaks more tender.  My steak was good, but it was cooked a little more than I would do it at home.  My wife's steak was less tender and because of her medium order, which they did, the steak was less juicy and there was a fair amount of sinew that you wouldn't expect.  She was quite disappointed although some blame needs to be placed at her door.  But above all, I'd say, please don't cut my steak.  I'm not a two year old and I'm not infirm.  I Googled this when I got home and found that the only reason (perhaps) to do this was to cut the steak against the grain the right way.  We each had a sundae for dessert.  They were OK.  I left Echo & Rig very disappointed.  The length of time from ordering to getting our mains was ridiculous when the place is less than 1/10 full.  It was a Tuesday afternoon--not date night USA at 8 PM.

PYioN17WNcnZ56LvjBm2HQ.text: This was our first time going to this place with my boyfriend. Now the food, OMG best steak ever!! We loved the place and will definitely go back again. Hopefully our second visit is as awesome as the first one ;) Awesome service Awesome food  Awesome place
