duyJgD5_WkGcn9hlgKsAyA.text: This is a favorite brunch spot of mine. It's a great spot to go if you're looking for patio dining, they have an awesome upstairs patio to sit at and take in the nice views of tivoli village. They offer bottomless mimosas with a variety of juice options. Service is fast and they have great customer service. Every time I go, the manager makes it a point to walk around and ask every table how they're doing, which I think is fantastic. I've only been here for brunch so I can only speak for brunch items, but food is also fantastic! Will definitely have to try this place out for dinner. Would definitely recommend!

qZGeY1gANgjtdgv1vmnpfg.text: What an exceptional place to dine! The service was superb- very attentive and professional. Appetizers were delicious and unique. The main dishes, chicken pot pie, lamb, scallops and lasagna were the best we have ever tasted.  We sat on the patio; it was a little warm but not enough to gave to go inside.

4kBbOM5AA-xMP71PpVPSEw.text: This has been a restaurant I've been wanting to try and now I'm wondering what took me so long! We had brunch - the staff was attentive and nice . The food was amazing - one of the best burgers I've ever had!!! I can't wait to go back for a stEak !!!!!!!

5ydhN1QCDSBP38uenWg7fw.text: Yes, this is a classic steakhouse, but so much more. Their seafood is either sustainable or organic, and they have a solid cocktail program. Their price point is reasonable compared to other restaurants of the same quality. However, I was most impressed with their sides. Asparagus with a fried egg on top with Parmesan, perfectly cook and seasoned. The standout was their side of lentils with carrots and green onions. I have had lentils prepped in various was and several varietals, but this was their most surprising. I will definitely be back again. Highly recommend for anyone in the area. Also Austin, our server was great as was all services. Selina (?) our floor manager was always available and accommodating.

mOOHeNWQdAmNcc1XEHwYUw.text: I had been wanting to go here for a while, so I knew the menu by heart before we got there. My most favorite cut of meat was on the menu, Rib Eye Cap, but they didn't have any!  Oh no! But all was not lost. So many cuts to choose from! We decided to share a 50oz. Tomahawk Ribeye (even though my husband wanted it all to himself).    Our server was Samuel, he was excellent at explaining everything. All of our service experienced was fantastic. They addressed my husband as Mr. D... The manager stopped by to chat with us. We went on a Friday around 6 and there was no wait. We opted to sit outside on the patio, it's a heated patio so we stayed nice and warm.   We had some drinks over dinner and after...great selection of bourbon, whiskey and scotch, how can we not! We didn't catch his name but the bartender downstairs was knowledgable about all the bottles we asked about.   Before our steak we had some complimentary bread (which was delicious) and ordered the Carne Asada  Bone Marrow. Yum! Very flavorful, we would go back just for this!   Our steak was cook cooked perfectly. Nice crust of char on the outside, just enough red on the inside. Juicy and seasoned perfectly. It came sliced, bone on the side. We got some dipping sauces but they are not needed. We tried the Bleu Cheese, Red Wine Demi,  Chimichurri, and  Green Peppercorn....they were all tasty. It came with a  Stuffed Mushroom Rockefeller and a handful of Garlic Potato Chips. We ordered sides of Garlic Mashed Potatoes with Sharp White Cheddar (yum) and  Chile de Arbol  Roasted Cauliflower (nice spice).   I was full at this point but we decided if they'd make us just a regular Hot Fudge Sundae since they have the ingredients for it (their dessert menu is all ice cream). It was nothing special, just a sundae.  I would definitely go back, look forward to trying other items on the menu. I want to go now!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 50 oz. Tomahawk ribeye

CIAXSiNS8tKrhaXdqVUpCQ.text: After hearing so much about this place from friends living in Summerlin, we finally made it.  Came for lunch, and it turned into a carni-whore pig-out fest! We ordered the Hangar meat entree with chips and mushroom - amazing! Meat was well seasoned, cooked to the right temperature and presented beautifully. We also ordered 2 small plates, 2 sides and a dessert. oink oink. The bone marrow carne asada and the octopus were both very exotic but definitely cooked perfectly, not over done as that's easy to do. The butter squash and cauliflower sides were both very unique and very delicious as well.   I really like the butcher shop modern decor on the first floor with the juice/sandwich bar for people on the run. The restaurant is on the 2nd floor and has a very nice view of the Trivoli village fountain. Such a lovely place! The service was very friendly and attentive. Our waiter was funny and took good care of us.   Highly recommend!

5c5lwa6lk0la49h6ljUhUw.text: This place is amazing. Delicious steaks for a great price, and the service is awesome. I went here for an anniversary dinner and they brought us a cute dessert and were very sweet. They do a great job of answering any questions and making good suggestions

Let's begin with the fantastic ambiance - you cas check out the dry aged meats, they have specialty items when you walk in - I love the salt scrub (yup!).  They have spectacular wine service - however overall the service was 5 stars.    The food was EXCELLENT, the service EXCELLENT and I loved the ambiance.  Here is a secret - no corkage!  Shhhhhh....

QGriwUTyfNnr7gytNy-Djg.text: Fantastic service!!! Steak was great. However, I ordered my ribeye cap rare-plus and it came out almost medium. Might have been the sizzling plate. Nevertheless it was tender and flavorful. Great atmosphere! Very unsuspecting place in a surprisingly upscale center.   Dress code: none. We came in jeans and tee and even a baseball cap. No dirty looks. No questions/comments/etc. Granted a good portion of diners were in more dapper attire. Oh wells!

i4FYn1Lj7dSZUeLEuOTxqw.text: LOVED this restaurant. Absolutely a beautiful place for dinner. I highly recommend coming here when you are in town. It's about a 20 minute drive off the strip but totally worth. First off, the location of the restaurant is in a beautiful shopping center and is very easy to locate as soon as you get in. The restaurant itself is also very spacious and the dining area is primarily upstairs.   When you first walk in, you will immediately see on you right a very well decorated meat display and meat cutting. The service was phenomenal and the food was delicious. I ordered the lamb and it was cooked perfectly. All my other girlfriends really enjoyed their meal as well.   Overall, great place for a date night, GNO, or family dinner. You will not regret driving a little out of your way for this steakhouse.

qdiuTwMX3gFSgWaSM8VF-w.text: Went for brunch during the weekend with friends. The food was mediocre, but the bottomless mimosas were great. They kept our glasses full. Make sure to ask for other juices; they have white cranberry juice and pineapple. Anthony, the waiter, told us about them. He was amazing!

h_u5V6D-fHxz1ywlQTjWig.text: DANG.. this was great.   amazing place, beautiful environment, great meat,  probably deserve another start, my meat was incredible tasty, however _WAY_ too chewy for the billing.. soo 4 stars it is.  Bottom line, you can't really go wrong with this place.  great food, not too expensive.  enjoy.

8ru2EqAvY499OP3pdBvr1w.text: We came here during brunch on a Saturday and who could say no to $16 for bottomless mimosas. I ended up getting the short rib hash and I thought it was way too heavy for breakfast. But it's okay there's bottomless mimosas! You can even control your ratio of champagne and orange juice which was so nice.   The service was great, we really couldn't get to the bottom of our mimosas before they refilled it. The manager also came up and asked us how we're doing. It's a nice extra touch to show that they care and even asked if we wanted sriracha to go with our short rib hash. It's feeling so fancy though since it was the first time in my life seeing sriracha served in a sauce cup haha.

J_nyQ_MUfLpiDI6ddkjgDA.text: Great food. Impressive meat cuts, very flavorful and cooked to perfection. The sauces are amazing that came with the steaks. i got the wild mushroom soup and it was under seasoned and under salted but good flavor once adjusted.

wldOxb7u-reI6sFwQwDnVQ.text: NO!  The owners should be aware of the rude man hosting the door.  When I simply asked about how long is the wait, he said "Do you want to go upstairs and see when the four tables that I only have available will be leaving?"  I've never, I thought he was joking but I guess the joke was on me!  Thanks but no thanks, go to Brio instead.

sgQFl6_LuEXCvuXbOXPRcw.text: Wow that a great experience. I'm not just talking about the food and the ambience; It's the customer service that blew me away! I'm so impressed with how the management emphasizes on the importance of service. The moment we walked in the hostess was friendly and complimentary. And the service manager came back a few times asking how things are going and she even welcomed me back. The waiter was great too. 10 stars for customer service!

QlgDXa79LmNjSZm2o9aAzA.text: This place is really nice for brunch and dinner. I prefer to do a late lunch because it gets busy at night from what I hear. The interior was kept very clean modern, with a country style hint to it. Waiters and waitress staff was kept very uptight and professional long sleeve white button up flannels.  I ordered the butterfish and my partner ordered the very famous short rib grilled cheese. The first bite into my fish and it melted in my mouth the mango slices give it just the right amount of acidity and the balsamic and butter green onion gives a good balance. Texture is fantastic with a light brown crust at the top. The grilled cheese you kidding me the marriage with the short rib and mozzarella cheese is a perfect marriage. I just wished they added a sour soup on the side preferably tomato soup to balance the rich flavors.  Overall a great place to wine and dine I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crusted butterfish

h5dNaSL99lZJGCBpfXdOwg.text: After revisiting Echo and Rig with clients I was so impressed to find that the room was still in beautiful shape, the food and services have found their way, and this Summerlin staple gets it right every time!  In the last month I've been in for business and pleasure, and each time it just gets better!  Managers remember you and greet you at the table, servers remember me by name, and the food is always oh so good!    Eat here now and often...You will love it!

qs2lCEz9FpcQ6krq7Gevww.text: Food was excellent as always! Our server, Ari, was excellent as always & his busser, Zach , was great as well (our second time with Zach). We tried the crab cake, bacon & grilled octopus for appetizers. We ordered the usual favorite steaks, but tried these broccolini as a side dish with the mashed potatoes this time.  TIP: Fresh Oysters are only served Thursday- Saturday. This visit was excellent as always. We brought two business partners who loved the place as well & definitely want to return when next in town.

w4cocomFby9du6Eij6BhlA.text: This top notch steak house and butcher shop is the total package. Amazing ambiance, full menu full of delicious options, and the service is off the charts professional and friendly. Loved the ribeye. The sorbet was amazing!   Coming here again and again

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner and crayon play at the table

DJGbIM4OS3gd9FASlTLcvg.text: The staff is very polite and welcoming. They were able to oblige all of our requests and did it with a smile when we stopped by for Sunday brunch.   The standard coffee is really something to rave about. Such a smooth roast.   Unlimited mimosas are as cheap as you will find and are presented beautifully.   The food is healthy and tastes wonderful.

FQf6BVusf9UCWEphpeh1EA.text: I cannot say enough wonderful things about this place, food is AMAZING!!!!  The prices are great considering the quality of food and meat that you receive. I go to the butchers more often than the restaurant and it always means that my meal will be outstanding. I always feel like i am being taken care of extremely well when I come in. LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.

ZUMl7Q1js5vbsPBln4aOQg.text: There's not much more to say that hasn't already been said about this place.  It is amazing.  We've been here twice and both times sat out on the balcony/patio.  The service is top notch and the food is outstanding.

MtYfDnZXJd5UGrm-qnN7Og.text: This review would be based off of the Happy Hour. As always, service here is great. Happy Hour is great especially if you are looking for snack sized portions. I mean, a $1.99 steak and egg wouldn't be bad (2ounce steak). Portions are all right. Drinks are good. The ambiance is perfect. What is there more to look for. And yes, do try the portobello fries... it's worth trying!! Even their crudo is perfect:

_ZwdD3LdVLxwyVfSkjqF9w.text: I was brought here by my boyfriend for my birthday dinner.  From the time we walked in the door to the time we left the service was amazing. The hostesses at the door both greeted us with a smile and wished me a happy bday.  When we were seated or amazing waiter, Art, was there to greet us and again I was wish a happy bday. As soon as we said that we woukd like water to drink we blinked and it was there on the table.   Now onto the food... Art explained the menu and made recommendations. We decided on the Portobello fries with aoili... AMAZING. I decided on the butterfish and it was delicious. It was not the best that I have ever had but it definitely did not disappoint. Rarely do I finish my but tonight it was clean. My boyfriend had salmon and it too was delicious and did not disappoint. I also had the black and blue berry mojito, oh I wish I would of had a 2nd one.   For dessert, which we don't usually do, we had the Carmel turtle and it was ah-maze-ing.    What was observed.... Being it was our first time we like to people watch, watch the staff and check out the crowd. The WHOLE team worked together as a TEAM. Watch closely and you will see how they communicate passing little card(s) and whispering about likes, dislikes, allergies, reason for visit, anniversary, bdays. We watched as each team member picked up to help the next. How the team in the kitchen worked together to get the food out. How ALL of them helped clean off plates and glasses from tables. To include the manager helping with getting food out to tables.   Thank you Echo and Rig Team for giving us an excellent experience.

s8Tf9mx8zUN-khUD6zXz1w.text: I took my Mom here for her 86th(!) birthday a couple months ago. The portobello fries were great and my fillet mignon even better. My only complaint was our server was attentive at first then just pretty much blew us off and took forever to bring the to go boxes and check. I'm going again and will update so hopefully the server will be more on point. Maybe he was having a bad day. The special Birthday sundae they made for my Mom was amazing! She's very picky about ice cream, cake, etc but she loved this one and ate lots of it!   The balcony was really prime that day too. I highly recommend it when the weather permits.

lT_Z3f8xyEL4eQPCU8mqSQ.text: This is a wonderful restaurant for brunch. The reason it is getting four stars rather than five stars are for two main reasons: the first is that the service needs improvement in terms of how they serve their bottomless mimosas. There is one person that is assigned to pour champagne and he filled everyone's glass as he kept coming around. The problem is that he would pour champagne in your glass without asking if he could pour it into your glass. Some people like a little more juice in their Mimosa so I did not like the fact that somebody kept pouring champagne into my drink without asking me. I'm sure that if we asked, we could get a carafe of champagne to pour ourselves as we please. This should be the standard for this restaurant and not somebody coming around, pouring champagne into your glass without asking first. To me, that is seriously bad service. The second reason for the four stars is that we reserved on OpenTable and got their way earlier than other people, yet we were told that we could not get a table outside because they were already requested? At no point does the restaurant indicate that on OpenTable, nor in all of the times that I have been there which have been plenty. That was not cool to me. The restaurant tried to rectify it by giving us a complimentary serving of avocado toast, which was very nice of them, but we didn't really care for it because we ordered plenty of other food already. With that being said, we had a wonderful waitress who was just awesome. We ordered the steel cut oatmeal, the salmon with bagel and cream cheese and condiments, and the waffle with berries. It was all delicious. I will say that I did not order coffee, but I know there was a problem in serving with coffee. One of my friends was pretty frustrated because the person pouring coffee, which was the same person pouring the champagne, kept pouring coffee into her cup without asking first. Therefore, this is a great place for brunch, yet you want to make sure that if you are ordering a bottomless Mimosa, you are OK with a lot more champagne and a lot less orange juice, due to the way that it was being poured. Secondly, make sure to add notes to your OpenTable reservation or call to request a table on the outside patio.

I_t3_BwGty5DJmGhUp3l4g.text: OUTSTANDING!!! This place pays attention to detail. From the hostess introduction to them communicating to server who my boyfriend and I were. Our server (Oscar;Ask for him for sure) was amazing and so informative for 1st time clients (we will be back). We started w/the oysters and clams (AMAZEBALLS-Best I've ever had!!). And Now the STEAKS, The steaks, the mac n cheese, the garlic chips, the portello mushrooms, EVEN THE BREAD AND BUTTER....SUPERB! And they even allowed us to partake in their dessert the berry shortcake for my boyfriends birthday! very nice and light! If I was a food critic I would tell EVERYONE to dine here when you are in LV! Thank you!

fq6Q1NjO03ZM6ejkoddJIg.text: Coming straight from the Source LELV! We love Echo and RIg no complaints here. Brunch has always been our thing and E&R doesn't disappoint. Outside balcony is fabulous being Las Vegas you would think the outside might be a little uncomfortable but don't you worry about that. So how's food. Excellent!! Every dish we try puts a smile to our faces. Don't forget the bottomless mimosas.

wrWiuu3FPONagABUQUvphA.text: Start with the amazing staff and ends with a smile and 5 star food.  This is the top 3 dinners I have ever had.  The floor managers are impressive and detailed in finding out if there is a special occasion to where you live.  He checked our table regularly and made sure everything was going perfect.  It was mostly because of our waiter Israel!  He brought out the steak tray to pick the steak they were cooking for me.  He knew the menus like the back of his hand but even more importantly, he was engaging throughout the meal.  3 or four times through the meal he grabbed my wife's phone and took a picture of us.  Even when walking out,  4 staff members thanked us for coming.  Can't wait to tell friends when they visit Vegas!

mynftM9zEUmH2xFVdl_xIQ.text: Wow. Lamb Porterhouse, portobello fries, cauliflower and tartar were off the charts!!  Marry that to great service and you truly can't go wrong.

CFVYqJdgrabNB53l5AcfWg.text: We eat here at least once a week. The food is amazing and the prices are jaw dropping affordable for the quality. The sea bass a la Plancha and Spencer steak are the two favorite dishes. We sit out on the patio and our favorite server is Adam.  I can't believe these prices for such high quality meals. The ambience is just a bonus.

p8WhIRyaR0bssAPi9y7CjQ.text: Stopped by here without a reservation and got seated at the bar at a rather busy time, self-seated and our waiter was quick and prompt. Complimented my date and was very enthusiastic about her dishes when I asked for suggestions. We ended up getting the King Salmon, Ribeye Cap, Oysters, and the Portobello Fries with Herb Aioli. Ribeye was requested medium and came out perfect, portobello fries were interesting and tasted amazing with the aioli however I only really enjoyed the first few. The king salmon was cooked well and went great with the carrot puree.  As for the negatives out of 3 selections of oysters only one was available during our time eating, we came at a rather busy time so it is understandable, along with that the garlic chips are really unappetizing with the steak and I believe that mashed potatoes or a savory green dish would be a better complement instead of the chips. Mushroom side was good however there was only one with the steak. Would have definitely enjoyed the steak more if sides were different.  Price wise in terms of food with a drink and side for dinner would likely hit you around $40 however this place is also good for a quick bite with the sandwiches, salads, and soups at around $7-15  Valet Parking is free which is a plus but overall the food was enjoyable service was amazing and I will likely come by again, though i hope I can substitute a different dish with the garlic chips.

tDz2bhHvN5dzn2IK7N0VGQ.text: When Bear reminded me that I needed to think about what restaurant I wanted to go to for my birthday, it's not like I was stumped for suggestions.  If one thing's for sure about Vegas, there will NEVER be a shortage of places to explore different cuisines, excellent to otherwise.  Echo and Rig was one I'd heard about before, and I saw it when we went to Tivoli Village to another eatery, Cantina Laredo, which was also excellent.  So once I saw it on Open Table as I flipped though, selecting it was a no-brainer.  Now, we like to pride ourselves on a knack for one-upping the quality level of our experiences, each time we go out to a new place to eat. Anyone who does knows that there's about a 50/50 chance you'll have a great time, or not-so-great.  I am over-the-moon to report that E&R was nothing but spectacular.   Let's start with walking in. More of a butcher shop that just happens to have a full bar downstairs, and a restaurant upstairs, the meat cases are the very first thing to capture your attention as you enter. And you realize immediately, seeing the impressive various cuts of steak and pork and who-knows-what-else on display, that no, Dorothy, we're not in Kansas anymore.  We ain't at the local Safeway Meat Department, either.  We were warmly greeted and invited to have a drink from the bar and a seat in the lobby, while we waited for them to get our table set. I don't think the chairs had a chance for our butts to warm them up, when the receptionist came and took us up to the dining room.  Once she seated us, again it was only a brief moment before our server, Sam, (fancy that - easy name to remember, too!) appeared to see to us.  When the wait staff in Vegas establishments is good, they are VERY good, and Sam is top-notch. Knowledgeable, witty, accessible and quick with great suggestions, he made sure that as the 'birthday boy', I was well taken care of, but he DEFINITELY made sure that we both got exceptional service, as did all the staff who delivered our several different courses.   Now, experienced 'foodies' know that because you spend a boatload of cash on a steak dinner, it doesn't necessarily equate to a GREAT meal. Echo And Rig makes any concerns you may have about that aspect disappear as quickly as the moisture from the misters out on the patio did, by laying down some of the best damn food I think we've had in the almost five-year span we've been designated 'local Las Vegans.'  The bread-and-butter starter as you peruse the menu is a 'green flag' for what's to come.  The bread is right-from-the-kitchen fresh (even if it isn't warm), with creamy, whipped, unsalted butter to go with, and they will keep bringing as much as you like.  But you'd best control yourself with that...you WANT to have room for all the other offerings, because they are worth it.  I have NEVER experienced anything like the Portobello Fries with Avocado Aioli before, and a few more go-rounds with them may convince me to '86' potato fries for GOOD. Golden brown with crispy, crunchy breading, they are as tender, juicy and meaty on the inside as you would expect portobellos to be, and the aioli complements them with a mild creaminess and flavor that never becomes too overpowering.  We kept forging ahead with the thick-cut bacon with barbecue sauce, (pig candy addicts everywhere, BEWARE - this will NOT help you kick your habit!), plus a bowl of what may be the greatest Onion Soup known to man.  I could have EASILY done three bowls of that with bread and a salad, and simply called it a day. (Glad I opted NOT to do that.)  When Sam explained how they handled the meat dishes, he treated us to the spectacle of a display tray of brontasaurus-sized slabs of beef. He told us the actual cuts were for family-style service and that we could opt for the saner cuts from the menu - which we did.  Bear's eyebrows arched in recognition of the Tri-Tip with the Santa Maria rub, (he hails from SLO), so there was no question what he was having.  After Sam answered my questions about the Spencer Steak, I went for that.  With our entrees, at Sam's enthusiastic urging, we had the cauliflower with Chile de Arbol, crispy shallots and the Kennebec Salt-and-Pepper fries.  Yeah, I know - I said the Portobello Fries were my new 'bae', but these reminded me of what it is about fries I dig in the first place...the crispy tenderness dunked into ketchup with a forkful of steak? ORGASMATRONIC.  Portions here aren't MAN VS. FOOD-sized, nor did they need to be.  With a great wine, we were pretty much stuffed to the gills by the time we got halfway through.  (Oh, yes...there WILL be doggie bags.) The beef was everything as advertised, and MORE. I may have even learned how to like medium-well steak now, (I usually won't eat steak unless Drogon has breathed on it. For a VERY long time.)  At the conclusion, Sam surprised me with a complimentary birthday dessert of two different sherbets, and that clinched the deal.  Amazing. Will we be back? Does Trump Tweet?

wId8oomq2iazEPbvayCVrg.text: If you're looking for a brunch spot to have mimosas this is the place to go! Bottomless mimosas for $16 and the large glasses they were served in were constantly being refilled, not once was my glass empty for more than 60 seconds.. They also do bottomless Bloody Mary's for a few dollars more.   I ordered the Eggs Benedict and my boyfriend had the Steakhouse Scramble.  The Eggs Benedict were good but the plate had such an overwhelming amount of spinach that I ended up pushing most of it off to the side. The Steakhouse Scramble was also good but the server forgot to bring out the sauce my boyfriend requested and brought it 20 minutes later when he was almost finished eating. I know he forgot about it because he walked passed us plenty of times empty handed and asking people at other tables if everything was okay. It wasn't a huge deal honestly it was just awkward when he finally brought the sauce out and my boyfriend had 2 bites left, he could've mentioned something or even apologized. Again, not that big of a deal for us.   We also ordered the thick cut bacon and it comes with homemade BBQ sauce, you must order this! I wasn't a huge fan of bacon until I tried this it was so thick, flavorful and juicy. I will make sure we place 2 orders every time we come because we were fighting for it, it was that good ;)  Also, make sure you make reservations because we didn't and we weren't able to sit outside. Sucks because I love the outdoors, I sometimes pick where to eat based on the fact that they have outdoor seating  Overall a good experience. We will try this place again but make reservations next time.

SOj59m4tgld6P53BYKnnyA.text: This is the best off-strip restaurant in Las Vegas.  Spencer steak is unbelievably good and under $30, the pork belly burnt ends will blow you away.  I eat here every chance I get, absolutely a must-try for locals.

I2t9qUI2eO_7Q8RcVKxblA.text: One of the most fabulous restaurant experiences I have ever had. Flew to Las Vegas from The Bay the first week of April. I called Echo and Rig a few weeks before after researching their stellar reviews on Google and Yelp. Every hostess that answered the phone was incredibly polite, engaging, and accommodating even going so far as to asking the correct spelling of the birthday girls name to enhance our experience. My friends and I arrived a few minutes late to our 7 pm reservation after a 20 ish minute ride from Planet Hollywood on the strip. The outdoor patio is not able to be reserved and is one of their most popular seating locations in the restaurant (heated patio that overlooks Tivoli square, really breathtaking when the sun sets.) Our party was seated on the patio and greeted by the upstairs host, the server, and even the manager. I, unfortunately have forgotten his name, but his introduction and subsequent questions about our stay and how honored he was that we came to celebrate at his restaurant truly made the experience. The food of course was outstanding. I had the skirt steak (melt in your mouth) and my girls had the Colorado lamb (moist, tender, and full of flavor). The delicious salted caramel sundae that was presented after the staff sung "Happy Birthday" was amazing! Creamy ice cream that wasn't too overwhelming and had lovely crunchy elements to it. All in all if you're debating about coming, don't! Make your reservation and let the staff and the food make your night one to remember. I think the best part is knowing that they've just opened a sister restaurant in Sacramento, Ca. So I'll be able to experience this wonderful restaurant again.

542EoZFvEh6P3XCG0Z0Jwg.text: This by far is the best steakhouse in Vegas! It's ways from the strip but worth the drive. If you enjoy attentive service and quality meats then this is your place. Management n staff go above n beyond to please their customers.

NA4pigX78K6oO-k5P4rcWA.text: My meal here was in my top 10 ever. Shared the 50 oz tomahawk with 5 people. The meat and every single other item we ordered was amazing and much better than our expectation. Service was also exception (thank you Hugo!). Highly recommend this place.

5An_AQUo0b1GmoUwL-eVoA.text: I love the place and our waiter Jeff was the most amazing knowlegable person. Hewas super patient and always knows what is the best to recomend. Food is the best. I recomend for appetizer avocado toast!!!And of course steack. For dessert take an icecream!!!

1Skr92n9xory0msUMk8R2Q.text: Great service and amazing food. I was skeptical about the $1.99 steak and eggs but OMG it was delish. Must try the mushroom fries !!!! I shall return

L8yxSdteduEnBODhp6pSeA.text: Definitely the best steaks, best service and overall best restaurant in Vegas!!  The hangar and skirts steaks here were the most tender steaks my boyfriend and I have ever had and they were cooked to perfection! We are both chefs and we were completely  blown away with the meal. It was my boyfriend's birthday and the entire staff was so kind and everyone wished him a happy birthday. Our server Hugo gave us phenomenal service and we were so pleased with every single aspect of our experience. The care and effort put into this restaurant definitely shows. I will recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone heading out to Las Vegas.

mH_kHPOQgqY7VIMG6iFUVg.text: Hugo our server was AMAZING, Derrick  the maitre'd was the utmost professional,  the food astounding!!!  The porterhouse steak was cooked to perfection, portebello fries to die for, bottomless mimosas ...  When in Vegas you gotta come here! Brunch, dinner ,  casual attire

g3x5We304Og2tQ7Z1armuA.text: Echo & Rig was great! They had a wonderful cocktail menu and the bread appetizer was perfect, warm and not too much. The array of meat they brought by for viewing was impressive as well as their service. I had their rendition of French Onion soups which was phenomenal with the added touch of Sage. If you're looking for a great steak place with a fun atmosphere definitely come here!

JV42FMooIAFbP6mCeWO2XQ.text: I've been coming to this plaza by myself every weekend for Pressed Juicery and have been wanting to try all of the restaurants here since they look so nice. Finally the boo made time to make the trek out with me :D It was either Echo & Rig or Brio so we decided on the one with A+ reviews :0) It was Saturday around 6/7pm and the wait was 40 minutes so we decided to sit at the bar.   We ordered: x Over The Rainbow Salad (farro, quinoa, red, yellow & orange bell peppers, corn, red onion, asparagus, cherry tomatoes, almonds, herbs & champagne vinaigrette) - this salad is AMAZINGG!! So much texture and so fresh! They were kind enough to split the dish for us without even asking. I highly recommend this. x Maryland Lump Crab Cake - I'm not sure what to say about this crab cake.. it was good, but not very crab cakey.. it was like it's own thing. Good flavors, but just not what we were expecting. x Bouillabaisse (prawns, clams, calamari, mussels, fish of the day, black tomato broth) - Lots of flavor and good, but I prefer lighter broth/sauces. Clams were a little overcooked, but overall this dish was good. x 1/2 dozen oysters - I forgot the name of the oyster, but they were the smallest ones they had that day and they were AMAZING! The sauces that came with it made it that much better.  Loved the vibe of this place. Looks upscale/trendy, but we came in casual shorts and stuff and it was fine :)  I want to come back to try every other seafood/veggie dish asap!!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bl50njsk4_ogT_lwGoHvrQ.text: We've eaten here many times and their service has always been great but not tonight. The first indication was when the waitress set a beer in front of me when I had a cocktail and my husband didn't. Then my medium well steak was rare and served with the wrong sauce. My husband ate his 31st anniversary dinner by himself while I waited another 15 minutes for my steak to be cooked. They brought us food we didn't order. Our desert never showed up. At the beginning of dinner the waiter asked us if we had other plans. We told him yes a show at the Palazzo Hotel. That did not matter we are late for our show. They ruined our 31st anniversary. Will not go back.

SPZnQ7dnFcF6YMQKSjwZfg.text: I've been a little apathetic with my reviews lately, but really feel inclined to write one for this place given the extremely awesome experience we had here over the weekend. When it comes to a holistic dining experience Echo & Rig executed perfectly on all aspects of what "I" (just my humble opinion; others are entitled to their own...) deem as important when eating out.  This place is a restaurant/bar/butcher shop. As you walk in you can see them butchering meat behind the counter to the right, to the left is a bar with some small tables and upstairs is the dining area. This place sources really high end meat from Snake River Farms and Compart Duroc (pork)!! The customer services was top notch, our waiter was super attentive and we were greeted and checked upon by management before, during and after our meal. The food was excellent; since this was a butcher shop we chose to order some non-traditional cuts such as the ring of rib eye and the bevette (hope I didn't butcher the name; pun intended...). Steaks, small plates, salad and drinks were beyond excellent. The waiter recommended the portobello fries and they were delicious. We also ordered the grilled octopus, kennebec salt & pepper fries (same potatoes In & Out uses), broccolini and shared a Caesar salad. Everything we ordered was cooked to perfection and tasted great. I'd say this is the best dinning experience that I had in the last year (we eat out often).   This place is unique because it is very evident they are extremely focused on working with most fresh and "best" ingredients, their customer service second to none, the environment is lively, elegant and welcoming, and the prices are reasonable (compared to "Vegas Strip" prices).   My new steakhouse/restaurant in Vegas is no longer Mastro's, it is Echo & Rig (we may still go there for the Butter Cake LOL). THERE! I SAID IT!!!! STANDING OVATION...

D4RaJ8jDYbBKeya8saKl0g.text: This place is fantastic.  Celebrated my husbands and mine bdays, along with our anniversary here.  Food is flavorful and reasonably priced.  Atmosphere and our server Jeffrey, were great.   We will definitely be back and bring others with us.   Thanks to all the staff!

MBWJH-dKLVCC_Ds2yJLSXg.text: This place was very, very nice. One of the nicest places I've been to in a while and my Dad and his lady took my boyfriend and I out to dinner. We had an amazing sunset dinner, on the balcony. I had a piece of skirt steak I believe it was just alright I wasn't crazy about it and side of asparagus.  The setting, the food, and the atmosphere really made this an enjoyable dinner while visiting in town for the week.   Our table ordered everything from the Steak Tartare, to the Portobello Fries, to the  thick bacon with bbq sauce which the bacon was made in house ( it was the BEST bacon I've ever had). my boyfriend loves the Oysters too, and the men had the Butterfish and were raving about it.

ZtTu4UIvbX1SUs-85I1jvw.text: Echo and Rig is killing it for Sunday brunch!    My friend and I came here for bottomless mimosas and some brunch on a Sunday. Surprisingly, there wasn't a wait.  Awesome!    We ordered several items and they all tasted fantastic.  Favorites were the avocado toast, beef rib hash, and the sherbet spiked with champagne.   Echo and Rig offered fantastic service-probably the best service I've had in a while.  The hostess quickly greeted us, found us a table, and we were seated. Our server was extremely nice & helpful. I never felt like the staff was overbearing, yet they were attentive.   Bottomless mimosas: $16 (June 2016) served with a bourbon soaked cherry at the bottom of the glass. They give you a glass with champagne and a carafe of orange juice. The servers walk around and top off the champagne. And bring a new carafe of OJ when you run out. Our glasses were never dry!  They also offer bottom bloody Mary's. I believe these were $21   Avocado toast: simple yet delicious. No shortage of avocado. Avocado slices on a baguette, maybe drizzled with olive oil?  Served with peppers on the side- mild heat. Very tasty. Will definitely order again.   Beef rib hash: my new favorite brunch item!  I don't usually favorite the highlighted menu item-but this one hits the spot. Beef rib with egg and hollandaise sauce and veggies. This is a must try!    Steakhouse scramble: tasty, but I prefer the beef rib hash.  Steak with veggies and potato chunks.    Shortcake with fresh berries: the fruit was perfectly ripe and the shortcake was good.   Sherbet: Three flavors of sherbet served with fresh berries. Omg amazing. Add a little champagne to liven up this dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado toast. Simple but awesome
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steakhouse scramble- sausage, filet mignon, peppers, potatoes, and tomatoes. Nothing exception - 3/5 stars
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib hash- short rib, potatoes, peppers, shallots, herbs, poached eggs, hollandaise sauce. Excellent option 5/5 stars - must try

mdIyu34LBfyvJItE_Qxxag.text: Delicious meat. Delicious sides. Excellent service in an inviting atmosphere. I would highly recommended this place for lunch or dinner.

lgHn8valvBejTa1ryZPN5Q.text: Excellent food at very reasonable prices.  I had a chance to go off the beaten path in Las Vegas to have a dinner with a large group at Echo & Rig.  They are known for Grass Fed beef from organic providers such as Snake River Farms and others.  When you enter, you will see the meat coolers of the butcher shop with some very good looking beef, and other cuts.   As we started dining, we all tried several appetizers. I'm generally not a lamb fan, the the lamb cigars were awesome, as was the bacon and pork belly.  On to the steaks. Most of the group opted for sharing the large cuts; Porterhouse, Rib-eye, etc.  Since I like my meat rare, I ordered a Wagyu Filet.  The waiter suggested a temp closer to medium rare, and I said OK. My mistake.  When the steaks arrived, the large cuts were a classic medium rare, with a slightly warm RED center. OK for me, but several of the diners were expecting a bit more doneness. I can't fault them for that, but my filet was more like medium.  I should have followed my instincts and ordered rare. The quality of the steak was excellent, just done past my liking. I did sample some of the porterhouse, and it was outstanding. Great aged flavor.  The sides and sauces were great too, and the prices were lower than expected. I would have given 5 stars, but for the overcook on my steak. I'm sure they would have corrected it if I had asked, but with the large group, I was happy to sample some of the larger steak instead. I'd definitely go there again. My suggestion is to make sure you are specific to understand the temp requests. Other than that 5 stars!

ePOqFDajN2U_d8Sk67XnGw.text: Place was amazing!!!  Will definitely be coming back.  Wife and I went here for dinner and it was our first time. We loved every moment, the food, the service, the atmosphere. It was all a 5/5.

C3dvuLYVzBwujaERyGGXNQ.text: Everything was top notch except the steak... we drove from the strip where there are a ton of excellent steakhouses, based on the recommendation of a Las Vegas local. When we arrived I asked the Butcher working in the downstairs kitchen what he liked tonight, he recommended the ribeye. I ordered the ribeye and I was completely underwhelmed. The steak I was served was no better than a supermarket USDA choice ribeye!  I wanted to love this place and claim it as a hidden gem in the Vegas valley but alas, I can't do that.

xUQxkEhhjh7TJWKHdWpHcg.text: There is nothing more satisfying than leaving a restaurant after a good meal and great service!  I love that this restaurant is on the higher end, but none of the pretentiousness of a snooty staff. Don't get me wrong, they were very professional, yet so genuinely warm and inviting as if they were welcoming us into their own home.   The prices were reasonable considering the high quality of their steaks. Additionally, we ordered 3 sides for our party of 4, and there were leftovers.   It's so exciting to find a gem of a place like this. I can dress up for a romantic dinner with my husband, or go there with my kids in jeans and flip flops and not feel out of place. This place is a winner in my book!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Broccolini, Mac and cheese, garlic mashed potato with cheese. I went into a food coma after i devoured the Mac and cheese
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon, cucumber salad was delish!
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their most popular cut of steak, sorry I can&#39;t remember the name??!!

ugy61k8wqJCCoC0W8W2LtA.text: Never disappointed...excellent service, great food beautiful restaurant.The tomahawk was fantastic..I get some of my meats in their butcher shops, always first rate service.

-TpIEoNORAjdCoWRsXQchQ.text: I honestly can't say anything bad about this place! All the food is amazing and they service is much better than some of the spots in the strip.  I recently realized they had a happy hour menu and Its also a killer!  Their butcher shop is where I buy some of my steaks and beacon and it's incredible quality.

pxuf0fJQ3uBGaJdhKKpF4Q.text: Took my niece to this restaurant for her birthday and we were very happy with the service, the atmosphere and most importantly ... the food! Very delicious, we highly recommend eating here, we'll be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kr2YzfuSqEOeYCA41xqSWQ.text: Echo and Rig is a True hidden gem that is turning into something not so hidden anymore. I cant believe it took me this long to try it! i believe our server's name was lucas and he was phenomenal. Funny and great with suggestions. The portobello fries are a must here as a starter. mashed potatoes with white cheddar was nothing too special but that does not fault them here due to the fact the server suggested the cauliflower instead of the mash but i went against that judgement (i will listen next time lol) the steaks were excellent and good portion size. i had the spencer steak. prime cut of meat! comes with chips and mushroom rockefeller as well. if you are looking for something off strip that is a really a bang for your buck this is 100% the place. will be back to try more soon!

VhvvvF11vqIBp_km0pyDmA.text: Environment, service, food.. phenomenal! My cousin and I went here for Sunday brunch and our service was as good as it gets (shout out to Joy!) - friendly, attentive, informative, etc. we were never waiting on anything and our mimosas never got close to being empty. Best traditional eggs benny, breakfast potatoes were awesome, along with the pancake.   Highly recommend making reservations (they stop serving brunch at 3pm). Took me so long to finally check this place out because I would try to do a walk-in but they were/are always busy. With the reservation we were greeted and seated right away. Excited to check it out for dinner.

jYN9s6EfpgHZh2M3Fn1HyQ.text: After a subpar experience Echo and Rig went way out of their way to correct it - They couldn't of of provided a better experience. Because of their customer service they now have us for life! Sheryl Best, deserves all the credit...she was awesome, and kept us. Can't wait to go back!

RlimK6VJ_v09mgcdZli0-g.text: I'm an LV local and I've always heard great things about this place so we decided to try it for ourselves. It definitely didn't let me down. Wow. Besides the amazing food that speaks for itself, the best part was the service. These guys know how to a run a smooth operation. We had dinner on the balcony I recommend that to anyone on a summer day! Also we had skirt steak... omg....

hGkmqMLfNqzfRRSbcsR7tA.text: I've been going to Echo & Rig for several years and have always given them a 5 star review until yesterday when 3 of us went for Brunch.  We first ordered a Bloody Mary which arrived almost instantly along with 2 Bottomless Mimosas which took almost 10 minutes to arrive at the table. How long does it take to pour some champagne in a glass ??? We ordered the Salmon Plate, the Steak Scramble, Avocado Toast and Portobello Fries. And then waited and waited and waited for our food which took close to an hour to get. The Salmon Plate was fine as was the Avocado Toast and Portobello Fries but the Steak Scramble was just a nasty mess!! The eggs were more of a brown color and the two pieces of what was suppose to be Filet Mignon were the size of a quarter and almost impossible to cut and equally impossible to chew. The dish actually looked as if all the leftovers were thrown in it. We did send it back and they promptly replaced it with another dish. The real zinger came when I asked if we could have fresh champagne glasses and were told no by the waitress "We don't do that with the Bottomless Special"  Are you kidding me !!!!!!!! I have never been anywhere in my life where I could not get a fresh glass for anything. And how much effort would it have taken to please the customer especially since mine had avocado on the rim? Enough went wrong that I'll think twice about returning with all of the new cutting edge restaurants opening. I would suggest that the owners of Echo & Rig take a step back to the beginning when everything was perfect. You've lost 3 customers !!!!!

5wUh_mdNXK8InEVg4NTmPg.text: One of my favorites- excellent service at the bar. Excellent food- Awesome cocktails- Highly recommend!

Xr_-MjeKLRx2rjm277IfuQ.text: Always on point and constant. I sit in the bar area usually and the service is 100% and food is spot on. Well done guys....

HvTzA1lMooyV9NJ60R1Q7Q.text: Wonderful atmosphere and the dinner was delicious. Went there with a group of 5 and most of us split steaks and ordered sides to share, you can even bring your own drinks! Amazing time overall would for sure recommend.

x-j0vuel4iuIgD1e5ZQSOQ.text: Echo & Rig is a steak house with a small retail-butcher shop inside.  Super close to us, and very well rated, my wife and I were looking forward to coming here for sometime, and now that we've been several times, it's one of our absolute favorites in this town.  Their happy hour is what drew us in originally. With specials such as top shelf vodka cocktails (Kettle One, Hanger One, etc.) for $4, steak and egg for $1.99, who wouldn't be curious?  Their food is top notch, and recently, we purchased a couple pork chops from their butcher section, and were very, very pleased! Kyle, who's usually manning the butcher shop, was extremely helpful and knowledgeable and asked what some of our favorite cuts are, prior to recommending the cut we got. It's nice to have that kind of expertise when shopping for high end chops!  Atmosphere is also stellar here. It's a great date spot, as well as, just a casual setting if you're just at the bar.  Food: 5 Ambience: 5 Service: 5 Value: 5

dS6j9rREsZVpIloz2Ne43w.text: BOMB BOMB BOMB! There Brunch is soooooo dang good!

8gB7zPI9uSeJVGHWcRk-iw.text: I'm going to start this review off with the customer service I experienced because honestly it was unlike anything I've ever experienced. Tonight was my birthday and we had a table of four with Tim as our server. Let me tell you about Tim because this review is mostly about him. He was so courteous, genuine, and friendly. He had an energy that was both welcoming and warm, the kind you get when you hangout with an old friend after not seeing them for a while. He was so incredible not just at his job but also his people skills. He knew so many things from the menu, and recommended some phenomenal dishes, he was thoughtful and professional. I dine out very often with friends and I can't think of one time the customer service anywhere has blown me away like it did today.   Now on to the food. Wow. Everything was perfectly cooked and incredibly delicious. I had the sea bass and it tasted like Jesus caught it and cooked it himself. The garlic mashed potatoes were awesome and the creamed kale was soooo good! For dessert I had the apple pie ice cream and it was everything I always wanted.   Ambience is great, upscale yet everyone is super friendly and not boujie like other upscale restaurants I've been to. I've actually been here once before and didn't have the best experience but I'm so glad we came back and gave it a chance because now I'm telling all of my friends how amazing it was and asking for Tim every time I come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel sprouts

DZNYJ0xUx9o2Z7i8-Y-0Tg.text: Came for the brunch on Sunday and stayed for the service! The brunch is easily the best in town with a wonderful staff and a menu that is the freshest in town easily. From the moment we walked in to the time we left not a single moment was bad. The best part is the food, I mean the steak scramble and 1/2 inch bacon with homemade BBQ sauce was as the server said magnificent. All I can say is we will be back and have found our new brunch home.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch!

q-NHLjMF6M1w58Eskn9-SQ.text: Fantastic brunch in the morning.  Front staff can sometimes be a little more helpful.   Most of the time we eat at the bar to bypass.    Food and drinks great and rest of staff fantastic.

9WywjtVYcn17Wi2grELFmg.text: Service is impeccable and the menu is unique and exciting. Sunday brunch is the Best in Las Vegas

WUlBoQHbnkq-9FM4P9KzOw.text: I've been here 3 times now and I have the same experience every time. The environment and service is awesome! The food is just average. The steak salad is terrible- end cut pieces of grisly meat. The baked Brie came out with burnt bread and everything just tasted bland. Won't be back again.

PBevV-q7PuieNi7Rip3AQw.text: The food and service were both amazing! The flat iron steak was cooked perfectly and paired very nicely with the red wine demi.

ktJWbkArxVTTZGFy43uqbg.text: Great food, great service!  We were greeted by name and the entire staff was attentive.  My only regret was not taking an outdoor balcony seat when it was offered, it was a beautiful night and that would have just completed the package. We will return.

833ckFRwRyMmAP6-bEcr0w.text: Fantastic atmosphere, service and food. A great place to dine that's away from the strip. I'd recommend it if you are looking for healthy food and a lovely view.

bd5j83oPwAzWyhSGxzgw7w.text: We were staying at the JW Marriott, so we chose this restaurant because of the good reviews. Ricky was our server. He   completely missed my friends salad when she ordered it, and had to be reminded. The appetizers took longer than expected to come out. This was a Tuesday night so the restaurant was not that busy, I'm not sure what the holdup was. I ordered the New York Strip, which is my usual when ordering steak. I'm used to some marbling, but this cut was extra fatty. Strangely, someone took away an almost-full side of mashed potatoes before we asked them to. The octopus app, the kale and the peas and mashed potatoes were good. I probably wouldn't come back here, since Vegas has many other restaurants to choose from.  Overall, I was disappointed in the slow service and wasn't really happy with my steak.

O--Bd7fz7JjV4pH3_rVfPA.text: How did we miss this place for so long? Had first meal at Echo & Rig at the bar last nite and my only complaint is it was chilly (cold nite) and felt like I was in a bldg lobby, but dining room was full. A minor inconvenience for my lack of making a reservation, as this place delivered on all fronts...from service - Jose was excellent and offered great suggestions, to the selection- (going back soon -too many things we wanted to try but would have been an embarrassment of food), to the flavors-the portobello fries, spicy roasted cauliflower (my pers fav), to the rib cap eye, spencer steak (meat was cooked to perfect temp, so flavorful and at $25-$27 each was a perfect serving size) and garlic cheddar mashed potatoes...what a meal, to finally the very affordable pricing- (incl 2 well shaken martinis and a glass of wine and beer). Very impressed on all fronts and can't remember when the last time a restaurant experience was so perfectly complete (and we just had Christmas Eve dinner at Carnevino -meh!). I look forward to many a more pleasant evenings here.

Oc7qblB5OI73AsH8enX_jA.text: I'm giving this restaurant five stars, food was great, atmosphere was loud when we went but nice location. We decided to try it for the first time and had reservations at 8pm on a Monday night. When we arrived we were automatically asked to wait, mind you we had reservations. They looked extremely busy and they had us sit down and wait. About 15 minutes later we got sat. I'm usually impatient but I hold it together for my other half. The hostess was great and engaged in great conversation as she walked us to your table. She automatically apologized for the wait and it wasn't that bad. We appreciated it. The manager came by shortly as we sat and introduced himself to us by name and was so kind and apologetic. They get five stars for their table touching and atmosphere ! Their bacon and mac n cheese .. Awesome! Thank you Xavier !

cGSpwa9Q-OO9AN8qc5_7xw.text: Made reservations for valentines day. Called in half an hour before to let them know we are running late and what a nice surprise....they LOST our reservations! The hostess got a piece of my mind which I later apologized for because they were able to get us in anyway. Came in and still waited 45 minutes for our table. Got two rounds of drinks...first round was 5 dollars less than second....for the same exact drinks. Im not sure whether the bartenders are trying to steal...but the management needs to keep an eye on the bar. We didn't say anything but called in next day to let them know. Hostesses looked like they didn't know what they were doing. Five managers in the floor yet everyone is running like chickens with their heads cut off. Get it together Echo and Rigs, you've been opened for over a year...at this point everything should be handled with ease, even a big event like Valentines day. I gave 3 stars for the food...and our server was nice...

uWjWYm9KAifiVqaQr3bI0A.text: Alright here we go- Lets start off with IMPECCABLE service. From the moment you walk in, you are greeted by two hostess' who walk you up to your table making small talk about how the restaurant works and what the occasion is we have joined them for. Once seated, the server takes full control and walks us through the menu, elaborating on his favorite dishes and the most popular items. Unfortunately this time around it was only two of us or we would have gone with their delicious Tomahawk presented to us on a platter with all their fresh cuts of beef. To begin, we ordered a Tempranillo that paired well with our three starters (Flash fried spinach salad is a MUST, along with the watermelon cucumber salad that adds the sweet/salty mix to your tastebuds. Our meat selection for this meal was the beef tenderloin cooked MR and the cowboy marinade skirt steak served M that was full of flavor and quite honestly "blew our minds". At this point of a meal we didn't think it could possibly get any better until they brought up their 20 and 30 year ports to finish us off right. This steakhouse could quite possibly take over Las Vegas or anywhere it expands to. Do not hesitate to give this place a shot. You will surely be overjoyed with the camaraderie of staff and the love and pride they have in their establishment.

LSmuOhKY_HQHsaARjswreA.text: The staff is is not very professional.  While seated on the upper balcony outside we kept noticing the waiters frequently congregating there.  It seems they can hide from management there or something.  They kept grouping up next to our table complaining about other guests and the other staff.  At one point a young guy dressed in a black outfit (busboy maybe) came to our table and put two large dirty dishes from another table on our table.  Then he proceeded to talk to us about nothing and interrupted our dinner conversation, while leaving someone else's dirty dishes right next to my girlfriend.  It was rather gross to look at someone else's dirty plates while trying to enjoy an expensive meal.  Lack of experience maybe?  I don't know but unless the service level improves to match the food quality and prices, we will not be back.

86i6UBLoMwEE5QHncScz0Q.text: Had an excellent time. Portions are more "reasonable" and prices match. What I mean is if you finish your entree you will be appropriately full. No left overs. Went for my fathers birthday and all of the servers and hostesses were informed and wishes him happy birthday. A very nice friendly touch.  I was visiting from LA and I would definitely come back.

LRkXoqci9v0g47h0IISF1w.text: It was loud, service was OK, nothing special, and food was average good, again nothing special.  I actually think the steaks at my local bar and grill are just as good and half the price.

HDw0rSxpJYTB8VxUHgTX8w.text: Today my wife and I visited Echo & Rig again after the bad service that we received.  Mind you this meal was not on us due to management reaching out to us after our last visit.  Actually, management spoke with us the next day and was very concerned with what went wrong and what could make it right.  That impressed me.  Usually large restaurants don't have the time to apologize, solve the problem, and try to right their wrong.  Echo & Rig did that tonight.  It wasn't because this was a free meal, especially because after the incident we went to TAO and had a feast.  They did a great job because as a consumer this is not only what I expect but I KNOW this is what they expect from themselves.  To the management staff, servers, and cooks thank you for being honest and True to your brand.  Thank you for taking this situation head on where most companies would have ran.  I will be back, I will be bringing people to your business, and I hope that every guest gets the True Echo & Rig experience that I received and know that you can give.

B3WaCyn5pk4oYakxx391vw.text: Our first visit here and couldn't be more pleased. It was the wife's birthday and they treated us the best!! The service was great and the food was amazing. This will now be our go to place when visiting Vegas. The Tomahawk ribeye was amazing and make sure you try the lamb cigars!!! Thank you!!!

BogWlt5txZpNrjUvTQO4Xg.text: Great service, great food, great atmosphere.  If you haven't tried this local gem, you're missing out.  Today we had the portobello fries and split a burger.  Everything was perfect.

eTyCGCNQDPXxDZZFJuK4Jg.text: Awesome Restaurant.  We have been here for brunch, lunch AND dinner and each meal has always been Amazing!!  We love the atmosphere; It is relaxing and they have a great outdoor patio too!!!  Brunch offers a great menu and Bottomless Mimosas for $16, which is a great deal and worth the drive from Henderson.  The service is outstanding and your beverage is never empty!!  We usually ask for Kendra's section if we can....she is the BEST!!!  Our favorites for brunch are the Portobello Mushroom Fries, The Fried Spinach Salad, The Short Rib Hash, Quiche or the Grilled Cheese with Short Rib and Gruyere!!  YUM!!!  The steaks are also Great and they double as a butcher downstairs so you can take your favorite cuts to go and cook them at home too.  The Spencer and the Hanger steaks were both very flavorful but I am sure all of the steaks are Great!!  We can't wait to get back in there to try the rest of them!!

pRc8jgkoNy3NAb8dIOS3zQ.text: FANTASTIC!! From the moment we walked in the customer service was stellar. The assistant manager Derek first greeted us at our table followed by our server, Jason. Both great people that were genuine and very knowledgeable about the menu and what it means to have a dinner experience. We got oysters and tuna poke to start, followed by shareable small plates of portobello fries, bone marrow carne asada, and steak tartare. Everything was delicious and strategically coursed out by Jason as far as timing was concerned. The main dish provided a GIANT tomahawk steak which my wife and I split and a family style dish of mashed potatoes. It was delicious, fun and everything we hoped for in going out for a special meal together. Not only was the food great, the staff was prompt with clearing our dishes, we had new silverware for every course, and the people are generally pleasant to be around. I felt like I got to know them as people and that was important to us. Wonderful experience, HIGHLY recommended and will be returning soon. Thanks Echo & Rig!!

IFmagR7Gvmt8ftoIyN7XYg.text: What a great experince. From the minute we arrived we felt welcomed. We arrived about 20 minutes early, and we got the opportunity to speak with the butcher down stairs. He was very helpful and shared his knowledge about the meats. Once we were seated our server was very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. My mother-in-law had the butter fish and she enjoyed it, but once she tasted my t-bone and my wife's ribeye she wished she had ordered a steak. My steak was great, (t-bone) but my wife's Ribeye was excellent l. The Bacon and Bbq sauce app was amazing, the mash potatos  were fantastic. My Mother-in-law is coming back tomorrow night. I highly recommend eating here. An enjoyable experince.

LsdFHqG_PQynmaHz4lCnnA.text: My husband and I dined here on the last night of our trip to Vegas for the Janet Jackson show. It was amazing.   Rae was our server and she was EXCELLENT. We were taken to our seats promptly, greeted by Tim, the manager, and attended to by countless other staff.   The folks here know what customer service is and they do it right! Great steaks and sides. We'll be back!

AjRrEC-1zDQxf4T90f-ItQ.text: Went to this restaurant because it was highly recommended by a friend of ours. There were 6 people  in my group. 5 people ordered steak and 1 ordered scallops. We ordered appetizers and some side salads as well. The drinks were really good and the service was on point.   However, ALL of our 5 steaks were under cooked and the scallops were raw. The manager who came over to our table apologized and had our food redone. After we complained about all of our entrees, it seemed as if she was not too pleased. I'm not too sure whether this was directed at us or her staff. Some of our appetizers were burnt. By the time the food was redone, everything else in the table was cold and we had been waiting for more than an hour for food.   I really wanted to like this place as it was highly recommended by a friend. But with our experience, I would just simply not go back.

9hWnZMKgImmPGoui50O5ag.text: If you come in for brunch head to Joy's section! He's always attentive and I don't think I ever saw the bottom of my mimosa glass.  The food is amazing and the environment is lively! E&R is a must go brunch spot.

kvTNZZDlyYY4-17YPile4g.text: We loved it! We valeted which was free and the shopping center was beautiful. Seated right away even in a Friday. We sat upstairs outside- the misters were on and it was perfect. Our waiter Shane was excellent! Very knowledgeable and helpful. Service was 10 stars! We ordered dirty grey goose martinis with bleu cheese olives- delishhhh. I had a glass of Opaque Darkness wine  it was full bodied and so nice. We split a Caesar salad with out croutons because are keto. Then also split the 34oz Tomahawk. Cooked to perfection. We will be going back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vbB8Pu0oWJn3_ho1Q6229Q.text: Though their menu isn't cheap, it is WELL worth it in my opinion. Our server Beth was very pleasant and knowledgeable on the menu, provided very helpful information. The pork burnt ends were SO good, my filet was cooked perfectly and the demi-glaze sauce was the perfect compliment. The gnocchi I had was the best I've had anywhere, even than Italy!  I may only be a visitor here, but I'd go back if ever in town again and HIGHLY recommended trying it out if you don't mind paying just a little bit more for great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free beef jerky the butcher offered during our wait.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iFXpv5oNl-AXSRIOWmUSGQ.text: Haven't been more disappointed in an experience here tonight. Was told they didn't have any Rib-Caps then got the Bavette instead. I was okay with that because I knew my favorite steak was out of the picture. After I received my steak it was cooked more rare then medium and overheard our server telling the table next to us that there's a Rib-Cap left and he's lucky he gets it. Such a shame because I loved this place. Really puts a bad taste in my mouth and won't be seeing me back anytime soon :(

651gz1rhcMBl6-ERvvFf1Q.text: Amazing butcher shop. Love this place. Tasty sausages. My go to place. Wish there a location in Henderson

xsMeL9iTYke8AR4j5aR7bg.text: Wow. This restaurant never lets us down.  FOOD AMAZING PRICES AMAZING SERVICE AMAZING   BOTH TIMES WEVE BEEN HERE- AMAZING.  Today Ari was our server and was TOP NOTCH. He new about every item and was prompt with service! We loved him!  We forgot our servers name from last time but he was awesome too! The managers are also amazing and food runners totally know what they are doing.   BEST PLACE TO EAT IN ALL OF VEGAS. #1 WILL ALWAYS RECOMMEND!

N31Qt1XMiyeevaBtnewP6Q.text: Service here was impeccable... very attentive... water always filled... always making sure we were happy and taken care of...great staff.  the appetizers were really good... super fresh... unbelievable tastes and textures.   the ribeye steak melt in your mouth very good flavors very simple just how I like it nothing overpowering but just perfect... We also got the Kobe beef steak the outside was really good..  tender in the middle... Really good flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel ice cream
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Views from the balcony eating outside
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe beef steak middle

w1WOZD_RXYwHjzW2YJ5KsQ.text: This new discovery, tucked away in Henderson far off the strip is one of my new favourite restaurants in Las Vegas. With an ample selection beyond meat and a broad section of cuts available, all at very reasonable prices is why this hidden gem has become such a favourite.  Friendly, none tourist harassed staff are knowledgeable and very helpful.   The one and only slight critic I have and why they lost a star, was cause the filet mignon only comes in one size and for a big guy like me, was a little to petit.  On the good side, it left space for dessert.  Enjoy but don't let to many people know :-), let's keep it off the Vegas tourist trap map.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1OfZGHjw1LQbKbO6szUAIw.text: We've been here for dinner a few times and loved it. Echo & Rig is like a fun adult bar, butcher shop, and a tapas restaurant all rolled into one.  Plates start as low as $4 and the happy hour food prices can't be beat.  $1 for a good hot dog, $1.99 for shrimp, etc.  Not a huge selection, but the food is great and again, the prices can't be beat.  This place is great for date night or a small group of friends. The only issues we've had here is with bigger groups - even if you make a reservation, it'll take a while to get seated.  Plus the service and cooking times are always a bit worse at busy restaurants. It would take a long time to get outta there if you had a big group (esp with kids).

RenoaD-teZslwEi8zSsBkg.text: Not that this place needs anymore reviews, but Echo & Rig is awesome! You cannot get a better bang for your buck than their happy hour. We ordered two orders of the steak and eggs, two orders of the shrimp cocktail and a hot dog. We also brought two of our bottles of wine that had no corkage fee. Our happy hour bill came up to a total of $10!  We then had dinner upstairs and I highly recommend the portabello mushroom fries. They were all out of the ribeye cap steak so we had to settle for the european cut steak. I thought the steak was good but not great. I normally wouldn't rate lower because of that but since this is a steakhouse and should be their specialty, I had to deduct a star for that. The service is top notch and I would definitely come back if we're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not counting the wine that we brought ourselves with no corkage fee, but all this for just $10!

7tD21Vv9Xl9i1x4vZoxs3A.text: WOW! I wish we could give 10 stars!  We just moved to Vegas from New York and Echo & Rig was recommended to us by a co-worker.  I can't say enough about what a great restaurant this is.  From the lovely hostesses to our Server Ariyeh who was fun, warm and gave us superb recommendations.  The waitstaff were spot on and seamless, but most important the menu is broad and creative.  Although Echo & Rig bills itself as a meat heaven we chose for our first visit to dive into the lengthy list of small plates that included Portobello fries, fried chicken oysters, and burnt pork belly tips among their more interesting creations...all were sublime!  This restaurant is spacious with a bar and market on the ground floor and indoor and outdoor dining on the second floor.  We chose to sit outdoors on their veranda with beautiful views of Tivoli Village and it's scenic fountain.  Honestly, as a born and raised New Yorker I have never experienced such a great combination of ambiance, service and great food...I was "Kvelling"(look it up you non New Yorkers). We will be regulars at Echo & Fig and look forward to our next visit to try their top notch steaks!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GP5_TRZW0wnLcOdK4L1RUQ.text: Went there for brunch and everything we had was great. When they say bottomless mimosas they really mean that too. Not once did we get to the bottom! The staff was great and attentive. Everything we ordered honestly was just really good. Wish we could have had patio seating but were told they were all reserved. We will visit there again and make reservations for that patio this time. Would definitely recommend this place for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch with the birthday boy!

l2QLYln-JvsGemI3ruDRlg.text: This place was ABSOLUTELY amazing!!! Our waiter Shane, was very knowledgeable and his recommendations were spot on. The Spencer cut , Brussell sprouts, pork belly burnt ends and then some was superb. The rest of the staff was awesome too. I just can't say enough, you have to eat there!!!!!

k0a_DUQwmMAu1koYYi7vRQ.text: Service was great and the food was good. My ribs were great. The bread was bland. The brussel sprouts were good but a bit too salty. The vongole was great as well. Atmosphere is loud inside but so are my kids so that was ok. The veranda is beautiful but in the summer too warm for me to dine outside. For the price really good overall. I would go there again.

nq1sjyZMwrShtPruTs0KTw.text: We had spent the week going to super expensive steakhouses in Caesars. We decided to go off the strip to Echo & Rig.  We brought an expensive bottle of wine with us. It was our last night in Vegas so we Ubered 20 minutes. We were blown away! Not only was the service on point, but the food was amazing. We started with the Pork Belly Burnt Ends. They were fantastic! My girlfriend ordered the Filet and I got the Ribeye. The sauces that came with the steaks were so good. She ordered the red wine demi and I the brandied mushroom sauce. We ordered the Brussel Sprouts as a side dish. It was the best dinner we had all week. The best part was when the bill came. No corkage fee! The bill was less than $100. We live in California, 3 hours away from Sacramento. We plan to visit the other restaurant in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Luis was on point!

QRLhqqUjePYAb416MYAvsA.text: The food here is amazing. Mom loves their Mac and cheese. I love their grilled cheese.  The bartenders are amazing and friendly and the hostesses are friendly. Their drinks are well made and they do my favorite drink from NY as if I was in NY. I love how they are so professional and on top of ow to make their drinks.  The bathroom is so clean and I love washing my hands with their sat and essential oil mixture.

SAKXLvcVj9_BZ07r1qBDBQ.text: Happy hour review only.  Echo & Rig is a steakhouse at the south end of the Tivoli Village shopping/living center. They happen to offer an happy hour (Mon-Fri 3-6p, Sat-Sun 4-6p) in the first floor bar area, with options that were enticing enough to draw me and a few friends in to check it out.  My eyeballs practically popped out of their sockets at the sight of $3 draft beer. That's nearly unheard of on any sort of even semi-regular basis, and they actually have interesting craft beer-type selections too. I got the Almanac Passion Project and Saugatuck Bonfire Brown, both of which were quite delicious and neither of which had I seen much if at all before in the Las Vegas area. Three local beers and five other beers, ranging from craft to mass-produced, were also available. Those not so beer-inclined can do a $5 wine glass or $4 liquor (I'd presume cocktail).  The food selections were somehow far less diverse than the beverage options, but they were also priced very reasonably. I tried some of each.  Steak And Egg ($1.99): a rather small piece of steak (chef's choice as to the cut) with one fried egg per portion. I got two of them, and although the eggs were perfect with beautiful runny yolks, one piece of steak ended up being cooked to medium-well, while the other did stay pink but took on a bit too much salt on the crust.  Shrimp Cocktail ($1.99): some of the tiniest and softest shrimp around, but the portion was reasonable and the bed of greens were fresh and provided enough texture.  Echo Dog ($1): considering that they use Hebrew National dogs, this preparation was almost too simple, but the dijon mustard and sauerkraut were reasonable toppings and a quick thinker might find some use for extra eggs from other happy hour orders. I don't see how you can go wrong with $1 anyway.  I find it hard to entertain the idea of driving out here from Henderson all the time, but they have easily one of the best happy hours around for people who want affordable craft beer and a few bites of food. Also, after seeing those beautiful meats in the fridge, I also should put a proper meal here on the agenda.
