beUliT3NB2PZpgNog4hHaA.text: My husband and I returned last night after six months, looking forward to a great experience like before.  Food was good, but our wait staff experience was horrible.  Whoever, is in charge of the front needs to be reminded that the "total" experience counts!!

LJ2xD6bbxhXYlnhlKCH5-Q.text: Went there for dinner last night and was disappointed from the last time I had been a few years ago with the food. The staff was friendly as the manager came out and greeted my friend and myself. Drinks came quickly. Menu was not familiar and believe it or not the prices looked inexpensive to me. I ordered the Waygu filet medium rare and it was scorched on both sides. Also everything we ordered and I mean everything was in desperate need for salt. Maybe because it was Monday and the chef was off is why food was lacking. I saw people send back a side dish of Mac and cheese that looked horrible. Not sure if I will go back. See steak pic I posted

u-31QuAT3QvcpsbYB9TCSw.text: Absolutely LOVE this place! It's now our go-to spot for celebration dinners. The staff always treat you like you're royalty. The food and drinks are quality. This is a place to go to if you want amazing food and stellar service!

NpGIWrYxxW1pFvEvNdVU2w.text: This place has a super classy vibe but prices aren't outrageous. Breakfast was fairly good, dinner was so much better and dessert has never failed! Great place for a romantic dinner larger party.

Ou7U7qalD-8t5NFePBAx6A.text: Very rude, no sense of customer service.  Hubby and I were dressed nice.  When we entered and approached there were at least 5 women who worked there just standing and talking.  I stood smiling waiting to be greeted.  I was rudely told that if we did not have at reservation it would be 8:30 before a tablewould be available.  Sad that a successful business is inconvienced.

vtlMoIUb0d8fNTH5iea_RA.text: If I could give this place 10 stars I would , the steaks are amazing , staff is on point and the manager Kevin Naylor was super friendly and makes you want to come back . Its been 4 days since I had dinner there and I am still thinking about how delicious my prime rib cap was .

g3fljqqzmdaL8odxnykQnA.text: Absolutely delicious! What a great experience! Everyone was pleasant and the atmosphere of the dining room well well lot and cozy at the same time.   The waiters are so knowledgeable. My father, God knows why, insists on well done steak. When he order the cut he wanted, the waiter politely suggested he try a different cut or have his choice butterflied in order to avoid overcooking on the outside. It was so refreshing to have a suggestion along with an explanation. Often it can feel like you are being pressured into a more expensive cut, but this was the opposite.  The brandied mushroom sauce was AMAZING, as was the blue cheese sauce. Oh and dessert...We don't usually have dessert, but these were delicious sundaes and reasonably priced. The cappuccino sundae wad fantastic!!   We will definitely be back!! You won't be sorry.

pp4sgBaS6K6movmpS0KptQ.text: Just had brunch here & can i just say... WOWZA!! not only do they have bottomless mimosas, but they have a white cranberry juice option instead of orange juice which I am, personally, a huge fan of. We ordered the thick cut bacon, fried chicken salad, and the short rib hash!! All so amazing, so filling, so flavorful!!! Plus our server Austin was so wonderful & present!! Will definitely be back! Xoxo

StFgWL5DcIlge21VvNsc_g.text: Echo and Rig was our last dinner in Vegas. After a variety of cuisines, going with a steakhouse is how we decided to finish, and what a great decision that was! Everything we had was spectacular. Our appetizers were delicious - the bone marrow carne asada and the lamb cigars. Our entrees were perfectly cooked and sides were even better: the spencer steak, the ribeye cap, Brussels sprouts and roasted cauliflower. And finally, dessert consisted of a selection of large sundaes that were great. Our waitress was very friendly, made good recommendations, and brought out our plates with perfect timing. Not to mention that the value you get here is great, and they also have a butcher shop on premises. Lets put it like this - if I lived in Vegas, I would be a regular. :)

AWFyBG7ESK7eU7ac92CYpw.text: I would give this place a higher rating if I could. I had my birthday brunch here with close friends, the experience was amazing! Delicious food, cool rustic scene. I couldn't ask for anything more! I can't wait to try this place for dinner. I'm looking forward to trying their steak my friends rave about.

PW7wadquYru6NCAeGK-QBw.text: Update: Derek, the GM, contacted me the day after I posted my review. 5 stars for  listening to your customer base and trying to make things better. He was very polite, apologetic, and offered to make the experience right for us. I'll update again after we try this whole thing again.

VALJHGtxqVTesThgx79wGQ.text: I'll admit, when my friend suggested we go here for dinner, I wasn't too excited. I've only been a few times before, and I had only "ok" experiences. Nothing bad, nothing great. I hadn't remembered the food being good enough to return. Well, I was proven wrong last night.   Made a reservation for 10 people, when we arrived the hostess greeted us, made sure to see who the person the reservation was made under, and then chatted with us as we made our way up the stairs. She asked is we had dined here before, I said yes. Just as we had sat down, the manager came over and asked "Ms. T....." (He said my last name wrong, but I'll let him slide, he was cute) and then thanked me for returning. I thought this was pretty a nice gesture. I asked if they removed a drink off the menu that I had here before called the Hot Mess (it's delicious by the way, if you like Jalepeno type drinks) and he said they would still be able to make it (another bonus).   Onto the food. I started out with the Lamb Cigars. These were so good, I could've eaten a few more rounds and called it a night. But I didn't, I ordered the Horseradish Crusted Butterfish. I had never had Butterfish before (from what I can recall) this was delicious. So moist and flavorful and the potato au gratin was served almost like al dente, it was different than any way Id had them before. Most of my friends had ordered steak, and they all finished their plates clean.   Service and food really made up for my previous visits. I will for sure return again.

O95UM3QQtRfZbKYdpJJAPw.text: What a cool spot in the Valley to have a nice dinner or grab drinks. The two story space is beautiful and modern. I was a little bit scared to try this place out because of the price point I thought it would be, but I saw the menu on Yelp! And it actually is very affordable with most entrees being around the $20-$25 mark and their steaks ranging from $20ish to $40. They even have sandwiches and burgers around $15 so don't be scared!  The first thing I will say is that the service is on point. It got a little relaxed towards the end when the outside balcony emptied out, but really good nonetheless. It wasn't too uppity which I liked. It was an interesting experience having the off menu steaks shown to you on a big cutting board. A little extra and doing the most but I liked it.  I have to say the food was very good. Everything we had was unique to them (scallops with a side of fried lentils) but it still had the feel of a steak house. Even though they literally serve you a side of fries house potatoes with your steak it just wasn't a meat and potatoes kind of thing.  My standout dish I'll tell y'all about was the bone marrow carne asada. Bone marrow topped with grilled steak and an onion salad was amazing. The calamari was also delicious because of the aioli that it's served with.  They do have off menu bone in steaks, but I got the top steak on the menu. I have to say the steak wasn't one of the better steaks I've had- cooked well but not anything to write home about or crave. They are served with a sauce to amp up the flavor but maybe I just haven't found my sauce to steak pair yet. I will definitely stop in just to have a drink and some small plates. The menu is huge and unique enough to want to explore. Maybe I'll try one of their marinated steaks next time.

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gQjwfoDKXhOdRJ4boumSPw.text: My experience was great i ordered the spencer steak medium came out perfect!!! I would have preferred a finger potato instead if the chips but it was still great. I also had the portabella fries they where amazing with the aioli. I recommend this place and the pricing is great for the pricing. Definitely come back for the seafood.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender &amp; oil cocktail

kvNsoaXv2edToX7SBesMmA.text: This is one of my favorite lunches in a very long time! I randomly found this place on Yelp and the reviews looked interesting. Got the green tea which is tropical, refreshing and delicious. Then ordered the fried spinach salad, the cauliflower and bone marrow carne asada.   The bone marrow carne asada came out first and was killer. Bone marrow perfectly cooked. I didn't eat a lot of the onion salad and skipped the bread, but the orange on top was the perfect balance of citrus. Made about 6 bites of marrow, meat, and a few onions.   The cauliflower is amazing. Not sure it's low carb as the topping was fried garlic, nuts and there was definitely brown sugar in it. Delicious.   The spinach salad was great. Fried spinach is one of my favorite foods. I did pull out a lot of raw broccoli, which was tasty, but doesn't sit well on my tummy. Delicious, fairly priced lunch. Will definitely be back when I'm in Vegas next!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cauliflower , Chili de Arbol , Crispy Shallots &amp; Onions and Fried Spinach Salad
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone Marrow Carne Asada

ioC_hSUN8NkJeNFyYLIgEA.text: This was my favorite restaurant in Vegas. Real good place for locals to eat and feel high end. But today was the total opposite. Very disappointing after building up this place to my cousins from California, which who was not impressed.   Pros: 1. Short rib hash was good 2. 1/2 inch bacon with bbq sauce was bomb  3 the server lady was awesome  Cons: 1. Coffee brought to us had a thick peace of hair on the brim of the cup.  2. The bus man didn't know if they have ranch or not.  3. The bus man to me was rude and had no personality 4. Salmon Benedict tasted rotten and trash 5. They forgot about our French toast  6. the French toast was uncooked and mushy 7. I told them to box my short rib hash but wasn't given back to me, I think it was thrown away  I would recommend this place to all my friends and family members but after today I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemies. The manager wasn't even informed after I told the server we found a hair in the coffee. Very very disappointed and wished we never came.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I dont think French toast should look like this.

ZMwgv5kAe4DaLqTFFmFsXQ.text: We dined here this past week. It quite possibly ranks as the best or at least top 2 meals I've had since moving here. The service was pretty attentive/food was excellent(Brussels Sprouts were the only thing that was underwhelming/server's explanation of the menu was super helpful. We will definitely return! I had the Spencer steak. Pork belly burnt ends and calamari were also perfect.  Docked one star because we ate outside and were told that the tables all had heat lamps around them. I believe we were sat at the coldest table with no heat lamp. Also, my husband ordered the onion soup and never received it, plus the server said he would put another side of blue cheese sauce for the steak leftovers I was taking home, but that didn't happen either.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oisKIQOTj7p-KYty6oEgSg.text: Echo and Rig was not only delicious, but affordable. The view was beautiful if you are seated on the patio. My steak was fresh and cooked perfectly. This location is also a butcher's shop. This making the experience better than other steakhouse I have been to in Las Vegas. All of the sauces came with the meal unlike others who charge for these items. The server rendered outstanding costumer service. This is definitely a place I will return to frequently.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk Steak

Kmno63VipTWxWHFZ-5HRpg.text: This might've be one of my favorite places to get a steak. The food is on the same level as the expensive steakhouses at a fraction of the cost. Had a dinner reservation and didn't have to wait long for our table to be ready. The servers were excellent and very attentive. It's located in a nice upscale area of Summerlin and is more of classier restaurant, and you don't have to dress up here. We ordered the Tomahawk Ribeye and split it between the group. We also ordered the Mashed Potatoes, BBQ bacon, and the Asparagus with Egg.  Tomahawk Ribeye: Getting this cut was actually cheaper to get per ounce than each person ordering their own steaks. We split this ribeye between three people and still had leftovers. They cooked it a perfect med/rare and it had lots of flavor. The sauces were all good that they brought out, but the blue cheese was something special. They brought out multiple blue cheese sauces for us at no extra charge.  Side Dishes: The Mashed Potatoes were very creamy and had a good cheese flavor. We had to fight each other for the Thick Cut BBQ Bacon, it was so good we ordered it three times. The Asparagus was cooked tender and was great with the egg.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk ribeye

hfBrjKBrdwDCgRc-ZQqGBA.text: My sister came into town and I wanted to take her out to mimosas. That being said, our purpose of coming here was to get bottomless mimosas. After being in Vegas for two years and trying multiple mimosa places, I can honestly say this has got to be the best. NOT only because of the mimosas but the service and food definitely exceeded our expectations. Our server Ari, was extremely attentive to us. The manager even came to our table multiple times just to check on us. And the food, wow, it was not expensive and it was filling. Portobello fries were juicy and crunchy. The caramel turtle, great way to end our meal as it was not overly sweet. Will deff be coming back!

VuCyPqT_o1CO2d_vkO3hEQ.text: Its ya boy X,  IM IN VEGAS AND THE "STAKES" HAVE NEVER BEEN HIGHER. ha.  I hit up Vegas pretty often with the boys, and when I do Echo & Rig is always on my list of go to's to eat. Its probably one of my favorite steakhouses in the United Stakes. ha. Me and the boys like having a nice steak dinner before we go out-- its important to have the mind clear and the tummy full before a night on the strip.  My go to at Echo & Rig is the NY Strip - the sh*t is thick!! My boy Ty is from NY and he recommended it to me once, and I was never let down. The garlic mashed potatoes are bomb too, and don't sleep on the calamari.   Proceed with caution vegetarians - this just ain't for you!   -X

dMtccYwG5WiIX08l2GlLyA.text: Ambiance: classic steakhouse off the strip, full bar on the ground floor, and spacious indoor dining area and balcony patio outside, soft lighting and comfortable seats   Service: super friendly and very patient, our waitress was a very nice lady, provided useful suggestion and showed her hospitality sincerely, other servers stopped by the table frequently were also very helpful    Food: overall delicious, almost like everything ordered from the menu    Bread & Butter - *** a bit dry   Onion Soup - **** gratinee gruyere, pumpkin squash, sage, not too salty, recommend    Portobello Fries & Herb Aioli - ***** crispy and flavorful, highly recommend    Fried Calamari - **** tender and chewy, recommend   Roasted Broccolini - *** tasty with garlic    Mushroom Rockefeller - *** average taste   Porterhouse Steak - **** not listed on the menu, but if you ask they have it, cut from the rear end of the short loin and thus include more tenderloin steak, along with a large strip steak, one order for two types, great taste and excellent texture, recommend   Blue Cheese - ***    Red Wine Demi - ****    Brandied Mushroom - ***** favorite sauce    Bearnaise - ***    Charred Onion - ***    Horseradish Cream - **** bold taste   Lemon Chimichurri - ***     Price: generous portions and reasonable prices, expect about $50 per person

vN4i0fKvwqu4tdyxYy8-Vw.text: Great place to dine.  Top quality steaks.  I have not had anything there that disappoints me.  Highly recommend it.  I always order the Ribeye steak.  Always my favorite.

Dwr4snd2jH7_6zlcyzXiuQ.text: Cheaper than the "fancy" high end places on the strip and in the resorts for similar tasting or better dishes and variety.  However, the steaks they show you on the steak tray are pricey ex.)     New York 20 oz, 40 something oz porterhouse will be pricey.  $2.59 an ounce.  The items on the menu for they're prices are above average to your typical restaurant, and for the high side it's cheaper, but I think this place is overpriced as a whole  The servers are all excellent in customer service, but keep in mind, places like this specialize in sales.  You really dont want anything here, you're just asked and shown and you say yes and everything's up there.  I recommend this place to steak heads or rich retired older folk in summerlin.  That 40oz porterhouse cost me $110 plus tax for the one steak.  It's good but not that good.  Cauliflower is good but still overpriced imo  Decent selection of wines and drinks but all overpriced.  Typical prices for steakhouses.  Brunch and evenings/night when it's dark on the patio is lovely  Inside interior and decor is minimal and nice  The servers are great talkers and quick but a bit too talkative.  I think this place us an ambiance and locational place.  You got the nice walking area for the mall and a balcony.  For foodies it's a flop.  The food is better at places low key on Yelp and around the valley.  For a steak eater, you'll love it cuz the flavor, choices, and price will be the usual for you.  Young folk on a budget, no.  Retired folk, yeah.  Vegetarians and vegans definitely not.  Health conscious, nope.  This place is impressive with the properties interior design and service.  Also, it's been around for like 6 plus years.  Many businesses dont last that long.  I just wont recommend this place or go here anymore unless its brunch with a group of steak lovers.

OmkDOO73V5_pfC7_iD0V0g.text: Echo & Rig is one of my go-to brunch or long lunch spots. I go there to enjoy myself and the time I get to spend with the person I am with. Brunch is my favorite. Bottomless mimosas for less than $20 (they keep them coming) or bottomless bloody Mary's for like $22.   I'm a big fan of their lamb chop, steak and fries, their fried eggplant fries, all of it. I have yet to have something I dislike.   And their desserts. Omg. The turtle dessert with the caramel and the crunchy pieces of heaven! My absolute, must have item on their menu.   Overall, highly coming here on a nice day for brunch and sit on the balcony if the weather permits. AND PLEASE go to the bathroom and use the hand salts they have (OMG I NEED THEM) when washing your hands. The main highlight besides the dessert.   A little pricey but so worth the dining experience!

vVAfWR9xTQ3CKghJonTxbw.text: Went here for happy hour on the way to Vegas, so this review can only speak for the happy hour experience. The place was an upscale dining establishment and was decorated as such inside. We sat at the bar area- our bartender was so kind and gave us many great recommendations for our time in Vegas. They had a good local beer selection for good prices, and had three food items to choose from on the happy hour menu. We tried them all- the hotdog was good and so was the steak and eggs. The shrimp cocktail was really odd tasting- wouldn't recommend. Overall, seemed like a really respectable establishment and I'd recommend the happy hour for sure.

HjQ5M4TYqVCtxwgRA9kgLg.text: I went for the brunch at Echo & Rig and it was amazing. The portions were pretty big, the service excellent, and the atmosphere perfect. I plan on being a regular there from here on out.

y1hmHVWoWCPe0ymUslLpXg.text: I searched and did some research and that's how I needed up here for my first Vegas brunch. I'm so glad I did. It was a bit outside the tourist areas (the strip). You could tell that it was mostly locals branching there, which was kind of nice. The ambiance was nice with very nice decor. The bottomless mimosas were so good and it came with different juice options on the side - so I could make them as opaque as i liked! The food was SO GOOD. We got the short rib hash, bacon, avocado toast, and the smoked salmon Benedict. All of which were soooooo gooooood. It reminded me a lot of the boutique restaurants in Tampa. Highly recommend and will make the trip off the strip again the next time I'm in Vegas.

CfRFwpHJP3RtNTiENL7rFA.text: Lovely venue, great food and service.  Sunday morning Mimosa Brunch is a must try! Unlimited mimosas from 11am to 3 pm for $16! The brunch selection is great, good vegetarian options too

3Crh0yUo7wFLYBpqlYWSMA.text: We had a wonderful dining experience at Echo and Rig last Monday, August 6, 2018. The restaurant had great food and their service was just equally topnotch. We knew from the minute we entered the place what we wanted to get, and that is a classic ribeye, but wasn't really certain of what their meat size options are as it wasn't indicated on their menu. And Yelp pictures weren't really consistent with the ribeye pictures either. The server thoroughly explained to us the differences among the steak cuts and ounces we could choose from without asking him. I liked that he was very thorough about it and patient in explaining to us everything he deemed necessary to help us be certain of our choice. He did a lot of talking, but in the end, it was all worth it because we got what we had looked forward to have, a delicious, medium well 18oz ribeye. Both me and my husband had a plate of that with different sauces for each. I had the horseradish while he got the charred onion sauce which were both very good, by the way. We also ordered their mac n cheese, roasted garlic mashed potatoes, and summer corn as sides but all good for sharing too. We needed to box them for take out because of their large portions. As for our drinks, I got a classic, perfectly concocted Old Fashioned while my husband had a Guinness which was surprisingly perfectly poured too. I wish we had room for dessert as I'm sure this place would've had a promising dessert menu as well. And for a wonderful meal like that with a classy, trendy ambiance, their pricing, I'd say is fair and decent. A plus too is their restrooms that looked like that of a hotel's with their own brand of salt scrub free to use, fabric like paper towels, and an enormous, full body size mirror. I wish I took a picture of the restroom which I think is a plus in any restaurant establishment. All in all, I would say that I would highly recommend this place especially if visiting Vegas and would like to dine at a good steakhouse without spending an arm and a leg, like us. It's an easy 5/5 rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0VnGp9rBVOUOvj5i9EowYw.text: I was able to book a dinner reservation on New Year's Night at 6pm. I was so excited to celebrate not just a new year, but the first new year as husband and wife. When we walked in the restaurant, I was a little confused. To the right was a butcher shop, to the left a bar, and a host stand with four hosts. We told them we had reservations and one led us upstairs to be seated and gave us menus.  I think I've been watching too many Bar Rescues lately because I just started observing and timing the service. No one greets us for at least five minutes, then some employee came by to light candles on our table refusing to make any eye contact so I assumed he wasn't our waiter. Then another five minutes, a manager stops by and welcomes us, tells us about the concept and hopes we enjoy our dinner. He says he will get us water (yes, that would be great). Then another five minutes and we get water (from some other employee that doesn't make eye contact either or interacts with us). Okay....  Another couple minutes pass by and we finally were greeted by the waiter and I order the Date 17 cocktail and hubs orders the Black N Blu Mojito. It probably takes another 5-10 minutes to get our cocktails and we place our order. Now, I will give them the benefit of the doubt since it was New Years Day! My cocktail was superb! I highly recommend it! I don't think I've ever had such a great drink that had dates!  The hubs and I order the Portabello fries with garlic aioli, House Blend butcher burger and the grilled cheese with short ribs! The portabello fries will not let you down - you need to try it!! Actually, everything was delectable and I was impressed.  When we get our bill, it was less than $60, which I was pretty happy about because the last few restaurants I've been to were more than $60 for two people and the food quality are probably the same.   Thanks for celebrating the New Year with us, Echo & Rig - it was delicious and fun and for that, I will give you five stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The grilled cheese with short ribs
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The butchers burger

dtoK2Gr-Own0104lVEoOGg.text: Came here for brunch, sat on the patio which was lovely. Had my all you can drink mimosa which i loved. Had an amazing and very friendly server! But i just did not love the food. Obviously i would come back because they have a fantastic mimosa brunch with a great location and view of the mountains... but wouldn't order the salmon Benedict or the brisket hash i believe it was. Didn't love either one.

uxgG39qEMelaBOT7UV1OCw.text: I came here with my friend in scrubs:)! Haha. We were hungry for an awesome steak at a local joint, so we opted for Echo & Rig.   At first, the lady who welcomed us gave a bad impression. She didn't write my last name correctly. I don't really mind, but if it's a nice restaurant, they usually address you with your last name. She told me it did NOT matter, but she wrote it on another paper. She wrote it incorrectly, again.   The ambience was perfect. Fancy, yet not too fancy to stop you from getting a good steak in jeans or in my case, scrubs!   When we were seated, the manager, Lisa, promptly asked how to pronounce my name correctly. Again, murdered my name. Anyhow, they serve flat or sparkling water complimentary. My friend and I wanted sparkling water. It took a while for us to order but Lucas, our main server, was very patient explaining the differences of each cut.   For sides, we ordered portobello fries, grilled octopus with green olives and beans, roasted garlic mashed potatoes. Lucas suggested he serve the portobello fries and grilled octopus first. My friend and I were awestruck. Where have we been before Echo and Rig? The grilled octopus was tender and cooked perfectly. The vinegary sauce matches the saltiness of the octopus, green olives and the crunch and freshness of celery. Portobello fries was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside and paired with an excellent herb aioli!   My friend and I got the grass fed wagyu medium rare. Lucas made some arrangements for us to taste all sauces. There is a free mushroom rockefeller and freshly made crispy potato chips that came with our steak. The steak was cooked on point! It is good on its own, but my favorite sauces are horseradish, blue cheese and brandied mushroom for a creamier side. The charred onion was my fave for the non creamy side.  Ari, another server, helped us out when Lucas was in another table. He was very friendly and took the time to get to know us.  Got caramel turtle for dessert. Everything was made in house so basically it is outstanding. We also wanted coffee after. We got cappuccino. The froth complements the sweet espresso.   Our bill came out to $123.71 without the tip. I think it was worth of what we paid for.   My friend and I will be back!!! Sharing this sweet spot to people who want to eat great food!

R9moXPqU8IKcjrHnMVBb6g.text: I have brought my family here on numerous occasions for a nice meal.  Echo and rig doesn't disappoint in the meat department.  They will usually bring the cuts right to your table so you can see the selection.  Pick your choice of temperature for the meat and add some sides. It is literally that simple.   We got he tomahawk which was 40oz for $120 (easily split between 3 people). I really enjoyed the cauliflower, calamari and portobello fries as sides. This is an easy meal to come and splurge on.  The restaurant is located upstairs while below is the butcher shop.  Everything is elegantly appointed. The restaurant ambiance is almost a feeling of pure elegance along with a family style dinner. A must eat in Summerlin and you can walk Tivoli village after your meal.

cNhsu7XogYazIbO2e84jkQ.text: This place is quite a way off the strip but worth the ride.  I would have given this 5 stars but there were two key mishaps that I could not bring myself to give it a 5.    This place first and foremost is a butcher shop as were told by Dylan our server, and it is the only Echo and Rigg.  The atmosphere is hip and happening, and the place has a great outdoor patio area that would be great on a warm night or day.  We started off with portobello mushroom fries and I can see why it's a favourite for so many.  Juicy on the inside and a crispy batter on the outside, not like the tempura batter.  With the creamy dip it's perfect.  For dinner we both had the Spencer steak and side orders of the sweet potato and cauliflower.  All were delicious, I really like the spicy punch of the cauliflower when you bite into a piece of the chilli pepper.  Steaks seasoned perfectly.  However our steaks were not the temperature we asked for, both looked the same, between medium and medium rare, over cooked for my husband and undercooked for me.  For a steakhouse, you need to get the temperature right and because of this I would give it 4 stars as we really enjoyed the meal and drinks (mojitos) and service.    Dylan brought out a birthday sundae, it had coffee ice cream and chocolate bits and  pieces of cake but the cake wasn't great.  It was dry and just not right.  Needless to say we couldn't finish our meal, especially the steaks so we asked for it to get packed up.  And this is where I'm going to give it 3 stars.  They brought out the bag, we took it back to the hotel and when my husband went to open it up, he realized they gave us someone else's steak left overs.  This place would have gotten 5 as everything else was enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday sundae
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackberry mojito
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UdPB8F-GskbPR6_dmfWfHQ.text: I came here once before at dinner and lost a battle with a steak. We were full, we couldn't stop eating.  Actually, I thought I reviewed that night so I'm surprised I didn't see it posted.  Anyway, we stopped by over the weekend and just made it in time for brunch! It'd had been a while since my last visit and I was surprised how fast I was seated since this place is usually very busy, it's a popular spot in Tivoli Village.  I ordered a cappuccino and ordered for my date and I since he was running a few minutes behind and said to get anything. There was a short rib hash with poached eggs that stood out. There was another steak skillet thing with filet mignon and egg in it I can't remember the name of right this second. I explained I wasn't sure which ones to get and ordering was left up to me, so they brought it out family style so we could share. Also got the portobello fries with the pesto aioli cause they are one of my favorite things from the last time.   Echo and Rig's focus is on the food and presentation, there is a butcher downstairs, as well as a bar.  But what sets them apart is the level of personalized service. I was escorted upstairs to my table and addressed as Ms. Stewart by the staff. This is the only place where this has ever happened. Everything here leaves a great impression.

1B_-raf0efo29E8IXb4qlg.text: Echo and Rig EASILY gets a 5/5 stars in my book!!!  I went here with a group of friends and actually came back two days later with my wife and my mom since she was in town.  Located in a convenient location in the beautiful Tivoli Village, Echo and Rig is a two story restaurant/butcher shop. When you walk in, you are greeted by some of the highest quality staff I've ever encountered at a restaurant.  To the right is the butcher shop where they are chopping up meat in front of you and to the left is the bar.  Seating is upstairs.  I chose patio seating under a space heater and the view/ambience was perfect.  The staff here is probably the best I have ever encountered.  From the wait staff to the hosts, to the manager who walks around greeting everyone, service was prompt and extremely friendly.    The food is also very reasonably priced considering the quality.  You can get a huge steak for around 20-25 dollars and I tried a few bites from everyone there who got different cuts and they were all delicious.  The jumping beef is almost like a soup with large cuts of filet mignon and one of the better dishes I have ever tried.    My chicken was amazing.  It came with 2 oven roasted chicken breasts and beans on the side.  Mac and cheese was also amazing.  I highly highly highly recommend giving Echo and Rig a try. This place is amazing and I will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumping beef
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spencer steak

3zJPTLHSyeuSlgQL6-2EQQ.text: I've been here about 5 times now, I'll never go to another steak restaurant because of this place. The price is hard to beat for having fresh cuts from an in-house butcher. There is NO corkage fee and the service is the best in Vegas. Worth the drive from Henderson.

_0_DjELeUfU-Lzn1G41hHQ.text: After reading the reviews on yelp and other ratings sites I decided to check out Echo and Rig to celebrate my wife's birthday. The food here is simply amazing! We ordered the steak tartare and onion soup with gruyere for our appetizers and the filet and spencer steak for our entrees. The tartare was the best I've had, with the right combination of salt and spices (green chilis cut up) and the soup was simple but extremely flavorful.   Now to the steaks. The medium filet was melt in your mouth quality and char was all the flavor you needed. The Spencer's was equally juicy with a different flavor all together. Both cuts were accompanied with gourmet sauces, that you honestly didn't need due to the natural flavors of the cuts themselves. Wound up using the sauce with the garlic potato crisps they where served with.   The entire meal put a smile on our faces and my wife was extremely pleased with this selection for her birthday dinner destination.   To top it off our server Ari was top notch. He was very attentive and obviously knew his stuff. My wife and I were very impressed with his professionalism as well as his ability to be helpful with our questions. It's not often we review servers by name, but Ari you are the man, thanks for making our trip memorable, we appreciate it!  Lastly, the prices there are very good for the quality of their food. Other places that charge more should learn a lesson from Echo and Rig. Well done guys, well done. You don't have to charge an arm and a leg to appear to be a 5 star steakhouse, just serve great food, your customers will do the rest. We'll be back here for sure.

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Tartare (winner)

iV-I1uymR4ZClEGOE1FT0A.text: This was my first time coming here and I truly hope they were just having an off day cuz it was beyond unenjoyable. We arrived at 1145am and were told there would be about a 45min wait but the hostess told us it would probably be less. We said sure, no problem. We were expecting there to be a wait. When they called our name after about 40mins, they told us our table would be outside on the balcony and if we wanted an inside table it would be an an ADDITIONAL 45min! Now, keep in mind...today it is oppressively hot here. So my friend asked what it was like up there and the hostess told us not to worry, there were fans and a misting system. So we agreed and go up there to get seated and we are seated in the far corner of the balcony where absolutely NONE of the fans or misting system reached so we were very uncomfortable. A bus boy then brings us lukewarm water with no ice in an attempt to cool us off. We talked to our waiter and he said he would try to get us a table inside. At first he came back and said it wasn't possible since the tables inside were all reserved. So then a manager comes to our table and we talked to her and voiced our complaints...honestly, if when we first arrived, the hostess would have informed us that all the inside tables were already reserved and that the only availability as for outside, we would have gone elsewhere. So then the manager left and came back quickly and somehow found a table for us inside. We get seated and then they actually gave us cold water with ice in it, finally.  It took about a half hour to get our waiter to place our order and when the food came, my food was luke-warm at best and pretty over cooked (I got the short-rib hash). I informed the manager and she offered to bring me something else (I then asked for just some scrambled eggs and toast...not that great)  While we were sitting, it was very hot and stuffy inside and I mentioned it to our waiter and he informed us that the a/c was broken yesterday and it's not working well today. A few mins later the manager came over and actually brought a little desk-type fan to place next to our table, which was greatly appreciated. Towards the end of our meal we asked for the check and it took about 25mins to get it. The manager actually sent us out a free trio of desserts, which was a very sweet gesture. She did also comp my portion of the meal, since I barely ate it.   I hope if I return, that the experience is much better cu this turned me off to a place that I've heard such great things about.

Npm486xWr5VuNOWIoOO4xw.text: One of the best selection of steaks you'll have. The questions are a bit overbearing.

DMCjmUvVnxVuk1-Yebcd7A.text: Can you say absolutely AMAZING?! Echo & Rig is an upscale steakhouse located inside Tivoli Village. I had the pleasure of being treated this past Sunday to brunch from my best friends to celebrate my birthday. After doing a bit of research on this place prior to arriving I decided to book a reservation. This is a MUST especially on the weekend and even more so on a Sunday. The popularity on the Sunday brunch is crazy busy. They connect with opentable so if you prefer to reserve on there you can and or through the restaurant website/call in directly.  Upon arriving my party was greeted immediately by the two lovely hostess who stand up front. They confirmed our reservation and even wished me a Happy Birthday! So thoughtful. From there we were escorted up the stairs to nirvana. No I'm kidding but it sure felt like it. You can't help but notice this most beautiful chandelier as you are making your way up. Impressed already from the decor and ambiance of the whole place I was sold and haven't even sat down to eat. Usually places like this are super elegant but the service and food doesn't match. Usually is an operative word in this case because the exact opposite was provided. Not only was the food great but the service was impeccable! One of the manager's Beth came over not even after 5 minutes into us being seated to personally come over and introduce herself and again wish me a happy birthday! So thoughtful I was blown away. Our waiter was awesome to he made some excellent suggestions for starters and walked us through how the bottomless mimosas worked here. And hey... if you are like me and can't say no to a great mimosa do yourself a favor and indulge into this $16 never ending champagne and orange juice river!   Starters: Avocado Toast & Maryland Blue Crab Cake  Food: Two orders of Short Rib Beef Hash & Eggs Benedict  Everything tasted great! We all were so quiet because that could only mean one thing? Yeah we lobed our food lol. The Short Rib hash was prepared so good and I literally finished my whole bowl. I always have leftovers and today my stomach said NOPE be a pig so I did :-) There wasn't one dish that was placed on the table that wasn't good! I ended my brunch with the birthday ice cream that they provided and again just delicious!!! Shout Out to Manager Beth and the Echo & Rig team for providing such a fantastic experience for my birthday! I will be back very soon!

S2gva9G_VYMi-AKwzI7Xkw.text: The service alone is 5 stars.  There is a lot of care that goes into the front of house at this establishment.  The hostess asks all the right questions while you journey up the stairs to the dinning area.  With that information you are greeted after you sit down by who I assume is the floor manager.  He graciously welcomed us and knew who was local in our party and that I was visiting from Vermont.  The entire staff was very attentive and I think we had about a half dozen people taking care of our table.    Everyone in my party was very happy with their meals.  Everything is farm to table, but pretty straight forward for a steakhouse.  There was only one thing I was missing and that was a wedge salad, which I always love to start off my steakhouse experience.

RJns5FBJVHwPifTbx1sPbw.text: The food was excellent and moderately priced.  The atmosphere is great.  Better than the food and the atmosphere is the service. No room for improvement.  Luis made the experience very special w excellent suggestions and his attention to detail was superb.

GLrM7d83kQOnarBOVAPVOA.text: I'm surprised that this place is rated so high and as a top Vegas restaurant as I just found it ok.  Came here for dinner on a Saturday night.  The check in process was a shit show, 3 girls and these weird little slips and it took 15 min to get checked in and seen to a table even though we had a reservation.  My cocktail, black and blue monitor, was awful.  The food was just ok.  Steak was decent, sides ok, appetizer soap and salad really shitty.  I expected more.

SSrx4YSv5RE8u6AEmsRT4A.text: For my husband's birthday both of our son flew home to celebrate their father.  We normally go to Del Frisco's for a fabulous steak dinner on any special occasion.  This time we saw the amazing review for Echo & Rig and were so excited to try it out.  A butcher inside the restaurant?  This place must have great steaks.  The restaurant was very nicely decorated.  Our waiter Hugoman was very nice, we felt bad asking him to repeat a few time what he was saying because he spoke at the speed of 200 MPH and the restaurant was very loud we could barely catch what he was saying.  We had the Caesar Salad-good...Fried Portobello Fries-good...Mashed Potatoes-fair...Mac & Cheese-Good.  We also ordered the Classic Filet Mignon, Classic Ribeye (To be shared) and the Ribeye Cap.  When they brought out the steaks the Classic Ribeye was sliced to about 8 pieces, we were beyond disappointed because we ordered a STEAK.  We wanted to cut it piece by piece as we're eating it.  As we all cut in to our steak no one said anything until I broke the silence, "My steak is cold."  At that time everyone at the table broke silence and said " So is mine."  The outside of the steak is room temperature and the inside is cold to the touch.   I am being extremely generous by giving this place a 2 star rating.  The only reason they get 2 star is for the decor of the restaurant, their sides and salad was good and good customer service.  The steak we didn't even finish and we were starving coming in.  The thing I was most disappointed in  is this was a very special occasion and our entree was so disappointing.  We will not be returning for a steak dinner.

Xzl_cGC_5oQnEiIvDYPDOA.text: I cannot say enough how much we love this place. We went again last night for a business dinner and it was superb.  I got the salmon and it is TO DIE FOR.  The waiters always remember us, our waters are constantly refilled and the food is consistent and delicious EVERY SINGLE TIME. Echo is by far one of the best restaurants in Vegas. Thank you Echo and Rig!!

d6UUpUt8U7R5cvLaBVzWMw.text: Yes Yes Yes! Here's a restaurant that knows what they are doing. They took a casual first visit and delivered an experience, we were stopping by for a quick bite and got so much more.  Whoever is responsible for the hiring and training of the staff from the hostess to the waitstaff and culinary team knows what they are doing.  Izzy the server was a rock start and accommodate our 8 month year old and made us feel like part of the family.  Portobello Fries were delicious and what a fun side dish. Goat Cheese Sandwich with walnut bread and apples delivered on flavor and could not stop eating it.  Rarely take the time for reviews but today's experience prompt me to say Thank you Echo & Rig staff!!

6_ofyu76dAFOyuKj3I7-Ig.text: We moved to Vegas 6 months ago.  Friends from Arizona came to town and we looked this up on yelp. Great food. Had the pork chop. Wonderful. Service was excellent.

TjF-0UtGM3JEvXTMwoUn3w.text: We came here tonight for my birthday.  We had heard really good things about this place.  Everything that we ate was excellent.  Hugo was our server and he was amazing.  That being said the only downfall was that the ac was not working.  We told the manager that it was really hot if they could adjust the ac?  We were told that is as cool as they could get it,  that it is not working properly.  She offered to bring a fan over which she did when we were on dessert.   If the ac wasn't  working we should have been informed of that when we arrived.  The heat was really unbearable. We didn't ask for anything but it was really disappointing that the manager didn't comp anything off the check for the  inconvenience.  I mean this was a really nice meal that we couldn't fully enjoy because it was  about 100 degrees in the restaurant.

GpPdJ7EkqznRAjwlsJsabw.text: Great place for breakfast! The staff are very friendly and super helpful! The restaurant is very hip and lively vibe!  They offer a wide variety of breakfast option and several specialty menu. Definitely order the portobello fries - you would not be disappointed! Can't go wrong with their house special Short Ribs Hush..definitely a must! Can't wait to check this place out for dinner next time.

PS2GJtJW5t0J-BABrgf9mQ.text: The place is nice, the butcher shop downstairs is cool. Me and our large group of about 12 were all there for brunch birthday so we all ordered bottomless mimosas. Everything was great, only we had is that we waited almost 35 min for our food to come out, needless to say we were really drunk from the mimosas. They weren't messing around when they say "bottomless" because they kept topping our glasses off every time they could.  Food was good, but we just waited long for it

iH0J7U91ODgo3KVbmghoqg.text: This place is solid gold every single time! Sam Marvin's vision is an absolute Vegas masterpiece and everyone who hasn't done so already needs to come check this place out. The folks who have become regulars like myself know how they hit a home run every night. I'm proud to be a respected patron as well as refer people to dine any chance that I get!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is incredible. Nick Guiterrez and his team always style us out and make us feel like family!

PTXG0X5-qVyiljlgXwNnHQ.text: Five of my family came here for a birthday. The difference between this time and the first was that my brother was with us which meant I had a partner in crime to attack one of the bone-in steaks, which we did relentlessly. The fantastic steak, along with stellar service made for quite a memorable meal.  Seated immediately in a round at the top of the stairs for our 8 o'clock reservation, the manager greeted us and we ordered drinks. The Duck, Duck, Goose from their award winning bar was a fruity drink with some punch to kick off the meal. The menu was about the same from our last visit two years ago and no specials were being offered by the chef that night which are options that might need to be considered by the restaurant for those who want something different every visit. For me, just give me quality Double R Ranch/Snake River Farms beef every time.  Our server Luke was an exceptional guide throughout the meal, friendly (especially to my daughter and able to make her laugh) and knowledgeable about all food and drink. He actually helped us tilt the bone-in tray toward one tomahawk as we were teetering between two by pointing out how the marbling was more pronounced in one of the cuts compared to the other. His recommendation to have the thick cut cooked medium to assure a medium rare center and to have all the fat rendered through the steak, guaranteed that we tasted every bit of the sublime flavor. After requesting a recommendation of a cab to pair with my steak, two taste samples were brought out so I could decide.  We were also informed that a shipment of Mer Bleue oysters had arrived earlier that morning and there were only 20 were left, so a dozen were ordered immediately. The Canadian oyster definitely had the salty East Coast start, but a surprisingly sweet West Coast finish. The small plates are a definite strong point of the restaurant and we had a total of five to sample from throughout the meal. All food was brought out in a timely manner and all seven of their sauces were brought out with the steak. I didn't delve into the sauces too much, but my brother did and he said the mushroom sauce was the best. We finished off the meal with two caramel turtle sundaes.  Service has never been an issue with us, but I could see how it might present a problem at times because the servers don't work in teams of two and if one server gets caught up at one table, other tables might suffer because of a lack of availability. Price for the meal was $350 before tip which was reasonable with the numerous small plates and drinks ordered, but a price point much less than if we were on the Strip. If you're into meat like me, you'd make a wrong assumption that restaurant with a butcher downstairs wouldn't serve you quality product. Your server will be a valuable resource to guide you if you let him or her know your preferences. I will use that resource the next time I'm back, and I won't wait this long again.

6G2XqMRev02OpHigBEDDiQ.text: Came here as walkins with a group of friends on a Friday night. The fact that they got us a table around 730, without a reservation,  is already a 5 star rating in my book. Service from everyone, hostess, bartender, waiter, bus boys, was excellent, and even the manager checked in at one point at our table. The food was amazing and as great as it was the price point was even better. We will definitely be recommending this place to all of our friends.

fvLqdjG0PYvpGpQNLkVzeA.text: Great food and great service tonight! The 32oz Tomahawk split three ways was outstanding! Thank you E and R for a wonderful dinner

VksuIaebZzbpSmH3cGYRrg.text: One of our favorite go to steak houses in LV, outside of the strip.  The food is amazing, ambiance is great and staff is wonderful.  We always get a huge oversized ribeye to share, sometimes a fish or duck and the kids love their steak burgers and mac n cheese.  Our favorite appetizer is the portobello fries.  Make reservations in advanced for large parties.

u_ZjI75o0e5cGUWMpK93uw.text: This restaurant has been on my radar for a while now, so I was thrilled when my husband said that it sounded like the best option for a special night out.  I called and made a reservation for our second wedding anniversary, which was quick and easy.    On Monday night, we arrived a little early, and were seated right away.   Echo & Rig is not only a swanky, elegant restaurant, but it is also a butcher shop.  I absolutely adore this concept.   We were checking out the meat display when a hostess asked us if we preferred the stairs or the elevator.  We opted for the stairs, and I thought this was really nice of them to ask if there was a preference...it shows that they are looking out for their customers who may appear to be able bodied, but have problems walking or climbing stairs.  The hostess wished us a very hearty happy anniversary.    When we were seated, the manager came over and also wished us a Happy Anniversary.  Talk about attention to detail.  Everyone we interacted with that night congratulated us and wished us a happy night.    Our server Hugo arrived and took our drink orders.   We ordered the "Sweet Passionate Love" (for me) Nolet's Dry Gin, lychee liqueur, Green Chartreuse, , fresh passion fruit & lime juice, citrus soda.  This was perfection.  I absolutely loved every last sip.  Light and refreshing, I was actually quite surprised, since I'm not usually a gin fan, but this sounded too good to pass up.  I'm glad I ordered it.  It was wonderful.  We also ordered the "Black and Blue Mojito" for my husband.  He's a huge mojito fan.  Atlantico Platino Rum, blackberries, blueberries, fresh mint, fresh lime juice, sugar.  This was a lovely mix of sweet and tart, and was really a great drink.    Hugo was, in a word, incredible.  Attentive.  Prompt.  He went over the whole menu with us, answering all of our questions, making suggestions.  Service is always a deal breaker for me when it comes to dining out, and this was no exception.  The food was wonderful, but the service really sealed the 5 stars for me.  From Hugo, to the food runners, to the manager who seemed to be very hands on, and checked on us and several other tables frequently, its obvious that the staff takes pride in their work and want for their customers to enjoy every moment of their experience here.   Now, the food!!!  We opted for 3 small plates: Grilled Octopus, Gigante Beans & Green Olives:  tender cuts of octopus.  Delicious.  Whatever sauce this was in, I want to drink it.  The beans were amazing!  Every element of this dish was great. Crudo, Diver Scallop, Tangerine, Asparagus, Cilantro.  Raw scallops?  Sign me up.  Something we normally only get at sushi, I'm a huge fan of raw scallops.  This was light.  It was refreshing.  There was a tiny hint of spice that I'm honestly not really sure where it came from, but what a delightful appetizer.   Mac & Cheese.  You knew I had to order this.  Being the mac & cheese snob that I am, we almost didn't order this, but decided to as the first 2 small plates were very light, and we knew we'd have room.   This is a 7 cheese mac.  SEVEN. CHEESES.  Of all the mac n cheeses I've tried out there, this one is second ONLY to Gordon Ramsay's truffle mack at his steak house.  The noodles were perfectly cooked.  It was creamy and cheesy.   For me personally, it could have used just a tiny pinch of salt, but that's just being nitpicky.    For our entrees, we had:  Barramundi (for me) flash fried, spring onions, fresh peppers, sprouts, Ponzu.   Is it possible to be in love with a fish?  I'd only heard of barramundi one time before:  Saturday watching "Hell's Kitchen."   Its a very hearty, meaty fish, with a wonderful flavor.  It was cooked to perfection, and paired really well with the peppers, onions and sprouts.   The ponzu was delicious.   Seriously, one of my favorite meals ever.    My husband ordered the Bavette cut steak.  Hugo recommended having this cut cooked to medium, as it is a highly marbled cut, and he said that their cooks tend to lean towards the rarer side of the temperatures.  We took his recommendation, and it was perfect.  Well seasoned, cooked to perfection, it was tender and delicious.    The mushroom Rockefeller was a nice touch.  We weren't super impressed with the garlic chips, though.  It seemed just a touch...under elegant, if that makes sense.   They're actually pretty tasty with the horseradish cream sauce.  We tried that and the brandied mushroom sauce with his steak.  They were both incredible, but the mushroom sauce was a perfect  pairing.  We ended the night with a complimentary sundae, the Caramel turtle, at Hugo's suggestion.  It was delightful!  Definitely a great ending to a delicious meal.  Echo & Rig, you've stolen my heart.  We will most definitely be back again.  Thank you for making our anniversary even more special and enjoyable.
