S86jYjeMKhOFCIBe8gBLGQ.text: Amazing Food with Stellar Service  Recently dined at Echo and Rig to celebrate a friend's birthday. When I made the reservation the kind hostess asked if we were celebrating anything on the night of our reservation. When I told her we were celebrating a birthday she asked for the name of who we were celebrating. She was very engaging and even asked if we had any other plans to celebrate that night. I told her we would be going to the Paul McCartney concert later that evening and we were looking forward to a fun evening.  Much to our surprise, when we arrived to the restaurant they greeted us BY NAME and wished our friend a very happy birthday. Nicholas Gutierrez, the manager on duty came to our table to introduce himself and wish our friend a very happy birthday. He also mentioned that he knew we were going to the concert and promised to get us in/out with plenty of time to make it to T-Mobile Arena for the show. And boy did he keep to his word! He constantly checked in with us to make sure we were having an incredible experience.  Service was spot on! Never had to ask for anything. The steaks are AMAZING. Perfectly seasoned and grilled to perfection. The kale salad was fantastic, as were the four side dishes we ordered. The staff came out to sing happy birthday and presented our friend with a dessert on the house.  We purposely wanted to eat off the strip, and although Echo and Rig is about 20 minutes from the strip, it is worth the drive/Uber ride to get there. Value for money this place can't be beat! And the service will blow you away.

orMvOjKXBLAb0HBy3wZbEg.text: Still one of my favorite places to go in Las Vegas summerlin area.  Visited for brunch on a busy memorial day weekend with the family.  Took our server's, Hugo, recommendation and ordered the steak Skillet along with the short rib hash and mannn, did it not disappoint.   One thing I noticed was the coffee and the sweet cream milk they give you with it -- just absolutely sensational.  Highly recommended for locals and tourists if you're in the area. Just make sure and ask for Hugo when ya do. Merci beaucoup!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best coffee in summerlin. Must be a sweat cream milk?
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely chandelier

NmDosSlL1yzuJSj9w0IekQ.text: Very cool and trendy restaurant in the Tivoli Village plaza in Sommerlin.  Once you walk in there's a market and butcher area where you can see them cutting up different cuts of meat.   It's kind of interesting getting a peek of the preparation process.  There is also a bar where you can grab a drink as you're waiting for your table. The entire second floor is mostly where all the dining happens.  We came in a pretty big group so the staff was trying their best to accommodate all of us.  The prices for the menu items were very reasonable and it didn't feel like you were going to be broke at the end of the night.  The small plates were amazing. We had: Cauliflower (normally I reluctantly eat cauliflower, but the preparation was great) Mac & Cheese (perfect balance, it wasn't too creamy or too dry) Grilled Thick-Cut Bacon & bbq sauce (this disappeared from the table very quickly, a table favorite) Butcher's Sausage (can't go wrong with sausage) Asparagus & Fried egg. (This was good, but with a table of carnivores this lasted a while but was still really good) Portobello Fries & Herb Aioli (one of my personal favorite dishes, very thick cuts of portobello.  simply amazing) Fried Calamari. (pretty standard, it's what you would expect)  For my entree I got the Rib Eye cap along with the lemon chimichurri sauce.  The steak was ok. It wasn't bad, but nothing amazing like the appetizers.  I heard really good reviews about the fish as well.  That can be something I'll try next time.  All the desserts were sundaes and there were so many different types and variations.  We shared the Chocolate Cherry, Cappuccino, Caramel Turtle, and the Apple Pie.  I can't really remember the differences, but they were all amazing.  They were a decent size where there was 6 of us digging in and getting a taste of all of them.

xsjKNsFaW-YQ0VwLhor01w.text: Loved everything about this place.   - try the scrub to wash your hands in the bathroom. I bought two mason jars to give as gifts.  - happy hour is worth the early dinner and drinks - homemade potato chips can be your dinner - lamp cigars are amazing - always order an extra appetizer, it may surprise you - service is impeccable. Thank you Hugo for taking great care of us for our anniversary dinner!

-OZ5pPotPAOQpn60C8foyA.text: This breakfast spot was unbelievable. It knocked my socks off! We had reservations here and I believe it was reservation only restaurants on the weekends? But it beats me, we got to eat here hahaha! I had an awesome time here, we all came for bottomless mimosas. UNLIMITED mimosas for only $16! It's a high end butcher shop so they also sell meat here as well. Irrelevant or not, go to the restroom first and wash your hands with their sea salt soap.. You'll probably want to shower with that!! Hahaha. They sell it downstairs as well.. just go for yourself and see what I'm talking about! It looks high end here, but the food was VERY inexpensive. We also had a great time here because of our experience with Nan and the management.  Ok ok, a few people mentioned the portobello mushrooms fries and wow, it's a banger. If you get the chance, order the thick grilled bacon.. dip that with the bar b que sauce and it will leave you wanting more.  I ordered the butcher blend burger and the quality of the meat was on point. USDA prime beef medium rare, so delicious. They added yellow tomatoes which I thought was odd because I've never had one but in fact it went well with it! My girlfriend ordered the Flat Iron and that was delicious, next time I'm ordering that! A few friends ordered the short ribbed hash which I had a bite of and that one bite was promising!   Def a good restaurant to come back for when I'm in the area, looking forward for round 2.

inSpLj3fORsemiXFUgH4Wg.text: Great atmosphere, attentive staff. Great alcohol and food selection. We had the ribeye which was cooked perfectly. We added a side of garlic cheddar mashed potatoes which were phenomenal. We ended with the Turtle sundae which was also great. All in all a fantastic experience, if we lived nearby we would definitely be repeat customers

AvliihFmS6nNLAzAfI0xPQ.text: We were visiting out of town and decided to dine off of the Strip. Echo and Rig sits in a beautiful location and the dining experience was even better. We were seated promptly and had a seat on the balcony overlooking the fountain. The manager introduced himself to us as he saw we were out of town! I can say so many positive things about this place. The steak cuts are affordable, the sides extensive, drinks are tasty and the service is through the roof! If you're in town visiting Las Vegas this is a must visit.. and the wine bottle list is not just adorable but extensive...

W6aes2nz6hZ52aV6mVAA6Q.text: Walked in for our 6:30 reservation. We didnt get seated until 7:15.   Not a great first impression, but luckily the food was very good. We had the hanger steak and the ribeye as well as the portabella fries and a side of brussel sprouts.  Entire meal with one drink was over $100. So I dont agree with their two $$ price level. Its definitely a $$$ restaurant if you want to leave satisfied and full at all.  The amount of food was perfect for 2 people. We ate pretty much everything because it was really delicious.  Servers were friendly and attentive  If it wasnt for the long wait to be seated with reservations it would be a five star experience. There didnt seem to be much sense of urgency about reservations and the staff could have been more apologetic for not being able to keep their timing in order. Saw atleast 3 groups leave angry and go to Brio across the street, I was patient though since we had already waited 20 minutes at that point.  Ill be back, but for more of special occasions since I cant be spending $50 a person on dinner every week

RW4OLoPl7601_k2F7hXPiQ.text: Echo and Rig is a must try place if you like steak. See echoandrig.com/history for info behind the restaurant. In short, a well known chef re-invented the steakhouse by making it light and airy; providing great steaks at a good value and topping this off with excellent service. As our server stated you don't need to mortgage your house to purchase a steak. I really like steaks cooked over a wood grille. Here they cook over red oak. Cooking over wood adds a nice flavor. Wood cooking can be a bit harder in the kitchen because the grille can have wide temperature swings. Echo and Rig nailed the cooking and delivery. Many steaks are what they call Natural prime where beef is fed natural grass and finished with grains to create prime marbling. On top of this you have two ways to purchase steak: 1) from the menu or 2) a larger shareable piece from the butcher tray. The larger pieces are priced by high the ounce. Service at Echo and Rig really stood out which started with excellent staff communication. The hostess found out it was our first time and where we were from. Magically, our server then asked us why we came from our home town to Summerlin Nevada. Before the evening was over the manager stopped by to talk and give us his card. He promised to give us another special evening when we came back which he did. So all was present to give Echo and Rig a five istar rating. We will be back when our travels take us to Las Vegas. Our first experience we had brunch consisting of watermelon salad, avocado toast, steak frites brunch and a cappuccino sundae. All was superb. Our second time we had a steak from the butcher tray which was a thick thirty ounce prime New York precisely cooked along with some sides.

quVshspzPrR4NeuYEln_rQ.text: Great concept. Terrible execution. Trying so hard to like this place but no. What's the point of bottomless mimosas if no one fills it. Then waiting 10 minutes to run our card after a 10 minute wait to give someone the card. Food is blah. I got an eggs Benny and the Canadian bacon didn't stand out and I couldn't taste it really.. so fail on the execution because the meat should be the focus. And please put the butcher behind glass because that smell is rough. Again great idea but poor execution. My option same level as Brio and brio isn't anything to aspire to :/  North blows this place so far outta the water.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wrap is classy but don&#39;t send bread in a wrap if it&#39;s not warm. Cold bread wouldn&#39;t have been a let down if it wasn&#39;t for the delivery...

Woro5sM5guusaShgseImpA.text: With upwards of 2000+ reviews, there is not a lot that I can say that has not already be said.  So on that note, I will narrow my review down to the following four points about Echo & Rig.   1).  THIS PLACE HAS A MODERN FEEL VS THE TRADITIONAL STEAKHOUSE LOOK:   When out of town guests or friends are seeking a "steakhouse" out on our Summerlin side of town, I tend to shy away from what one thinks of as a traditional steakhouse.  You know the ones...darker ambiance and decor (maybe wood walls), dimly lit, appears stuffy and old school, rich heavy food choices and the traditional items you find on every menu from Smith & Wollensky to T-Bones (no offense) and usually very pricey.  Echo & Rig has a ton of natural light, it lighter in color and has a big open feel.     2) I AM QUICK TO RECOMMEND THIS PLACE AND I DON'T EVEN EAT MEAT: Echo & Rig has a varied "tapas like, sharable, extensive" appetizer/side area of their menu which really is a highlight.  This part of their menu has so many things that are not meat based and are delicious (do yourself a solid and do not leave without eating the portobello mushroom fries with dipping sauce...I order them every single time and love em!).  But in addition to this great part of their menu and knowing that steaks are really the highlight of the restaurant, they always have salads, sandwiches or fresh fish to please any eater like me.   And as for price in my first point, a steak will set you back $30, which seems incredibly reasonable considering that this is Vegas.  A non-meat main dish will set you back under $25.  3).  NO CORKAGE FEE:  Let me repeat.  Echo & Rig does not have a corkage fee.  Unheard of in this town, this steakhouse is 5 stars on Yelp to me for this point alone.  There is s a limit to the number of bottles you can bring, so call to clarify this.  This makes Echo & Rig unique in this market.    4).  BETH & STAFF:  This spot can be very busy, for a variety of reasons, but also because of their patio seating and ability to accommodate large groups.  Beth has been a manager and a server and every single time I visit, she is professional, welcoming, friendly and hustling.  She remembers me and greets me with respect and delivers great customer service every single time.  I would say this about any staff member I am sure, but Beth is notably my favorite.    You are modern steakhouse to me Echo & Rig and with the no-corkage fee policy, you will always happily have my business.

g7XM11vlzQsofAI0UCZtEw.text: The wagyu beef ribs were burnt but I didn't have time to order something else. It was nice that ER served a complimentary ice cream sundae for my friend's birthday. Service was attentive and ambience is first rate. I hope my return visit will be better.

uENIzp3U93C49IROdNIQJg.text: Steaks are cooked more to the pinkier side. If you like it like that, then all is good. If not, make sure you let them know you like more cooked than not.   Portobello mushrooms, grilled octopus salad with giant beans (are those from Jack?!? Lol  you know, and the beanstalk?? Haha )  Well, steaks aren't grass-fed, entirely. And still, we enjoy coming here. Service is outstanding and we're glad to see this place busy.

MMMNYjIuABLMO6gfh8TZ-Q.text: Went on a horrible date here a few years back, and the only thing that kept me there was the food.  been back several times since. Brunch is also amazing.

j2XOi2lP0BX1vIQhQ_ccSA.text: Holy cow! What a great find. All the credit goes to my coworker Badger.  I'm going to make this simple for you True Yelpers.  Service 5 stars. Food 5 Stars. Ambiance 5 Stars. Bar, well it's a bar and its great!  I had the filet with Fat Boy Oysters and let's just say "ILL BE BACK" to get that again. yaMK7zNewFbl_uSBfR7wbg.text: We had an amazing dining experience at Echo & Rig a few nights ago and everything was great. We started with oysters that are only served Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday to insure freshness. I had the Rib eye cap and my date had the skirt steak with lemon chimichurri sauce. We also had the portobello fries  & Caesar salad. Everything was superb. Sheryl Best and her staff, Tim, and Celine made us feel welcome and our server Beth treated us like royalty. We're going back and bringing friends.

Uso3gFKtONXUqJGM90O5qQ.text: My friend took me here so we decided to try it out. While we were waiting, we saw live the butchers slicing up the meat. This gave us a visual idea of what we're about to order. Of course, I ordered the ribeye. The taste was a bit different. Maybe the steak was cooked or smoked over real wood? Nevertheless, I thought the meat quality is above average, definitely not the best prime meat. The sides were okay.) For Thinsulin fans, there's plenty of green light dishes.

Xc_22ybHHUVp6YTvlKHCbg.text: Ate her when it first opened a d forgot how bad it was. Made the mistake to go there tonight. Slow and poor service,  and the food was mediocre. Server never came back after dropping off our food and had to wait at least 20 minutes after we were done to ask for a dessert menu. It was thrown down on the table. I am surprised this place is still in business. Choose another place to eat in Summerlin.

I_806Cvc17WOlxga7QGF3w.text: I can't believe I have never written a review! I frequent Echo and Rig a few times a month. Everything here from start to finish is amazing! From their happy hour, brunch, and dinner it's all wonderful. Happy hour menu is great, you cannot beat $1.99 steak and eggs! Their brunch features bottomless mimosas for only $16, they use a good quality champagne and your glass is never empty. Our favorites on the dinner menu is of course the filet, portobello fries, steak tartare, octopus salad, and the wild mushroom soup. to finish definitely get the seasonal sorbet, you will not be disappointed! I love that they do not have a corking fee if you bring your own wine. They track your visits by your phone number which is one of the best customer services strategies I've ever seen. They appreciate repeat customers and it really shows. Ladies make sure you stop by the restroom and use their amazing hand scrub before you leave! The service is impeccable, friendly, and attentive. It's definitely strip quality at a fraction of the price. We have all of our major events here. Why go somewhere else when you know this place is going to be amazing every time?!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottomless mimosas
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch!

t-0HPuwrOJyfgxXcEtA1mQ.text: What a great find just a few minutes from the Las Vegas Strip. A better steak than you get on the Strip - at a fraction of the price along with a much nicer atmosphere. Seriously. Steak houses in casinos on the Strip will charge you $60 to $80, or even more, and that's just for the steak and the pleasure of inhaling the stale smoke air in the casinos. Our server, Louis, was first class and the manager even checked to see that everything was up to snuff. My wife and I both had the rib-eye ($36) and it was excellent. Some wonderful mushroom soup to start, potato, asparagus and two cocktails, and the total was $135 before tip. You would have spent $250 for a similar meal on the Strip and I doubt that it would have been as good. Hell, you could take an Uber or Lyft out to Echo & Rig and you'd still be ahead of the game.

NqxTePnPU9hU9jFZCDr-xw.text: I just wanted to compliment a few people who took care of us at your establishment about 3 weeks ago! It was a Wednesday night , April 17th &?we came in to eat cause it was my birthday! We got there late...I think it was 9-9:30 when we got there, & I know by the end of the night, everyone is tired & ready to go home, so you sorta feel rushed to get in & out, but our server never made us feel that way , in fact, our service was perfect all the way around, & our dining experience was a 10! Arie was our server & he was just the Best! I had inquired about the filet that I had seen on your website under the $17 menu, but I think he said they didn't offer that anymore , (maybe your website menu with prices  needs to be updated with current menu prices ) , so he had suggested the "skirt steak". He explained to me the fat marbling , so you would want to get it cooked to medium I think he said cause it would be too hard to chew anything less than that, so I took his advice, hoping I would like his recommendation. Well, he gave me impeccable advice on his choice of steak! That steak when it came out was exactly like he had described it...absolutely perfect in every way! It was prepared exactly like I like it! Almost like Pittsburgh style...sorta charred on the outside, & tender & rare on the inside! That was the best steak I think I've ever eaten, & if it wasn't for him recommending that to me, I would have never tried that cut, but he said he gets that all the time & it's a tender cut of meat, so I said ok, I'll try it.  He described that cut  to  a T...it was everything he said it was, then some! It was tender, moist & seasoned perfectly....it just melted in my mouth! It's even more tender than the filet,  which is what I always order , but those days are over! It's skirt steak all the way!! Big kudos to the excellent chefs in the house....thank you for always putting out mouth watering, & tender steaks! And I must say it was the 1st time I've ever gotten a hot steak here, cause normally I order a rare filet which is barely warm, so it was nice to have something different to compare it to. One suggestion I would like to make tho...serving homemade potato chips just doesn't go with steaks! Why can't you give a choice of mashed or baked & if you have to up the prices a few $, I'm ok with that. I just don't think it fits on a plate with a delicious hot steak! Then we had Eric who brought us bread & the water & he was awesome too...totally impressed with the service! Then the little dark complected server...I think she said her name was Renee or her name started with a J?? I can't remember, but they were the only 3 still on the floor, but she was awesome too! She came & took our order without writing anything down & recited back to us our order, & we said yep, that's what we wanted. When our food came, everything was just perfect & the food was out of this world , as usual! The only thing that could use some work is the amount of cauliflower that you get for the side order. I think it was $7-8 , but the portion looked really small this time. I have to get this every time I come, but their wasn't enough there to share...it looked like a 2 oz portion . If your gonna charge $7-8 for a side , then give us our moneys worth, cause at almost $10 for a side item, I wouldn't order that again cause I don't feel you get your moneys worth on it. Maybe it was because it was the end of the night...who knows, but I will give it another try the next time I come in to see if the portion is the same or they give you the portion for 2 people to share. My portion was for 1, anyway, the whole dining experience that night was perfect & just wanted you to know that! Then to top off the evening , our server asked us if we would like some dessert & we said oh no, we're too full, but thank you. He left our table & I assumed he was going to get our check ready, but he impressed me & came back to our table with my birthday dessert of vanilla ice cream with salted Carmel sauce with a lit candle  (to die for) & sat it down in front of me along with 2 spoons!He remembered that it was my birthday & totally surprised me when I had forgotten that's why we came  up to echo & rig for having the best servers in this town!   Buca di Beppo is the same way... I never worry about service when I go there, cause all of their servers are awesome too! Never have to worry about bad service at either restaurant, cause both places have the best servers in this town! Thank you Echo & Rig....you'll always have my loyalty!!

qvb_P4qTa_39tCbLnP_gyQ.text: Shut up and give them your money!!!  The service was so great I felt like pure royalty. Special shout out to Lucas( our waiter) and Nicholas (the manager). The food was spectacular and their recommendations were spot on.

Rr-DJCdBo1MO3WkeOAHrQg.text: Firstly, the staff are the best part of this place. From making a reservation on the phone to being greeted  at the door to being seated and served throughout, they are friendly, welcoming, accommodating and very knowledgeable - an absolute asset to this restaurant. We were sat upstairs and saw that the atmosphere is quite strange, not to say it's bad, it just feels a little busy and reminds me of eating at a cafe at a train station - open space, people walking past, similar textures. My partner and I tried a variety of small plates. Good prices and good variety, I just didn't like that someone popped by every 10mins to take dishes away that weren't quite empty and that we weren't finished with. Other than that, great!

bWf2rNenhOFYU72d3vEGSg.text: The food was exceptional.  The skirt steak is the best ever. The home made chips are delicious. You have ri try the mac and cheese. Best of both world nice restaurant with great food and service but you can dress casual and comfortable.

14YmqlXnKn5l0_Usl0SoWg.text: Best restaurant in Vegas hands down. I've been coming here regularly for the past few years. Customer service is amazing. As long as they keep up the quality and customer service I will continue to spend my money there and refer everyone I know.

gyRNgZhnRDrZ9NmxY8gvZQ.text: My second time coming here - first time was for dinner a year ago.  This time was for lunch and I was not disappointed.  I like that I dont have to drive to the strip for a really good steak meal, and parking for Tivoli Village is hassle-free!  Appetizer--Portobello fries with basil aioli is a must have.  There is parmesan on the mushrooms that is really, really good.  We were also going to order crab cakes, but Im glad we didnt, because the bread the bring out with butter, along with the fries were more than enough.  Baverre cut steak--really good.  Our server suggested the charred onion sauce and if you love onions, youd enjoy this sauce.  The steak really didnt need a sauce, but its free, so why not.  The steaks come with these potato chips that I didnt care for, and 1 mushroom rockefeller which was delicious!!! I would have preferred no chips and 2 mushrooms.  Skirt steak--this was so/so...my friend said the Baverre tasted better and Id agree.  She got the lemon chimichurri sauce with it, and it tasted ok, but the steak didnt need it.  Sides--mac & cheese (amazing, very cheesy, I loved it); broccolini (amazing, with a lemon flavor)  Bottomless mimosas--They usually only have the bottomless mimosas on the weekend with their brunch menu, but this was the day after xmas (on a Monday), so they had bottomless mimosas and bloody marys....they give you a full wine glass of the sparkling wine and a very small flute of orange juice and they come by to refill both constantly...honestly, they never refilled my oj because I like my mimosas with minimal juice!! Lol.  Service--a little slow for lunch time on the day after xmas, but we werent in a rush and it allowed us to have more mimosas!!  I will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skirt steak with chips and mushroom rockefeller
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baverre cut steak with chips and mushroom rockefeller; Sides--broccolini and mac n cheese...amazing!!
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our meal

xKsbcqW4vmsWcYDwGaMqcw.text: Love to sit on the patio and have one of their nice glasses of wine  the food the great I live for that portobello mushroom it's soooooo goood!!! Service is great and the managers are attentive and welcoming.

2YTK7embKvajNY1REMPRNg.text: Went here for a birthday dinner My fiance requested a good steak. So to yelp I went and landed here. And boy were we not disappointed.   Service: Our waiter was wonderful! He went over the entire menu with us, and answered any questions we had. He suggested drinks for the food, and pointed out items we might be interested in. As it was a birthday, he even came by with a birthday treat in the end.   Environment: When we entered we were greeted in a very friendly manner. I liked the butcher feel, and the bar to the side. As we walked upstairs you could tell it was fancy and well out together. Even though we were sitting in the middle it still felt romantic and personal as we ate dinner.  Restaurant is located in Tivoli Village, which has nice shops and is great for walking around.  Food: It is quality you can taste. The sides we had were the mashed potatoes and pork belly. I could have just eaten that pork belly all night long! Then came our steaks. I have not had a more tender well cooked piece of meat since Alberta Beef.  You could tell the butcher knew what he was doing, and the chef did as well. It was perfectly seasoned and cooked exactly to how we wanted it.  The dessert was impeccable as well.   Overall: Worth the trip! Would go back again for our next birthday/anniversary/or Friday.

7zNfUhQXHDcmjE89GE6y0g.text: A pretty decently priced steakhouse in Tivoli Village!  I came here only once last summer with a good friend. We've heard all about how cheap yet delicious the steaks here were so we had to come find out for ourselves.The ambiance has a modern sophisticated feel. The downstairs has a butcher shop and a bar seating area and the upstairs has restaurant seating.  I recall it being packed when we went and we had to wait for a table, but not too long. Everything we ordered came out at a slow place. I can get pretty impatient, but a steakhouse on a busy weekend in Tivoli Village can be understandable.   We ordered a few appetizers and got a bottle of wine. We both went for the ribeye, $35 is a price you can't beat! There was a bit too much salt added for my taste but it was very juicy. (I do like salt so I still devoured my steak). It was a thinner cut of ribeye than what I'm used to at restaurants, but for the deal you're getting it for it doesn't come as a surprise. My only advice would be to order rarer than you'd like. I like mine medium but because of it's thickness it came out closer to medium well. The steak also came out with homemade chips which was different to see paired with steak but nonetheless delicious.   I was telling one of my coworkers who had also tried out Echo & Rig about how I thought their steak was a little salty and she thought that was strange because she thought her steak could have used a little more flavor! Different chefs? Different cuts possibly?   Good price for good quality meat, they just have to master that steak seasoning ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Feasting at Echo &amp; Rig

51VQQt0m_zCScN3cEAADSw.text: First time here and definitely coming back! Had a great dining experience. Our server and busser were very accommodating. Food was superb, and the dessert was delectable! We were also visited by the resto manager, Kevin, to make sure we had a good dining experience. I'd go back for more mouthwatering steak if I could right at this very moment!!!

LiOAyNA_o1hVXi2DNYMnmA.text: I've been to this place about 3-4 times and Everytime the service were pretty bad. The only reason I go back this time because my friend wants to try the steak there   I wish I could give this restaurant a -1 star but there's no options for that. So the  1 star is for beef. The service was the worst I've ever received. Everything was wrong from the begining. The server and the manager had no clue what the hell was going on.  All they gave us was excuses one after another.  too bad we have 9 ppl in our party so they took advantage of charging 20% tip. After so many times of bad experience here, I will never go back to this place again. Lesson learned.

zms4KbayVhmkgBdo3upvEw.text: My friends and I always come to Echo & Rig for brunch and normally have good service but today the hostess and customer service has gone way down and the hostess with pink hair was extremely rude and short with my group today. Walked in with a party of 6, which we usually have no problem getting a table or waiting for one, however the hostess didn't even bother offering us a waiting time and just said they were booked and to "grab a card and make a reservation next time". Will definitely make our friends aware of the situation and take our business elsewhere then.

k01XOkPFNCoXZd_1bhai9A.text: Echo and Rig is a destination dinner!  Each time I know I'm going to Las Vegas, I call Echo and Rig to place a reservation for one of my favorite meals of the year!  The staff is courteous, very well trained, welcoming, and confident.  The atmosphere is clean, relaxed, and inviting.  The menu is full of great options and excellent quality.  I would recommend Echo and Rig to anyone who wants a relaxing dinner in a casually comfortable atmosphere with great service and delicious food.

Rd1V8T-ZMzSEk_gIdQToTg.text: Ok. Last minute dinner to fulfill bday obligations. Austin our waiter made suggestions:fried spinach salad, skirt steak, a wine. It went perfectly together. Heaven!

RKwF0bo-iHrfBIevjE95SA.text: So delicious! Great atmosphere and service. Tim was our personable wait staff and helped make this a memorable experience! Wonderful prices and we will definitely return and recommend to everyone! That lemon chimichurri sauce is my new obsession!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hNBnMBXwd7Eh2KPJmxkM2g.text: Absolutely loved this place! I had the spinach salad and portobello mushroom fries..my husband had a steak..everything was so flavorful and fresh.Sauces were addictive! Service was top notch as well...I have not experienced a meal this great in a long time, and we eat out in Los Angeles frequently..wish this restaurant was in LA.

9U1xXE57poSMtaUmY6DYFQ.text: Dined here a few times with small and large groups.  It's hit or miss in terms of walking in to get a table.  Tried to get a table on a Tuesday evening at 8pm and it was a 45 minute wait...  Dishes eaten: - Portabello fries with garlic aiolo sauce: lightly battered mushroom slices, you have to try this; the sauce is bomb - Fried calamari: fresh & flavorful.  Light batting that didn't fall off in the dip. The calamari sans sauce is s still tasty. - grilled cheese sandwich: short ribs, gruyere parmesan & white cheddar.  I still dream about this and want to go back and try it again.   - Jumping beef: not what I expected.  I expected a dry dish with tomatoes and potato, but it was more saucy. - the Tomahawk steak shared family style for was not good by any means.  The steaks are always undercooked when we eat here (for you too?), so over order for what you expect...at least that's what we learned on our 4th trip. Example: - ordered steak med-rare last time...it came out very rare - ordered stead medium this time...it came out med-rare  Best of luck in your dining adventures here!

RHmGv2JUVhsJDeffCcTE1A.text: This was our treat dinner while in Vegas this year for DEF CON.  While expensive this place was really great for dinner.  Reservations are recommended and we were haphazardly sat on the first floor as there was a part on the second floor.  You will need to dress nice for this place as it is rather upscale.  But the steaks here are truly great as are the sides.  It's a standard Ala carte type of place like you would find on the strip with the sides all servers family style.  While expensive it was worth it and still cheaper than on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This should be really good....

K8UZzri0hBYQZdbppIkUfg.text: I always love going to this restaurant.  I have been there for 2 of my last 3 birthdays.  The food and service are fantastic.  It is quiet enough to chat with friends.  They have amazing tapas, I love the watermelon/cucumber and my friend ordered the portobello fries, so good. The steaks were cooked to perfection.  Just a wonderful experience, every time!

PqpGCwcB9rkoZoE5prbBng.text: Wow! This place is pretty amazing. Currently my new favorite steak house. This is a perfect date nice place (if you're in to that sort of thing).  I had a New York strip and tried a few of the small plates. Crab cakes, steak tartare, pork belly all for appetizers and then with the steak was Brussels sprouts, corn, and mashed potatoes. I also tried their Manhattan drink and it was delicious. Not that over powering liquor taste.  This place has its own built in butcher shop. You can order meats to take home if you want! Since they cut their own meat, you can get some unique cuts that aren't served at other places. Best part? Bring your own bottle of wine. No uncorking fee!

mFLdeF9mz2oDulWhwfqhcA.text: Excellent. Tonight was our first visit. My husband took me for my birthday. We were greeted by two managers, a food server, & a hostess who all wished me a happy birthday. We shared the portobello fries, that were great. Next we shared the chopped salad, also delicious. I had the filet & my husband had the ribeye. Both were done perfectly. They brought me a salted caramel sundae for dessert for my birthday. My husband drank the house Cabernet & I had a brandy old fashioned. My husband ordered a Dogfish IPA after his wine & it took quite awhile. He asked the server to check on it, he brought it, then the manager stopped by our table to say it was on the house because it took too long. Overall, great service & great food. $120 plus tip, a great value too.

cHrX0ddnQ0TnQd_-C9w4Eg.text: Loved this place !!! Had brunch on outside upper terrace and it was so delightful .  I cannot wait to go back .  The chef came out to chat with us regarding our  unique requests .  He was so fun and accommodating .

9pzwo4sDCtHZEIfyolzv0Q.text: Service and happy hour at the bar is great. They just need new bar stools as they hurt the back of your legs.

Hl-iCjT0gAvnoD0m6kaFHw.text: I'm going to start with 4 stars and work our way up. I can't in good conscience give a 5 star review without having a single meat entree. (although I'm tempted to) We ordered the tomato and watermelon salad, portobello fries and veggie chopped salad.  First, this place is the perfect romantic little spot nestled in the front entrance of TiVoli village. They have a butcher shop to the right upon entering. A bar to the left and small table and chairs scattered throughout. It's two stories & so a lot of the remaining seats are upstairs.  The tomato and watermelon salad has chunks of watermelon, tomato, onion, cucumber with a vinaigrette that pairs perfectly against the backdrop of that little summer fruit.  The portobello fries are some of the best I've had. Large and in charge. They come with some green mayo concoction for dipping.  The veggie chop was such a surprise hit!!  It has so many unique adds I had not expected. Snap peas, carrot, green onion, squash and hearts of palm!!!!!! I cannot wait to stop in again, but this time for a full dinner!!!

5r5PHj_T1Q5RlaFGwlyX-Q.text: Echo & Rig - some of the best Food in Las Vegas away from the strip. The service is also outstanding (coming from an ex server in a resort who knows what good service is)  HIGHLY recommend that if you have not come here and are thinking about it, GO! Cheaper than any similar places on the strip, yet higher quality - they butcher and age the meat in house, the side dishes are fresh made and I have yet to have one that didn't wow me! The Caesar salad made with real anchovies, Mac n cheese with real cream and cheese baked with breadcrumbs, spicy cauliflower, and portobello fries are all hits! The steak to have is one they sell out of on a regular basis - you can call ahead and see if they are available - the Rib Eye Cap! Just order it medium, as the chef recommends.   5 stars all day for E&R - will be back many, many times.

LJN7_xwCpE93fjcPFaXtNQ.text: Best place for brunch and all you can drink mimosas! Can't wait to go back! The short rib hash was the most amazing dish

5YAkr2oLo4rnU73PylswIw.text: When you first drive into Tivoli Village you think I've probably arrived at the wrong spot. The outside looks gorgeous. I arrived in jeans praying they wouldn't turn me away and they didn't but you definitely feel a little underdressed. Downstairs is their butcher shop and upstairs is for dining. My second time here and the service is pretty good. Your mimosas never touch the bottom which is always a great thing. (Bottomless is 16 and for bloody Mary's its 22).The food for brunch is mediocre at best. So far we had the steak frites, the New York sandwich and the steakhouse scrambled, all three meals were nothing to brag over. And to be honest, it's very disheartening because the decor and the vibe from this place is awesome.  Maybe I should try the dinner sometime?   So to recap, decor check, service check, food the box remains empty but the bottomless mimosas keep us coming back.  UPDATE: after coming back several times, the food has stepped its game up! The menu remains the same but the seasoning is on point. The service remains up to par and has become a go-to spot for us.

WyBx9yKH3ByOy3MS-5nzZA.text: If I could give this place 10 stars I would - I haven't had such phenomenal customer service in a long time.  We went early on a Sunday night for my husband's birthday based on recommendations and Yelp reviews.  We had reservations and this was the first time we had been in this particular shopping center.  Valet parking was easy and convenient and we were seated immediately.  Our hostess asked if we were celebrating a special event and thereafter everyone who came over wished my husband a happy birthday.  Our waiter was extremely courteous, made sure we knew everything was a la carte and made some recommendations.  The whole service team was great.  We ordered the butcher's sausage, bacon and a caesar salad for starters and the southern fried chicken salad, salt & pepper pork chop and a rib eye for the main course.  Dessert was a caramel turtle. The starters were great. I am not sure the bacon was as "life changing" as our server mentioned but it was pretty amazing.  I believe the sausage changes weekly - this one was a turkey sausage with Anaheim chilies, it was very tasty.  The Caesar was pretty standard but good.  Everything had lovely presentation.  The main courses arrived promptly.  My pork chop was to die for.  Amazingly tender.  It came with a phenomenal baked apple and some beet greens that I did not care for, but that's me, not the fault of the beet greens or the chef LOL  My mom had the Southern Fried Chicken salad and loved it.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  My husband who ordered the rib eye found the steak to be too salty.  He didn't want to complain because the steak was cooked perfectly but he really wasn't enjoying it so we let the manager know.  The team could not have been more accommodating.  My husband thought maybe it was his taste buds and after tasting my pork chop thought he could easily switch his order to that and be assured he would like it.  The manager however wanted my husband to have what he wanted to eat.  He spoke to the chef that prepared it, explained to my husband how it was prepared and suggested we just ask the chef to cut down the salt a bit.  Honestly, I think my husband just is sensitive to salt, not that the steak itself was over salted.  The managers could not have been more gracious.  They also brought my husband a tomato, cucumber, watermelon and red onion salad on the house while he waited for his new steak.  When it arrived (very quickly) my husband couldn't rave enough about it.  It also had a side of perfectly prepared potato chips.  I can't tell you how much we appreciate the management caring about my husband and his experience and never making us feel like we were a bother.    After dinner we were stuffed but they brought my husband a caramel turtle on the house with a candle for his birthday.  OMG, it was the BEST and we managed to eat it all LOL  In addition to the attentive staff, the phenomenal service, and the stellar management, we so appreciated the little details such as the staff folding your napkin when you left the table, the wait to clear the plates until everyone was finished and never feeling rushed to leave even though they were packed. As a plus, the prices were exceptionally reasonable.  We have eaten at Morton's, Flemings, Mastros, etc, and I'd chose Echo & Rig over these anytime.  Thank you Echo & Rig for the excellent food and great service.  We are customers for life.

dkBttuhoLRGMgKqU6iNIVQ.text: Restaurant: fancy stuff, come for special occasions or just skip it. Happy hour: very good deals for simple bites. Bartender was the rudest jack hole that's ever served me. Would come back for the cheap bites. Butcher shop: quality meats at good prices. The guy who runs it is sometimes rude but then really friendly. Throws me off. Either way this is the place to go for meats and I'll be coming back a lot.

ie-6fg96sjsgXHAzQBgGAg.text: Amazing service like always! We sat in the indoor section next to the balcony this last Sunday around 11am and our server was wonderful as well as the bussers. I didn't get their names but they were all attentive and made sure that we had everything we needed. The great service along with the great food and drinks keeps me going back! Thank you to the entire staff of Echo & Rig for always showing my friends and I a lovely time. I always recommend this place to all my friends who are looking for a cool spot to have brunch, I adore this place and will continue to come back for as long as I can!

CC-AxrLDwO26CzOkbHu5Zg.text: A great steak. Maybe even better side veggies. I love this place mostly because it's chef owned and run. Actually I think there are a couple chefs. Anyway, the menu is not a typical steakhouse menu, everything looks really inviting and interesting. I'll come back and try other things, but I think I could just have a series of veggies. I thought they were that good. The bread was okay but trust me, save your appetite for the menu.  The service was very friendly and attentive. I bit noisy, but they do have an outdoors balcony that is likely quieter. It's misted just in case it's hot.  The menu was at the low end of pricey so don't let the $$$ scare you.

BVv_lYassOzjRFyI_cLsWQ.text: There are t many places that I have spent this much money on a meal that I said was worth every penny.   This place was worth every penny.   And the happy hour specials made me a happy, happy man  The presentation goes a long way. This place has flair. Do yourself a favor and plan a date night here

mS5LBEWACDq-cXrImzQXMw.text: Wonderful food, great ambiance and view, excellent service from Jesse and Ari. Make sure you sit on the balcony. It has a gorgeous view of Tivoli Square. I didn't try the beef, but this place has the best lamb dish I've ever had.   Recommendations: Fried cauliflower Baked brie in sourdough bowl Portabello fries with garlic herb aioli Colorado lamb porterhouse Caramel turtle for dessert

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Colorado lamb porterhouse with fried cauliflower on the side. You gotta try it!

bPB0-m0qk2hJNkurbZCywQ.text: Totally affordable pricing for a delicious meal! My girlfriend and I went here for the first time to celebrate my new internship and were completely taken care of. We walked in without a reservation and only waited about 7 minutes to be seated on a Friday night at 6pm. The three hostesses were welcoming and took down our last name. We checked out the fresh butcher cuts and just enjoyed the lobby area. They have a meat case to peruse and a seafood station. You can purchase meat cuts and goods to take home and prepare yourself. We were seated in an intimate area and a manager or supervisor came by and greeted us and congratulated me on my internship. Our waiters were very accommodating and made us feel high class even though we were in jeans and t shirts. When we come back, we will be sure to dress business casual or nicer! We ordered the roasted broccolini, mashed potatoes, and the Spencer steak (ribeye). Everything was delicious! We didn't have a single leftover, not because of small portions, but because we devoured it all. Bread and beverage refills were frequent and without asking. My girlfriend and I were extremely impressed with the price point, yumminess, and diligence of the staff. We are excited to return for date night!

JwsBEA4honJ448dsfwwFtg.text: Ordered: -portobello mushroom fries -octopus salad(?) -cauliflower -46oz. tomahawk steak -4 beers  Sides: The mushroom fries were highly recommended by our server, but unfortunately, was a disappointment. The batter was quite thick, and was too salty for my taste. The octopus salad also did not impress. Our favorite side dish was the cauliflower by far.   Main: The 46oz. tomahawk was shared between 4 people (2 men and 2 women). I don't think it was enough for the four of us (even though the server said it'd be plenty of meat)...but I guess it all depends on how big of an eater you are. We ordered medium rare, but was told by our server that medium might be better since it's such a thick piece of meat. We went ahead w medium, and to our surprise, it was quite rare. However, it didn't bother me since I like my meat on the rare side. Overall, it was quite good. The 46oz. tomahawk came out to be $115(ish).   Our total bill was $200(ish)

Daniel was better than our waiter and he made sure we were taken care of! I don't understand why he's not a server! Lh8MzcXm_-hiBg1FgowyVA.text: Nicholas was absolutely fantastic! The appetizers were delicious and the steaks cooked to perfection. I'm heartily recommending the mac and cheese, or the bacon and barbecue sauce combo. The pot pie just melted on your tongue... Can't say enough good things about this place!

sVi1SdPZKCaYe6m5_Ur9Kw.text: So what made my husband and I try this place for the fist time was the great reviews! And it all definitely lived up the hype! The portobello fries were so good!!! I had the Spencer steak and it had amazing flavor it was just the right portion since we shared 3 sides, My husband had the Rib eye Cut, he liked it as well although he said it was a little salty for his taste and he definitely got full fast since it was a big portion good enough to share for 2 people! But overall everything was amazing, definitely recommend sitting out in the patio beautiful view. And our server Ramon! He was awesome very knowledgeable and we will be coming back to try your other recommendations! Also I think his name was Kevin but loved that he came to introduce himself and I saw he did to others which I love that and was very sincere and glad for us to be there!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Explanation of the different cuts! By Ramon!

PpCZT1vcLfKExM9phMbeig.text: I love this place. Great food and service 99% of the time. Everyone has a bad day here and there. I've been coming here with various groups of people for about 3 years now and Sheryl, Beth and Xavier always offer great service and attention. The food is consistently great and the minor detail of the fact that they use actual silverware is the cherry on top for me. I feel I may have told too many people about this place and now I really have to plan ahead to have a large group for a dinner here. First world problems IMO.   The Bavette steak is the fatty goodness a part time carnivore needs to experience. I love that they use poultry from Mary's farm from NoCal and their oysters are always LEGIT fresh. I even brought a doubtful seafood importer here once and he was convinced after trying the oysters.  This spot is way better than any steak joint on the strip and less than half the price. (Literally).  Eat here and get fat. It's worth it.

CVnqyk9UlUHeEwMKYWhgvQ.text: Been here twice. Service was excellent. Great selection of steaks and servers very knowledgeable about menu. Drinks fun. Ordered a dozen or so small plates. Everything was good or great. Have tried dozens of Vegas restaurants. This is the only one I'd recommend or revisit. Beautiful outside patio that was low key enough to take my five year to a nice dinner. Inside more formal. Both beautiful.

jPXY08yrtfqAgcTe1KUlmA.text: Happy Hour Review: I have only come for their Happy Hour, which is 3-6 every day and 10pm and after Mon-Saturday. Ladies get a free specialty drink of the day (crazy!) and guys get a free double upgrade on premium well drinks. I had the E&R hot dog for $1. It is a short stumpy hot dog with sauerkraut and mustard on it. Anne L. had the shrimp cocktail for $1.99. Warning these are the baby baby shrimps haha... But you honestly can't complain for two bucks. The steak and egg is $1.99 (this one looked bomb.com) I wish I ordered that. Everyone was really nice to us and our bartender Scotty was super nice and fun to talk to. He even played Splashy Fish on my phone with me haha. Such a great happy hour I was really surprised it wasn't packed. I guess it just depends on the night. I can't wait to come back and try their dinner.

Se2O9LR0HGoWgNj7vVajCw.text: Spraggle!!!  You heard me right, the food at Echo & Rig is spraggle!  This is one of my favorite spots for the $$!  I have been here a few times now and each time I have been completely satisfied with the excellent quality they consistently put out and the reasonable price.  I'm not saying that it's my favorite steakhouse, but again, for the money, it is certainly one of the best around!  They are a butcher and a steakhouse.  This makes for a unique feel as you enter, but there's more... The steakhouse means that they have several regular cuts of meat on their menu all the time...the butcher part means that you can order from the shop to-go...but it also means that several additional cuts are available routinely that are not on the menu but sold per ounce.  Steaks are seasoned well and cooked beautifully.  I would not hesitate to order with confidence any cut that you fancy on or off the menu.  The real standouts for me are the small plates.  They have 30 different veggie and small plates that range from $5.50 - $9.30.  On this list you will find such taste-bud copulations as Grilled Octopus w/ Gigante Beans, Bone Marrow Carne Asada, Maryland Lump Crab Cakes, Asparagus & Fried Egg, and their now famous Portobello Fries w/ Aioli...start with these, then venture out to the Sweetbread Nuggets, Steak Tartare, Brussels Sprouts, and Mussels Mainiere...Looks like I need to try more of their veggies next time!  If you are here with a group of 6 - 8 you might want to see what Ribeye Tomahawks they have (or if you happen to eat on your own like a Thunder Cat.)  This cut receives nice flavor from the bone and marbling, and slices up nice to share.  All of their steaks come with the option of the following sauces: Blue Cheese, Red Wine Demi, Green Pepercorn, Bernaise, Charred Onion, Horseradish Cream, or Lemon Chimichurri...I'm a succker for the more traditional Bernaise.  E&R is a great place to take a date and share some of the small plates...or come with a group and order by the ounce.  Did I mention that they don't have a corkage fee here?...well they don't, so bring in your favorite bottle of vino.  They also have some incredible looking Happy Hour prices, but I have not sampled any of these options. I have however tried the wonderful boutique hand scrubs in the restrooms, and I'm a fan.  Come here for remarkable food for the price point Come here with a group open to sharing and trying a lot of options Come here for fancy hand creams in the bath room Come here for a trendy date spot with a modern distressed interior Either way...you should come check it out  #200thReview  #OnlyTakesMeThreeTimesAsLongAsNelsonQToGet200Done

deGGOiwIOwWQch5UkNiLjw.text: Better steaks than most on the strip! Excellent cuts of meat, wonderful options for sides. Brunch is outstanding!

GYTYdawglcmnKUbMv-oF1Q.text: I have been to this place twice and food was always good. My friend recommended this restaurant to us and I hosted one of my employee party here. The only thing I didn't care for too much was after the dinner, our server came to me and told me we were charged 15% for service charge and that was the "minimum".... I don't know if the management knew that's what their employees been telling customers.... I dont think ask for more gratitude is the right attitude, that should leave for customer if they felt they received outstanding service and extra care!

oEX-gWoE5CUi06odCq5RqQ.text: Attentive service. Management came to the table to say hello and welcome us. Very knowledgeable wait staff.  Food very tasty.  Price reasonable for table of 4 $$$.  Try the sugar scrub in the bathroom. We will be back.

cKcimDZFVOB6qo0iOBiwHQ.text: I dined at this restaurant a month ago with a party of 10 for my friend's birthday dinner. We were served by an older gentlemen (never got his name) and he was absolutely amazing. He brought out the thick cuts of steaks to our table and gave us the whole presentation of how they are prepared and served. Me not being a meat eater and having no clue of the difference in cuts of meat and so forth was fascinated by the fact that he took the time to explain this information in detail to our table. My friends ended up ordering different cuts of rib eye, which they all loved. I ordered the portabello fries, mac and cheese, and cauliflower side dishes. Everything was delicious. This was my 5-star experience. I loved the service and food so much that I decided to come back the following night with my boyfriend and his mother. This, unfortunately, is where my experience went from 5 stars to 1. We were seated and introduced to our waiter (caucasian mid 30's looking, also didn't get his name). This waiter did not have a pleasant demeanor like the older gentlemen the night before had. No smile, no welcome, no warmth, he was very cold. He gave us our menus and never mentioned or brought out the presentation of steaks. I questioned him about the steak presentation when he took our orders, I informed him it was my boyfriend's and his mother's first time being there and I wanted them to see the different cuts of steak. He told us that since they both wanted different types of steaks and at different temperatures (medium rare and well done) there was really no point in bringing them out (those steaks are meant to be shared). Ok.. good point. However, I feel that it should've been offered as an option prior to taking their orders so they can decide if they wanted to order them or not. Anyways, they ended up ordering the filet tenderloin and double ranch rib eye (they were out of the rib eye cap). I ordered cauliflower side, mac and cheese and caesars salad. When the food came out, my boyfriend couldn't eat his rib eye because it was extremely tough. I couldn't eat the cauliflower dish because it was overly burnt. Did our waiter ever once come by the table after the food was brought to check on us? No, he did not. Not even one glance. My boyfriend placed his steak on the side of the table hoping to grab the waiter's attention. More than 5 minutes went by when finally Xavier, the assistant general manager addressed if there was a problem with my boyfriend's steak. My boyfriend told him that the steak was too tough to chew and wanted to order the tenderloin instead. Xavier apologized and graciously took his request and reordered him the tenderloin. When the waiter brought out the tenderloin, he told us that the other steak was probably too tough because it was medium rare and the fat didn't render. This information would've been great while we were ordering since none of us knew this. I also pointed out to the waiter that my cauliflower was burnt and he apologized and brought out a new unburnt dish. Round 2.. again, the waiter never checked on my boyfriend to see how he liked the tenderloin.  Good thing Xavier was there, he made sure my boyfriend was satisfied. Which he was, he said the tenderloin was very good. When it was time for dessert, the waiter came by and dropped off the dessert menu. He didn't put it in our hand, he didn't go over the different desserts, he simply set the menu on the table and walked away. WOW. When I read these bad reviews on Yelp about customer's getting terrible service, I bet you anything, it is this same waiter. Although his service was horrendous, I still tipped him over 20% because that's how I am. Who knows, maybe he was having a bad day, month, year? All I can say is that I can't believe I had 2 very opposite experiences at this restaurant. If it wasn't for the great hospitality and service of Xavier, our night would've been ruined. He is the reason I am giving this restaurant 3 stars instead of 2. There is no doubt that the food is delicious but a dining experience is not only about the food, but also the service which makes it an entire experience. Needless to say, I was embarrassed that I recommended this restaurant to my boyfriend and his mother, I said nothing but great things about this restaurant and set their expectations high. Unfortunately, we won't be dining here again.

O8dLyosPAoM9OiuQHhhysQ.text: I really like this place. A couple of friends and I came here for brunch on Sunday.   Upon entering the lobby area, the butcher shop was on the right, and the hostess and bar, to the left. I loved the modern-rustic decor and the ambiance of the place. We were seated upstairs in the loft. There are elevators to the right, if you do not want to take the stairs. There is also balcony seating, but a bit too windy for me, so inside was nice.   We had the Smoked Salmon Benedict, Blueberry Buttermilk Pancakes, the Waffle, and a side of the 1/2-inch Thick Grilled Bacon. Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted delicious! The only complaint would be the Bloody Mary; it was a bit too bland for me. They could probably spruce it up by adding a square piece of bacon with the olive. They are a butcher shop, after all. Anyway, service was very good and there was a "Brand Ambassador" walking around making sure guests were happy (I think that's code for General Manager). Overall, I recommend this place and look forward to coming back for dinner. I can't wait to try their steaks!

trd6EgBXwIrGBWDkXQCCdw.text: Echo and Rig started out as a 5 star for me, however they have not kept up with the same standards that they had originally started with in both aspects of service and quality. A dinner here will run you about 50pp with drinks and a few appetizers.   On multiple visits I have been served food that had been sitting out. I am not one to send something back but had to on my last visit because I could not stand paying good money for what I was being served. The server happily took it back and apologized after he touched the plate and realized that I was right.   Regardless.... The layout of the restaurant is stunning. When you enter the restaurant you are checked in downstairs where you will find their butcher shop, then walked up the stairs by a hostess where you will find an open kitchen and dining area with a gorgeous patio overlooking the tivoli fountains (Not much of a view, but they definitely worked with what they had).  Echo and Rig is a great spot to have a casual lunch with a friend, date night with that special someone, or celebrate a special occasion. I loved the concept that they had going and the different menu items that they tried to push, especially when it came to their smaller appetizer plates but if I had to spend 100+ on a meal I'd look for another spot.

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried spinach. Best salad here! Must order.

WvAkhGqmj5QBOMpC69-f4Q.text: I loved brunching here! The service was outstanding, the food was great, and the $16 unlimited mimosas were on point!

n2xdcTPsRw5iKhQqdRcbLA.text: Fabulous steaks. The best seasoning on a steak I've ever had. Cooked perfectly. Portobello fries are awesome. The service was of the highest standard. This is a must visit restaurant.

IRnOs7OQ-oTB4wZlKac-9g.text: Absolutely my favorite steakhouse off the Las Vegas Strip. Food is excellent. Service impeccable always and staff are well trained and incredibly hospitable. Spacious atmosphere.  Try the Tomohawks that are off menu, you'll never go vegetarian! Also, terrace seating is the way to go when it's not summer.

autzF1tApAXKelNJHhHwoA.text: We went to Echo and Rig for brunch on my friend Courtney's birthday. Honestly, I have never had better service in my life. Shout out to Adam and Jessie (#Jadam) for being the world's best servers. They were constantly wishing my friend happy birthday and hooked it up with ice cream for her too. The bottomless mimosas are to die for, especially with the variety of mixers (try the white cranberry juice, incredible).  Great prices considering the servings and service. Thank you again for the incredible experience!!

kTteyz1Ymm8tS-u1_5ejgw.text: Great brunch place In Tivoli Village. We made reservations on a Saturday morning thinking it'd be crazy busy but it wasn't. At least not at 10 am. We sat on the outdoor balcony which was very pleasant. Probably well known for their bottomless mimosas for just $16. Our server was not as pleasant as the water guy but she seemed to warm up a lot towards the end of our meal. We ordered the short rib hash  that had a good mix of Yukon potatoes, veggies and 2 poached eggs (very tasty but would have been good with a splash of sriracha), the farm fresh   breakfast (also with 2 located eggs and goat cheese)which was more flavorful than the hash, and the blueberry buttermilk pancakes which were great since they had blueberries cooked in the batter plus fresh blueberries on the side and even some dropped in the syrup as well. A big plus for me since i say the more blue berries the better! Price was very reasonable $9 - $15 average. I'd come back!

eKMnzFT91Uv6fkKKFxuUOg.text: Amazing food and even more amazing Staff. Allison was so professional and the sweetest hostess and Austin was one of the best servers I have ever had. Both managers came by to check on us.  Great service and great Team!  Will be back as much as possible!

oFH0hxE3TImCDfun4xcIYA.text: Spinach salad is a must! Prompt seating. Excellent service.  Seafood top notch.  Will visit again

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patio view

W-FbfUyL_pMooc0RRgb6Gw.text: YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(131/365) "The Unhappy Hour" Update for Reverse Happy Hour: What is advertised: Mon-Sat. 10 pm-1 am $1.99 Steak and Eggs $1.99 Shrimp Cocktail $1.00 Hot Dogs Free Cocktail for the ladies Free double upgrade on premium well drinks for the gentlemen $10 pitchers of beer Sometimes, you just want a little snacky-snack and not a heavy dinner especially this late at night. We happened to be in the area on TWO SEPARATE OCCASIONS... On our first attempt, we call in just to confirm that they are doing happy hour. The woman on the other line says yes, gives us a rundown of the days, hours, items, etc. Upon arrival, the hostess(maybe the same person we spoke to earlier) apologizes to us saying that there will be NO HAPPY HOUR because there was a "Back of the house brawl" type contest going on!?!? I was so ready to brawl with one of the sides of beef hanging in the butcher shop Rocky Balboa style!!! Did we not just speak to you over the phone? Or was it another airhead that we called where our conversation went in one ear and out the other? Time passes, and we decide to give it another go after a great evening(so far) this time, after waiting about 10 minutes one of the waiters drops off a dinner menu, and mentions that we can order anything off the dinner menu!?!? We try and get answers to what's going on, and I overhear him telling two other parties across from us(who also came for HH) that they are NOT serving the Happy Hour items. We express our disappointment that this is the second time we came here, and again we are denied? WTH??? The waiter AND bartender were supposedly going to check with the manager on duty to get some answers. Within that 18 minute span, the bartender whips up a complimentary ladies' cocktail for Wifey, and tries to get my drink order...TWICE and I politely tell him that I'd like to order some food first, because at this point, we still didn't have answers. We flagged the Hostess down and hoped that she could get us answers. She disappears upstairs TWICE for a few minutes, and upon her return, this is what she told us: (**The manager on duty never came down because he was "tied up" on a phone call-at 10:30 pm? Right...) "The cook who manages the Happy Hour Menu had an emergency and we are short staffed, HUH??? The Hostess also softly "but my manager said it would be okay to order the HH Hot Dogs." What's this? A pity party/consolation prize??? At this point, it was just ridiculous. So you mean to tell me that there is NO ONE on the line that can duplicate the Happy Hour items except for the cook who went home? Let's see...there's the Executive Chef, Sous Chef, and Lead Cooks in each station...Three smaller, easier items cannot be duplicated, but you are still able to cook anything off a bigger dinner menu? It just makes no sense. In every kitchen I've worked in, we served every item on the menu regardless if we were short staffed or not. I'm even gonna side with John Curtas and agree that the butcher shop is not the brightest thing in that spot right now. Why not do like your big brother Bottega Louie yelp.com/biz/bottega-lou... and put in a patisserie??? Not only is Bottega Louie making a daily killing from all their desserts and pastries, they are nearing almost 8000 reviews which makes them one of the most, if not THE MOST Yelped business! It definitely beats staring at carcasses and cuts of raw meat IMO... Let's hope you can get some consistency in your food and service, but for now, I'm VERY disappointed in you Echo & Rig...ALOHA!!! Shaka Meter: \uuu/ \uuu/ 2

C8jWlCMh9TiFVqRFu8r2wQ.text: The services were great. The price was right. The fish was very tasty. I wish the steak was a bit more tender. We will be back to try another cut of steak.
