v9-gi6FiE_gumX9lxIjxbA.text: This place is 20 mins off the strip which is good. The plaza it's located in is nice. There are upscale boutiques and shops. The restaurant itself was high end but not pretentious. In fact it had a chill vibe about it but also felt fancy af! The food and service were great!  Steaks, excellent. My teenage son loved his lasagna and also his crab cake appetizer. Highly recommend Echo & Rig when in Vegas.

9EcEAKw4Msb1Mp2PKLoc7w.text: I know This is late... but I want to say how amazing there food is and customer service. I took my husband for his birthday we both got the rib eye cap which was absolutely amazing. Our waiter was super attentive and even brought him out a desert for his birthday. I will definitely go back and had a amazing first time experience dining there, was well worth the drive from Boulder City. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye cap!

y-gQ3TfvZE2vo7pNtM-j_g.text: This has to be the best steakhouse in town! Jesse our waiter was so knowledgeable in helping us to decide which steaks to get. I had the Ribeye cap which was phenomenal and my husband had the 20 oz NY. Both cooked to perfection. The service was excellent! Thank you for making our Anniversary memorable! And thanks for the complimentary dessert, it was delicious as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ytd88Efi7A5NsQ2RAnjO3A.text: Best steakhouse for locals to enjoy in Las Vegas! The restaurant is absolutely beautiful and very romantic. The pricing is the best thing for what they're offering. The stakes are all delicious and the service is even better. If you want to take a date to this place to impress this is definitely the spot.

7uHJjubGXE5h8Jul1TSjKQ.text: I love this steakhouse for many reasons. Love the location.  Easy parking or valet parking also. The happy hour is 3-5pm.  Bartenders are great & we like to eat from starter menu.

43VAkJklSIyy6Bn2r1I_DA.text: I gave them one more try to celebrate Mother's Day and the service, yet again, was terrible. We were a party of 6 and there for brunch. The check was around $250 and the waiter ignoring us like the plague. My husband didn't get his second drink that he ordered and we had to flag him down to order literally anything. At a certain point I felt like he knew he wasn't going to get a good tip so he checked out completely. The restaurant wasn't even that busy so I'm not sure why he wasn't available. This restaurant has been very disappointing time and time again. There are hundreds of better restaurants you can go to where they will actually pay attention to you so don't waste your time here.

tEusyxlA_R8_7X2P_jrjyw.text: I ate here with my girlfriend two nights ago for the first time. In short, the service and food were fantastic. The waitress was attentive and knowledgeable (Beth, I believe, was her name), and the steaks/small plates were perfection.  We started with the tomato, watermelon, onion salad at the waitress's suggestion. It sounded strange, but the flavors paired so well together and was not in the least bit too filling to enjoy the rest of the meal. Ours included the garlic mash and the corn & marjoram. Both were great. My steak choice was the Bavette, which had a lot of marbling and flavor. It is up there with one of the best steaks I've ever had. My girlfriend chose the Filet Mignon that was also cooked to perfection, although I preferred mine over hers.   Our waitress and the rest of the staff kept up with just the right ratio of attentiveness and leaving us alone to enjoy the meal. Even though it was a cold and borderline rainy evening, we sat on the heated patio and it couldn't have been a more pleasant dining experience.  This is my new favorite steakhouse, hands down.

hj3qXZ6EOPpA_X1xqcdzMQ.text: Did somebody say brunch?!?!? I have been to echo & rig multiple times for their dinner service, but I recently visited for that meal between breakfast and lunch that all the "fancy adults" seem to enjoy so much. I figured it was about time that I try it out myself... and I was not disappointed!  We sat out on the patio around 10am, which was totally okay for the first hour because of the fans they have out there to help with the Vegas heat. Bottomless mimosas run about $18, while a single mimosa is $8. You are also provided with the option of OJ, grapefruit juice or white cranberry juice. I opted for grapefruit juice and of course tried out everyone else's for comparison- grapefruit juice won by far in my book! I also really enjoyed their cappuccinos! Perfection for a coffee lover like me.  We also enjoyed some yummy avocado toast and bacon to start. I highly recommend both.  My main dish was the short rib hash. SO GOOD, but I certainly could have split it with someone else because it was very heavy. And as though we hadn't had enough... we also opted for dessert. The menu provided the same options as dinner time. My favorite is still the berry short cake with ice cream!  Service during brunch seemed a little more hasty than it is at dinner as they wanted to make the most of space and time it seemed. But overall no big complaints. If there's anything I learned that day, it's that I need more brunch in my life!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

licWTfRGfRmEhjT-l0hAqw.text: This place is a jem. The price and steak quality is off the charts. I recommend this place to everyone looking for a great steak at a great price if your willing to drive off the stripe.

i-0DdhTSoYDylw_wZhMttQ.text: Great stop in Vegas! Great service that did not miss a detail and really laid out the carpet for each customer!

BGz_6IRIMMUcdrkZFUv-5w.text: Was invited here for our employee Christmas party.. We had 3 tables that seated 7 to 9 of us  The environment was amazing , we ate upstairs outside on the balcony.. it was so pretty and just right in comfort . Not to hot or not to cold . The heating lamp kept it cozy.. perfect lighting .   We had a family shared menus ..  that our employer picked .  so good beaded mushrooms , roasted carrots , bacon , salad , steak that Melts in your mouth , chicken,   salmon was amazing .. everything had a lot of flavor .  Omg !! The ice cream  The food was a five stars  The services made it even better 5 stars ..  they keep our glasses full of WINE we never had to ask .  cant wait to bring our family here .  Make sure you make reservation because they are busy., not required , but I recommend you do .   Enjoy !!!

kA2X_HufZZbKxJzmhUfaAA.text: This place is BOUUUGIE -- from its location in Tivoli Village, the decor inside, the furniture, the service, and best of all, the food. Came here for lunch with some friends on a Sunday. We had a reservation, so we didn't have to wait but I can definitely see long wait times otherwise.  I got the Farmers Market Breakfast ($13) and honestly thought it was okay -- a little too healthy for my mood that morning lol. For dessert, our table got the Berry Shortcake and the Caramel Turtle -- both very yummy!   Although I didn't enjoy my entree as much, I did see and taste the other dishes my friends got, so I would definitely come back here for brunch and get something else.   The customer service was excellent, even on a busy Sunday brunch. I'll be back for the other dishes and the bottomless mimosas!

O7KxREwtTgB-s8MZzh4j5g.text: We LOVE a good steak, in a modern steakhouse, but absent that stuffy (pretentious), steak house environment.  And we also love being ULTRA comfy & casual (shorts & slippers, Braddah!), especially when dining last minute on a quickie (less than 24 hours) RT drive to Vegas...that's why I'm glad to have found Echo & Rig.  Saturday night before Mother's Day, late (9p-ish), no reservations, we walk in in shorts & slippers (& yes we felt somewhat under-dressed compared to other patrons but we were too tired and hungry to care). After a 5 minute wait we were seated upstairs outside on the patio - it was perfect.    Based on the reviews & possible limited availability, I just had to try the rib-eye cap steak (smaller than I expected but so flavorful & juicy - it was truly the perfect size as I finished it off!), and we shared the Mac n cheese, the baked sweet potato, and the creamy mashed potatoes (yes, we LOVE our carbs - don't judge!!) - all were deliciously tasty and comparable to those at other fine steak houses.  Hubs ordered the short rib grilled cheese - it was bursting with cheese and generous with the flavorful short ribs & he enjoyed it.  Although we were stuffed and had our sides packed, our server convinced us to try to Caramel Turtle desert (it didn't take much convincing since we love our sweets too!) - it did not disappoint! We enjoyed every. last. bite.  Our servers and service were great, the Manager stopped to check on us, they kept our glasses filled, everything including the bathrooms were clean, and the bill wasn't bad either - I'm absolutely lovin Echo & Rig - we will definitely be back again!

V4lL5qDlHtA7OemfzyWeyA.text: Service is top notch. We celebrated a birthday here and they made it extra special. The waiter was helpful, showing different cuts of meats and even brought us a special dish while we waited for our meal. They have a nice outside patio you can sit on as well. Food was quick and inexpensive with large side dishes. My only gripe was I wish they served the bread warm. But I can deal with it for the great service and delicious food. I will definitely return and recommend.

ilTJ-_a_d4_Tna3gw32QvQ.text: Because I sht you not(excuse my french), the service is 10 out of 5 and the food's really good. Make sure to find Ari as your server because he is exceptional. Definitely coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

78vGQTfr7bsF5HvfHis9eQ.text: My boyfriend and I went to Echo and Rig for his birthday dinner on Aug.25. The hostess was gracious, Nicholas the manager was wonderful, and our servers Hugo and Juan were the BEST! We ordered many of the small plates..potato gnocchi with mint pesto pea sauce was delicious..brie in sourdough very good..pork belly burnt-ends to die for..and if you've never had chicken "oysters", try these because the maple jalapeno glaze is superb. We also had the short rib grilled cheese sandwich..my stomach is still smiling! He had a toffee, chocolate sundae(?) for dessert, and as full as we were, that too was polished off the plate. Beautiful atmosphere, attentive service, and some of the best food around!!! I suggest the outside seating in cooler weather, but inside is just fine..try it, you'll like it!

O70pNdye40vzRpPnl60AUg.text: My new favorite off strip local steak place!  Unfortunately I can only give a limited review after only one visit.  There are a large variety of starter dishes served like tapas ranging from $5 to $10.  I ordered the bacon, pork belly and octopus.  All good but the pork belly over grits was amazing.  The menu lists a variety of non traditioinal steak house cuts such as tri-tip, hanger, flat iron, skirt, etc all at very affordable prices $20-$30.  I was excited to try one of these thinking how wonderful it would be to find a cheaper cut that is well prepared.  Then they tricked me by bringing by a tray of special cuts.  The tomahawk chop was a giant 45 ounce rib-eye with perfect marbling.  I caved and ordered this to share.  This steak was almost 3 inches thick after grilling which is a challenge to cook if you want anything rarer than med-rare.  It was done perfectly and seasoned very lightly.  Meat taste and quality was very good. I appricate the light seasoning as the quality of meat should stand on it's own...add your favorite sauces after the fact. My only slight complaint is that the chips and stuff mushroom side that comes with every steak was rather unimpressive next to the rest of the food.  So in the end, food was great and I'm not done sampling from their awesome menu. I spent way more than I could have but I was able to make steak and eggs the next 2 days and my dog was happy there was a bone left over as well.  Oh...other details, party of 2. Walked in on a Friday night at 6pm. 10 min wait.  Great service. Casual to dressy environment. Not the quietest place for romantic dinner.  It's a steak place...everyone was happily consuming drinks and beef!

UUc23DPH3H0J0pPx18RAug.text: Had dinner at Echo & Rig last night and I have to say it was a lovely experience.  The staff was very friendly, knowledgeable and attentive.  Atmosphere was classy without being pretentious.  It was busy but not overcrowded.  All of that was great but the real show stopper was the food!  I had the Spencer steak with a side of the Black Tuscan Kale.  I'm generally picky about my steaks.  I want them to be flavorful and tender but I hate big chunks of fat.  This steak was PERFECT!  It was juicy, tender and delicious (no easy task considering I ordered it well done).  It came with a stuffed mushroom on the side that was very tasty and some chips that were done just right.  My side of kale was very good as well although I was too full to eat much of it.  Overall it was a great meal and I can't wait to go back.

3F9ZQgApsa6thjp9gDfz6A.text: We went there for dinner a few months ago and had the worst service, but the food was really good.  My husband and I agreed that we would try this place again this time in the bar for happy hour! Already from the start it was five stars for price and quality of the happy hour items and drink! $1.99 steak and egg and shrimp cocktail & $1 hot dog.  For ladies, we enjoy the drink of the day for free- today it was tequila sunrise! We decided to try a few other things on the menu we were adventurous and tried the sweetbread nugget.  This didn't sound appetizing when the bartender explained what it was- but once in your mouth it was absolutely divine! Next we tried the bone marrow carne asada- bone marrow was good, tasty, fatty, with carne asada and onions on top with three toasts.  I would have preferred to have more carne asada. Finally we tried all the happy hour items and you can't go wrong with those prices! All were delicious! Our server in the bar was awesome too! He made the experience even better and that's why I gave the full 5 stars! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t go wrong with a $1 hot dog!
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweetbread nugget- hesitant to try it at first, but ended up wanting more!
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone Marrow Carne Asada- try it at least once!

2yzW0oPQYHV0QzWBKsbD5A.text: This was an amazing culinary experience.  I do recommend to everyone to enjoy the great food and amazing desserts.  But i do have some constructive criticism.  I only have 4 complaints.  The ambiance was incredible but i could barely hear my waiter.  I got the duck duck goose mixed cocktail.  Amazing and refreshing but i got to different looking drinks... a little inconsistent.  I also witnessed a waiter cursing at other staff members.  A little inappropriate with costumers all around and finally, im not trying to nit pick but i had sparkling water and my wife had still.  Without asking a helping waiter poured still water into my half full glass.  My wife and I will certainly return but hope we can have that flawless night that others have mentioned before us previously.

J02qVsr_h409aiVvBG9L6Q.text: Super love this place. Pork belly, Portobello fries, and the Spencer steak. Best aged steak at this reasonable prices! Came here 2 days in a row, just love it

KnfR7xN15XW3ozH3aZRyEQ.text: I don't understand why other people's reviews before the one I'm about to write had so many legitimate complaints, but still gave this place 4stars (too generous).  We went there for dinner a few nights ago and thought the service was a bit disjointed and the steaks were so so.  Service got off to a very slow start. After they finally brought over some bread, they forgot the butter/oil & vinegar.  By the time they came back with the butter we then needed more bread.  I had the spencer steak which was cooked okay but not very tasty.  Place has potential, but also has some kinks to get worked out.

80utISS7191JQ3OSbhFOsw.text: So impressed with this place- great service every time and one of the few places where literally everything on the menu is great. Best to go with a large group and order everything family style!

HGX2eEIFu5sFsO_O_Lf-Cg.text: First time visit this week and we think we have found a keeper. Diverse menu with some unique dishes. Horseradish crusted butterfish was great as were the vegetable and spinach salads. Approachable prices and we look forward to trying more of the menu soon. Wine prices were reasonable as well.

eEwLZDudH_JFqS0IbgkTYQ.text: Beyond amazing and delicious. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were very friendly and funny. The food was absolutely fantastic. The pork belly with grits was killer and the calamari was great too. Having a butcher shop inside a restaurant is such a cool idea and their cuts of meat are incredible. My father ordered a strip and it was the best steak I had tasted in a long time. Can't rave more about this place and would recommend it to anyone. Will definitely be going back soon!

XRAKt21gKc19ynmzIvc5Sg.text: Well I finally tried eating here.  Fantastic steak, unique side dishes and a very good simple wine selection.  Very reasonable prices too.  No reservations here so be patient for dinner - gets crowded.  Try the portobello fries or the grilled octopus side dish - fantastic.

6tK7P2OxW5iUt9zkSAX5YQ.text: The service was excellent!! Rib eye was the best and the sides and appetizers were yummiest!  The only sides we didn't like was "burnt peas". They should remove it from the menu. We tried it and it tasted bad but other than that the waiter was very nice to ask us how it was and we told him, it's tastes bad and we didn't like it. So he asked us what we wanted to replace it with... we said "heirloom  carrots!"   The rest was history.  For the price you pay it was very reasonable.   We would definitely come back to Summerlan!

kT9PotiBUglymChq7Eyy1w.text: This place has been mentioned quit a bit in the food scene in summerlin, maybe because of low menu prices. You get what you pay for. The room has a real cold feel to it almost like a high end cafeteria. Service is a little sub par both times we were in. The food was average at best and that's being nice. So much better quality around town. And if you want a great butcher shop check out the butcher block.

P5X5rA6p8FQrPOMhDrNTyA.text: Sam the server and Beth the manager are so welcoming and have such great personalities! Not to mention the chefs did an AMAZING JOB!! Love this place !!

34UIjWSOl-nyPtRiR38otA.text: Seriously impressed. Superior quality, ingenuity,  and service. I will go there again and again and take anyone who comes into town.

YK0RW5mZ-c6hC1nWrHwdlw.text: I'm incredibly impressed with the exquisite caliber of food at E&R and at the prices, it's unbelievable. Amazing cuts of meat with incredible flavor and fantastic sides/small plates though I have yet to try the brussel sprouts... They run out quick!  Great list of draft beers (and pitchers!) and wines also incredibly reasonably priced. This is a great spot for business or pleasure meals. Love!

xZ57dMVhH1rGGVyLMzVDXw.text: This is definitely one of my new favorite places. Everything about our dinner was wonderful from the service to the meat quality and and selection. The preparation of everything was perfect! Definitely try one of the larger cuts to share , the cauliflower, Brussels sprouts, and portobello fries. Now I don't feel like I need to go to the strip for a good steak dinner anymore! I like this place better than STK, honestly.

umtljUSz7MF1pDjchdbp3g.text: Went on a Sunday night.  Heard about them from many people, so I figured I must give them a try.  It was great.  Service, food and ambiance all top notch.  Meats all organic, lots of veggie dishes for vegitarians.  This place has it all.  Ask for Ramon he will guide you all the way through if you need help deciding on what to get.  There are so many choices.  I will be going here alot.  Even the Manager was fantastic.  Thanks guys:)

z6ZV5lNgI5WGmTB-64IXgg.text: Was here a few weeks ago and had an exceptional time so we went again.  Arrived kinda late (10PM) and the hostess was very warm and welcoming.    Unfortunately the service beyond getting sat was the main issue throughout the meal.  The server would leave the table for extended periods of time and we had to flag him down  for beverage orders.  Were told they ran out of Bread... so no bread service.  Clearing for each course took a long time.    The entree arrived and they forgot our cheddar mashed potatoes!  Then told by the waiter it was the food runners fault for not communicating to us they were out of that as well..?  The server seemed kinda rushed to leave for the evening and it was apparent during service.  He did buy us a glass of wine that he said repeatedly he paid for by himself for the inconvenience...unfortunately it wasn't the wine that i ordered....  The manager touched the 3 tables except ours in the restaurant.  Mgmt Feedback:  Always attack issues with the tables and deal with the problem head on.  Don't avoid addressing issues in the dining room.  The 3 Stars goes to the hostess and the food at echo and rig which is OUTSTANDING!   We want to go back but I am afraid of the inconsistencies in service.

KZN3v9ZI4Z3hkz_WQmEkgg.text: Went here for Sunday brunch and sat at the bar.  Ordered Short Rib Hash and we were not impressed.  Had 4 tiny pieces of short rib that we counted.  Service from our waitress was horrible.  She never check on us after we received our food.  We had to flag down another worker to try and order more food.  First time and probably last.

FvtAQKZuEr4X6-27Hj6Y6A.text: I love this place! The balcony outside is the perfect place to sit for brunch! The pretty view of Tivoli's entrance fountain and their service add to the overall ambience experience. Their Farmer's Market poached eggs with grilled veggies was an amazing meal. I can't wait to come here again!!!!!

qxB81wrUtsMkzoni6KJJZQ.text: One of my favourite places to eat! We went there twice in one week for lunch and both times it was great.   The first time we went our server was Nanc (Nancy?). She gave us one of the most detailed rundowns of the menu I have ever had. She was very knowledgeable about every dish we asked her about. It was very hot out that day, and being from a cooler climate, we opted to sit on the patio. So she had other servers come check on us through out the meal. When we went back a couple of days later she came out to talk to us again. Also, their managers and other staff are very friendly and attentive. Any server that came would bring more water or ice if needed, as opposed to a lot of other restaurants where only your server will do anything for your table.   As for their food it was also great. We had the portobello fries- they weren't greasy and had nice flavour. We had the flat iron, grilled cheese, and roasted chicken sandwich. I would recommend all of them. Portion sizes are perfect. You can choose a side salad or chips as a side for the sandwiches. Prices are very reasonable for what you get!   The bathrooms are quite nice. At the sink they have a scrub that has some oil in it (I think) so it is very moisturizing. It's sold in their store downstairs and is quite pricey, but might be worth it since it smells great and seems to work well.  It's one of the few restaurants where there are so many good options that it's hard to decide what to order. I can't wait to return!

xnRzvap3B0VH02BY_gVyRQ.text: Good but not great... our waitress had a bad cough and took away from the environment.

kP84O6L0GzAJNDSwLiTgDQ.text: Love their bone-in ribeye! this is a new American restaurant has a huge menu to choose from.  Great for family with kids, my kids love their appetizers, they enjoy order food from regular menu instead of kids menu. we always come here for brunch, ask for secret chef menu that only the regulars know:)

JU0ocljWTB_WBjcunvGfaA.text: I love echo and rig! My favorite restaurant! I try and come here at least every two months. Reasonably priced and so many yummy sides. I also love the sauces they have for the steak "brandied mushroom" is a must try! Also try the roasted corn, it is my absolute favorite side!

X2qcVQdh6GbQwGKcRRTnPQ.text: Took my husband there for his birthday. It was on a busy Saturday and we hadn't made reservations but they said we could eat at the bar. They have an awesome happy hour from 4-6 and the bar was crowded. But at 6 it cleared out. We had dinner at the bar and enjoyed the USC game.  The food  absolutely amazing. I had the ribeye and I can't remember what my husbands cut was called. The steaks came with a stuffed mushroom and house chips. Both were amazing!!! The steak also comes with your choice of sauce and they were amazing too!!! We also ordered mashed potatoes and mac& cheese. The potatoes were to die for and you can't go wrong with the Mac and cheese. We ate it all and loved every bite. We could have done without the extra sides and been full but the sides were amazing! It was a treat so we went all out!!!!   It's also in a beautiful location. Away from the strip where you can still get free parking and we didn't have to walk through a casino to get there.  Can't wait to go back!!!!

bZ5yKxVYKnlE4jfmdUBwPA.text: Ok... this place was fantastic. Not only was it reasonably priced (because we're Vegas-ing on a budget) but the food was fantastic and the service was even better. We did the bottomless mimosas and never managed to get to the bottom because they were so on it. And the staff was amazing. So genuinely happy and on their game. I'm gonna give a quick shoutout to Rae. You're the best!

Emff1IFUmi04GvRIFYQwyQ.text: After seated on the patio we weren't quite sure who our server. A man in a suit came by a couple times but didn't introduce himself as our server so we were alittle confused. He ended up taking our order and gave us a tiny wine tasting so we could figure out what bottle we wanted.  After a good 20 minutes our server finally came by. I think he was the only server on the patio cause he was backed up beyond belief, even other tables were complaining. The guy that ended up taking care of us, Alpheus (coolest name ever, like a Greek god) was outstanding. Some if the best customer service we've ever had. Even the hostess Arianna was great (which is always an awesome surprise haha)   Food was outstanding! We had; Lamb Cigars- tzatziki sauce was refreshing and very light Pork Belly- fell apart in your mouth, full flavor Thick Cut Bacon with homemade BBQ- HIGHLY RECOMMEND  Cauliflower- light appetizer but bursting with spice! Brussel Sprouts with Pistachios- light and subtle flavor with alittle crunch Skirt Steak- Carmelized with brown sugar, very juicy and full flavor Bavette Steak- popular European steak, similar to a rib cap cut. Not as tender as a rib cap but full of flavor  Wash everything down with a bottle of Malbec! Yum!!

Zrf9KkmJS5pXF5MBbJXDOg.text: This place is the bomb! I was shocked because the prices were so reasonable for the atmosphere, ambience and the quality of the food and preparation. The food is outstanding. The staff is so personable and professional. Chefs are great!

-DQaAJBenmT-R2NXSaLQag.text: This is hands down the best food I've had in a long while. Had the Brussel Sprouts, Cauliflower, Tomahawk steak...all as amazing as the service!

7j7R61FRKLRF8e3FZoHmwA.text: I've eaten at Echo & Rig a couple times and it is pretty good, but I'd say overrated.  That said, Ive been going to the butcher shop for about a year to get bone broth and am consistently frustrated by the service. If they weren't the only place I could get the stuff I would've stopped going a long time ago. Most of the guys are usually extremely nice (hence the 3 stars), which is wonderful, but they have no sense of urgency and are painfully slow in completing every task. Every time I go there I call ahead and ask them to set aside my items, so I should be able to run and run out. I'm not there for a leisurely brunch, it is a simple errand I generally run while out trying to get to other appointments or errands. However, I inevitably end up waiting for 10-20 minutes for them to even get to me, even though there are very few customers at the butcher shop and always at least 2 employees.  I went recently and the butcher was helping another customer. I watched while the butcher pulled some items out of the cooler at a glacial pace, carefully cut individual pieces of paper, lined the paper up on the counter, laid the meat neatly in the paper, wrapped the meat with the precision of an origami master, taped the package, tied it with a string, found a marker, and wrote on the package. Then he started on the second package, which involved some kind of bacon resembling meat and he has to brush individual piece which some tool, then trim each piece, before stacking it in a basket weave pattern in the butcher paper. If anyone has seen Love Actually I felt like I was watching the scene where Mr. Bean is gift wrapping the necklace - just get on with it already! Then the butcher asked the customer what else he needed and the customer named about 6 more things and I knew Id probably be able to sit down for meal before I could get my broth I called ahead for that was just sitting in a jar in the cooler.   I was eventually able to catch the butcher's attention, told him what I needed, and asked him to just grab my broth when he went into the cooler for the next items. I showed him I had my money (exact change) ready, told him I didn't even need a bag or to be cashed out. He responded "well I guess they (the other customers) probably won't mind". Yeah, I'm sure they won't since it literally will not take one minute longer for you to just grab my stuff I called ahead for.  Don't get me wrong, I understand that if someone else is there first I have to wait. But you could at least move with a sense of urgency and act like you care that someone is waiting. Additionally, I do appreciate that they're offering something different than your grocery store butcher and I appreciate the care they put into what they do. However, if the service they provide is going to take 10+ minutes to help every customer, they should balance that with something else that would allow them to accommodate customers who can be helped in just a few minutes. The least they could do is have another employee (like the other kid behind the butcher counter) check in with me and see if he could help me. I know he may not be equipped to handle all orders, but he could've retrieved by jars of broth and cashed me out.

AZMP9x9XnZyZHCFZ9M2vcg.text: The hosts near the bar were very terrible! We came in around 7:45 with a table reservation. The young lady told us she's going to check us in and we can wait at the bar. She approached us more than three times just to say "were about to check you in" and it totally pissed us off cause it's too obvious that they messed up the reservation. Finally At 8:30 we finally got our table. So yeah, bad experience for us. But hey! The food was really awesome!

Xoi7ksNBm4IE1WFFjgKGNQ.text: I carelessly throw around the "L-word" & this review will not be spared its usage.   Echo & Rig was recommended by a family member who clearly knows great food & with confidance, I can now also vouch for E&R's deliciousness.   I love love love that there are over 30 "small plates" on the menu. Grazing is my eating style, & if i weren't hell-bent on having filet, I would've ordered more than the superb portobello mushroom fries & herb aioli. Tried a bite from his stack of thick-cut bacon w/ BBQ sauce -- smokey, fatty, more like baked ham than bacon.   Love love that you get a (free!) sauce with your steak. His "charred onion" paired beautifully with his rib-eye cap, & my horseradish cream pick elevated an already lovely filet. Say yes to their garlic mashed potatoes.   And finally, love that our service issue was immediately & professionally addressed. My filet arrived medium after we'd waited 40-minutes for our steaks. They whisked it away with sincere apologies, & the filet was returned well done as I had ordered. Desserts & coffee (as if we could eat anymore!) were comped for our troubles (carmel turtle sundae is a must.)   Room for improvement: though I love (lust) that they pour ketel one, my cocktail, A Love Affair, delivered zero buzz, & tasted like a weak lemonade.   Provided they don't make a habit of making customers endure excessive wait times for their steaks, E&R's extensive menu deserves a second look the next time we're in charming Tivoli Village.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. thick-cut bacon w/ BBQ sauce
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello mushroom fries

L9pnIO5HiMb420v1RGkzlg.text: Wow! We went to this restaurant on a friends recommendation. We were not disappointed. The service was stellar. The staff treated us like VIP's. The food was delicious. The waiter, Lucas, had several recommendations. All of them turned out to be better then we had hoped for. My husband and I both had steaks. They were flavorful and tender. The best we have had in a  long time. The sides were all wonderful. We can't wait to go back and try something else. We already have our selections for next time! I highly recommend Echo and Rig. Best service and dining experience we have had in Vegas.

f8f3zqt6qZ6xgetMFtBzFQ.text: WOW...I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! The Spencer Rib-eye with brandied mushroom sauce made me "DO THE HAPPY DANCE!" The Appetizers were very tasty and reasonably priced. By the way, their desserts are insanely good!! Echo & Rig has a beautiful view and the staff is totally dedicated to their guests. You just couldn't ask for more. They're a great place to visit. Simple yet refined. One of my all-time favorites in Viva Las Vegas!! Stop by and say hello. I think you'll really enjoy the experience!!! :))

mSRPPRo9hPTnwqgPhKREiw.text: Went here for our 5th wedding anniversary and had the absolute best experience. Our server was hilarious and very helpful. Accommodated my special requests without any issue. The food was amazing! The Spencer steak was cooked perfectly and the mac and cheese was so good. We also ordered the grilled bacon, do not skip this if you like bacon! It was delicious. Love this place and will be back. Perfect place for a date night.

LY4ryfcp8YHt1NIb8LSl_w.text: I asked for a medium rare New York strip. I got a cold, raw strip. No problem, I sent it back, and again I requested medium rare. It came back raw again. They have a beautiful selection of fine-quality cuts, but one of the brunch cooks cannot grill a steak to save their life.

Vrd49aPr3H5ZNF4Qm-FzVg.text: Cool steakhouse with a lot of options. Everything tasted great and our service was exceptional. I'll be back when I'm in Vegas again and recommend them if you haven't tried them out yet.

PQIEkzkofQCMkuoKz7Q-Bw.text: Location - nice good shops good atmosphere Service - excellent, manager, Xavier very attentive- greeting every customer with a warm welcome and a handshake. Even a thank you and handshake as you leave. It's the small things that count and make me happy that there are good, courteous, people left in this world. Nicholas, was equally attentive. Food- oh my the food was so good! We had portabello fries (must do), pork belly and spicy slaw (perfectly cooked, seared off the fat as it should be, slaw was a nice accompaniment although not Spicy); Brussel sprouts so so so good and steak sauces you can't go wrong. Ribeye cap and spencer cut for out steak choices. Must go-

BNzMKWvJKgb_4eHLO81NzA.text: Came here on the recommendation of a friend and I wasn't disappointed. The steak was excellent and the price was very reasonable. I'm used to paying about 40% more for that quality cut. I ordered 2 sides not realizing that each side feeds 2. The only thing I didn't care for were the fresh garlic chips which I found too salty. The service was excellent. It was nice to sit outside and enjoy the open air instead of being in a dark room. I think this is the first time I've been in a high end steakhouse and actually been able to see that my steak was cooked to my liking. If I ever pass through Vegas again, I would definitely dine at Echo and Rig again.

9fmEZ4ulcxazubDwFsYMKA.text: Mixed bag. Appetizers mostly wonderful, entrees inconsistent. Came here with locals who are both familiar and affectionate toward E. & R. and even they were underwhelmed and disappointed with our dinner.  It's a comfortable place, to be sure. Inside is a bit more sedate, but still has a pulse. Outdoors, on the 2d Floor patio, is refreshing and luxurious - and also considerably louder with the music pumping. Our server was a pro: He offered guidance and encouraged ordering all at once to avoid interruptions to us. I can appreciate how that can help the flow for the kitchen and everyone, really, but it seem slightly disingenuous. Our party was catching up and a few beats behind that sort of pace: we needed a moment. The only other thing that felt a bit awkward is how much the appetizers were over-ordered. The irony is, I think the appetizers were the most interesting dishes we were served. I just think we had twice what we needed.  The portobello fries are wonderful. I wasn't crazy about the accompanying sauce, Herb Aioli, mostly because it didn't improve an already clear winner. We had several pair of oysters, too, and those were lovely and fresh. We also got the fried calamari which looked good, if almost too typical for a place that seems to thrive on invention. (Sorry, but I skipped it) There was a spicy cauliflower dish (Cauliflower, Chili de Arbol, Crispy Shallots & Onions) that I liked, not too spicy. I believe the sauteed jalapeno peppers came with the avocado toast, but don't quote me. We had an eruption of apps, and I did my best to keep it all straight. (I loved the jalapenos, by the way). The avocado toast -- not so much. I tasted mostly lemon and left it alone after one bite. There may have been one other appetizer (with octopus?), but I didn't try it. With so many apps (some double ordered), I was pretty much thinking that we got a tremendous amount of appetizers - with little regard for entrees, let alone dessert.  I love a great steakhouse, and I think that's what's going on here - but, honestly, maybe it was an off night. A New York Strip Steak didn't taste right and was sent back. I had the lamb chops  (Colorado Lamb Porterhouse Chops, Peewee potatoes, dried apricots & violet mustard) which is not the typical cut I'm familiar with. The chops were seasoned very nicely, I thought they were just OK. The meat was tough, at times. And my requested medium-rare came out mooing (or rather baa-ing) at super rare.  We did have some positives in the Entree department. The butterfish (Horseradish Crusted Butterfish Roasted, root vegetables & tarragon pinot sauce) was received very warmly; it remains a big hit. The grass-fed cheeseburger also got high marks. Fries are extra (and at first they did forget the fries). Otherwise, the burger comes standard with what seem to be homemade potato chips: good, simple, not too greasy. The one meat entree that got high marks at our table was the Jumping Beef (Filet mignon tips, roasted tomatoes, red onions, crispy potatoes & Peruvian demi-glace). The Peruvian demi-glace does have a kick, but that will only make you enjoy each bite more slowly.   Some memorable sides and veggie plates include: Black Tuscan Kale (we boxed the remainder and made a tasty scramble the next day); The Roasted Garlic Mashed Potatoes & White Cheddar is another well-seasoned winner.   I passed on dessert, but those who partook in the berry shortcake liked it a lot..  A nice surprise about Echo & Rig is that the corkage fee here is zero.   So, there's obviously a lot going on here. Some of the food we had was great; some of it really wasn't. I'm not so sure our local hosts are as eager to return, but there you go. And again, it may have been an off-night for Echo & Rig. We had our challenges just sitting still, ourselves, so I'm sure that didn't help, either. However, I would like to try them again. They have Brunch; they have a nice looking bar with tasting sounding cocktails. It's a lovely looking place with generally excellent service. (Music on the patio got turned up too loud at one point, but they were unable to turn it down.)

AB_pw9uRsOFwR-nhr_Jx6Q.text: Celebrated my best friend's birthday here last night and tried this place for the first time. If you know me, I got right on yelp before dinner to see what's good and what ppl suggested to try. Well you did good ppl! The food was...... AMAZING! And the prices weren't as high as I was expecting at all. We started out with the Pork Belly Burnt Ends. HOLY SH** BALLZ that was delicious! I just wish the serving was bigger because I would have tore the whole thing up! We also tried the Portobello Fries & Her Aioli. ADDICTING AS HELL! Some of us ended up ordering more.   For dinner I suggested to the hubby to try the Rib-Eye (seeing how it was Yelps favorite), and I ordered the Hanger. The Hanger was good but honey's Rib Eye? OMG! I was mad at myself that I didn't order it! It was so moist and mouth watering good! We shared the delicious Mac and cheese, baked sweet potato and corn. Just when we thought we didn't order enough, we thought wrong. Good was so delicious and well worth every penny. Staff and service was top notch and on it!! So on it , we were laughing because every time I took a drink of my water, they were right there to top it off. I don't think my glass ever got half way lol   We'll definitely be coming back again with family and friends.

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanger, stuffed mushroom and potato chips

4-EFx4p2bQUV3WZUY6qmrA.text: My group of 7 came here for dinner, my bf and I celebrated our 10 years together. Their customer service was phenomenal. Our server was Chuck, he was very friendly and informative. He showed us all the cuts. We ordered 2- 38oz tomahawk steaks, Mac and cheese, 2 portobello fries, 2 fried calamari, and 2 Maryland crab cakes. All the food was amazing!! On another note, they have a life changing sugar scrub in the bathroom. If anyone knows what brand it is- please let me know lol!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VhMlVVh9Ua4hgk5HY3sasA.text: Great food...Great service... Great prices AND NO CORKAGE FEES! Have been there for several large birthday parties and was a blast everytime. I'll be back.

-QTn4FvcEBgMhlfdkF2fIw.text: A steak house with old world charm and it's far from the strip, I'm there.   Yes, it's about a 30 minute drive to get here from your hotel, but it is definitely worth the time. Trust me.   First off, the location is like a small European city. Nice shops and restaurants. A good place to explore.   The service was great from Shane. Omar refilled our drinks like a ninja (awesome guy) and Nick the manager was constantly checking on us. In other words, we were taken cared of.   The food FANTASTIC!! Here's the rundown: Oysters - we got 3 types. All were good, but the Washington (smaller oysters) were the best. The condiments (vinegar, hot sauce & cocktail sauce) elevated those oyster. Yum!  Caesar Salad - this is what a Caesar salad should be. Wow! My wife and I were splitting everything and they halved the dish and served it on 2 plates. Did I mention great service.   Grilled Octopus - DELICIOUS!! First off the Octopus was grilled to perfection. Smoky grill taste and super tender. The celery top worked well with the vinaigrette dressing. The beans and olives were sublime. A perfect dish. Get this one.   Ribeye Cap - the menu said it's the best part of the ribeye. You know what, they are right. I prefer medium rare, but Shane (our waiter) recommended to cook it "medium" take his advice. The steak was perfect. Tender and had that smoky aroma & taste. One of the best steak I've had.  Since we were sharing, they pre cut the steak into perfect serving sizes. Yes!! It's only 8 ounces, but it was just right IMO.   Price was very reasonable. Specially for the steak. When the steak is cheaper than the oyster, (and the steak was great) it's a great value in my book.   Parking was not an issue, it's plentiful. If it's your first time, watch for those big number signs they have. Look at the address (Echo & Rig is 440) look for that number and park in that area so you're close to the location. You'll know what I'm saying when you see them.    Yes, this is only my 3rd review (2019), because in my attempt to being more positive, I've decided to only write 5 star reviews.  And ladies and gentlemen, this place is one in my book. So, What are you waiting for? Lol  Try them out for yourself and decide =)  Review #3 -2019

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye Cap. One of the best steak I&#39;ve had. (5 Stars)
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Octopus. Delicious and tender. Get this one. (5 Stars)
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters (Washington, Kumiai &amp; Soho) the smaller once were yum!! (4 Stars)

n_O0dWV9XDY_ccTJVl_vWw.text: Not one bad thing. They even gave me their best dessert as my comp birthday treat. Salted Caramel, brittle ice cream sundae. That got the 5th star. No wait. It was the heaven smelling salt exfoliating scrub, beautiful ambiance in Tivoli, hanging butcher shop as you enter and the super accommodating service that earned the 5 stars. I have been to ALL the fancy French monikered steakhouses on the strip and this will rival them all. You dont fight the tourists for a table, no crowds and the prices are 20% less than the big casino steakhouses.   We got a reservation for our Party of four Saturday 7:45 seating same day. It was crowded and lively but not psycho over crowding and tons of noise.   Ordered:  Carnage-Tomahawk ribeye, pork chop. Both made to perfection  Sides-Corn, chicken fried oysters, asparagus with fried egg, Brussels sprouts, Mac-n-cheese, garlic mashed potatoes  I would probably pass on the asparagus fried egg as it's just that simple. With some flakes of Parmesan cheese. Nothing exciting.   Loved the mushrooms that accompanied the tomahawk. So rich and soft. The house made potato chips disappeared so fast I didnt get a second chip. But the one single chip I had was crispy and tasty.   Can't wait to come back and the 14 other sides that we didn't order.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomohawk Ribeye. Soo scrumptious. Took 4 of us to eat it

x6sVrzPDVIi3eJQcEki9kA.text: Ate here a couple years ago. I still think about it. The food was delicious the drinks were delicious the dessert was delicious the whole experience was delicious. That excerpt probably needed some commas. But my talk to text doesn't seem to do that. Regardless. Echo and rig is a super fine establishment.! It can do that! But no commas.

Sp_fe8-AUvtMBUCUWXvsLQ.text: MEAT.......MEAT.........MEAT......!!!!!!!   I saw a segment on the morning show either The More or Fox 5, and thought I'd stop by.   Well, that was two years ago and I'm at least a regular customer. I get my bacon on Fridays during the NFL season for my large Sunday morning breakfast. The BEST bacon. You'll never ever buy from any grocery store including Whole Foods again. Buy the bacon here....they will trim it to your liking.   Great steaks, burgers and the smoked chicken is out of the world.   Everything is priced affordably.   Customer service.....FIVE Stars and more. Not fake, real.   Thank you!!!

0YmXI17Xb3-xOhFwMmgL6Q.text: Awesome food, drinks, and service. Great selection of wine. We had the Mac and cheese, shrimp cocktail, mashed potatoes, oysters, and a tomahawk steak. Everyone was fantastic - including our server Augustine.

l6L3GX5_jTLHNa1MWTtLyw.text: Been meaning to post a review about this place... went there on a Sunday while brunch was ending... we wanted tomahawk steaks... they told us first we would have to wait till 4 when dinner starts ( it was 2:30 ) then we met our awesome server joy... he pulled some strings for us and brought us 3 beautiful 58 oz tomahawks... hands down one of the best steaks I've ever had..   If you go ask for joy... I'm in the serves industry but he didn't know that till it was tip time... I tip on service... I wish I could have bought him a car haha he was amazing!!! Every trip to Vegas will consist of an echo and rig tomahawk from now on

XP5i2YKbAJBMCIJMk8BSYQ.text: Great place for an elegant date night. The steak selection is top notch. The servers are the best off the best. Make sure to make reservations. They get booked up!

422Y8-AcsMvbLLSsHdeBGw.text: This review is for lunch. Previous reviews covered the Brunch and Dinner. We arrived mid afternoon and there were not many customers. Our server Alana was friendly and helpful in answering questions about the menu. Water glasses were immediately filled and the wait time for the food was short. Alana followed up on our satisfaction.  Items ordered were: Butcher's Beef Pot Pie is made with tender chunks of filet mignon and carrots, celery, potatoes and mushrooms in a hearty beef broth. The crust was very flaky. This was a delicious dish that was large enough for two meals.   Over The Rainbow Salad is a healthy bowl of the entire garden. Farro, quinoa, red, yellow & orange bell peppers, corn, red onion asparagus, cherry tomatoes, almonds, herbs & champagne vinaigrette. A great bounty of flavors. Served in a bowl, I was only able to finish half of it. Plan to enjoy the rest at home.  Again Echo & Rig did not disappoint in service or food. We look forward to returning to enjoy the beautiful second floor outdoor patio during the Spring.

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Pot Pie with Top Crust

Ay6b_O6ae_JVeje3B6Kq_Q.text: This restaurant seems to be pretty nice, and my other family members are fans, so my husband gave it a try. I loved the fried portabella mushrooms the most, I could have just eaten that for dinner.   I only give three stars for the steak though. My husband and I shared a med rare tomahawk. I can appreciate a well aged steak, but the steak came just under room temperature and I like to have my food at least warm, unless it's sushi. I liked how the steak came with so many accompanying sauces, but ultimately, we only liked the horseradish. I'm a believer that a good steak requires zero enhancements, so the sauces were lost on someone like me. The burnt ends tasted pretty good though, I just wished the whole steak tasted that way.  I can see why this restaurant is popular, the service is attentive and the dining experience can be exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried portabellas - very tasty

Y2rYNqL0bRPQdoi3Qd5a0A.text: I was here for a birthday brunch. Service was excellent, especially for a party of 28.  Bottomless mimosas - worth it! They serve champagne with orange juice on the side so you can choose how much to add. Just a splash was enough for me.  Portobello fries and 1/2 inch bacon sides - good starters to share. They serve house made bbq with the bacon, yum!  Steak platter - they bring out ridiculous slabs of beef for you to choose from (New York, T bone, porterhouse, tomahawk). They also had some steaks to choose from their regular dinner menu as well. They overcooked a few of our steak orders unfortunately :((( I would expect a steakhouse to be able to cook steaks to perfection as their specialty.   Steakhouse scramble - I ordered this and really enjoyed the pieces of tender filet mixed with an egg scramble topped with some burrata cheese.

qh3sf1mIi13L4Y0XB1yWQQ.text: 04-13-19 Went back, to give them another chance. And I am sure glad we did! We had an amazing meal, with delicious craft cocktails, and a beautiful ambiance..  We will be back, thank you!  03-19 It's a shame.. that after many years of amazing food, atmosphere and hospitality it's diminished to treating regulars as a nuisance.  The current management:staff lacks the communication and polish we had come to love about Echo.. not sure if this is training area that needs to be revisited or if the customer interaction procedures have changed..  It's the small things that keep people coming back.. the food is good, but in a city with amazing chefs you have to do more to keep regulars.  I wish things were back to the days of Derek, Xavier, Kevin, and Sheryl.. those are when it was THE SPOT t

QcVBV0FDy0sb9g_3J19MXA.text: My favorite steakhouse in all of great LV.  The food is always prepared precisely as ordered and served by friendly staff. I enjoy Echo and Rig so much, my wife and I had our wedding reception on the balcony. Perfection!

hfwz3aUwMtaBa-wbvxj2Lw.text: Excellent restaurant! Highly recommend! The steaks are very fresh and cooked to perfection! I added the glazed carrots which were amazing!  The service is excellent. The wine list is very good.  I honestly have nothing but good things to say about this place.

2T8KvTkU47jxLTWiignoqw.text: What an excellent place to have brunch! I came here on a Sunday Girl's Brunch outing with about eight ladies brunching. I was very impressed by the quality of service and the attentive staff who took care of our table.  We all ordered different dishes and everything was brought out on a timely manner and all tasted great. As for myself, I ordered the Bloody Mary, the Avocado Toast with Burrata and the Crab Cake. I enjoyed all of it especially the Bloody Mary and Avocado Toast with Burrata. Adding Burrata to the avocado was a delicious touch! The Crab Cake was good but I have been spoiled by East Coast crab cakes, sorry!   I would love to come back and try their other dishes during dinner. For me, that does say something when I am in interested in what a restaurant serves during the different hours of the day!!  See you soon!

AB2hBJ8rHjpVBxnqZiZPfQ.text: Portabello mushroom fries and that sauce was bomb. Crunchy & savory ($9.90)  Their Tomahawk steak was ok. I was expecting more flavor from it. Got the 36ounce @ $2.59/oz ($93.24) they were out of the rib eye caps which is what we each wanted.   The sides we ordered were the Brussels sprouts ($8.80) & garlic cheddar mash ($6.90).   Our drinks we enjoyed! I got the seasonal sangria ($11.30) and my husband got a Japanese Whiskey on the rocks: Nikki Coffey ($22.00)  Their service was excellent. Never had to ask to have our drinks topped off.   The only con was it was a little too dim where we were sitting but otherwise it was an enjoyable dinner. We will definitely be back...

pOQuoJkYwYitXFOG1Lr7eA.text: What a great experience from the moment we arrived, greeted with beaming smiles as they checked us in for our reservation. The attention to detail from our Server, Ryan was exquisite, as he guided us through the incredible grass fed beef options that rival the finest chop houses in America accompanied by an exciting menu of mains and sides. He provided attentive service throughout our dinner including a delicious salad he brought out on the house that complemented our Tomahawk Steak! The presentation of our dinner was as pleasurable as each bite was too!  I observed the room during our visit and what stood out to me the most was every table was having the same exceptional experience we were. By the time we finished our meal the room was full. The tables are laid out well, so you don't feel you are sharing your meal with the people surrounding you & the acoustics of the room allowed for good table conversation.  A short 20 minute drive from downtown Vegas absolutely is worth every mile to Echo & Rig. This a great place for a date night to a business dinner or any gathering with friends who enjoy a quality meal at a great price point!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 34 OZ of Tomahawk goodness!

mjiresBvKleAJ-d-wmhlfg.text: Off the Strip, but worth the trip  Echo & Rig is located inside the Tivoli Village Shops 13 miles west of the Strip in Summerlin. If you are visiting Las Vegas, the chances are you have booked your room somewhere on the strip. Thirteen miles might sound too long of a trip to you, but I assure you it is worth your time!  Owner and executive chef Sam Marvin combines butchery with a new concept steakhouse. This place does not look like your traditional steakhouse. Rather, it's an open dining area with a menu that invites diners to learn about the different cuts of meat. The servers can explain  how each cut should be properly prepared, and they should be listened to!   I could go on and on about all the wonderful things about the place, but instead I recommend you pay it a visit and when you do, give yourself enough time and avoid rushing through dinner because it really is a wonderful experience.

7QKL_zWy85nqoQXhl7SXcw.text: Service service service!! This place created the word! Food at amazing prices! Quality food 10 star!

WDgXkw0YEcNZNcW5SouM8A.text: We had dinner there 2 nights ago. It was excellent. The service was outstanding. We sat outside next to a heater. I had the ribeye cap, ordered it medium rare, but must say it was rare. Next time I will order medium. The meat was very tasty, nice char on the outside. It came with yummy potato chips. I had Caesar's salad, very good, creamy dressing just how I like it. We shared Brussels sprouts and mac and cheese, both very good. Hubby had onion soup, like French onion, but with added pumpkin cubes. He liked it and also liked his salmon and spinach entree. We brought our own wine. It was a very enjoyable meal, and we will be back.

i9CIWP88BqMpkYePl2bsWw.text: We decided to eat off strip for this trip to Vegas and found E & R.  The decor was cool and staff was great and attentive.  Our waiter Hugo aka "Slick" made sure everything came out well and took good care of us.  I had the Rib Cap which was quite amazing.  We also tried the scallop entree and horseradish crusted butter fish.  Outstanding quality and service.  I would highly recommend this gem which is worth the uber/taxi ride out to Summerlin!  We will definitely be back.

pTo6ChAladpWPH0JZ-XPfQ.text: Went for brunch for our anniversary and everyone really went out of their way to make sure we had a wonderful meal.  As for the food, we both had egg dishes and they were cooked simply and perfectly!    Also, the patio is a great space to enjoy while the weather is good.  The service really set the place apart from others, so a special thanks to manager Beth Blomquist and our server Mikkel (spelling?) for taking such great care of us!

5pQlGvFsJnhhp3hj_HLjeA.text: Came here for happy hour on a weekday.  The bar was almost full.  Probably because their happy hour is such a deal!  Here's what they offer: $1.99 shrimp cocktail - excellent $1.99 steak and egg - excellent $1 hot dog - tasty They also have drink specials.  Such an amazing deal with an amazing staff. Bartenders are attentive and friendly!  Offered 7 days a week.

PVAKvqdewQWrOXMxbUzigA.text: Awesome happy hour specials!! The steak and eggs happy hour special is a steal! I don't like beer but the Stiegl Radler grapefruit beer tastes great, especially when it's $3!
