2YEm5YjIewUN2nwBEJ-xSw.text: Another outstanding dinner experience at Echo and Rig!  Great cocktails, excellent service, and steaks broiled to perfection. Be sure to ask for Sammy--he'll take great care of you.

VewRzyvbnEZUfOWehwPSvw.text: Love this place! Off of the strip and very reasonably price considering their impeccable service. Portobello fries and the brie are a few of my favorite small plates. Their fat baby oysters are the best raw oysters I have ever tried. I'm excited to try their weekend brunches soon. Heard nothing but great things about it.

4fIUVloFNzv87YLcW6uULA.text: Looking at all the reviews, I was expecting it to be fabulous.  First, we had reservations for 6:45 and we didn't get seated until after 7:00.  Other people came in after we checked in and were seated before us.  We were the last ones waiting.  I was already unhappy.  After we were seated, it took 15 minutes before I had to tell our server we were ready to order.  When we finally got our steaks (NY, filet, Spencer, and ribeye) and they were just okay.  I ordered the ribeye and I thought they gave me the NY steak.  No marbling and no flavor!!  No one was impressed with their steaks.  I had a more flavorful filet at TGIFridays!!  This was really disappointing! :(

SXyCThr2k3o-myrZQ1cWzw.text: My wife and I where just looking for a place to get a bite to eat before the gym and we ended up quite surprised!!!!! We called before hand to find out dress code if they had one and they where come as is!!!!!! We where seated at a great table by the window and it looks like there really is No!!!!!! Bad table in this place!!!!! Are waiter was great the whole time. When are meals came out they where amazing the meats there are tender juicy and have so much flavor!!!!!! The prices are very very affordable compared to any other stake house in town!!!!!! This place is a must try!!!!!! We will be back again and again!!!!!!

r75eSWLXW6SVh-4e9IjJQQ.text: I think this place is a hidden gem for sure! It has all the quality that places on the strip have but is at about 50% of the cost. Take a cab out here or rent a car or uber but whatever you can to get out here as this place is excellent! Very unique cuts of steak that were excellent, great appetizer of homemade sausage and really great cauliflower!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Eye Cap Steak with Garlic Chips and Mushroom Rockefeller, in the back you can see Cauliflower and Cheddar Mashed Potatoes

zfBNMRijtbtXpQc2cCnqJQ.text: Mostly 5 stars because the server was a babe but seriously the food is absolutely amazing! Service is amazing! The octopus salad and the espresso martini are delish!

WXXhkRNHaZWQkuX5k-3Fsw.text: Came here on a Tuesday night with a party of 6. We were warned that Tuesday was their busiest night but we didn't expect to wait for a table for over an hour. However, that gave us time to check out the butcher case and speak with one of the butchers, Kilan. He offered us a bite of some beef jerky they made the previous night, which was delicious. Also, the butcher working the cold meats section near the stairs took pity on us and offered a little appetizer which was also good.  We finally got seated at our table. Unfortunately, it was right next to the kitchen and in a draft zone. Whenever someone opened the door to the patio, the cold air swept in. Again, manage my took pity on us and tried to warn their servers to close the door behind them. Sometimes they forgot so we had to get up ourselves to shut the door.   We ordered the calamari and crab cakes for appetizers and they were both delicious. The aoli for the calamari was perfect. I had a couple of bites of my friend's over-the-rainbow salad and I wanted to order one for myself since it was so good. I ordered the skirt steak with a chimichurri sauce for my main course. My steak was cooked perfectly but was a bit on the salty side. I also ordered a side of roasted cauliflower which was fantastic. On the other hand, my boyfriend ordered the jumping beef which was apparently filet mignon with peppers and onions and a kind of light gravy. It came a little too well done when he had asked for it to be medium rare so he only ate a few bites. The coffee dessert was a nice ending to my meal and everyone else enjoyed their desserts.   Service was great, everyone was exceptionally friendly. Food was ok/good with the exception of the well done beef, which was comped along with a few of the desserts. I would come back and give this place another try.

6OTqzVqRRRGOgPvKfnc-Gw.text: On a recent trip to Vegas, I was looking for tasty food that wouldn't break the bank. I found Echo & Rig on Yelp and decided to take the 25 minute trek from The Strip with my boyfriend. I'm so glad we did. I adored my dinner. It was delicious. I had the black spaghetti, watermelon salad, chocolate cherry sundae, and white sangria. Everything was delicious. The spaghetti wasn't fishy at all, the acidity of the sauce balanced everything out. The watermelon salad was crisp and refreshing. The sundae was pretty standard, but still yummy. The white sangria was delicious and refreshing as well. The prices were absolutely incredible as well. I wish Echo & Rig was closer to Los Angeles because I would absolutely visit more if it was.

fxvhXhGQYp7a2I7ts2EJmw.text: Do not miss this place while visiting Las Vegas. The staff is wonderful and the food is beyond delicious.

ve__VY4qaZ61uOfCC4WzcA.text: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday. The  steak was good, the sides were bland and the service was medicore. We waited 20 mins past our reservation to be seated and waited another 5 to get a server to speak to us. I've had better experiences.

GHnya35WtIim1gQPkmNq9A.text: Amazing.. best food we had on a recent business trip to Vegas.  Great wood flavored Filet

k_-eDt_wJUF4FUdPQ_Hv8Q.text: Thank you for listening!  A couple or three visits after a disastrous summer where they made you feel cheap, looked down upon you for bringing in your own bottle, and upselling the crap out of you (COME ON, TWO TOMAHAWKS FOR 4 PEOPLE?!  OR 6 APPETIZERS FOR 4 PEOPLE BECAUSE YOU DON'T THINK IT'S ENOUGH FOR THE TABLE??), I have not seen it since.    Our last visit was the night before the Rock And Roll Marathon, manager Xavier took care of us and pretty much any manager that walked by checked in on us.  Xavier did an excellent job always being there for us and checking in on us.  The food is always good but our server that night did need a little help with his culinary vocabulary.  Butterflying the meat doesn't mean cutting it in half.   People who are reading, the meat here is not ruined by unnecessary (but sometimes yummy) stuff thrown on it.  It will be undercooked so it's easier to (raise) or get the temp you want.  Well done E&R, I'll be back soon!  And thanks again Xavier for listening.

OXBBfZFF59Jpd1m-qta76A.text: I am in love with this place. Wow!!  It's in an upscale outdoor mall, that is beautiful and a perfect place for a stroll to walk off some of dinner. When we walked in, it didn't seem very impressive because it is somewhat sterile in the downstairs lobby. The dining room is upstairs and the lower level is a butcher shop, which is basically how this restaurant exists.   The cuts are all so amazing. I ate way too much because it just felt like a waste to leave a bite on my plate  At our table, we had the rib eye (not the cap--that's mostly the fat), the brisket and the Spencer steak. Each of us loved our choices. We got the portabella mushroom fries (amazing, you should try them), ahi poke, cucumber watermelon and tomatoe salad, Mac n cheese and the Brussels sprouts. The only one that was just ok was the sprouts. The others were outstanding.   Ally was our server and she did an awesome job of making us feel special and attended to. This is a hidden gem. Prices are very reasonable for what you get. Plan to spend about $60 per parson (or more if you drink a lot and add on dessert).   Yes!!! This is a winner. Can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel sprouts.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu. sorry for glare

omhuUAb4dGFmJXM52OoRNg.text: Echo & Rig provided a wonderful experience for my husband and I. The hostesses were warm and friendly and did not hesitate  accommodating our wish to sit outside. With a genuine smile, we were greeted by our server who was prompt and professional. The food was amazing and the star of the morning was Joy. He was attentive and charming, never giving us a moment to have to seek service.

Nw0xg9jmZaiXQctL8U1YTg.text: Brunch here is amazing! You receive high class treatment just as you would for dinner service. It was very busy, so you definitely need reservations. They have an endless mimosa option, which probably explains the high noise volume. The eggs Benedict was delicious. The hollandaise sauce was perfectly prepared and it was a nice size portion. I did try the portobello  fries that they are known for. They were tasty, very crunchy and salty. Though I would not visit here just to try these, they were not spectacular. All-around this is a great restaurant and definitely worth the price!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello fries
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict

hU_dS2dy6-lyjgJhqwIZUQ.text: Wonderful dinner!  We had a Tomahawk steak and it fed three of us.  Our waiter, Jesse, was great!  To be honest, everyone we dealt with was amazing.  We are from Seattle, here on vacation, but when we are back in Vegas, we will eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p9PDwGMzS_Li0BpXppQ-Ww.text: Sunday brunch was a bit of a letdown. They were extremely busy so our food was a little weak. The place was so loud we couldn't hear each other.  The prices and service was good.

IstnxjNuvtpDc8UeAWgbMQ.text: My wife and I were staying at the JW Marriott down the road and wanted to have a nice dinner. The restaurants at the hotel got dismal reviews, as expected, so we found E&R on Yelp, and I am SO glad we did.  Walking by the Ferraris and Porsches parked in the valet right outside, we entered around 5pm on a Saturday and were greeted by the hostesses. We didn't have a reservation, and they said the next spot for dinner wasn't until 9:30pm...but that we could take any of the open seats at the wide-open bar area and have the full dinner menu. We happily took the high-top right next to the window and I immediately ordered a Moscow Mule.  Even though we were seated in the bar area, service throughout was awesome. Our server went through her recommendations for appetizers and main courses. We had the portobello mushroom fries for our app which were...so incredible. Highly recommend.  For entrees, my wife had the Shrimp and Artichoke dish and I had the Spencer Steak. Both were delicious. Countless times throughout the meal, my wife and I looked at each other and wondered if this was one of the best meals we've ever had. Everything just tasted so good.  The decor and feel of the place is awesome too; classy, but not too fancy. A lot to look at in the lobby as the raw bar is right there along with the butcher shop area and other cool stuff they sell.  Get to Echo & Rig; truly a 5 star experience.

NovA6GLJstqDQberr27Fzw.text: Thoroughly enjoyed their weekend bottomless mimosa and Bloody Mary brunch. It was my first time trying the brunch. When they say never bottomless they mean it. Our flutes never saw the bottom of the glass. I've had dinner before which was outstanding. The food quality was marvelous. The overall experience was Great. The restaurant was bright and cheery. And due to the summer Vegas heat they offered inside air conditioned seating or outdoor seating with the misters on. Everything we tried we enjoyed.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1-B3mEhCfWCPSXLOeP2Zcg.text: Our favorite go to place for delicious steak for my husband and my birthday and anniversaries. All their cuts are delish! Don't forget the portobello mushroom fries, they are a must!  Don't forget to make a reservation! There is always a wait but the service is phenomenal! They always treat you like family.

gdljAlteAHHBY_O_AvOsJA.text: I'm going to start this off with one simple statement: the food here is AMAZING. I'm stingy with stars, but Echo earned all 5 of them easily.   There were four of us in our party. We were celebrating a friend's birthday and we found this place. When we first walked in, we were a bit taken aback because we didn't realize there were two floors to the building. Downstairs is a full meat market and bar area, while the restaurant resides upstairs.   Ok, now onto the food. We started with several "small plates": Ahi Poke Tuna, Portabella Fries, Cucumber/Watermelon Salad. For me, the portabella fries were the hit of the appetizers, nicely seasoned and cooked and comes with a fantastic dipping sauce. The cucumber salad was also very good and refreshing. After that we got to the meat: Spencer steak, 2 Rib Eyes, and Brisket. All of the steaks were cooked to our individual requests and we all raved to each other about how great they were. My brisket was very tender and flavorful. My wife's rib eye was also very tender. We also ordered "small plates" of mac & cheese and brussel sprouts.  Nothing we ordered was disappointing.   Our server, Allie, was a rock star. She was attentive and helpful, her service helped to enhance our overall experience. If you're anywhere near the Vegas area, get ti Echo and Rig. I'm already looking forward to going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Small plate&#34; of mac &amp; cheese.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slow smoked brisket with kale and grits.

rS6__aNoEj0DkCfrs_Dzmw.text: Super awesome restaurant amazing food and service. I would recommend highly!  Also happy hour is from 3:00 to 6:00 everyday  I love this place and will visit soon

ZgMjji6EgJHDdGQDEou_Ow.text: One of the more memorable meals I've had. Steak was delicious and the sides were great as well. It was a bit pricey but not disappointing!

wCscjXXCU1Up-Ifj74CFTA.text: Best complete meal I've ever had in Las Vegas. Every suggestion our wait captain, Ari, gave us was spot on. Spectacular food, magnificent service, very fair prices. All the small details from the garlic chips to the salt scrub wash in the restrooms exceeded my expectations. I had the Caesar salad and the ribeye, Ari suggested blue cheese sauce (but to use it as a dip for the garlic chips) and the cauliflower side. Everything was spectacular, and good portions. I was too full for desert. Next tine!

dguOqxR7LmbNPTaW4x7YoA.text: We came here on a Monday afternoon and the food and service was amazing. There were about 5 other groups in the restaurants so there was a lot of attention paid to our food. The steaks were delicious..the hanger steak and their signature spencer steak. They were perfectly cooked and melted in your mouth like butter. The breads were fresh and of high quality. The avocado toast and brie in sourdough with a cherry fruit sauce...very flavorful. The only thing that was strange was they served chips with the steaks. Other than that it was a wonderful meal.

qBNknWQyrUFZovoVdp1FYw.text: Yep. Worth the $$. And if you're not in the mood to spend a whole lot, their sides are bomb. Bonus: no corking fee!!!! I'm a quickly becoming a loyal fan!!

v8kKFZVX-TEOUc5fP0uklA.text: You want great steak without the strip prices. Look no further!  Great atmosphere with an awesome upstairs patio. Old school Spencer cuts, Bavette, ribeye cap, Colorado lamb, and even a good seafood selection. Grass fed too for those all into the organic.

QSD6TCJjraKSK3A1zvxnUQ.text: We came on a Saturday at 1:45p for lunch. We didn't have a reservation but they were accommodating. We waited about 20 minutes and were seated. The manager came to the table to introduce our waiter. He promptly took our drink orders then.... Disappeared. He was chatting with the table next to us for awhile before we got his attention.   When we finally ordered, we ordered appetizers and meals all together. We were so hungry! So we told him to being everything out as soon as it was done. He was nice though. It was brunch, and he let us order the Mac and cheese and cauliflower from the lunch menu.   The initial round of appetizers came out. But we're sitting right next to the kitchen. And those 2 orders of Mac and cheese (which can only be ours) is sitting under the earner light.. Its been there for 15 minutes.   .....  Yay! We finally get our food! It is now 3:02pm. We waited about an hour to get our main course. And everything came out all at once. Including those 2 orders of Mac and cheese we saw sitting on the line. Everything tasted pretty good. But 3 of us ordered the burger. We all asked for it to be cut in half. Only one was. 2 were supposed to be medium, 1 was supposed to be medium raw. But all 3 came out medium raw and cold. Like so very pink/red in the middle that I questioned if I could eat it. I'm pregnant so I can't take chances. I left it alone. Instead, I ate up the rest of my husband's grilled cheese. That was VERY GOOD.   Even though the Mac and cheese sat there for a long time, it was amazingly still cheesy and tasted quite delicious.   Overall everyone liked their food. (Except the raw burgers) and the fact that it was all rather cold already. The experience was nice. At the end, the server gave us a free sundae of our choice because it was my sister's birthday.   But if you're in a hurry. You can't eat here. We got here at 1:45p and are leaving now at 3:55p. And its not because we sat around chatting. We spent a majority of our time just waiting on food (chatting too of course) but the food took very long!  Giving 3 stars because food took forever and burgers were not cooked as ordered.

U54ThJdhgciU9BnKtYFeTQ.text: Brunch, one of the most important meals of the week.  The perfect combination of tasty food and alcohol. Finding the perfect balance requires well crafted food, good champagne, and great customer service. Highly recommended, Echo and Rig delivered.  The restaurant was full, so we sat at the bar area. It worked for my group of 5, but I wouldn't recommend it for bigger parties. Beautiful view of the shopping center fountain. We were greeted straight away. Once the bottomless mimosas were ordered our glasses were never empty. They give you a baby jug of OJ and refill your glass with just champagne. The mimosas were $16.99, but with brunch from 9am to 3pm you can definitely get your fill.   The avocado toast was amazing! I only wish it was bigger. My deconstructed salmon bagel was awesome. I was surprised by how much fish they gave me. When we mentioned it was Bub's birthday they brought him an ice cream cake dessert. I was a little buzzed by then so I don't remember exactly what it was, just that it was good.  Don't forget to check out the bathroom! Hand salt that makes your skin feel baby smooth.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VVxPgewrN8XXPBGQ18Jlug.text: Outstandingly amazing service, food and environment is truly top notch. The bus boy, I've never seen such attention and our waiter was a True pleasure to dine with. I went yesterday and I'm going back again today with my 3 sons.   Love you guys :)

nBqQEN0gX11ma2NfO1GE9Q.text: Amazing food is just an added benefit to the cool ambiance and incredible service.    Check this place out for brunch as well. A serious Summerlin find.

0t1QPoIwuZrAPkL3QgLJJA.text: Great steaks and sides at reasonable prices. Butcher shop is convenient. It rivals most restaurants in the Vegas Strip!

lgS-D3sWhJhZGvADERW2Og.text: Always good!! The no corking fee is incredible. Got the lasagna last time and it was very good. Flank steak had a lot of flavor too. But the fried spinach salad is one of my favorites there.

1R681GXI6Nuwui0BdH5ktg.text: We had brunch here for my birthday -- a terrific choice.  Our table of four was quickly seated (no reservation!) and service was prompt.  Cocktails and excellent and well poured.  My short rib hash was succulent, tender and well presented with perfectly cooked eggs.  One companion enjoyed his NY Egg Sandwich, another the smoked salmon Benedict, and my husband enjoyed his eggs Benedict.    A big pricey for everyday fare but a great choice for a special celebration or indulgence.  Loved it!

LaYPgxW3AB8eDnz3xo0LGQ.text: First off, I'm a vegan......I just had the most amazing brunch of my life. Not only were they 100% accommodating to my dietary restrictions but they also had the most exceptional customer service I've probably ever experienced as well. My brunch lasted from 11am-7pm. Please don't pass this place up, from the view to the service everything was 5*s. I had the most beautiful and delicious chopped salad with balsamic vinegarette dressing. Super filling, colorful and flavorful. Vegan bottomless mimosas. Perfect Sunday.

z8V7m7mp6dJaq8mM6II52g.text: Awful experience!!! My husband, 2 year old daughter & 7 week old son walked in for lunch (it was a weekday around 2pm). We instantly received glares from the hostess and dirty looks as we were looking around the meats in the front entrance. We walked over to inquire about dining and the hostess blurted, "It's a 30 minute wait. I would sit you at the bar but you know you have little ones." She then asked what we wanted to do. We put our name down and the hostess asked for our number. She said that she will text when a table opens up....we walked out to shop around....and NEVER got a text!!!! It wasn't like my daughter was running around wrecking the place or throwing tantrums and being loud. We dine out frequently. Very disappointed and will never dine here and will make sure all our friends are aware of our experience.

d_EiFgu5RUY6JXbG4pWcAQ.text: Sunday Funday Brunch Day!  Wonderful service and gracious hosts.  We sat outside and it was glorious. Be careful with the bottom-less mimosas, they magically refill themselves.  Delicious grub! The french toast is more like a loaf cake. Bacon was lush!  Veggies tasted like they were picked from the garden.  Shrimp cocktail arrived with just one little shrimp. Was a good shrimp  Potatoes were scrumptious!  We were there for over 2 hours savoring every bite. Great place for everyone, all ages.

8CUab2lG46Xu2p3W_Ovz0A.text: Let me start by saying the service was excellent but the steaks -- not so much.  I mean granted the prices are reasonable but I expected better quality since the butcher shop is on site?    We ordered portobello fries(yummy) Brussels sprouts (okay) Garlic mashed (okay) Mac & cheese (excellent) Ribeye ( full of gristle) Filet. (Full of fat)  So I'll post the pics before we tried them and the picture of my filet .... you be the judge. I've never ever seen a filet look like that and trust me , we have dined in many many steakhouses

xzNlpAb5iIRL90vshxyX1Q.text: Good but not great.  Little Gem salad was my favorite of all the things my lunchmates ordered. The cheese was dry and salty. Heirloom cherry tomatoes: A+.  They would have picked Porkbelly Burnt Ends as their favorite thing. And Thick Bacon.   Use the salt scrub that everyone raves about.   Staff is upbeat. Foods are fresh. It's just kinda snoozefest. Nothing that tantalizes the senses. Personally, I thought all the food was better next day.

1sDo5Y-ZYK-PFkTeSnaY2A.text: This place is ALWAYS amazing! I have been coming to Echo & Rig for the last 3 years and it's always a great time! The bottomless mimosas, the thick cut bacon, salads, and avocado toast, are just a few of the yummy deliciousness that they offer!

DgrGlVRCBiKnLoPCnWF9ww.text: Meat eaters rejoice! Besides the excellent cuts of meat, the customer service is superb! They will explain everything you need to know to chose the best entree. I chose the Rib Eye Cap, medium with the braised mushrooms. It was fantastic. No salt, pepper, or A1 needed. It was perfection.  It came with garlic chips, and stuffed mushroom; the chips can be dipped in the braised mushroom sauce for an extra boost flavor, the mushrooms were nothing special but also tasty. The Rib Eye was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. The sides were also delicious. I chose mashed potatoes(two portions), brussels sprouts with pistachios,  porta bella mushroom fries (two portions), seven cheese mac and cheese, the cauliflower and pork belly. The pork belly, porta bella mushroom fries and the seven cheese Mac and cheese are a must!! The sides were enough for six people and the Rib Eye was enough to share with my spouse. Prices are very reasonable considering the quality of food and customer service. It is a few minutes drive off the strip but well worth it ( we did find when our Uber driver took the streets and not the freeway we arrived much faster). I will definitely make this a stop on my Vegas trips!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly on the right; tender, bbq-ie. it was excellent.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Eye Cap, picture does not do it justice. Perfectly medium, melts in your mouth, seasoned to let the meat shine NOT over power it.

iCF9MvuNL-mMfHWADtryyQ.text: Located in a beautiful Tivoli Village (about a 30 minute drive off strip or 8 miles) Echo and Rig fit right in with ambience and decor. The staff was amazing! We were running behind and 1/2 hour late on our reservation but still received a smile from the front hostess and we were sat within 10 minutes. Drinks were prepared perfectly. He had Raspberry Mojito.  I had smoked respardo(?) Thyme. That's a sipping drink,  no doubt! I liked the smoky herbal taste. Not for everyone.   The waiter was very knowledgeable and we really liked his demeanor. Very good server. They offer complimentary distilled sparkling water which is a plus for me.  Menu was a good size. Main focus is on the proteins, with sides and such being your choice with an added cost of. $6 and up.  We got: Portabella fries....perfectly cooked, and thick cut w the lightest coating. My husband ate these up quick!  Watermelon salad with heirloom tomato cucumber and red onion. This was good and fresh,  with just the right amount of dressing. Red onions sliced a bit too thick. .. they need to be almost shaved to enjoy raw. Very overpowering so we left several slices lingering in the bottom.  We split the Ribeye Cap. Cooked perfectly but a tad salty for me when used with the bleu cheese sauce.  We did like the red oak grilled taste. We could have eaten a bigger steak but had a big lunch so this was ok. This came with one stuffed button mushroom and fresh potato chips...so we also got... Butternut squash with pepitas and some kind of white cheese. This was earthly and good to me but my husband would have preferred something else.  We received complimentary wedding champagne and sorbet with fruit from the manager. A very nice surprise. Thank You.  Overall,  if I lived in the area,  I would come back,  try other menu items, (but of course get those portabella fries hahaha) and ask for light seasoning on my steak. This place is a winner.

9LHgK21LDuvvoEbANOnMuQ.text: Great food, can't complain but why do you serve chips with my steak at dinner that is very weird and I don't like it at all.

6UFHDOpVGwxrtPwUuctlIg.text: Well, we haven't been here in a while and we figured we would come back. We tried lunch around 2 pm. Nice enough staff, the busser should of been the server, but the server was nice. Had a cocktail, "Goldigger" it has a "peat mist", not really a peaty whiskey in it but it was good to try once. For an appetizer we had potato pancakes, my wife said they were a little cold in the middle. They were a little bland but not bad. I ordered the salmon with poached eggs on a potato pancake. Salmon was fresh, the pancakes really were cold in the middle and the eggs were hard. Not poached well at all. The manager was very nice and she checked on us.  I received new eggs after a few. They were not that busy, but our server really didn't come by to check on my food or ask what happened. Maybe we r spoiled, sorry no pics as my wife didn't finish her short rib hash, it was ok. About $30 a person btw

IVxnPD4cU408M9QcC5Qkxg.text: Wow, this place was amazing. The food is unbelievable! I've never had such a delicious steak. The whole place is beautiful we sat inside but next time I'm going to request the outdoor balcony, the view is stunning of Tivoli Village. The service was top notch & the pricing is right for the amazing meal you get. I highly recommend this great steak house. The dessert is delicious too!

5XenscFJX6tMY4jJ7rnjHw.text: Shout out to the staff, our waiter Ryan, the general manager, and everyone who made this a fabulous evening celebrating Dad.  Shrimp, Jumping Beef, hangar steak and Spencer Steak (yay Ode to Jocko's) were all perfectly cooked.  Side of brandied mushroom sauce was a favorite.  Mac and cheese were the biggest hit!    I highly recommend this restaurant for meat lovers (there is a butcher shop downstairs) and do much more.

_r6UKaNWX1JOcfsWdEuHBA.text: OK, so how have I been sleeping on this place for so long?  I went here for a late dinner a couple Sundays ago. My date informed me we could bring our own wine, which blew my mind, cause what? That's a thing!? (And Total Wine is like right up the street!)   Our reservation was pretty last minute and they were flexible with us pushing it back even later. Service was great. The hostess was sweet, our server was very attentive and personable without lingering or being overbearing, and the manager stopped by our table to make sure everything was to our liking as well.  We started out with a caesar salad. Nothing particularly special, but honestly, I just enjoy a nice, fresh salad. The surprise came in the form of the pork belly burnt ends. My goodness, they were good. So good. Like, let me eat this for the rest of my days good. For our main dishes, my date had the skirt steak while I had the Spencer. Both were cooked perfectly, with him opting for their blue cheese sauce and me sticking with the red wine.  Overall, it was a great dinner, and definitely worth the trip across town.

4IVAMk1AogYxpwgX4b3yLQ.text: We just watched a movie and was ready for "lunch" we made our way home and passed Trivoli village and thought of echo & rig's. We hadn't been in a while so we decided to stop.   We road the elevator instead of doing the stairs, both my husband and I have bad knees, the hosted left us at the elevator and said she would meet us at the top?  Last time the hosted road with us! Felt abandoned.   Then we walked through a very busy restaurant, straight to the out door seating area, corner table next to the railing. Next to one of those space heaters. I am warm bloody and chose to sit as far from it as possible. Bad decision, wind coming across that corner was too much for me, had to change seats, a little better but still windy.   After a good 20 minutes, a server finally acknowledged we where in his section and took our drink orders. Then it took another 20 minutes to get them. After what seemed like another 30 minutes, our server came back to take our food order.   Now on Sundays they have a 'brunch' menu with limited items, mostly breakfast things, by this time it's after 230pm, we got there at 120pm. They offer unlimited mimosas for $16 and unlimited bloody Mary's for $22.   We are not much for drinking, tea and coffee is our usual and occasionally a cocktail.   We ordered a couple of things for appetizers, we had a small plate, crab cake and the goat cheese sandwich, the drunken goat. Red wine marinated goat cheese Brie, cranberry chutney, herbs de province green apple, petite greens, aioli and walnut bread.   I really liked this combination, loved the walnut bread, it was toasted and three layers. Loved the goat cheese. The whole thing was really good. It's a really big sandwich enough for two to split.   The Maryland crab cake was also very tasty with big chunks of crab with red pepper coulis and lime. This was a 'small' plate and you should expect that, small taste for two, for one person it would be just right.   For main courses my husband got the Summertime Steakhouse salad. It's a natural USDA primeflat iron steak with red onion, mango, avocado, basilromaine & white balsamic-lime vinaigrette. Very good size but only three small strips of steak. It was cooked to order, my husband said he was satisfied, so I guess it was the right amount.   I got the Flat Iron USDA Prime steak, roasted anaheim chilies spinach & preserved lemon chimichurri. It was on a baguette and came with home made potato chips.  First bite and I ended up using a knife and fork to eat it, steak was tender, cooked to order, but big pieces and not able to take smaller bites, so I just cut it up.   Our food was good, our service on the other hand was a disappointment. Seemed very slow and we where still eating our apps when our main entree's came. Then getting refills also took some time as well.  We've been before when it was not so busy and service was great, so not sure if it's the time of day we came this time or that's the new norm. We're sure to return, just hope service is better.

lwFfQoakAqBghVO02FFM7Q.text: If you want to know were locals eat in Vegas, this is one of them.  I always get the filet, medium rare, outstanding. The bar is typically where I eat, nothing but good service from Ryan, Carlos, and Beth.    If you're in the mood for something a little more formal, upstairs seating is perfect. Bring a date or a group of friends, you wont be disappointed.

FLib3auB7kWWn_xt5MpbAA.text: The restaurant is fantastic.  Undervalued steak house compared to the Strip. Service always great, as is the food.  I recommend the ribeye cap w blue cheese sauce.    BUT, the butcher shop is a hidden gem.  Incredible cuts, and THE BEST BACON IN TOWN.

Bif0_ZFViS1JU9FZLowl4w.text: Stop!! Do not read all the reviews of employees that continually write raving reviews of this restaurant. Great service is all that should be written. Food is bland,cold, and has no taste. So many better restaurants in Vegas  Go here with your wallet open and disappointments will abound.   Had such high hopes for good food but all the main items everyone recommends were bland.

Fa_ymBaIBkhASrIjVvZ1hw.text: It was my first time at Echo and Rig and I can safely say it will not be my last!   The place is really nice and so were the bartenders! We were sitting at the bar, we went for happy hour and their steak and egg is delicious! My first plate steak was slightly overcooked and my eggs a little undercooked, I guess that's how most guests enjoy theirs, not me. I won't take stars away cuz it's just not the point here. I talked to em and the 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th orders were so good(yes I had 7 orders of steak and eggs) don't judge me! Lol  I was drinking gin and tonic which were made nicely!  The happy hour is very enjoyable, it's nice and cheap and you get nice drink, great food and such a nice and clean little place. Def will be back to Echo and Rig

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their steak and eggs is fantastic!
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of choices!

NMn3ZHGGKR5u4_cbM_VGSA.text: This is a cute little spot at Tivoli Village. I'll definitely be back when I'm in the area next! The happy hour is just too great to pass up! The bar area is small, and where we decided to enjoy our afternoon. The steak and egg is $1.99!!! We ordered a double steak and egg and they had no issues with that at all! My issue however was the under cooked egg; of the 4 of us, all of them were under. Even another customer at the end of the bar returned his to get recooked. With the undercooked egg and the over cooked steak I was thankful the steak was still tender and full of flavor!   The butcher shop next to the bar was a welcomed sight! They had a beautiful case of meats to choose from. They even offer bone broth and bones for doggies! All the meat looked great and the next time I'm going straight home from there I will make a purchase.   Looking forward to our next happy hour at Echo & Rig!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. undercooked egg and over cooked steak, but $1.99!
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4mOXztk_Y2k-tG1Yu-lxaQ.text: This review is exclusively about the Echo & Rig HAPPY HOUR...And it is FANTASTIC!!!!!   Only 3 Food Items on the Menu: $1.99 Steak and Eggs...One Beautifully Cooked Small Chunk of Sirloin and a Perfectly Fried Egg... $1.99 Bay Shrimp Salad....Delicious and not too sweet Cocktail Sauce on a nice sized pile of Bay Shrimp sitting on a bit of Arugula.... $1.00 Hebrew National Hot Dogs.... A dog on a bun with Saurkraut and Mustard... Large Beer Selection including Guiness, Stella as well as a few IPA's all at $3 a pint... $4 Top Shelf Spirits.... Super Friendly and Efficient Staff.... All in all an INCREDIBLE VALUE!!!  VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour Menu

Y7ASmq0xAPOyIQ7FCb5NzQ.text: My mom and I had dinner here recently and really enjoyed it.  I had heard good things about it and wanted to try it.  We had a 630pm reservation and had to wait a few minutes for our table.  The restaurant is two stories with the bar and hostess station on the first floor, along with a butcher shop where you can buy meat.  The 2nd story is where the kitchen and all the tables are.  We had a nice table over looking most of the restaurant.  Our servers were great.  Coming by often and being attentive.   I had a Summer special peach mule for my drink.  It was really tasty.  Nice peach vodka and tart ginger beer.  For starters, mom had the Onion Soup Gratinee - gruyere, pumpkin squash, sage. She really liked this.  Not a large portion as onion soup normally is.  A good starter size.  Nice sweet onions.  I had the Avocado Toast, Macerated Baby Tomatoes & Burrata. Really tasty.  Nice mild avocado and burrata.    For entrees, I had the Jumping Beef - filet mignon tips, roasted tomatoes, red onions, crispy potatoes & Peruvian demi-glace.  Tender beef with a spicy sauce, good veggies.  Mom had the Salt & Pepper Pork Chop - Fuji apple, slow-cooked beet greens, calvados demi-glace.  She really liked the pork.  Nice flavor, well cooked.  She took half of it home as it was big piece.  The apple was sweet and tender.  For dessert, we split scoops of peach and grapefruit sorbet with fresh berries on top.  This was the perfect portion size to share.  Nice light sorbet flavors, fresh favorable berries on top.  Overall a really nice dinner, great food, good service.  A nice local place away from the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach and Grapefruit sorbet
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumping Beef
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork chop

VP9J9MP-_Gx81zXEzZVFGg.text: Echo & rigs is such a popular place for Las Vegas locals.  We've been there numerous times and by far, our last visit was our worse experience ever.    We took our out of town guests for Sunday brunch, we wanted to impress them with this local gem provides no gimmicks just good food and service.  However, echo & rigs didn't do any justice.  We had a party of 9 people, we were running 30 mins late because we had 2 toddlers with us.  We called them and they were nice about it.  We arrived but we still waited about 30 mins to get sit.    Everybody was famished.  We ordered right away.  After our server took our order, he was no where to be found during our whole meal.  We had no water on the table.  We were missing utensils.  Our toddlers were hungry because they didn't like the food.  We couldn't add more orders.  It was a mess. There was no one to help us.  This place charged 18% gratuity for big party automatically, the server was doing the minimal because he knew his cut was safe.    We were fed up with the negligence, finally we waved like crazy to get someone's attention and the manager came over, and we told him about our situation.  The waiter came immediately and helped us.  He did apologize.  It didn't help much with our frustration even thou he was trying to charm us with his big gorgeous smile.  Too little too late.   The food was horrible.  The short ribs has was oily and mush and egg benedict was over and english muffin was chewy and old.  The portobello fries and avo toast were the only food up to standard.  I was literally embarrassed in front of my friends.  Because Las Vegas local restaurants have so much more to offer, just not Echo & rigs.  Btw, the menu were not kids friendly.  The brunch menu was limited and not versatile.  They have no regular pancakes, so  we ordered plain bread for my kid, 2 sliced of wheat toast arrived, seriously?  End up our toddlers were hungry and grumpy.  And we were frustrated and angry.    I will not recommend anyone to this place.

upNtEauR85ukVXUaSZ8xWA.text: Amazing steaks!! Great options for appetizers, too. I went all out and ordered whatever my heart desired. Started with a delicious veggie salad. Literally chopped veggies, cold, with a light dressing. Very good!  Tried the crab cake, it was decent. I was trying to get as close to surf and turf as possible. The homemade chips are great! Side of broccoli was decent and mashed potatoes were pretty good.  This place is pretty fancy but the staff is gracious, knowledgeable, and helpful. I had 3 people come assist me when I was looking for the bathroom! Pricey but worth every penny.

Acp9K5WV5ahObAl3PCtOCg.text: This was my first time here and what a great place with a great ambiance. My friend and I met here for brunch. My friend ordered a Bloody Mary and I ordered the Melon-Coly Misfit cocktail. Wow, what a combination of ingredients to create such a smooth delicious drink. Next, we ordered the Short Rib Hash and the Quiche. The hash had such amazing flavors. My quiche came out cold so I immediately told my waitress and it was replaced quickly. The quiche was so amazing. I simply love anything with goat cheese and this quiche had it. The portion size was good too. The salad it came with was perfect and light. Our waitress Rae was so friendly and attentive. She didn't hesitate at all to replace it. She kept apologizing and had a smile the entire time. Overall, this place was excellent. I will be returning.

8omEsRvM7yHoerhJI4OEEA.text: Classy and tasty. I like great dishes with a tasty slant. Got the creamed kale which had a slight coconutty flavor. The lamb cigars w/tzatziki was like a gyro egg roll. Avocado toast was on a rustic long bread.  The hamburger was a sturdy piece of protein and pleasant char. Not oily. The crispy home style potato chips were crispy-good.  Its a large 2 floor restaurant with bar and outdoor seating. Its located in the Tivoli shopping complex. On Open Table, too.

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado toast on rustic bread

9ULnwCcy9_J2iIOregV7kw.text: The food was good, but the service was the stand out performance of the night. The staff checks in frequently and when our drinks were down to 1/3, they brought a refill.  Small plates: Brussel sprouts - sauteed in butter. Good flavor but defeats the whole "eat them because they're healthy" rationale. Good for sharing   Pork burnt ends - served in a caramelized sauce that seemed to be similar to the Chinese bbq pork flavor. 8 slices on our order, good for sharing   Octopus salad - tremendous flavor in the dressing and the octopus (smoked?). My preference would have been for the octopus to be a bit softer in texture but was still a nice dish. Good for sharing   Crab cake - was good but my portion (we split it) didn't have a a lot of crab while others did. Good for sharing but it's not something I think I'd order from here again, not because of the crab portion but because it's average as far as crab cakes go  Fries - standard fries. Not much to say here  Entrees: Lamb porterhouse - was very good. Smoked flavor and meat wasn't gamey at all. Served with small potatoes  47(?) oz tomahawk - meat was very tender and had good marbling. Some parts came a bit too charred for my liking, but that didn't impact the medium rare at all. You can ask the chef to cut it for you for sharing purposes. Comes with 4-5 sauces for you to choose from, we didn't really like/need any. Salt to flavor ftw

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kennebec Salt &amp; Pepper Fries

eqksUyz6Z_M5GWex2tp3sQ.text: What a great place! The decor is beautiful the pearl finish on the walls look amazing!   My mother in law was coming in to visit and I wanted to take her somewhere and that somewhere was Echo & Rig! They sure didn't disappoint, the service was impeccable. My husband had The tomahawk steak and he was alll about it!   They also have a meat market downstairs if you want to buy meat to take home and cook.   If you want to go to a great place with very nice surroundings.... then  this is the place for you. Btw I also hear they have a great happy hour menu on Wednesday's!   My husband and I plan to go back alone next time

lh5sAtpmq7PQLmB_avDpCA.text: I had made a reservation for dinner, which was definitely the right thing to do.  The hostess checked us in and had us wait to the side.  Normally, I feel the need to keep checking with the hostess to make sure they haven't forgotten about us, but at Echo & Rig, the hostess was on it and kept us informed.  Brownie points for that.  After getting seated, our waiter seemed a bit rushed and annoyed that we weren't ready to order.  He spoke really fast.  I think he warmed up to us by the end of the meal though.  Now onto the food.  It was perfect!  The roasted chicken I had was so moist, breast meat too.  I was concerned about the black beans under it because I don't like beans, but it was cooked with the chicken juices and just enhanced the flavor of the chicken.  All the steaks at our table were done to perfection as well.  For sides, we had brussel sprouts, mac & cheese, roasted broccollini, and portobello mushroom fries.  You can't go wrong with any of these options.  For kids, they made us a simple cheeseburger with fries that got devoured.  All in all, it was an amazing experience.  Oh and how could I forget the dessert.  A pink grapefruit sorbet and a berries sundae.  The cake in the berry sundae was dry and crumbly, but that's my only complaint for the entire meal.  I'll definitely be back.

kbg3XngeCyRC-BndXvfn-g.text: I usually here for the brunch but today was dinner time ! And it was not disappointed at all !!!!  So We started out with the pork belly burned end was really good enough BBQ sauce for someone doesn't like eat pork often I have to said this was bomb !  The portobello fried surprisingly so good with the little crunch to it !   I love love fish dishes here always perfect both of the fish came out perfect ! Although I like the sea bass a bit less than the butter fish today !  The baked sweet potatoes was great instead of the fried today   I love the good old Mac and cheese if I can have it with every meal I would !!!  Dessert today I choose apple pie with vanilla ice creams was perfect for after dinner the apple still crunchy so good !!!!

7Pj927yTuqJxcBfM536I7A.text: I've been to this place quite a few times, and each experience is a grander then the last. In my opinion I love coming here for brunch or late lunch timeframe.  You can't come here with starting up the ENDLESS mimosas, which are just that! ENDLESS. The servers make sure to make their rounds and to top the glass off when needed and also refilled the orange juice.   Now when it comes to the food? There isn't a bad choice at all! From the salmon bagel w/ capers, delectable French toast or the Maryland inspired crab cake.  The salmon bagel itself was amazing, well prepared, and presentation alone was nice. The French toast was delicious, sweet, and will always be a breakfast classic that no one should pass on. The crab cake was a special plate for me simply because I'm from the east coast where seafood is king and these guys knocked it out of the park from taste, appearance, delivery and smells.     I implore anyone on the fence about this place or anyone looking to try something new to give this restaurant the opportunity it deserves! You truly will not be let down or disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Bagel are the front 2 plates. While my French toast is just off to the right. Accompanied by my companions&#39; and I&#39;s mimosas!

BkR832PyBn1vFNXadL0M1g.text: I am so disappointed about the management staff for this place. I've been coming to this restaurant since the day they open. Over the past two weeks I called and spoke to 3 different people in regards of a party I wanted to book for my wife's birthday. Every time they say somebody will call me back the next day and they never do. I guess we will go spend the money somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

In-0y15CYvW8S4Ls8KkrLA.text: This restaurant has been on our list for some time now. It's just hard to find the time to drive so far from Henderson. But it is totally worth the drive, as we've now discovered.   The restaurant is at Tivoli Village and it's so much bigger than I had thought it would be. I had no idea there was two stories and a lovely patio/balcony. We arrived and were brought up the stairs by the most friendly host to our table outside. In fact, every single person who came to our table was very welcoming and kind. I've never experienced such amazing staff at a restaurant.   We decided to opt out of small plates and salads, aside from the shrimp. My husband ordered 4 shrimp not realizing they were HUGE and $4 a piece. Luckily, they were worth it and super good. I ordered the drunken goat sandwich along with fries and my husband got a steak that came with chips and a stuffed mushroom cap. First, the sandwich was ginormous which made me glad we didn't get appetizers. Second, it was the most amazing sandwich ever, I loved all the flavors from the sweetness from the cranberry and apple to the savory creaminess of the cheese. The fries were so good, I ate them all. My husbands steak was cooked perfectly and the chips were so good as well.   To finish off I ordered the cappuccino sundae. It wasn't overly sweet and you could definitely taste the coffee in it. It was very good but too big for one person.   Such a great restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino  Sundae
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kennebec Potato Fries
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Spencer Steak

2fM0K3XmJXenFQtajhDEXw.text: I must say, one of the best steaks I've ever eaten! That says a lot especially when I've eaten at many high end steakhouses throughout my Yelp years.   Best local secret in Las Vegas (in Summerlin to be exact). After a round of golf nearby, my local LV BFF made reservations for us at Echo and Rig.   We ordered the delicious Steak Tartar (must order), fried Portobello mushrooms, shrimp cocktail (it was okay), cauliflower, kale salad for the group. You must order the Steak Tartar with sour dough. It's the greatest!  :)  After the appetizers, our waitress brought out large tray of the tomahawk steaks for size comparison (I think there were 5-6 cuts).  I think we ordered the 2nd larger cut...48 oz and shared it with 3 out of the 4 in our party. The tomahawk was flashed charred and medium rare inside. It was cooked to perfection!!! Like I said before, the steak was perfect, it was soft and perfectly seasoned. Echo & Rig also has 7-8 side sauces that accompanied the tomahawk and if I remember, the mushroom sauce was one of my favorites.   Echo & Rig was casual (I still had on my golf gear, polo and shorts) and didn't have a problem dining in. Butcher on-site. Raw oyster bar in-house as well.   I will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas. Reservations recommended. It was packed!

tToB4wdo0lAPzU5LepQf_g.text: I don't think a visit to the Vegas area is complete without dinner here. Forget the steakhouses on the Strip and their bloated prices and drive 20-25 minutes east. I've never had any trouble getting a reservation for an early dinner, but it can get pretty busy on weekends. The staff here is friendly and attentive. As some one that drinks a lot of water, I've never had to ask for a refill here-- it just comes and I love that.   Here's what I've tried:  Butcher Blend Burger - Super juicy and delicious. Well-priced too. The brioche bun does its job and sops up all that burger goodness without it getting on your hands. Do yourself a favor and get it with cheddar.   Cauliflower - Really good textures. Great char, a little crunch, and a spicy kick if you want it.   Mashed Potatoes - Just what you asked for. Creamy, salty, delicious.   Portobello Fries - I order this every time. Their lightly breaded and fried. The aioli is so tasty.   Bone Marrow Carne Asada - If bone marrow is on the menu I won't not try it at least once. I'll be honest-- it's average here and the carne asada doesn't do much for the taste.   The steaks here are really good and incredibly well-priced. As I mentioned earlier, you're not paying the premiums you would if you were to eat on the Strip. In terms of sauces I like the Charred Onion one. It lends a nice tang and subtle char. What I love about the steaks is that the wood they cook them over impart a little bit flavor. The garlic chips are also addicting!  Ribeye - The portion sizes aren't posted on the menu but I recall that the ribeyes here are on the larger end, around 10-12 oz. The steaks here are very good, and you can't go wrong with the ribeye. I've never had to send a steak back.   Ribeye Cap - My preferred cut here. It's the best part of the ribeye! It normally comes around 8oz., and is the type of thing I'll eat slowly to savor.  Every visit I'll order a steak and a couple of sides. The bang for your buck here is unmatched. There's a reason why it's normally filled with locals. Parking here is readily available if you get in early enough.

uCKZ1pujwat2PmZxNI9v1w.text: My boyfriend and I had heard this place was good, but we were even more pleased than we expected. The staff from start to finish were knowledgeable and went above and beyond to give the best service. The food was perfection, but the service made our experience 5 star for sure. We will be back.

17MDl2qI2EwUREi_ZaUzJw.text: Loved it! Better than most strip steakhouses and definitely better service.  We will return

kkAxgj4-qb4sRKAAxgg3wA.text: I enjoyed the bone marrow carne asada appetizer.  It had a good amount of "meat" on there and it was cooked perfectly.  The ribeye cap was okay.  My first time having that type of cut. It wasn't as marbleized as I hoped t would be and not as medium rare.  But it was flavorful.  The service was great as well.

HJ8HwIJmuMieeXSeMJMpUg.text: One of our favorite places to eat!  Great customer service, friendly staff and  EXCELLENT food! I frequent Echo & Rig as they are consistent with their menu, the price is so reasonable and always scrumptious!  We had our Holiday Party of 50 and everyone enjoyed the service and variety of delicious food---They went above and beyond to make that event a memorable one!  Thank you!  One of the best steak houses in Las Vegas!  Thank you Echo & Rig for a wonderful experience!  Can't wait to come back- Cheers- April Martinez - Christensen

bn6QcS1VV-OFsLF0dVJXzg.text: We are locals here, but we have never tried Echo until my sister-in-law and my awesome brother-in-law visited us from IL. We ate here on a Saturday night & the service was stupendous and world-class w/ the manager coming to our table, introducing himself and chatting w/ the table.   The food was outstanding; we ordered Tomahawk steak; butterfish & shrimp w/ artichoke, which were all delicious and mesmerizing! Even the side vegetable dishes were amazing, i.e., cauliflower; fried spinach and Brussels sprouts, etc. We are definitely coming back in the near future!

9RpsDQjF9V7v_UDLsulaWg.text: We really enjoyed this place. The atmosphere is romantic and upscale. The food was excellent and so was the service!

zvA-9zDN7glPdo3jlivYiw.text: I love this place SO much, the quality is there the price is half of what the strip is and the service is top notch. This is my go-to for date night   I had the filet beef tips I could literally bathe in the sauce. The mashed potatoes were perfection.

_suLzQ842rfZ3u954QOwlw.text: I absolutely LOVE everything about this place, from the food to the service. This place is definitely all about meat but I loved the combination of an upscale restaurant with a butcher shop downstairs.   Importantly, it's BYOB!!! From what I heard, it's usually a bottle of wine per four people. Our waiter was kind enough to allow us to have several bottles open throughout the night. In addition, we were a party of nine and we were ordering so many items and couldn't order the charcuterie board because we thought it would be too much food. However, the waiter brought us out two boards to share on him!   Another thing that I liked about E&R was the person who helped us at the butcher shop(Aaron?). I was picking up some items to make dinner for the following night and he was incredibly helpful!   Overall, really great place. I didn't get to try any of the steaks because I was having it the next day. But my favorite items were the duck and portabella fries! Definitely coming back to have their steak next time!

jk6uuG12uB05bu1o6ZvLMA.text: Visited echo and rig for Saturday brunch for bottomless mimosas. Was blown away by the amazing service and the amazing food! Will definitely be coming here more often

-MpyyclkA_BvI7FTel9O1Q.text: I can't speak any higher about this place! I visited from out of town (dallas) and celebrated my birthday at random at this restaurant. I don't usually yelp but I was so blown away by the food, atmosphere and service that I had to right a review.  I'm in the industry and so I have high standard offood & service.....Sam was an awesome server. If I could recruit him to Dallas I would- Totally professional and knowledgeable.  Steaks were tender and cooked accurately. Charcuterie shouldn't be missed! Especially the mousse de foie pate...OMG.....I'm going to have vivid dreams about that stuff. A meal I will never forget!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie= magic!

9M6c9nNGfouphImH8Q583w.text: By far the best steak house in Vegas. Chef Sam is an amazing individual that supports his workers goals and aspirations in life. He has helped numerous workers go on to other restaurants and become managers or head chefs.   The service is second to none. They treat you like you are royalty and remember you when you come back.   Food is absolutely amazing. Ask your wait staff for suggestions.

yUiBD44LWnSCOSvCFvSpAg.text: Exemplary service and superb food. This is where you meet "The Best Steak in Vegas." Hands down!  My son and daughter-in-law recently treated me to this hidden gem. And, believe me, it is a gem!  The "Tomahawk Chop" Ribeye is, by far, the best tasting steak I've ever had the pleasure of eating. The service was equally impressive.  I will soon return!

NYGtKkhMVAROtdzyQ5Q32Q.text: This place would get 5 stars if you could come here anytime.  The ONLY time I have received great service & food is when I go for brunch with my dad. All other times it's just "eh".

33822CDlZ1wIbqRgFT0WiQ.text: Just left and I can't say enough good things about it. The service was the best I have had in a long time. I could barely put my water cup on the table before it was being refilled.   Get the skirt steak. When two different employees said it was their favorite AND it was the cheapest steak on the menu, I knew there must be something to it. It was delightful. There was no need for the delicious sauce that they served on the side.   Try for outdoor patio seating on a nice night. It was worth a few extra minutes of waiting.

7g9a8IhS_9j82uzvkIeOxw.text: This place has excellent food, but what really stand out here is the service. Honestly, my friend who gripes about tipping didn't bat an eye and paid more than 20%. We shared a 48oz Wagyu steak and it was FANTASTIC! Also, the sides (flash fried spinach, mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts along with portabella fries and grilled octopus) were really tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 48oz Wagyu steak. Soooooo good!

AKSqIBbcuudS9VYdcZMdbg.text: I love Echo & Rig so much it's almost hard for me to put into words. This is absolutely the best steakhouse off the Strip. You can't beat the food, the service, or the atmosphere. The restaurant is just so beautiful...this place is really amazing.  I've been here for dinner and for brunch - both are spectacular. My first Echo & Rig experience was dinner - my husband and I came to celebrate our anniversary and they made it really special for us. Champagne upon seating and the salted caramel sundae after dinner were really nice touches! Our server explained the menu in detail and brought out the different cuts of meat for the day so we could choose. We started with a caesar salad which was fresh and delicious, and for our entree, we ended up doing a tomahawk ribeye for two with roasted garlic mashed potatoes with white cheddar (on the side was this mushroom gravy...it was the most delicious gravy I've ever tasted), and macaroni and cheese. Easily the best dinner I've ever had in Las Vegas! They have an awesome wine list and we had a malbec - delicious and the perfect complement to dinner. The staff that helped us was awesome and couldn't have been more accommodating - Nicholas, Jared, and Jay M., you guys rock and made our anniversary so special. We just moved and didn't want to do a big trip for our anniversary so we kept it low-key...to have such awesome service, food, and wine made it a really unforgettable night.  Since then, I've enjoyed brunch once at Echo & Rig and it was also amazing. I went with friends and we sat outside to enjoy a beautiful day - their balcony is so beautiful. My friends had breakfast and I chose lunch - I had the grilled cheese with short ribs, gruyere, white cheddar & parmesan. It was THE BEST grilled cheese ever! If you're feeling something super indulgent, get that. I can't remember our server's name, but Beth, the manager came out to say hi and she was amazing.   I can't wait to come back to Echo & Rig. Definitely recommend for brunch, dinner, date night, or a special occasion...whatever it is, they will make it memorable.

kVuIopsNzzG9U_TbU0N7pg.text: Celebrated my 15 year wedding anniversary and the whole Echo & Rig team took care of my family the whole evening. Food was amazing and the service was awesome. Big shout out to Xavier, Jessie and the rest of the team! Superb!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice guy Jessie. Thank you!

MhDw9mzmylNvHSUhLpJI4A.text: Amazing food , friendly staff and friendly management . I'm never disappointed when coming here .  The price points are really good and I love the outside patio . I also love the fact that there is no corkage fee if you bring your own wines !!

3hH60HrtRptPwki6HXs41A.text: All around Echo & rig is a pleasure to go to, every single time. The food is exceptionally well priced and it's really fresh and delicious. The service is hands-down some of the best you'll get even at a five-star restaurant. It's a fun place. I would probably eat there three times a week if it was just a little closer to me. I cannot imagine anyone eating here and not being happy with the overall experience. I can safely say it is my top 5 favorite places to eat in the entire city and I know a dozen people that feel the same way.

dUwPvqBR8S8osC_4EEQN5Q.text: If you are looking for unreasonably great food at reasonable prices, this is it. The staff treated us like rock stars, we were even given a few appetizers on the house. The grilled octopus was a little tough, but everything else was so great we didn't care. I highly recommend the portebello fries and the filet.
