S8n8iBssHTIMRJoNwYS9oQ.text: They made us sit in the bar because we didn't have a reservation. The food and wine were very good... but the people sitting next to us were kind of loud and we were really looking for more of a romantic night out.

aOGHjwq9aQ3XybQY7UpgkQ.text: I decided to take my significant other and grandparents here for brunch. I'll admit I was super apprehensive simply because of the price point. But boy oh boy was I surprised!!! I had hands down the best breakfast I've ever had in my entire life. I had the farmers breakfast. The flavors that were in this dish were unbelievable. I'm a cook myself and can't fathom how that palette was infused into my meal. My grandparents were absolutely blown away and I thought my significant other was going to pick up his plate and lick it clean. They offer complimentary sparkling and still water. Everyone is so sweet and it is such a beautiful location. And who can go wrong with unlimited mimosas and bloody Mary's!? One for each hand, am I right? Definitely a customer for life. Wow!!!!!

dyRASdmFSo1AKAfwMlEeSw.text: The best steakhouse in Vegas I don't care what anyone says....  Butcher & Bar on the bottom & fine dining on top. They also have a beautiful upper deck patio with a beautiful view.  The service in this place is impeccable. By far the best.   The sides are delicious and reasonably priced unlike other steakhouses where you're forced to pay $10 for one side.   The cuts of meat are beautiful and cooked to perfection.   And any place that will allow you to bring bottles of wine into their establishment and not charge you a corking fee,  you'll have my business until the end of time.  Thank you echo & rig for doing it correctly! Hats off to you

D2nlxNByGIHz3Lo57fsmKg.text: Itty Bitty Echo & Rig Review: - Primarily a steakhouse, but I loved the small plates and vegetables. - Our party of four shared: Mac & cheese, Over the Rainbow salad, Roasted Garlic Mashed Potatoes & Sharp White Cheddar, Pumpkin Squash, Rosemary & Brown Sugar, Portobello Fries with Herb Aioli, Bone Marrow Carne Asada, Fried Oyster sliders, Butternut & Burrata Ravioli - Food is delicious, but it takes a LONG time to get to the table. You should probably have a snack before you come or you'll be really hangry waiting for your food. - We saw Siegfried (without Roy) there. - The mac & cheese is the best I've had in a long time. Never had portobello anything, but the fries have opened my eyes--great dipping sauce.  The pumpkin squash is fabulous.  The garlic mashed potatoes are nothing special--you can skip them. - We will be back.

V8hvuQgOQGV0simUMdpPew.text: If you love steaks, this is the restaurant to go. A wide variety of fresh cut meats cooked to your desire. My co-workers and I enjoyed our lunch. We shared the side dishes, try out the portobello mushroom fries, those are amazing! Everything was great and the service was excellent too. They were very friendly.

RlRXkc6eMYzvCx6rI5HoAw.text: Echo & Rig got some love early from Yelpers. Echo & Rig is a new steakhouse located in Tivoli Village. Echo & Rig is one of those restaurants that is very welcoming. What I mean by this is that it's wide open when you enter It's also spacious, clean, and your treated with smiles/greets. But then there's a wait just to be seated and for them to take your order. It was roughly 50 minutes between waiting for a table and taking our orders. Another issue...we were a party of 4 and had to share the rest of our table with another party of 4. We were asked if we were okay with it and we were...only because we didn't want to wait much longer. Enough said...Yes, there's a wait for a weekday night. Our group ordered a mix of food. -Mac & Cheese: Pretty good stuff. Got the light creamy, cheesy mac here. Love the thick macaroni too. -Butternut Ravioli: Buttery good -Garlic Mashed Potato: Yikes...not the best. -Pumpkin Squash: Amazing! -Portabello Fries: This was a good highlight for me. Mushroom fries? Yes sir! -Bone Marrow: I didn't try. So, I can't judge -Fried Oyster Sliders: My opinion, not a good mix. I like oysters. I like sliders. But oysters and sliders together? This just didn't mix well for me. Slimy and greasy all in one bite. -"Over the Rainbow" Salad: I'm not a salad lover, but couldn't help myself with their "Over the Rainbow". Tasty and they even added quinoa. What is it? It's Queen-No. Now for my main entree. I originally wanted to try their Spencer Steak, but was talked into the filet mignon. Our waiter suggested the filet since it's supposedly their best cut and best tasting steak. Honestly, I was not impressed with the filet at all. I regret that I didn't ask them in advance how juicy a medium and how dry a medium-well was. I usually get my steaks medium-well. What I got was a filet mignon that was well-done at the top and medium on the inside. I guess that's what Echo & Rig considers medium-well. I wasn't impressed, but the price was super cheap for a filet mignon. I guess I can't complain either. You get what you pay for. Filet Mignon: yelp.com/user_local_phot... Sampling: yelp.com/user_local_phot... A Must: yelp.com/user_local_phot... Overall, I was very excited to try this place out due to the reviews, location, and it's steak. I left with mixed reviews. Long waits, average steak, but cheap with delicious appetizers. You win some, you lose some. I broke even. YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE 2013 - (469/500)

B1M6gZ_uVaVcefug9jE7ow.text: Really nice place, their meat is absolutely amazing. We always share the tomahawk with my husband and bring our own bottle of wine we get from a vineyard as there is no corkage fee, so we splurge on their delicious sides.

duPTcPd4_Q56N32GTogtYQ.text: I had bookmarked this place after seeing it appear on the list for one of the best steakhouses in las vegas.  My friends really like this place as well and always bring visitors here.  Came in friday night for dinner with reservations and no wait needed.  We were seated outside, right next to the heat lamp with a nice view of the plaza.    to start, drinks-  huckleberry gin with hot honey: beautiful color, spicy and sweet.  food: -grilled octopus with gigante beans and celery: the raw celery really stood out.  octopus was tender, but overall combo was ok. -watermelon tomato onion salad: refreshing and sweet -cauliflower with shallots and onions: sweet like candy! crispy and delicious. -ribeye cap: very flavorful and tender cut.  it was recommended medium but mine was definitely a medium rare.  comes with mushroom stuffed with bread crumbs and side of potato chips.   -spencer cut: friend got this and asked for medium rare, but it turned out medium.  less flavorful and a little tougher.  passed on desserts, which included a variety of sundaes. service was ok, nothing impressive

0SC8SzHEs7uvPPRwanzcoA.text: I have eaten here 10-12 times and every time it has been great.  Great food for lunch or dinner.  Lunch favorites include, the burger, steak sandwich, and short rib grilled cheese all very good but my utmost favorite is the bacon lettuce and tomato on beef lard bread, 4 thumbs up yes I said 4, I borrowed my wives hands to help rate it 2 thumbs are just not enough.    My Cardiologist would disown me if she knew I was indulging so but what she doesn't know won't hurt me ;)  The steaks are all phenomenal I can not recommend one over the other as peoples preferences do differ greatly, I personally like the Spencer, old fashioned cut that I remember from my childhood so nostalgia even comes into play eating here.    The ambiance is very nice as are all the staff I have had the pleasure of being attended too by.  Oh they also have a great butcher shop that cuts meat to order and it is top notch aged prime meat, again have never had a complaint purchasing meat from them.  5 stars and 4 thumbs up I highly recommend.

W9yUrO7gDtU1cQDhnCmVIw.text: First impression walking in, "I kinda feel like I'm in a big city restaurant like Chicago!"   We walked up to what looked like to be the butcher shop and put our name down and the gal said it was going to be an hour wait, makes sense considering it's a Saturday night. So we parked our behinds at the bar downstairs.   So, I have to mention this bc I felt a little awkward about it... There doesn't seem to be a dress code, but the majority of the people at this restaurant were little dressed up... I came in jeans, t-shirt, flats. Seemed like every female was in a dress and heels... Just had to put that out there bc I felt SUPER underdressed, but whatevs ;)  I wasn't really hungry but I had to try everything considering that the reviews on this place have been pretty good. Once our name was called, the hostess took us upstairs to the dining room.  The Eats: portobello fries, steak (can't remember what kind) and a few cocktails. I'm more of a side eater than I am main course, so my fav part was the portobello fries. When people say "bomb dot com", yea, that!  Being the restroom snob that I am, I have to say that their restrooms are big, clean and comfy! Good job!  This place is great for a date night, drinks and there were a few big groups so from what I could tell, they can comfortably accommodate larger groups.

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye Cap w/ a stuffed mushroom and chips, drool.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello Fries for $5 and so f&#39;n good!

aKO1n3kQhlND4CozmcnlLg.text: One word:DELICIOUS! Great service. You can bring your own wine! We shared the most tasty rib eye steak, cauliflower, mashed potatoes and an ice cream dessert. SO GOOD!

_q0cRnPtPkbmGchdHpmwvw.text: If I could give this place 10,000 stars I would. Let's just start from the beginning.... Hostess was really nice dispite us not having a reservation. Once seated, the GM and wait introduced themselves to us and the hostess relayed the message that it was our first time. From start to finish the service was superb; and for whatever reason all the waiters look like models. (Not complaining). Once the bill was paid our waiter later found out we were celebrating an engagement. He then comped us a dessert and glass of champagne. I asked him to charge me but he insisted. My good gf and I were so impressed and I can't wait to bring others ... We shared the drunken goat sandwich (omg!!! So good) and the arugula salad, then finished off with their delish toffee icecream.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our waiter took multiple pics, it was like a photoshoot hahaha.

T8xo9wwqwk-QR6ykzVZG1g.text: Wow!  This place is amazing!  I was in town for work with a group of ladies, and we made a last minute run to this restaurant - knowing it might be difficult to seat five with no reservation.  The friendly hostesses told us it would be a short wait, but they would find a table for us.  We were seated quite quickly, and visited by Xavier, the manager, and Jason, our server.  While we saw beautiful cuts of meat being displayed for tables all over the dining room, we quickly decided to dine tapas-style and order lots of small plates to share.  And while the cocktail menu looked fabulous, we decided sharing a bottle of wine would be more fun.  Our wine was delivered quickly, and our small plates started being delivered to the table.  We ordered the cauliflower, thick-cut bacon,  lamb cigars, butcher's sausage, baked brie, ahi poke, and the grilled octopus.  The conversation waned at that time because we were all thoroughly enjoying our food.  Xavier also kindly brought over an order of the fried spinach salad for us to try.  It's something I had never heard of and would never think to order, but it was insanely good!  We ran out of wine pretty quickly, and our amazing server Jason recommended a red blend from Browne Family - one of his favorites.  We insisted that he pour himself a glass and spend a moment with us, which he did in between running around attending to his other tables.  All in all, five stars - for the food, the atmosphere, and the service.  We travel to Las Vegas for work regularly, and we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j0mkvCd4xnxZEDrBawsKZg.text: Had Sunday brunch with my mother here for the first time, place was very busy but we were seated immediately since I had a reservation through open table. I ordered the short rib hash and bottomless mimosas I had to share    Since it was  a pretty large portion. My mom had the toast and crab cake.Was even greeted by the room manager, my glass was always filled service and food were excellent would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZlfINbXuCBSP0qqZbOm_sw.text: Went for brunch on a Sunday - there was a normal amount of traffic, wait was less than 30min. There is a bar with some seating downstairs, so we didn't mind the wait. A couple of us got the bottomless mimosas - the waiters were attentive in refilling our glasses :) Many of the items sounded appetizing, what we did order was filling and tasty. The decor was simple but very elegant and classic. The only negative I can admit is that the dining area is pretty loud - a small price to pay for the lovely ambiance.

6Eg2uxaxXHp7FhPUys2IyQ.text: Steakhouses are a dime a dozen in Vegas so you better be on your A game. Echo & Rig really missed the mark last night. It started off great with James the manager coming by to welcome us to the restaurant along with our waiter Sam. Sam explained the menu and brought our their specialty steaks on a platter.   I went with the 19 oz prime bone-in New York and our table shared the mac & cheese and roasted garlic mashed potatoes with white cheddar. The rest of our table ordered their entrees and that would be the last time we saw Sam for a very, very long time. One thing I like at E&R is that you can order 1/2 glasses of wine if you want to sample a couple different glasses.  The drinks and bread came out pretty quickly, brought by two different people. The entrees and sides came out a little later, again served by someone else. I took my first bite and the steak had no flavor, I had to add salt and pepper. After a coulple more bites my jaw was actually getting tired of chewing. It was one of the worst cuts of meat I have ever had. Full of gristle and really chewy. For a "prime" cut it was terrrible. The others at the table were enjoying their filets and fish however the garlic mashed potatoes were very bland as we didnt taste roasted garlic or white cheddar. I thought the mac & cheese was good though.   Sam never returned to check on us to make sure everything was ok and prepared properly. We had to flag down James and let him know about my steak.   James apologized and had a medium rare filet out to the table in about 1 minute. Excellent service which I truly appreciate. He also returned to make sure it was satisfactory which it was. The filet was very tender and had great flavor (and cost much less than my prime NY). Still no sign of Sam.  We all finished our dinners, had our plates cleared and were just sitting there waiting for the dessert menu. Again we had to flag someone down to find Sam for us. I ordered the salted caramel turtle sundae which was excellent.   Sam brought out the bill and I was a little surprised to see I was charged for the filet. I have absolutely no problem paying for what I ate, but in my business if a customer is unhappy you do everything you can to change that. I almost never send food back, so when I do it's a bad sign. Although I appreciate James quickly replacing my steak, the quality of the prime NY, the mediocre potatoes and the total absence of our waiter was a big let down.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted caramel turtle sundae.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; cheese was good
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad was excellent

0wCt_otAhM119YMQ0-R_Mg.text: Went here tonight for my son's 21st birthday, party of 5. We bought drinks, plenty of sides, a couple of salads, a salmon entree, and steaks. First let me say that they do have their service down pat- the hostess asks your name downstairs and notes any special occasions, which she then writes on paper that's handed to a manager upstairs and they stop by your table to thank you for coming, calling you by name.  That's a nice touch.  The servers seem very knowledgeable and the water guy was the most attentive service person on the team.  The food: the mushroom fries are dynamite, so good and we ordered two.  The cauliflower and brussel sprouts, also very good. The garlic potatoes were okay.  The salmon, my son said, was delicious.  Our vegetarians both got salads- the quinoa salad was so bland that we sent it back.  It was just not good. That person ended up getting mac n cheese and said it was great. The veggie salad with cilantro dressing was also good.    Now for my chief complaint and the reason that this steakhouse gets 3 stars... the steak.  My mom had a skirt, which she said was very good.  She ordered it medium and it came out almost rare- but it was so good that she didn't care.  I had a more expensive steak and it was possibly one of the worst I've ever had.  I would even have expected better from Applebees.  I ordered it medium rare, it came out over medium.  I brought it to their attention and they re-fired it- medium again.  The manager brought it out himself and asked me if I approved.  I cut into it and yup, still brown with barely even a hint of pink- so I said 'good enough, I guess'... Here's the thing: we can all see that there's no red in my steak- even the waiter agreed later.  I shouldn't have to feel forced to accept an over cooked steak because I don't want to seem like a pain and the manager should have known as soon as I cut into it that it wasn't right. Everyone in my party was finishing their meal and I wasn't going to ask them to fire another steak. So I eat it because I don't want to dampen the mood anymore than it had been.  Luckily the blue cheese sauce made it better, since the steak itself had no flavor.   Final gripe, my bill comes and they didn't take anything off for the poorly executed steak.  I mentioned it to the waiter and he basically tells me that they cooked it twice, that was enough.  Then he says that he'll see what he can do for me....  he comes back and they took $10 off my bill.  Thanks? Now it's just a $20 fail that I paid for, instead of $30.  Oh, and the garlic chips? I don't even want to think about how many of those that they must throw out, along with the bland bread and butter than another poster noted.   It's a shame too because I come to Vegas a lot and I wanted to find a great place to bring people.  The search continues.

ocZot0P4OzeFxN_OW0SDmg.text: Love this place.   One of the best steak houses in town.  You won't be disappointed. In fact, you'll fall in love and want to come back again and again.

OCfWy1GHljulbyMd26H0Fg.text: I can only base my review on the one and only area of interaction I had.  My partner and rove out from the strip where we were staying to try the "best hamburger" in Las Vegas.  It's not a short little trip to Echo & Rig.  We were there on a Sunday afternoon.  As I am not local, I am only familiar with strip and downtown areas and this particular time is usually open at restaurants where we usually go.  Upon approaching the hostess, she and two othe young girls were chatting away.  I stood for a second and then looked at me with irritation that I had interrupted their very important conversation.  She then asked me in a very brusque and unfriendly tone whether I had a reservation.  I was surprised and that had to show in my face.  When I responded no, she told me with great irritation that you cannot come to Echo & Rig without a reservation.  They had no seating for the rest of the day.  She then turned and resumed her conversation.  I do realize that a local spot may have a different traffic pattern than where I am sued to going.  But the rudeness and irritation that this girl showed was totally out of line.  We left immediately and I will NEVER cross their doorway again.  I will also tell my friends that visit from the strip to not bother taking the extra time to go to Echo & Rig.  We happened to be with a friend who works at a highly regarded local restaurant and she was quite stunned at the hostesses behavior.  If this is the attitude you get at the door, I question whether the press has gone to their heads and that the food may follow if it has not already followed the horrid treatment we received from this young girl.

EROsoAYZ2ZeCSv8VBPi4Kg.text: This place needs a new cover photo!!!  Way better than it looks on the pic. These guys are butchers....in the best and real meaning of butchers!  They know meat. I had a Spencer cut...and I've hit a lot of steakhouses and never heard of it (it's the center, lean part of a ribeye steak). It was perfectly charred over red oak and perfectly seasoned.  Brussels sprouts were fresh and automatic. Only wanted to try to eat two bites of the cappuccino Sunday, but I ate the whole thing.  Not a Fleming's over seasoned but fresh True flavors.

EOEHhjHBkLZZcc31ZjH9KQ.text: The Spencer steak...wow! And the bone marrow carnitas  You don't need to go to the strip for the best steakhouse! The ambience does say trendy and it is, but not overly fancy. You can walk by the cooler to take a look at their butcher shop area with all the cuts of meat while you wait. I'm in town visiting family and can't wait to come back again!

ljniJwHU33qwyDPEIyT-gw.text: Austin is amazing! Best server I have ever had. He suggested the fries spinach salad and I wouldn't have ever ordered it unless he suggested it. The  by in the salad is great and Austin knows the menu so feel free to ask him about his picks on wha he would get on the menu. Super sweet. And the bottomless mimosas and the consistent fills - I will definitely be back next time I visit.  Can I just request Austin to be my server every time or is that against he rules? Super sweet people person that seems like he really enjoys his job. Can't beat that!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TCYygrlYDplSqMTX0VeZXQ.text: This is an awesome place especially if you are on a date. The bone marrow is to die for and the mac and cheese is simply amazing if you are going for simple. The crab cakes are always really good. They have an amazing grilled cheese and their steak is awesome. It is definitely a must try and it can be an expensive meal or not an expensive meal depending on what you order.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bone marrow. It is is a must try! It is a great appetizer!

mKYvlx7YiU3sAgaZsPUyAg.text: Stopped in during a walk about in Tivoli village. It happened to be their brunch time on Saturday. There is a butcher and bar on the first floor and the restaurant is on the second.  Very classy how they take your name and walk you to your table. All the meat comes from the butcher downstairs, so naturally we had to try the burger, which was recommended with cedar cheese.  This was an excellent, juicy, well put together burger. For $16 it is well worth the price.  We also shared some portobello mushroom fires - lightly battered server with an awesome sauce.  Our server was very attentive as well as Beth, the manager, stopping by several times to inquire not just on the food, but the experience.  I look forward to returning to try some steak!!

IVXqJ4LTeG47fSBFHA91Ew.text: We've been coming here for the last several years every time we visit Vegas from LA and every single time, the food is perfect and service is impeccable.  For dinner we've had all their different types of steak and our favs are the filet mignon and their rib eye.  Side favorites include their Mac n cheese, the portebello fries (!!!), and their corn.  Today, we tried their Sunday brunch and like their dinner menu, everything is superb.  French toast was amazing, eggs Benedict sublime, and their short rib hash was definitely hearty. The ambience is light and bright and unlike most steakhouses.  And you just cannot  the reasonable prices. It's our very very favorite restaurant.

jlprX2xcH5kw-hBn2Sg3YA.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! The wait staff is fantastic! They love and know their dishes well! I had a lovely barramundi entree and enjoyed their special cauliflower side. It was some of the best I have ever had!  I want to try their butcher shop next! I will be back next time I'm in town! It's definitely one that is not to be missed!  The decor is fabulous and the ambience is rich! Totally love the vibe!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgeous decor! My new fav place in Las Vegas!

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barramundi with ponzu sauce! Fantastic!

TCYnQZBNv6qZ7WK_Sm2zYw.text: Fantastic meats and dishes. Worth the trip from the strip for reasonably priced delicious food at a wonderful location. I highly recommend Echo & Rig.

EnJFbcY10XxCrEoQ8EbqSQ.text: Amazing food, ambiance, and service. Drunken Goat Sandwich. Butternut Squash. Bone marrow. Avocado Toast. Asparagus and Fried Egg. Baked Brie. Portobello Fries.

rx9px8mrxgCFKU0img12MA.text: Giving a three star only due to setting. Very noisy and did not care for the head knocking music that everyone has to try and talk over. Lauren our waitress was awesome!!! Service is very good!!! Seating was very weak in regards to everyone seems to be on top of each other. Yes you will hear others full conversation. Still I would say to all people's it may be worth a try if you don't mind a loud setting and you will want to have a state farm attitude love your neighbor!

KtC8dm0CvwhsYQ5n7htCHw.text: Best Sunday brunch spot. Love the cherries they put in their mimosas. Also the veggie sandwich with apples is outstanding.

GG0s_N1FidNenUjpQfFmaw.text: You will find Echo & Rig's bright sign shining across from Brio and next to the David Barton Gym in the roundabout area inside the beautiful Tivoli Village.  This place seemed busy from the get-go. My family and I had arrived 10 minutes late for our 8 o'clock reservation and was sat after a 15 minute wait. "The first floor included a bar area (only enter if you are over 21 with an ID) and some round tables and chairs. It seemed like a waiting room. The music was already loud. There's a butcher shop downstairs as well.  Service 5/5 When we arrived at our table, we were quickly greeted by the manager, Jason, who was very friendly and explained that he liked introducing himself to people who have never ate at Echo & Rig before. Cool beans!   We were offered our choice of sparkling or flat water, complimentary, for each person at the table. Jason came back to explain the concept of the restaurant and a rundown of the menu and source of food (everything is fresh, basically!) Great information to know :)  Sam was our server and was very friendly as well. Not sure what my dad had asked, but Sam left and came back with a giant trey full of raw meat for the steak options. We ordered the Tomahawk steak, medium rare.   Food: 4.5/5 Not sure if they forgot the bread until last minute but the bread came a while after we ordered everything, very close to when the appetizers arrived. Anyhow it was still good as I was starving. The bread comes with very creamy butter.   Our appetizers came shortly after the bread. Per Sam's suggestions, we ordered the Watermelon Tomato Salad and Portobello Mushroom Fries.   The salad was very different -- yellow and red tomatoes mixed with sweet watermelon pieces topped with a vinaigrette sauce (reminds me of the sauce on mozzarella salads). I didn't love it but found it pretty good. May have to try it again for a real opinion.  The fries were delicious! The green sauce for the fries had a buttery taste to it that just fits perfectly with the mushroom fries.   Next came our entree. The tomahawk steak was done at the most perfect level of "medium rare" I have ever seen. My arms had hurt this today (lol arm day!!) so I had a weak grip on everything. Yet without using force, the steak was easily cut into pieces. The four choices of sauce were in the cutest little gravy cups. Great to have these four choices -- my family and I were able to try all the different sauces! The two dark ones I didn't enjoy too much (one was red wine I believe and the other had an A1 Sauce flavor to it). The two light ones were better (one had a slight cheesy flavor and the other had a very rich flavor I couldn't explain, but this yellow one was my favorite).   Accompanying the steak were the side dishes: grilled corn, roasted airloom carrots, and some chip dish I didn't particularly enjoy. The grilled corn was very rich in herbal flavor (something my mom didn't like at all). I'm indifferent about it... Would be wary with ordering this if you don't like strong herb tastes. The carrots were really good, fluffy and soft, with a slight burnt taste that made the overall flavor oddly delicious.   We ended our meal with one of each seasonal sorbet (and for us, the flavors were peach, blackberry, and grapefruit). Topped with real fruit, I loved this! On the downside, I came here for my birthday but I wasn't able to get a special dessert or anything :( but I can't get everything haha.   We shared all these dishes between four people perfectly and it was around $40 per person. Not too bad for the price!  Color me impressed! My first experience with Echo & Rig was quite positive. You can count on me to come here again for another occasion and bringing a fellow steak-lover.  --------------------------------------------------  BRUNCH REVIEW Bottomless mimosas and bloody mary option for $16, which is one of the more affordable bottomless options I've seen. It really was bottomless... our server, I forgot her name (but she was blonde), was so delightful and always made sure to fill our cup. In addition to that, she was hilarious and very interactive with our table. It was also great because they gave the orange juice and champagne separate, giving you the ability to make your mimosas just the way you like it.  My friend and I both ordered the steak scramble eggs and short ribs to share. Even though we both shared two dishes, we had leftovers. Both were good options though I would opt to try something else on the menu next time. The food is definitely a lot better for dinner but still great to try.

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon tomato salad
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello mushroom fries with green sauce

Pf3GydoUGT1ZgMF8Padabg.text: One of my favourite steakhouses, I've ordered the ribeye cap and the spencer  steak and both taste great, although I prefer the ribeye cap as it is more fattier, thus a bit more tastier.  My wife has had the salmon and the butterfish and she definitely prefers the butterfish, I've tried both and agree that the butterfish was tastier.    We've tried the brussels sprouts, portabello fries and proscuitto and grilled stone fruit appetizers and all were great.  My favourite was the proscuitto and grilled stone fruit.  Service has always been top notch.  This time I celebrated my anniversary with my wife and the staff definitely made our evening feel special, our waitress, Beth, was very professional and attentive and the manager came by a few times to check on us and to wish us happy anniversary.  We were  delighted when the restaurant treated us with a dessert to celebrate our anniversary.  I highly recommend this place for special occasions and for a great meal and dining experience.

K6w0kQzuhYuricAdHg8EEA.text: Ate here with several friends on our visit to Vegas last week. We had excellent service from Nicholas. We had lots of excellent meals.  I had the traditional eggs benedict - cooked perfectly with added pleasure of spinach.  Husband and several others had their short rib hash which was amazing!  Beware the portion is huge - if we ever got it again expect we would split it. Bottomless Mimosas - thank you very much!  With fresh squeezed OJ and a decent champagne and truly bottomless - they just kept pouring and pouring them until you put your hand over your glass.  And it's super nice that they serve the OJ in a separate carafe so you can mix it to your liking - a nice touch. Lots of other yummy sounding things in the menu - if I lived in the area, suspect I'd come here often. check it out!

8mvwtcQ8eJpTh3MCvxxjPQ.text: Straight hit, no miss.  Located in the Tivoli center off of Rampart and Alta, this meat house could not be in a better spot. Vallet is right outside, the butcher shop next door, and a beautiful shopping center to browse around. This is a 2 story restaurant with balcony seating upstairs.  This was a belated wedding dinner from our lovely maid of honor and best man Aurora and Michael, and I admit  a great choice. We walked in and was greeted by 4 hostess. Already reserved for a 6-oclock dinner, our table was well and ready upstairs  by their huge windows. Perfectly spaced tables, medium  low ambiance lighting, and uptempo music set the mood to the room. Servers were on their toes being attentive to their tables always on the move. Mellow fast paced.   Proud to say that Ramon was the perfect server. Aurora and Michael got us a (Nothing Bundt Cakes) wedding cake, and for no charge Ramon took it to the kitchen where it was kept for us until dinner ended. Ramon also gave us the 101 on all their different types of meat cuts and boy did we get a full run down.    What ordered: From the Steakhouse cuts 2 Rib-eyes 1 medium well (Mike), 1 medium rare (for me) 1 Rib-eye cap medium rare (wife) 1 Horseradish Crusted Butterfish  Sides/appetizers: Asparagus & Fried Egg Fried Calamari Portobello Fries & Herb Aioli Bone Marrow Carne Asada  Calamari, bone marrow, and fried portebello fries were served to us first. Oh my, the fries. Who would have thought that mushrooms make a good fry. Served with what looked like a avacado sauce, this app. was amazingly tasty. The marrow, mmmm mm mmmmm! The starters so far have set a great tone.   Tables cleaned after apps. were finished. New plates were set, new cutlery for the steaks, and yup, dinner is served.   "Do you see the size of these asparagus?" Thick, perfectly grilled/seared, with a perfect sunny side up egg to blanket them. The rib-eye nicely rubbed, served with house chips and a side stuffed portabello. At this point my shirt was soaked from all the drool coming from my watery mouth. lol.... The first cut into the rib-eye was buttery, and red just like I ordered, and that first bite, Oh my! The kitchen had to put me in the freezer after I melted onto their floor. It was that good. In fact the moment of silence throughout our table spoke for itself as to how good the food was. Their house chips by the way is "A Maze Zing!!".  All I can say is, I asked for a side of ranch/buttermilk, and this is the first time I eliminated a full rib-eye, side , and its flaky friends without having to dip.   Family + Great food + Ramon + Awesome service = 5 stars  Need to get your caveman on? This is your place.

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye

71ixWHWeT5CG4Y-GxJg-WQ.text: Las Vegas vacation and it seems we saved the best meal for last. Nicholas was our server although we felt like we had the entire staff waiting on us like we were VIPs. They worked together like a well choreographed team. The food was excellent and well-prepared. We had the Executive Chef stop by the table as well as the manager, Xavier, and they talked with us like old friends. Lamb was great, my steak was great, wild mushroom soup was excellent. I only wish we were local so we could come by more often. The kids loved it, the adults loved it and I can't recommend it enough!

3T8MrGLW7EleZevUMLC3Lg.text: Awesome place, server and GM Derek made us feel very comfortable and vip. We were tired from a long drive from Park City and from soup to nuts, everything was fantastic. Ordered the tomahawk steak, portabello fries, arugula salad, and a couple other things that we forgot, but it made the rest of the trip back home to Pasadena feeling satisfied and enjoyable. Thanks to a great staff and GM.  They will make you feel at home. This place is just as good as Mastros in BH.

rp6tBv54sxpqB1niXKP2EQ.text: I went there on Wednesday the 25th around 8 o'clock for a birthday celebration. This is normally our favorite restaurant, but for whatever reason the service was subpar! our waiter literally left 3 to 4 different times without taking the complete tables order. He was trying to do this thing where he takes the women's order first. Zigzagging from woman to woman getting their orders, 3 to 4 times he forgot to take either mine or another friends. We were not a large party, we had six people. On top of that three out of the six people had to send their  steaks back because they were undercooked. My wife ordered medium well and I came out medium rare. Any cook should be able to touch the meat and gauge weather or not the steak is medium rare or medium well. The disappointing thing is my wife had to sit there and watch everyone else eat. By the time her food came out we were all almost finished. So between the chef and the waiter I was really disappointed. The food is still good because the quality of the meat. When my wife went to the bathroom she heard a bunch of people complaining about the service and how long everyone's been there, not sure what was going on but I feel like I wasted 150 bucks.

TNKrKdjR_H6AIxbSmHzUeg.text: We have only been there 2 times, but in my mind, I would return again and again. The tri-tip is melt in your mouth delicious, amazing staff and servers, we have gone with parties of 4 both times, so out of 8 of us, we have all walked away blown away.....the last time we went, for four of us, each with our own entree, and ordering 2 sides for the table (mind you, no alcohol), the bill (before tip) only came to $105!!!! Not anywhere near as expensive as it would have every right to be....its a must go in my opinion! between our trips, we've had the tri tip, the butterfish...(amazing),. the jumping beef, the grilled cheese, the salad, the brussel sprouts, and more....all delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Celebrating birthdays, so on this night, they brought out a free dessert....so nice....
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best steaks! Melt in your mouth...and you can choose off the menu, or the ones they present at your table. Stellar service.
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food

a0lwNHxDmIxvqYT3IaWs8A.text: This review is strictly for their Thanksgiving dinner which you pre-order.   The turkey stuffing was the worst I have ever had...it tasted just like bread with very little flavor.  So bad we could not even eat it.  The gravy had no flavor...did not even taste like anything.  The mashed potatoes were okay.   The cranberry sauce was fine.  The turkey was just Ok.  Sorry Echo and Rig but you were off the mark on this one.  The pumpkin pie crust tasted like a pre-made grocery store crust, but I must say I think the grocery store would be even better.   Had a meal before there that was great, not sure why this one was a total miss. Won't be ordering Thanksgiving dinner again.  A big disappointment and it was not cheap either.

qtR0hKXqTzRyPQAf2ei6Fg.text: Our server Ricky was great! He knew his menu spot on. This is my second time at Echo & Rig and their customer service is consistent. I had the jumping beef which was a great dish because it was light yet filling. Reasonable prices too.

xIdlIR47wFViizh25Ypr6Q.text: There are 102 NEGATIVE reviews for this restaurant and it's for a good reason!!!! If you try to make a reservation when you call their phone number no one answers.  If you're lucky enough to actually speak to a reservation host she'll take your information and when you arrive you will NOT be on the reservation list !!!  The consistency of their food is hit and miss. You are much better off playing the billion dollar lottery and win.   If you have reservations for six or more people  you may get a server to take your order and  get it right and pay attention to you. Less than that forget it you're on your own.   If you looking for a ambience cafeteria style WITH LOTS OF NOISE this is the place for you!   The general manager and all his assistant are  brain-dead. !!! So DO NOT except them to act like real General Managers in a high quality restaurant.  This restaurant is fortunate  enough to be located in Las Vegas due to the multitudes of tourists.  Locals would never return for a repeat of this awful food and service.   CHECK ALL THE REVIEWS. It will save you time, Money and aggravation.  MR. Never Eat Hear P.S. I gave this place one star, because it's located in Tivoli. Thus way you could find other restaurants and have a nice dinner out!!

TmhpIgqXdwRNauXHJJIqfw.text: Amazing steak and service. The sides were excellent garlic mash potatoes and asparagus with egg. I will be back. Best steak we have ever had. Family friendly as well.

QVYrA5TvcSFy7ct9Dg6yLA.text: While flying from Boston on JetBlue using the Wi-Fi, I was perusing the Yelp site looking for a great place to dine tonight.  I found this restaurant with its super positive reviews so I emailed them asking for a reservation.  I was delighted when I received an email response from the GM- Derek Scharadin & he confirmed us for a dinner reservation.  We can't stop raving about the Avocado toast with spicy shahito peppers, Bbq bacon, fried spinach salad with broccoli & cauliflower, pork belly with slaw and the deliciously- seasoned flank steak.  Can't wait to come back!

KxUFQ5JZ1BvpatQl22O_Jw.text: Found this place on yelp. Everything was excellent. Great service (Ricky was our server, very knowledgable and friendly and willing to do whatever it takes, a rarity these days), atmosphere, and food. Salads and sides are generous, we over ordered but don't mind because we now have leftovers! Steak, and fish are both amazing. Love the complementary sparkling water as well. We're definitely coming back. Reasonably priced as well for the quality, a great value!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I22rSXv-Y1L5TTggNVDdLw.text: Impeccable service.  Known by name. Mind you I've only dined twice. Formal attention business casual dining.  The house was full and it was only 6:30 so call ahead even weekday.  One of the best steaks eaten (like butter).

nVAXzgotAJOHmYoUSd1dpw.text: This is my local Vegas friends go to. Anytime I am staying off the strip or even just in town long enough I make my way to this place. Their brunch is absolutely delicious and their drinks are fun too. I wish I could remember my servers name but she is a sharp and funny, perhaps even spunky would be the right description. Either way, she always leads me the right way with a cocktail, wine choice, and of course the food itself. The steak is so good and I have ordered it to share as an app when I wanted to try a new dish. The short rib hash is my fiance's favorite and I always steal a bite or two. One time I had the grilled cheese and dear god I couldn't finish it but I certainly tried! We ordered that to share last time cause everyone wanted some. I only had one negative experience at this place and it was with a large group and what seemed to be a new server. It won't stop me from coming back.

x_dWRe6QJpxua5gzXSRA7w.text: My best friend and I flew out to Las Vegas for the rock n roll half marathon, and this restaurant was recommended to us for our day trip out to Red Rock Canyon. Absolutely the best food we've enjoyed this entire week! I had the wild mushroom soup and BLT.. My friend had the drunken goat and we split the portobello fries. Everything was so delicious, it's difficult to even name a favorite. Nothing lacked flavor and the service was outstanding. Our waiter took his time sharing details about the food to us to help us chose our menu items. If you're ever in the area, please stop by! Not to mention, the area and restaurant are absolutely stunning.

w_2URPQuLYXflUbEFcG2Zw.text: Molly was absolutely amazing! She was on top of everything, and never left our mimosa glasses empty! Coming back in the future to see her!

OwYOiB_jFeL61pAdTPb7og.text: Best bacon lettuce tomato sandwich ever services beyond great. We really enjoy sitting out on the patio in the open air. Lunch today there was great be sure if you're going to dinner there to make reservations.

501Wwq8hbJkAPQuyPKFe-A.text: I dined here back in November and found this place while surfing on yelp, one word "AWESOME!!!" Service is the best I've ever experienced, from the moment we arrived, the girl at the desk was very pleasant and friendly. The hostess that showed us to the table - I never saw the back of her head as she welcomed and thanked us for joining them for dinner, also asking how did we find out about their establishment, as we were seated and she said, "enjoy". The manager, Xavier, came right over and introduced himself, welcoming us as well, asking us if our table was okay and if there is anything at all we needed don't hesitate to call him over and enjoy your experience. As soon as he turned, our waiter Jason arrived and welcomed us, he was very humorous as well as informative, the best waiter we ever had! The fine dining restaurants In Vegas should train there staff at Echo & Rig. I don't want to spoil the experience and go into detail, but this is the place to go, I will dine here every time I'm In Vegas. I felt like a V.I.P. at Echo & Rig, Thank You for a wonderful experience...  P.S. The food..... OMG!!!...

iYZbHNuebPEvLPMtS7cmGA.text: Brunch here is awesome. Prices aren't bad either and the atmosphere is great.

ud3oBnSmpyXkiAAzBVI9Uw.text: Not at all impressed with the customer service. I stopped in this evening for a cocktail at about 10:45, I was told that the kitchen closed in a few minutes. This was not even an issue as I was stopping to have a cocktail. While there I ran into some friends there celebrating a birthday, asked them to join me at the bar and was told well we've already closed. It would have been nice to know this when I walked in, as I would not have spent $15.00 on a crown at the bar only to be rushed out. I would be hard pressed to return to a place that is ot very customer friendly.

TtffAGGIHyrEKHq2A4ibUg.text: If you are looking for the best brunch place in Las Vegas, look no further. The food is amazing. The service is impeccable.  And let's not forget bottomless mimosas with a great view of Tivoli Village. I highly recommend this to any girlfriends looking to connect.

2dV9g6eJOYr1iRXJfDcMVw.text: I have been to echo and rig 3 times and each time the service was exceptional.  This last time, however, Ricky and Xavier made us feel like royalty.  We were sat originally near a door but Xavier thoughtfully offered to move us somewhere less drafty.  We decided a corner table on the patio under a heat lamp would be the most comfortable.    Ricky, our server, was very knowledgable on the menu and wine selection.  I am a server as well and I'll be honest.  I learned a thing or two from him.  We started with the pork belly which was out of this world.  For the main course my date went with Ricky's recommendation, the spencer steak.  She found it delicious but we both agreed my lamb chops were the best dish of the night.  We were both so impressed with the lamb that I put my knife and fork down and dove in with my hands.  We finished the night off with the shortcake and cappuccinos.    Thanks again Ricky and Xavier!

Ie1wQQHjYkMyeCPHJupFdQ.text: Here's the lowdown ~  THE GOOD: + amazing service + nice atmosphere + portobello fries + mac and cheese  THE DECENT: ~ mashed potatoes ~ brussels sprouts  THE BAD: - burnt bread served with the carne asada bone marrow  - overcooked or underdone steaks - raw scallops  We were a party of six, and literally, every single one of our proteins were cooked incorrectly. The five people who ordered steaks received them overcooked or underdone. They were all sent back to be recooked, with the exception of one, who was too hungry to wait. My scallops were raw, but they did remake the plate and didn't charge us for it, which I appreciated.  Overall, I really appreciated that the management was super apologetic and tried to amend for the mistakes made, the service was friendly, and the sides/appetizers were delicious. But I just can't recommend a steakhouse who can't cook a steak, let alone serve burnt bread at a place that charges $30 - $50 per plate.  It must have been an off night, but it was really embarrassing and disappointing to recommend this place to our friends and the execution be so poor since we had previously really enjoyed the place.

_oQD9-XQKwjJGWipkyfPQw.text: This our first time here and I guarantee that we will be coming back. The food was delicious and the staff was great. Hugo was our server and he was great. The filet I ordered was cooked perfectly and the side dish, the asparagus with the fried egg, was also excellent. My husband had no complaints about his Spencer steak. We left there totally satisfied with the ambiance, drinks, food and service.  We were seated outside which was perfect.  We agreed that we are definitely coming back!!

Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Pot  Pie
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet

9kvmZEaE9DHDK195AwK1Lg.text: This was the best dinner my husband and I have had ever I think. Hugo our server was awesome and super attentive, making sure our glasses of water never got more than half empty. I ordered the Spencer Steak and my husband ordered the Colorado Lamb Chop and we both shared their Mac and Cheese. Everything was incredibly delicious and we cannot wait to come back and bring the rest of our family to enjoy this amazing food/service!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black &amp; Blue Mojito
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Spencer Steak, Mac &amp; Cheese

K75qXjFXiZVTQOlR9iuJUA.text: Place is great. Staff on it! Very impressive. Food outstanding. Fun atmosphere. Outside Area cool place to enjoy a meal

s_IceCqjxPGw3rI-7zhzeg.text: What a great find ...Tivoli Village is just a beautiful setting at night...but this restaurant was just special. Downstairs is a sit down bar on one side and butcher shop on the other. A beautiful staircase takes you up to a large open restaurant with a beautiful huge outdoor dining patio. We sat outside and it just added to the beauty. Austin, our server, was so accommodating and very informative. He took special care to make sure that my order was as sodium free as possible. The table bread was delish and the whipped butter was so light and just perfect. My 13yo ordered the grilled cheese w/short rib and 3 cheeses (he is a picky eater and he was in heaven), my oldest got the beef pot pie with the side of garlic white cheddar mash...both were terrific! I ordered the mache salad w/pulled white meat chicken (lemon dressing on the side) and the side of asparagus w/fried egg (ummm yummm!!) I will now add fried egg next time I grill at home. They went the extra mile and brought a fabulous complimentary turtle birthday sundae for my big guys birthday ...and it was truly divine! I cannot wait to come back again on our next trip back to Nevada!!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus &amp; Fried Egg
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Cheese Sandwich with short rib and homemade chips
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pot pie ( filet mignon and short rib meat inside) we would never order this but it was so good

IHQ7HcEC9eKCwLpBjegreg.text: This was far and away one of the best dining experience that my wife and I have ever had. Now that is saying something considering we've dined all over the country. We dined here the night before we renewed our wedding vows, along with celebrating my 40th birthday. Echo and Rig did not disappoint.  The food and service is spectacular! Absolutely amazing from the ambience of the decor in the dining area, to the food presentation. It is extraordinary!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aTMWj16rEl7_LAgzGNs9uw.text: After hearing so many friends and family raving over their experience here, I wanted to try it out for myself! I went to brunch with a few friends and it definitely lived up to the hype. The only thing that maybe could have been avoided was there was not really anywhere to wait, as the rest of the party hadn't arrived yet, and we had a large table upstairs. It was pretty crowded and busy, but hey, i guess that's a good thing!  The food was absolutely delicious and the bottomless mimosas are truly bottomless, and also delicious. Service was great, and the waiter was super attentive and accommodating to our larger group, especially towards the end with the separate checks.   I love how the use of different wood is used throughout the decor giving it a raw, yet sophisticated feel yet still hip and trendy.  I WILL be back for dinner and can't wait to see the ambience of the dining room at night!  I have a feeling it'll be amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GAFvrqIypYdgvO2BtbLR2w.text: We dined at Echo & Rig today and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We were offered upstairs seating as an option which provided an excellent and relaxing view. We received a prompt greeting by Joy who provided us the detail we requested to have an optimal experience of the restaurant. I would like to say that Joy set the bar for what exceptional customer service means and is someone I'd consider an asset to any team. We departed with nothing but an outstanding experience from the food, presentation, and server. We will return soon and would highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3nUY_fhsADQplpxwwxi6BQ.text: For my wife's birthday she wanted to find a steakhouse off the strip with food that is out of this word. She found it for sure. We made the reservation via Opentable, and they had plenty of openings even for a Saturday Night. We were a few minutes late, but that was not a worry and they were accommodating. The hostesses were friendly and nice. We had asked for a seat with a view and they didn't disappoint as we had the corner table on the balcony. As we sat down the bus boy and manager were there to greet us and to ask what water we would like.  Next came the waiter Ramon, who addressed the fact it was my wife's birthday while also wishing her a happy birthday. Knowing it was our first time they brought the display of meat and explained each cut. It was quite informational and helped decide what we wanted for dinner. After Ramon returned from dropping off the plate of meat we ordered our dinner.  Appetizers: Crab Crakes - Flaky, Fresh Crab, Moist, and smooth sauce Fried Oysters in a Jalapeno Maple Syrup Sauce - Cooked very well, lots of flavor, and the sauce was sweet and spicy Dinner Filet Mignon - Was cooked just a little above order, but the meat was a melt in your mouth good. Even better because it was cooked over the woodfire grill. (Note it came with inhouse made chips) Rib-Eye Cap - WOW. This was full of flavor, cooked just right, and again the woodfire grill made it just that much better.  During both the appetizer course and dinner course Ramon and the Manager continued to check on us ensuring we had everything we wanted at the time. Some of the best service I have had in a long time. I commend the restaurant for this. Sad to say you don't see customer service like this very often. Even the waiter who brought the drinks throughout the night was a kick and very professional. As we finished dinner we were treated with a Carmel Turtle Sundae. This was on the house for my wife's birthday dessert. The ice cream was silky smooth and full of flavor. The toppings were good, but we are not big on carmel. I had ordered a port with my dessert, but unbeknownst to the waiter they were out of that port. The manager and Ramon visited the table to explain and they were going to comp me an equal 20yr port. After getting the port, it too didn't disappoint. Their recommendation was spot on for a good dessert port. Lastly, as we finished up and headed out. I made sure to thank Ramon for a great dinner, but also the manager Celine. The evening was one to remember and we would recommend this steakhouse to anyone who is in the area.

25Tq8Cu06jMSphq5Uc-Gng.text: My boyfriend and I were visiting friends in Vegas for the week. They are regulars to this restaurant, so we were super excited to try it.  We were treated exceptionally well from the moment we walked through the door.  We did have a reservation, so we were seated immediately. Our server was Nicholas and he made the experience 5+ stars. He was polite and explained the entire meal to us in detail.   We ordered an assortment of smaller plates including the Bacon, Kale Salad, and Portobello Mushrooms.The bacon was the best small plate we tasted. The bacon was so smokey and delicious.  3 of us order steaks and 1 salmon dish. It was the best steak I have ever tasted. It was tender and cooked to perfection. We ordered carrots and brussel sprouts as additions for the table to share.   Nicholas even brought complimentary desserts of Caramel Truffle Ice Cream. The Ice cream was phenomenal and I ate the entire bowl of it.  You truly feel like you are the most important person to come into the restaurant and I truly appreciate the care they take of their customers. When we come back to Vegas, we will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strip

llFX45Nm1MstOOkvIdPZaA.text: Place is nice and it can get busy quick  . Recommend to get reservations otherwise you might not be able to get in  We try to get reservations on Sat but everything filled up so we got Sun instead I love their fried spinach salad since it is different and excellent. I don't think the salad offer from any places except this one. The calamari was also delicious but the bone marrow was mediocre and I don't know why many yelpers recommend that dish. It is different but I would never ordered it again since I feel I am eating a blubber of fat on my toast.  Rib eye got the smoked flavor but the meat wasn't soft.  For 37$ ribeye on their menu I was a little disappointed since I would expected it would be better than the rib eye  I make at home. They do have more options of meat on their tray but I am glad I didn't choose any of those since I know the cost will be more. My friend got snapper , she stated it was good but too salty  Overall it was nice , servers were very attentive but the steak was a little bit disappointed

pBMAOfcz3nV8eEP6zLiPJQ.text: I love this place.  It has been a staple in my family's steak outings before Yelp got huge.  The quality of the meat for the price is what gets me.  But the way the staff treats you, the ambience, and the food itself is what keeps me coming back.  The steaks are well prepared and the sides are something you won't normally find anywhere else.  This place is awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Spencer Steak is lean with just the right amount of marbling. My favorite
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello Fries is a must

NIplTAL9DrZsW5TjLRiNJQ.text: GREAT steakhouse.  I've gone here several times and the service and food is always great.

Vh5kGw-uxlmRCkCLcTcxag.text: It's places like this that remind me that there is more to Las Vegas than the strip. This has been a place that Jacob and I have wanted to go to for a while now and saved it for Valentine's Day.   There was not a Valentine's Day menu for this location, but that didn't both us as it gave us the opportunity to taste many items on their menu.   One thing to take note is, there is no corkage fee! So bring your own wine if you know exactly wheat you want to eat.   Because we tried so many things I would just like to shout out a few key items.  1. Those portabella fries are my favorite thing here and is my number 1 (Jacob would say it's his third favorite, but he isn't writing this :P) 2. The side of carrots (Jacob's number 1), they are super yummy 3. The bacon with BBQ sauce (Jacob's 2), that bacon is yummy 4. The charred steaks. They have a nice char on the outside and are True to their temperatures. I loved their creamy horseradish!!   We finished with the salted caramel sundae which was both fun and delicious. Sadly I turned away for a few seconds too long and Jacob ate most of it.   The service here is phenomenal. They try to leave you in peace and are extremely respectful, but we love talking to people and could see just how much the staff loves Echo & Rig as much as we do!   Happy Eating!

TuHXLpyZkx04XIKvGgwn6w.text: Amazing!! We took a chance on Echo and Rig and we're not disappointed. We took a Lyft from the strip and would do it again! Beautiful restaurant, genuine kind staff. The manager came over to greet us and wish us happy birthday and it was not forced or desperate. Prices were affordable and food was spectacular. Farm to table with an end to end butcher! Our total came to $101 after drinks, dinner and dessert for two. We were expecting to pay at least $250. Shout out to Beth! She was an amazing waitress and cared for our every need. Our glasses were never empty. Highly recommend the Bavette steak. A little smaller than most but the flavor was beyond anything I've tasted. Oh, and the mushroom fries we ! Thanks for a great evening, Echo and Rig!

dlMCbn2KN4EaVDJMn6chQw.text: Not only is the place reasonably priced.. it's so yummy. The service is fantastic. Definitely going to be my go to steak house from now on. Shane was so awesome to me and my girlfriend!! It was our 3 year anniversary. Thank you so much for making this memorable.

_MmAKCqLeY5Sfz7nDX1GXA.text: This was our second time visiting Echo and Rig. Our first visit was so delicious, we were back for round 2 while visiting Vegas. This visit was not as amazing. The staff was attentive and incredible but my entree left something to be desired. Let me start at the beginning. Our crispy bacon appetizer was delicious. Crisp, as promised, with a delightful BBQ sauce. My husband ordered a medium-rare ribeye which arrived more on the rare side. He roughed it out because he's not a complainer. I gave the waiter 2 entree choices (horseradish encrusted butterfish or lasagne and he picked the former). It arrived VERY over done. The dried out fish totally overwhelmed the possible "butter" flavor. I got more sauce to help it out but it was very disappointing and I was super hungry so I managed to get it down. We were celebrating our anniversary that evening and they brought some delicious ice cream with chocolate and caramel bits for us to share. As for the ambiance, I know it's not the fault of the restaurant but sadly when people allow their children to run around a restaurant it detracts from my enjoyment. About half way through our meal, about 3 families arrived with children (who ran up the stairs and then over to the table yelling at one another then went for a bathroom break and walked out fairly calmly but returned like gangbusters sprinting to the table and shouting to each other). I don't know that I will rush back when in town again. It was not the sublime experience we had a couple years ago.

31WnU_SfdhWBbOXWgLGxyA.text: My husband and I went here last night for a Pre Valentines dinner and we enjoyed the Portobello Mushroom fries, Roasted garlic mashed potatoes, the linguini w/clams (mine's ) & my husband had the 40 oz T-Bone steak...let me tell you...this place is   ! I did pay a pretty penny but my man is WORTH IT! The food is delightfully delicious and we enjoyed it. The manager greeted us and gave me her business card when we left...my husband gave a BiG tip (which I was surprised) so he said we will definitely come back again . Thank you Echo & Rig for the great food and lovely service!!

Wm8JwY7Xdoeim1v46rfkrQ.text: i have been at this place few times. I have always been impressed with the food and service. I thought it was a greatest of local restaurants !  but  today i went to bar downstair tried to grab some light food. when i asked bartender "do you guys have bar food" , he said  we have appetizers but if you want bar food, go to next door has bar(why you have to tell me to go another place since i already seat here????)     then, when we finished paid and stood up to leave this place, two or three bartenders were talking and ignore us( for sure they saw us leaving) but they didn't say anythings such as thank you for coming ????  ( they probably didn't know we tip them $20 out of $68 bills,lol , what is that ? cuz we didnt dress up,? cuz they think we wont spend that much money ? that  was really really makes costumer feel unhappy  !!!

IP6bEc_t6Mf2hbacrpRq3A.text: Today was a celebration of our 8th wedding anniversary so a few weeks ago i  began dropping hints to my wife about this place being among the finalists. I had dined here previously and really liked it. We agreed that Tivoli Village is great convenient location and that Echo & Rig was the place to celebrate.   Service here is A+. The greeter used our names repeatedly as did the server and restuarant manager who came by twice to check in with us and wish us a happy anniversary. Austin was our server and he was very helpful, pleasant and accommodating. I made it a point to remember his name as he knew ours.   The bottom floor consists of a swanky bar area and in house butcher where the meat is hand cut. Upstairs has both indoor and an outside dining patio with a great view of the roundabout and Brio restuarant.  I had the Spencer steak. Cooked to perfection and just as described by austin as being a lean cut of meat. Sides included Macaroni and cheese, grilled asparagus with egg & cheese topping, caesar salad. My plate had tasty homemade chips and a baked Portobello mushroom. My wife ordered the butterfish. Both meals were excellent!!  FYI, we did not order any alcohol with the meal, just 2 waters and a diet coke. Dessert was complimentary and consisted of a giant cookie broke in half with ice cream, sliced apples and fresh cream topping. Yummy!  I really feel that you get alot for your $ here and represents a great value for the experience for either breakfast, lunch or dinner. The ambiance is very upscale befitting the overall theme of Tivoli Village. We love coming here and we will be back. I recommend Echo & Rig. Give em a try. You wont be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple Pie for dessert. Perfect for 2 people to split
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome Macaroni and cheese!
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Asparagus with egg &amp; cheese

opHVRZW7BnYuZ7RlioqIug.text: Amazing food, great atmosphere, servers were attentive but not overly. Great prices too.  Table orders the bacon, lamb cigars and calamari. All were delicious!  I had the sea bass and broccolini, it was delicious!  Definitely will be back

OTId_PHt1-wMFmPLIW5N9g.text: Just stopped in for happy hour. Love the staff, great steak and eggs on the menu. My hubby dug the Kobe beef hot dogs. The best part was that cocktails I was paying $20 for at our hotel were only $6 during HO. Next time look forward to the full butchery experience. Only 4 stars because the shrimp cocktail was disappointing.

x5GN_VVQDZVj3ykzbm6JKw.text: Firstly, we dined at Echo and Rig for my husband's birthday, this was the first time he or I had dined here. I received a call confirming my reservation the woman who called (cannot remember her name for the life of me) she explained that our reservation was for 10:15am (we dined for brunch) and that we were allotted 2hrs at our table and then it was reserved for someone else afterwards (I was not informed this when making the reservation). She also stated that we had to pay together (which is fine) but would've been nice to know at the time of me making the reservation so that I could tell my guests, but no big deal.   So we arrive and they seat us promptly. We get to our table and it takes our waiter about 15 minutes to get to us mind you were only "allotted" 2hrs at our table so it's now 10:30-ish. Our waiter finally comes and, gets our drink orders and 5 of us order bottomless mimosas. Our mimosa come 10 minutes after ordering and once we got those we decided to just go ahead and ordered food because we didn't want to lose anymore time waiting...Quite frankly the rushed feeling is not enjoyable.  Anyway, bottomless mimosas to me means my drink is kept refilled until I call it quits or our allotted time was up. We were now 45 minutes into our first hour and still had not had a second refill on our bottomless mimosas.   Now the food wait begins...we did not get our food until half past 11, leaving us with eh 30 minutes to eat and finish our "bottomless mimosas"   Our food finally comes, the Caesar salad was the best thing about the entire experience oh and the sugar scrub in the bathroom LOVED that anyway, I assume the Manager checks with every table to see if our experience is going good, so he comes, he asks and I respond "eh it's been okay" and he says "okay? What's going on?" And I explain the issues with the time and the lack of what we're paying for and the over feeling of being rushed so he says he'll get the waiters over to take care of the of refills on our drinks and he will get us dessert and take care of a "few things" on the bill.   So the bill comes and nothing, no sort of discount, NOTHING. So I ask our waiter and he says "he took care of the desserts for y'all." Desserts we hadn't planned on getting? Oh great that was so generous of him. So by the end of our dinning experience we had 4 mimosas, I had 5 because my husband gave me his, free desserts, and a sour taste in our mouths about Echo and Rig. Heard great things about this place but my experience definitely didn't live up to that.

xAAaL6_-HPSeuDxN_HhPnQ.text: This place is great! Located in the Tivoli Plaza in Summerlin, Echo & Rig is conveniently located at the round about across from Brio Tuscan Grill. When you walk in, you'll see a bunch of meat for sale, all properly labeled (this place is also a butcher shop!). Reviews say they're all great, but I have yet to try as I only came for brunch.   For brunch, I really enjoyed the NY egg breakfast sandwich (only $7!) and the short rib hash. Both were super delicious and full of flavor. The short rib wasn't too dry, and I really felt as if I was getting quality food with each bite. The workers and managers were all very attentive and friendly, which I really appreciated as well.   All in all, I felt like the NY egg sandwich was still my favorite. The egg was runny, and the bread was so soft. I would not hesitate at all to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib hash
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sandwich

4mYfEEf9njw4SZ3HUdMBOg.text: We came here for my husband's birthday and were very impressed! Our server was friendly, helpful, and understanding especially because half of our party arrived earlier than the reservation. All of the food was outstanding and we had a great time!

Zs_ip2IcSdcCN8zM-diNUQ.text: This place was fantastic! Food was amazing, the variety of appetizers that sounds (and are!) delicious is quasi overwhelming, the service was excellent (thanks to our wonderful waitress) and the wine selection was wide enough as you would expect from a quality steakhouse.  We ate like kings and queens and we really enjoyed every dish; we had a lot of things to eat (portobello fries, bacon, pork belly, caesar salad, filet mignon, rib eye cap, rib eye, etc. to name a few) and everything was top notch.   The bonus? It is reasonably priced on top of serving meat from cattle that is not given antibiotics or hormones and is grass fed.

NIrtP1YJnLQxMKM9MjEtqw.text: Amazing. AMAZING. AHH-MAZ-ING! Love everything about this place- exceptional food and service. Have had both brunch and dinner there, and everytime it has been fantastic! Highly recommended.

Ees1kDJH4Xj0pMv_KQfw7Q.text: We've been here only once - yesterday, and it immediately became one of our favorite places to eat.  Me and beau had a date yesterday, which we didn't really plan ahead. So when we decided to go out all of a sudden at 5 pm, we remembered that we had echo&rig listed in our to try collection forever. We called and made a reservation for 7pm, I liked how they asked if that was a special occasion. We arrived at 7pm and were escorted to our table immediately. Water and bread were served fairly quick. Bread was good not warm, which is a shame. It would taste amazing if it was! We ordered drinks - vodka and tonic for my gf and lemon drop for me. They prepared everything but served us our drinks at our table, which was cool. Live entertainment lol Then we ordered food - Caesar salad, portobello fries, ribeye steak medium well with a side of garlic mashed potatoes and spinach - all to share. Timing for everything was PURRRFECT! We got our salad and portobello fries first. First thing that I loved was that they split our salad for us. I love when restaurants do that - it's so simple yet it shows impeccable service and class! They didn't bring our main course right after we finished our apps, which was perfect and very thoughtful. We had time to digest our food a little bit before being served more. I think there were good 10-12 minutes before they brought our dinner - it was perfect! Anywho, they brought our steak. It was perfectly cooked, it had a nice crust and it tasted charcoal (in a good way). Meat was tender, edges were crispy. I enjoyed EVERY bite! Mashed potatoes were bomb! Spinach was also really good. I liked that it didn't even look sauteed - it was pretty crunchy :)  All in all, everything was great - service, food, ambience!  5 stars for every single thing we ordered including drinks - everything was high quality, flavorful, and simply delicious.   We can't wait to be back! P. S. I took photos of apps but once I saw the steak.... My mind went blank - so no photos of the steak and side dishes peeps lol

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_SHZx1lecCOIVvJFp4abwQ.text: I have been to Echo & Rig a few times with my husband and with family and friends. The service is always fantastic. The food is great. They have a bleu cheese sauce that is excellent. Almost addictive. The salmon is fantastic. My husband loves the filet there.  Though the food is great, I still have trouble with the price. It is a bit too high for me. So, this place is a treat for my husband and myself. What I really love is the butcher shop downstairs! I can finally get fresh kielbasa!! I am thankful I found a place that has it fresh.

E_nphHZDMuDjzNYKWGkgLg.text: This was an amazing meal and super affordable. We started with the mushroom soup and I'm normally not a fan but wow! It was tasty without being over powering. My husband had the bone marrow which he said was the best he'd ever had and he tries it every time he finds it on a menu. I had the classic ribeye and the flavor was on par! It was cooked perfectly! He had a chicken sandwich which he also enjoyed. I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restroom with hand scrub!
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone Bone Marrow Carne Asada

CC9quiSchlFdt2YKWmA71Q.text: This is one of the best restaurants that I've eaten at in Vegas. Excellent menu. The beef tartare and pork belly appetizers are incredible and the cap steak is perfection. I loved every moment in this restaurant and can't wait to return.

WmLIaDwOvzs_nQvi1tRNHw.text: It has been years since we went to Echo & Rig, so time for an update. The last time was for a late Happy Hour, which no longer exists :(  We skipped the Cinco de Mayo street food crowd, and waited about 10 minutes to be seated. The hostess didn't ask if we wanted to sit outside, but led us right to the balcony. The weather was simply perfect for an al fresco meal. The chairs would have been comfortable if I weren't longitudinally challenged, but the loose cushions were a big plus, and I was able to make my own booster seat!  Our waiter, Ryan, was the best - attentive, smart, and considerate of our less-than-lumberjack appetites.   This is the only restaurant where I've seen the term "half glass" on the wine list, so I had to ask. It's a 3 oz. pour, and the explanation made a lot of sense. I had a glass of cava, though. I love my bubbly!  We shared an Over the Rainbow salad, a hearty mix of farro, quinoa, veggies, and nuts. The kitchen split it for us, and I was full before I finished my half. I was glad we'd decided to share a sandwich, the hanger steak. Neither one of us could have handled a second one.  We loved our meal, but I do have two nits: both the bread served before ordering and the baguette for the sandwich had soft crusts. I know that bread with crunch is sorely lacking in these parts, but some restaurants have managed to do it. Echo & Rig should, too.  The second complaint is that the steak, while tender, was way oversalted. We should have asked for no extra salt, but forgot. I also learned that one of the seasonings used is tallow; that's beef fat, and I wish I didn't know that; I feel my arteries clogging just to think of it! We were surprised to find that the sandwich came with fresh chips; they had salt, of course,  but not too much, and the delicious crispiness was welcome.  At the end of our dinner, which was shortly before closing, we had a terrific discussion with Ryan about the state of our country, and he got extra brownie points for being on our side of the aisle. I love it when servers interact with us instead of being automatons, and this was another layer of praise for the overall fine meal we enjoyed. We won't wait so long to return!
