iKLpY-oHNGAItMcj3dx6Tw.text: Superb people - superb food, great appetizers, great people - great atmosphere, what else could you ask for.  The girl greeting everyone wasn't too pleasant. - Will come back.. ! Great to impress boss, new client, new girlfriend.. everyone.. !

kwQPuf1aF9J2drch4gjdTg.text: I'm reviewing the butcher here; not the restaurant (haven't tried that).  The meat is of the highest quality. It's definitely not cheap, but you get what you ppay for here. Aaron - the head butcher - is very customer-orientated. He said his goal was to be like the local butcher as you'd have in place like the UK or Ireland, and he means it. I love this place.

MiCExG8XgVvcMGG7mccqFA.text: A wonderful place!  I took my family there to celebrate my husbands birthday Saturday evening.  We had reservations that I ended up changing about 10 times throughout the course of the day (sorry guys) as everyone was getting prettied up and the party of people was increasing as well.  However, they were always very flexible and accommodating which was nice.  We finally made it there, 15 minutes late for our reservation.  Still, nice and accommodating!  We were seated after about a 5 minute wait and although it was late evening Saturday, and two of our party were stragglers, we didn't feel rushed.  The food was excellent!  My husband had steak and I stuck with the lamb.  The kids had what kids have, sandwiches but they seemed satisfied.  Our guests enjoyed lasagna and we loved the appetizers and the variety as well.  The manager personally comes out to introduce himself and our server was wonderful as well.  We appreciate feeling like celebrities when dining out for special occasions.  It makes the experience that much nicer.  Thank you!  P.S.  I say not good for kids because although there were sandwiches and items such as that on the menu, some kids are funny about bread types and such- therefore I would recommend for adults.

SvM0mGFXmw9ONmqNGge4Kg.text: Echo kind of fell off of my radar the past year, not for any other reason than there are just too many and so many great restaurants in Vegas to check out.  But, considering it's only 5 minutes from my house it really should be in the rotation more often.  Anyway, went here recently to meet a friend for Friday afternoon drunch (drinks and lunch, so much better than calling it brunch), sat on the balcony patio enjoying the soft fall air and a view of downtown Vegas in the background, and it all came back to me.  The little skip of my heart when I take that first bite of the fried spinach salad, with it's lime vinaigrette dressing and crunchy veggies.  The perfection of the Portabello fries, how they aren't greasy or soggy, not even a bit, matched with the freshness and zip of the goddess dressing they're served with.  And then there's the butcher's sausage dish.  Smokey and seasoned to perfection, with a mushroom ragu that tasted like it was made to order and not sitting in a pot all day waiting to be served.  The service, as always, was amazing.  Our waitress was cheery, patient (my drunch date was 30 mintues late), and efficient.  Put this in your bookmarks list.  You won't be disappointed.

pWuCQxL_sRAjC_uIsSG4dA.text: I always come here to eat at the bar. Quick and fast service. The steak tartare is a must, steak and eggs were the size of my palm, the octopus is delicious, so was the broccolini. But I was not a fan of the scallop crudo at all. Their small plates are perfect to sit and share while having some cocktails.

7AaXhx0Qpnb4KXppVqI9Ig.text: Came out for my brother in laws birthday dinner and I have to say this place is amazing! We started with the calamari and pork belly which was a great way to start our meal. I ordered the Bavette medium rare and it was delicious to say the least! My wife ordered the Rib Eye Cap and was not let down on how well it was cooked. We complimented this wonderful experience with a glass of Cabernet. I highly recommend this place to everyone!

GSxLOdFNUpK987SAJc30kg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in town! The prices definitely reflect the quality of food and service. The first time I came here the server was patient, helpful, and friendly. He explained the theme, the presentation, and menu of the restaurant. He also brought out the different type of meats served and explained how each type differed. I ordered the ribeye medium with red wine demi, and wow! Nothing has topped or even matched the quality of the steak here. The meat is a big portion, and cooked to perfection. Each bite is so tender and the red wine demi compliments the steak so well. The appetizers are also definitely worth mentioning. The baked brie, portobello fries, cauliflower, octopus, and thick cut bacon are among my top picks. They are shareable and are uniquely made in regards to seasonings and flavor.

wRLMBo-em2IdaapOcdjZjA.text: This place is exceptional! It is one of my two favorites in Vegas! Service is outstanding, food is crazy good, this time I sampled 5 small plates and all were terrific! Crab cake, fries, cauliflower (this was the best thing and I don't even love cauliflower), lamb cigars and bone marrow carne asada. Just a great place with great prices!

sVIPzilFKfEtShpuTbCMdQ.text: Let me start by saying the service was utterly amazing.  I have not had that excellent of food and service as a combo in quite sometime.

dfVKPx5oe_GaPF3w2c994w.text: Wow....  Meat lovers paradise.  We experienced Echo & Rig in a celebration of our Son entering his 20s, and couldn't have picked a better spot. Walking up to the door and you're face to rump with a pig hanging in the window. Fantastic! My kids raised pigs so this was awesome to see. We had made reservations so didn't have a wait, although I feel as though we missed out on the atmosphere and goings on at the bar area. We were met by the maitre d once seated, who then introduced us to Nick, our waiter. After talking to Nick, he brought out THE TRAY, steaks with bones..including the Flintstone or as they call it a tomahawk. Impressive...but far too much meat. We all ventured on a Spencer (you'll know when you go) with different sauces. We also shared a cesar salad and the portobello fries. Again...fantastic! Our glasses never emptied, which was nice. For dessert Nick recommended the Salted Turtle sundae, which we shared and he also brought out a complimentary birthday sundae. We had a great time, and enjoyed our wait staff and appreciate the service they provided.  Also....my husband enjoyed the bath salts and was happy they had them in the wash room. Now I have to get some for him. Looking forward to our next visit to Echo & Rig, I want to try the burger or the BLT...so it will be in the near future. Enjoy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanging Swine...
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Birthday!

_QbayD0hAHXHpOH86ViiSA.text: First time here. Cool vibe, great food.  Grilled cauliflower and Brussels sprouts with pistachios appetizers were lovely.  Ribeye was perfect medium rare with horseradish sauce. Sorbet ice cream was delightful and a huge serving.  Grapefruit flavor sorbet was our fav. Friendly and excellent service from everybody - from the hostess to GM Xavier, the lovely lady who walked us to our table, the gentleman who kept refilling our drinks, and Amanda our server was nothing short of perfect- lovely and cordial.  Highly recommend this place!

VaiJUTvMqg6EXlrb0gNzIg.text: It's clear that this place is all about meat.  But they do have a unique take that separates them from traditional steak houses.  In my book, nothing beats the ribeye and that's why it can be expensive.  Echo offers entres that are just parts of the ribeye for a small pricetag.  They also have other non traditional cuts and preparations named after people no one knows.  The appetizers and sides are very creative and more interesting than tasty.  We had the legendary fries, but I wasn't too impressed.  I took a chance and went with a flatsteak with a french name rather than my favorite ribeye just to try something new.  It was a mistake.  The edges were completely burnt.  I wanted to send it back but the waiter rarely came by the table and the cut was so small it didn't seem worth the trouble.  The next morning I was not well.  I definitely had food poisoning but I really don't know for sure if it was from Echo & Rig.  We had a big group and shared most the appetizers and I was the only one sick.  And I know it can take over 24 hours for the symptoms to show after you eat the poisoned food.  I'm just mentioning it because it was the last meal I ate before the sickness and I had a lite lunch the meal before no breakfast.  So while I dig the atmosphere and creativeness.   I didn't dig the burnt steak or illness.

q9vg_UIiM6PiGWk_sqX3Bw.text: I went to this lovely venue for my bachelor party dinner.. if u have a party of 6 or more i highly recommend 2 Tomahawk Steaks equal to about 70 oz.. and a Porterhouse 22 oz.. Lots of meat ... great sides and High quality expensive steaks without the high price of the Vegas strip..  I will be back

w_XF9tePOex78h4eITPLmA.text: I've lived in Vegas for years and went here for the first time with some work associates for dinner.  Decor is good, but their is nothing to dampen sound (carpets , partitions, etc.) so it is extremely loud when it gets busy which it was.  Very difficult to carry on a conversation, felt like I was at a concert almost.    Waitstaff and Manager Beth were very attentive and very eager to please.  Forgot our server's name but he had this attitude like he certainly didn't want to be there which became evident throughout the night.  He showed us some large plate of meat cuts and I never understood what that was for as his explanation was very lacking and the large cuts of steak he showed us weren't on the menu.    We ordered and our food came out within a normal time frame.  Portobello Fries were amazing, Steak Tartare was ok, appearance was average but it was drenched in some kind of sauce.  Our main course arrived and everything looked good, however my friends "medium well" filet was definitely not even close to that.  Once it was cut into it was plain to see it was on the Rare side of Rare.  We found out that another member of the table had ordered the same thing and the serving staff had served the wrong food to both of them.  Beth offered another steak to replace it and after we had all finished eating her replacement steak arrived.  It was supposed to be "Medium Well" but they barely managed to get it to "Medium Rare".    We ordered some dessert and again the wait staff mixed up orders and served the wrong item to the wrong person. Nothing like paying to serve your own food.   We asked for separate checks and after an extraordinary amount of time our server ensured to point out multiple times that a gratuity was not included on the checks.  He seemed to be hovering over us as we signed our bills as he scooped them up almost immediately - can we get a little privacy or peace please?  Sheesh.  Overall - meh.  Waitstaff is attentive but unable to properly serve food.  For being a steakhouse, the kitchen can't seem to cook a steak properly.  Cost is far too much for the level of service received and quality/portion size of the food.   Definitely more than $$ place.   Cross this off the list places I will go again.  I don't mind paying for great service and great food, prefer it actually but there are plenty of other steakhouses in town worth paying this much for ok service and improperly cooked steaks (think Outback).

P6KPbpQkhAvLTS7ntLPDJQ.text: Great service at the bar. Excellent customer service overall. They have a fantastic wine list. The kale salad and the hotdog is my favorite!

It3yPEQIFGex_OkPXqNvEw.text: Perfect place for brunch! We ordered the steak scramble and the blueberry pancakes. They add ricotta cheese and a lemon zest to the pancake mix which also has fresh blueberries. It was delicious! Also they don't skimp out on the bottomless mimosas! They take reservations which is good if you are planning on the Sunday brunch bc it can get busy during the afternoon.

5o1F9zZr8DBHrPKFDpE4Iw.text: Awesome food, mimosas, service and atmosphere. I took my friend there for her birthday for brunch on a Sunday. I suggest making a reservation because they get busy.

IMhBIiU5pzQBskCVwK9tzg.text: Really good restaurant.   All the sides were excellent. The portobello fries, Mac and cheese, crab cake, garlic mashed, and sweet potato were all very tasty.   The ice cream desserts were great. Really great!  The steaks were ok. Cooked properly and seasoned well, but the overall quality of meat wasn't as good as some of our other, nearby favorites like TBones. Not tender and "melt in your mouth" like they should be at an upscale steakhouse.   The service was good and attentive. A nice experience, just not a 5 star experience.

NggYg7c1_YltDxxFq-_uPw.text: My fiance and I dined at Echo & Rig last night (6/2/2017). To sum it up, it was the worst restaurant experience either of us have ever experienced. For example:  - My fiance had made a reservation over a week prior to our 7pm reservation. We waited 35 minutes to be sat at our table.  - After being sat at our table, the manager (Kevin) approached us, apologized for the wait, and handed my fiance his card. He said that next time we dined there we should give him a call and we will be sat right away. Kind of a tacky move if you ask me, but this was the only apology we received that evening.  - We ordered oysters from the raw bar menu, and our server (Jess) later informed us that all were sold out other than one varietal. - Food runners removed appetizers from our table without asking if we were finished. We were still enjoying our food as they were removed to make room for additional plates. - My fiance's steak was over cooked. He asked for the rare side of medium rare and it was medium. - I ordered the "over the rainbow" salad and several ingredients in the salad were frozen. - We were celebrating a birthday and no complementary dessert was offered.  - A food runner dropped bread off at our table after our entrees were already cleared.  I requested on my check that 100% of my tip go to Jess. She was the only highlight of the evening, as she was friendly, professional, and attentive. Other than Jess' service, we had a terrible experience. I have worked in the service industry and I am sympathetic to minor mistakes, but everything that occurred had no excuse.  I sent a summation of my comments above to Kevin the same night. I have not received a response.

C9SrbSZ_sDaeXmCF0eWEGw.text: Consistently excellent food and service, and a tremendous value for the money. Zero corkage fee! We've been eating here for years and have never had a bad meal.

m4B9cFVomqZo9cn3hQVUxQ.text: Even though this is primarily a meat oriented restaurant, they do have some great vegetarian options.  I love the drunken goat sandwich, sometimes its big enough for 2 people to share.   Drunken Goat red wine-marinated goat cheese, brie, cranberry chutney, herbs de provence, green apple, petite greens, aioli & walnut bread  The Sweet potato fries are great. I don't know if they still have them as they don't seem to be on the menu anymore.  Great seating outside and in the summer have singers perform in the evening.  Upstairs can be a bit loud.  Haven't been in a while. Will probably go back when the weather is warm at night to sit out on the patio.

j3NhothNwaEe9jR4UrdF9w.text: If you are in Vegas this is worth the trip of the strip.......first off the cost of an uber or lyft will be offset by their prices as the real estate in Summerlin is far cheaper than the strip.  Secondly and moody important is the staff from management to the waiters, hostesses, and bussers are top notch, each and everyone of them are professional, courteous, and truly care about this place.  And they should it is one of America's greatest gems like M'Tuccis in Albuquerque.  They put effort in everything they do and the food is stellar to say the least.  We were in Vegas for just shy of 72 hours and we ate there 3 times and my wife and I know good food.  My wife and I are trying to figure out how we can get here quarterly it was that good.  I want to thank Kevin for showing us an amazing experience and caring enough to thank us for each visit.  I would love to mention all the staff by name but in three visits it's hard to remember each name but we will never forget any of you especially Kevin and former Albuquerque resident Ari, you made our vacation one of the best ever because food is the way to our hearts.  Eternally grateful,  Mario and Stephanie  From Albuquerque!

ueoIlCDYoyKAm0Oh5AxqaA.text: Great deal for drinks and mini apps during happy hour at the bar (starts at 3pm.)  Aside from that, I've always had great service and food whenever I come here. The prices are not too shabby at all when you consider what you're getting.  The tomahawks are, heck, pretty much anything from the steak specialties are bomb. Great sides too, like their grilled octopus or portobello fries.  Very nice restaurant/butchershop on the local side of Vegas.

TOy919eQk6Yr6BllKCKEeg.text: Omggggggg. This place was AWESOME! We got so much food, just about everything on the small plates menu and we loved everything we had.  We sat upstairs on the patio and had a blast. The cocktails were creative and delicious. The menu was also very creative and I hope to go back the next time we are in Vegas.  Service, food, atmosphere were all 5/5 for us!  Also, make sure to use their restroom, it's so beautiful!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i50n_TNmB-cogoH7fV0JJQ.text: First time to eat here in 2-3 years.  Wonderful start to finish.  Sat on balcony for dinner, very pleasant service, delicious Bavette and rib cap, watermelon tomato salad, mashed potato, lamb cigars, cauliflower and tasty tasty sorbets.  Two glasses of wine.  $125 plus tip.  Would we return???  Absolutely.  Tomorrow if possible.  Wow.  What a difference time makes.  My 3rd or 4th visit.  Ate here tonight.  Really looking forward to the dinner.  Disappointed from the get go.  Waited 10-15 min to be seated.  Why?  Not sure.  Restaurant half empty mid week.  Then another 10 min waiting on server.  Then the meal....ordered a couple of steaks, sides, no dessert.  Steaks burned.  Too much char, masked flavor.  Then the sauces....chimmichuri and horseradish cream.  Both very underwhelming,  I like strong flavors and I really felt like the chef was afraid to offend anyone with tasty bold sauces.  Horseradish cream?  Little horseradish character.  Chimmichurri....not herbal, not garlicky, not wow.  Couple of glasses of grocery store wine...$200 including tip.  Not sure I'd return.  It's really a shame.  I really loved this place.

IOMEC5Wu9iuXr2ngcTvFZQ.text: Before I go into this review, I just want to add I've been waiting to come here for a year so needless to say by the time I arrived my expectations were sky high. Were they met? A resounding YES.  Echo & Rig is a butcher/steakhouse set in the cool and gorgeous Tivoli Village across from the Suncoast casino. On the first level you'll find the butchers, a bar and the raw bar where you can get oysters while you wait. We didn't have a reservation but we were able to get a table inside. They ask for your full name which I thought was different but they do that because everyone from the manager to the guy who fills your water glass will refer to you as Mr, Ms or Mrs (your last name here). Nice touch.   For an app I had the Onion Soup Gratinee. The broth was absolutely fantastic and the small chunks of pumpkin were a nice touch. For the main, I had the 16oz Ribeye and for sides we got the roasted heirloom carrots, garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus & egg. The steak was perfectly cooked and the red oak it's cooked over added just a extra something. Incredible flavor. The sides were all amazing. I wasn't sure how the asparagus and egg would work but it did!   The service was absolutely impeccable. Our waiter, Jesse, knew everything about the menu including information about the Spencer's cut which was inspired by a small steakhouse in Nipomo, CA. The third person in our party was running late so my friend joked about giving him applause when he arrived. Jesse took it seriously and brought another server to clap for him upon his arrival. Little things!  In the end, Echo & Rig was totally worth the wait and will be a destination for me when I visit Vegas. The location is amazing, service is incredible and most importantly the food was delicious. Highly, highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye with garlic potato chips and mushroom Rockefeller. Side sauce is brandied mushroom ($35.80)
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion soup gratinee  ($6.20)

UAe8BOwEpZBOJQdc8IKWMg.text: We went to Echo & Rig on the first night of our vacation to Las Vegas this trip.  We had eaten there before on one of our previous trips.  This is a hidden gem of a steakhouse in the Las Vegas area.  They have many different types of meat from many different suppliers from around the country.  We arrived before our reservation and pulled up some stools at the bar downstairs.  Good drinks and good service.  The bartenders were friendly and nice.   While we were waiting for our table, we checked out the butcher shop and talked to one of the butchers for a bit.  He was really nice and gave us a few pointers on what his favorites were.  My Wife ordered the Lassgna and I ordered the Bavette steak.  The lasagna was a very large portion and she said it was very good.  She couldn't eat all of it.  My steak was a smaller cut but was cooked perfectly and was excellent.  Nicely marbled and very tender.  We split a side of the Mac & Cheese and it was delicious as well.  We also ordered the Mashed Potatoes which were very good. I accompanied my steak with the blue cheese sauce that was incredible.     Service at this restaurant is top notch and everyone is friendly.  Prices are very reasonable and the quality of food is as good as most high end steakhouses on the strip that are way more expensive.  I am looking forward to going to Echo & Rig again!    We learned about this place because we saw the owner, Sam Marvin, beat Bobby Flay a few years ago on Beat Bobby Flay.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bavette Steak- excellent!

TMvDoQYWvVyOXUwCwi--LA.text: OK OK OK, i found it, i found the BEST service in Las Vegas...Echo & Rig.  The young lady that greeted us said it would be just a minute to be seated, as we walked up stairs to the table she asked a bunch of questions. Friendly and i found out why. When seated water arrived quickly followed by the menu. Next the server, getting drink orders and answering any questions.  Now, the drinks arrived followed by the Service Manager Nicholas Gutierrez. He knew we were from Portland, he knew this was our first visit and that our daughter was a local......OK all the questions asked by the gal that seated us. Really nice touch. There are a ton of high end restaurant's that could use a lesson from you.  The great service continued the entire meal, by the way, it was excellent. Daughters steak and mine were done to perfection. We added the garlic whipped mash potatoes which also were really good. My wife had the Alaska salmon which she enjoyed and we had to laugh cause she told us "oh my God this is good" after every bite.  To finish, find yourself in Vegas and want a 1st class dinning experience... get away from the strip and head to Echo & Rig.  Thanks Nicholas,  it was a great night.

B257PgyfJVRJkoGfjlpYRQ.text: I heard so much about this place and finally got to go there during our anniversary. Service is impeccable and steaks are good! I was actually surprised how big the portions are and of course, cooked according to your preference however, the side dishes need some tweaking. Mine came out undercook but they fixed it. Overall, I'll definitely give it a try again.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UaaQZRMu0V6AT5A2K-3onw.text: great service and food! Recommend for anyone who would like a cozy weekend brunch without the crowds in strip restaurants. Our server knows our name when we sat down, and made great recommendations for ordering.  Reserve a table before you go - it fills up quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QYTb_7Ck9pOliyVPS-pxmQ.text: Came here on Sunday for lunch, forgot that that is peak brunch time. Their upstairs restaraunt space was fully booked so we sat downstairs at the bar. Apparently they are very popular for their bottomless mimosas. We got the portabella fries to share and a steak off the dinner menu which came with hand cut fries. The portabella fries are amazing and actually made of portabella, not some fries with seasoning on top like I thought it would be. The breading is super light and the seasoning is on point. 10/10 would recommend Definitely the best portabella/mushroom fries I've ever had. Also came with a green garlic aoili sauce that was really nice and complemented the fries really well.   The steak was really nicely seared, maybe a little tendon-y and the cook was a little uneven but overall the flavor was very nice. I think it was about $35 for the steak and $10 for the fries. Would definitely recommend coming especially for the fries, probably should have a reservation if you come during a busy time.

dEc9X2qL2nB7EQVb7yJ8Ww.text: Every cretin in Las Vegas has probably gushed to you about their favorite brunch spot - Echo & Rig. Who doesn't love being drunk at 11am on a Sunday with their best friends? E&R satisfies all the necessary criteria for a popular brunch locale: 1) location: it's inside Tivoli Village so your friends can pretend to be Summerlin moms and dads for the day. 2) Atmosphere: you can get away with dressing up or if you're still hungover from the night before you can wear your cargo shorts and Nickelback t-shirt. 3) Food: When you're finished obsessing over the fact that you're "brunching" and drinking OJ and champagne, you'll realize that you're actually in a decent restaurant. I haven't had a bad plate to date. I'm partial to their dinner menu with the scallops entree that rocked my world. I also like the mushroom fry thingies. My meat eater friends like their scrambled hash. Eggs were good.  Anyway, here's Wonderwall.

XDuMNI-zXgZIvSa3eeI32A.text: Another fine steak house located in Summerlin.  This one is in Tivoli Village and is great.   They offer a greats menu, great service and the prefect setting for a nice meal.   We enjoyed pork chops, steak and a great dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hLemGWkAqFwgNMvt7SJBwQ.text: I've mostly been here during happy hour, and it is definitely worth it! ! During happy hour draft beers are 3$ you can get steak and eggs for 2$!! I mean it's a small portion but for 2$!! It's worth it! I did order from the regular menu starters. I had the steak tartare and it was delicious! Very fresh. Everyone on the staff is super friendly! They make a great Sazerac!  On other occasions I've had the chicken Cesar, and I was not a fan. I don't like when the lettuce leaves are full size it makes it hard to eat. The dressing wasn't great either.   I can't wait to try their regular steaks!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sazerac
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absinthe
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour Menu

Wy1DZVrGZS05n7Pguz659Q.text: Had an excellent steak here. The crust was perfect. The steak was well seasoned. It was tender. The portion and price was certainly fair.   There were a good selection of sauces.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spencer Steak

-5cLfJ9vPf8GB6lg3FckOw.text: Amazing food, steak, oysters, and outstanding customer service. Definitely coming back here for their tasty, juicy steak and delicious oysters.

yiGleNmFTiU6FVVrqtbZ6Q.text: First visit was great but second visit with a party of 7 wasn't so great. Not sure if patio service is worse or server was too busy to give the same good service I received during the first visit. We were asked if patio seating was ok because it was a full house. Patio was pretty crowded and there were space heaters all around, we were also offered blankets if we needed.   I don't remember who our server was but no meat platter was brought out and it took forever to flag him down. When he finally came to take our orders I asked about the meat platter since we were planning to pick a meat from there. Eventually someone came to show us the different types of meat and I believe it was $2.49 an oz for any cut on the platter. We decided to go with 2 tomahawks and a few sides. Our server did tell us food would take a while since the tomahawk was a thicker cut, but it was accurate. I think he estimated about 45 minutes.   Bread was brought out with whipped butter. I wasn't too fond the whipped butter because it was like we weren't eating any butter! It was very airy.  For the 7 of us, we shared 7 different sauces which was disappointing because I thought it would have been 2 servings of each sauce since we did order 2 tomahawks. Some of the sauces ran out quicker than the others. The lemon chimichurri and red wine demo were our least favorite and the horseradish, charred onion and mushrooms were our favorites.   We ordered our tomahawks cooked medium but both came out medium rare. The centers were a bit too pink for my liking so I ate the ends. Even so, the tomahawk was really good. For 3 of us, the 33 oz was a little small so I'd recommend at least 40 oz between 3 people.   I highly recommend their cauliflower and portobello mushrooms. Calamari wasn't crispy enough for my liking so I'll pass on that and Brussels sprouts next time.   We did not see our server again until the end of our meal. He was friendly, but service wasn't on par with what I expected. I think they automatically put on 20% gratuity for groups of 6 or more.

Vm2Z9ucBICoe60dLtkm8_w.text: My husband made reservations here for our anniversary. The staff was very kind and explained the details of the menu. We ordered the filet with portobello mushroom, It was delicious.

2Fg8BaL3DsuVhkW_14SD-g.text: I came back in June for my anniversary and it was quite good! I heard mixed reviews before coming so I was prepared for mediocre butter expectations were far exceeded. Our server explained the menu very well and he offered good recommendations. The fried mushrooms -- amazing! My boyfriend hates mushrooms and he even loved them.   I ate the tenderloins and potatoes, which was good but definitely would try something else next time. My boyfriend got a filet and it was perfectly cooked.  Be cautious sitting on the patio! It was a nice day and the misters were on, depending on the breeze the mist would sprinkle directly over us. There was a solid 3 minutes I got rained on and the table, my food, my utensils, my hair were getting soaked! I laughed it off, but we had to ask them to turn the misters off and the manager came with a towel and wiped the table down and gave me new utensils.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3ujHNJ_opiuw4ScSfZp6Pw.text: Wonderful! Excellent food, great service, large menu and priced right for what they offer. Took the family to nice meal before heading back to Chicago. Meet a waiter from here last year while in New York who really got me excited about checking out the place. A nice spot for a date, business meeting or fancy family meal. Big thumbs up!

F37bIdwM_7suKHyoTuqCEg.text: all things considered... this place has good reputation  the good: - this is a butcher shop - guaranteed freshness and great cuts of meat - Savannah the Hostess and Tim the Manager more than made up for that deficiency (see below) - food was very tasty!  the not so good: - Server Ramon - not very attentive - aaaarrrrgggghhhh - they ran out of the ribeye top cap!!! disappointed - not their issue but mine since our dinner was a bit on the late side and a very famous cut like this will not be available later

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fresh kale salad - of course!
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beef pot pie - flaky crust, savory chunks of beef with hearty gravy for a nice comfort food dish
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ribeye - medium rare well done!! double yay

NqOdm3uNE__D_UWMe7yDeA.text: This is a good, reasonable priced steak house for anyone in the valley. The garlic mashed potatoes are very memorable and the quality of beef was prime. What sets this place apart is the quality of service was top notch. They really paid attention to our very request but didn't over do they're job. Sometimes it's overwhelming to have servers hover, which they did not.   The only issue I had was the fact that I made reservations a week in advance and when we got there we still had to wait over 40 minutes to be set down as other people seemed to be getting sat be for us. Rather upsetting seeing as these people just came in the door and were give tables ahead of us. Not sure why. What's the point of reservations if you have to wait so long? Overall the food was good, wine was also nice and the servers were attentive and sweet bit the front desk was a bit dismissive and aloof. Maybe you'll have better luck, but felt kind of unfair to us. Not the best look for them.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic sirloin cut. Big boy portion!

5QGnI-6-pnzgYbqXt9KDNA.text: I usually like to try a place 2 or 3 times before I do a review.   This is about my 4th time here so it's time.  While their happy hour offerings are a little light with none of the specialty cocktails discounted they do offer beer, wine, and mixed drinks at a discount with some food as well.    I have tried the apps at dinner with my colleagues and it was spot on but brunch, that's where it is at.  A nice brunch selection with bottomless mimosas and bloody Mary's on the weekends leads to a packed house.   Reservations are highly suggested but the bar also offers the full menu.  Like the meat?  They also have a butcher shop.  All in all 10/10 will try again.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Summer Sangria
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steakhouse Scramble
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tequiling me Softly

c_3X9I0-l2Td8G8utNV-ZA.text: Yes... 5 stars. Food was phenomenal, but I'm a service guy and this place gets it. The hostess set the right tone being welcoming, engaging and accommodating. The server was very knowledgeable and described the food properly. Timing was accurate, refills were always present. $80. For two, for a table full of great sharing option, including drinks and complimentary sparkling water.

XMdwa0GetFd_4H9JDYu6wQ.text: Great spot for a nice date night dinner.  Host staff was very friendly and accommodating, wait staff was very well-informed of the menu and prompt with service, and management was considerate enough to come to our table and introduce themselves.  We had a steak and lamb chops, both of which were cooked perfectly.  Atmosphere is a little on the loud side, but that's to be expected when the dining room is at full capacity.  I'll definitely be a regular at Echo & Rig from here on out.

lmhjs_M6otqwtF1sbAGf-A.text: Welllllllllllllllllll without going into details ....go but don't order the duck !!!

CqScSll6mgc2uRgDE8GWvg.text: I was very happy with my experience here and will be going back.  There is something I have found at so many restaurants - for all the cooks that know how to prepare steak or chicken well, many don't know how to bring out the best in vegetables.  So, I was very happy to find the best dishes I sampled here were from their small plates selection - cauliflower browned with chili and crispy shallots and the portobello fries.  Both were fantastic.   The wine list gets a gold star for some very reasonable prices both for bottles and by the glass. Our server was painfully new and slightly awkward, but his heart was in the right place, so any missteps were forgiven. A missed order was quickly corrected and comped, though I thought that was unnecessary, they were obviously aiming for good customer service, which is more than I have experienced at some of the other restaurants in that immediate area (that includes you Honey&Salt, ahem). For my main course, I had the rib eye cap at a truly reasonable $22.50.  It was served with garlic chips and a stuffed mushroom.  My steak was good and cooked exactly right.  It came with one complimentary sauce - I chose chimichurri.  I had mixed feelings about part of this: I tried both the chimichurri and the horseradish sauce and they were equally bland.  I also didn't really enjoy the chips or mushroom much, but considering that most steak places no longer give you anything with  your steak - any sides are usually $7 or more, I thought it was nice to have something with it. I finished off with a turtle sundae and left happy.  All that food for $50 per person (before tip) = happy diner.

WkGUkJYfQJ3QzKQdAA0SGA.text: Nice steakhouse off the Strip. Staff is very friendly. Food was good, but average. Nothing memorable. Not bad but not great. I would give it another chance, being that I've only been there once.

rkBeZQk5HX7VY1cU3yH3vw.text: Amazing food and good atmosphere BUT my server is the reason I am giving only 3 stars. If this was based only on her, I would give 1 star.  If you plan to dine here make sure you do not get Courtnee. She was very inattentive, rude, and either didn't know enough about the menu yet or wasn't interested in answering our questions. The food defiantly made up for her service though! I would like to come back on our next visit, but I will make sure to get a different server next time.

fXCwuxvP-2YidOKpyQM_IA.text: I love this place! I've been there 3 times now and I've also purchased skirt steak to make it home all excellent reviews. They're small plates are wonderful each one very different than the next and then of course you get a slab of meat. I remember the first time I went in there that's what I asked for a slab of meat and boy did my friend and I get a slab of meat! Very nice atmosphere downstairs is a butcher  and  upstairs a nice restaurant that you can look out onto Tivoli village. I went there most recently with a friend in November and we were seated outside with a heat lamp. A little chilly but still beautiful. The view was nice the area is nice you almost forget that you are in Las Vegas. Definitely see this place, experience this place. The meat is perfectly cooked so when you have that carnivorous craving this is definitely the place to go

KNdttzD0Vzc-dyvE-gS_kg.text: Great cocktails and Appies to start off. The patio seating is boss and steaks are fantastic.  Great little gem off the strip.  The bar downstairs has a great vibe too.  Fun place. Will be back for sure.

pkHUf1tQdZ4ir5tm9lS3mQ.text: Very disappointing... Service was average, food was average, very bad acoustic, Price does not reflect the quality at all.

PObthNJ5Tlj17hWyE2QKXA.text: Favorite place in Vegas. Great food and atmosphere and the prices are really reasonable.

ZMgl2dGYmVQVhQQcZqx0Zg.text: so far i've only attended the trial runs, so i'll be brief. everything my girlfriend and i tried was exceptional (and we tried a lot of food and drinks). I see great things for this place and it's a very welcome addition to our area. Chef Marvin has come up with an excellent plan and his exec chef aaron is seeing it through with great attention to both how the food looks and tastes. i'll write a True review when i've paid for a meal or two......or three. because with service and food like that i'll be back time and again

SswzQPDje33hIVL2P0IA3Q.text: A/C problem is repaired!  :-)  Alys is my favorite bartender in Las Vegas.

yPstn1o_oCNiLEKWMXklSg.text: Adorable restaurant. Clean, pretty, and has amazing staff. The food was delicious too. The steak was solid, but the garlic mashed potatoes and the turtle sundae were awesome.

zSYkpAGBRqINas_FMQPbkQ.text: Food was very good. Grilled octopus and the portabello fries were the best. All steak temps right on. Only complaint was the service was a little lacking. Need to retrain some of the front of housers and u will get 5 stars

5Wvvj2QXN_4S4mjYlNWICA.text: I really wanted to like this place, my boyfriend and I had been wanting to try it out for months, some were excited to give it a shot. We were seated quickly, but ignored after that for about 15 minutes, when the waitress finally came to take our drink orders, she blamed the hostesses for the wait, kind of annoying. My boyfriends ice tea came out pretty quickly, but my glass of wine took forever, so did the water for the table, so I was left without any thing to drink for quite a while. It also took forever for the server to come back and get our order, in fact, the server didn't come back, another person came and took our order, odd but, okay. They finally brought us some bread, which wasnt even warm and was nothing special, but it made no matter because the server took it away before we could finish it, weird! The appetizer of portobello fries was good, probably the best thing we ate, though the portion was quite small, and once again it was taken off the table before we could finish, kind of awkward. The arugula salad was next, and poorly dressed, with whole peppercorns lurking beneath, waiting to bust a tooth, hah. My boyfriend had the horseradish crusted butterfish with roasted veggies. The butterfish was not horseradish crusted nor did it really seem to be butterfish, it was cooked well, but had zero taste. The roasted veggies were still raw and unpleasant to eat. I had a filet, which came out so overcooked some portions of the crust were burned, also, the meat was flavorless. The garlic chips were flavorless, the  stuffed mushrooms garnish was also flavorless. The garlic mashed potatoes were okay, but seemed as though we were served the bottom of the barrel, because they were lumpy and cold. The squash with maple and rosemary was okay, but there were parts that were so overly roasted that they were hard and completely inedible. I was picking pieces out of my mouth. Yuck! We didn't bother with desert. All in all, the service was lack luster and inattentive and the food was bland, and overpriced. We left wishing we had eaten at honey salt.

n33DC8HGoxnCE3Oclf7hQA.text: It has been a few months since we at here so my memory may have faded. We arrived for our reservation early and I got a beer at the bar. Bar staff was friendly and attentive. Our hostess checked us in as we waited for friends and we were seated right away when our party was full. One of our party had a bad experience before and the staff remembered him so our service was remarkable. I got the Pork Belly spicy slaw as an app that we shared at the table. I was impressed with the tangy, salty bite. I can say that you can not go wrong with the new pork belly trend going on the dining world. My main meal was The Spencer Steak, a form of ribeye cut that is not quite the size a a bone in but fortunately not as pricey but just as filling. From my past reviews you know how i can be about a steak i can do better at home. This I could not do better. Perfectly cooked melt in your mouth tender. You must try this as an alternative to a big ribeye. The staff brought us lamb cigars as an app on them. I like these with the Tzatziki dipping sauce a tangy bite to start your appetite going. We also had the salt and pepper fries which to me were not impressive. We did not eat many of those and in hindsight should not have ordered as we were getting pretty full. Wife has the filet tenderloin with garlic mashed & white cheddar. Steak was nicely cooked and the taters were on par with any upscale steakhouse. Over all our dinner was good and lived up to reviews I have read. The atmosphere is open and it rather loud. hard to have a good conversation. I will eat here again and will recommend you try it. Staff was on point and drinks filled on the regular.

C6J8Mj_7PxA02cNPEmI2pw.text: Great Menu, Really cool place, and amazing service. This place is an awesome steakhouse, but even if your not a red meat eater they have a great selection of seafood and other options on the menu. The wine list is large and our server was so knowledgeable about everything on the menu which makes the experience that much better. The octopus in delicious, and we got so much yummy food and wine and our check was half of what it would have been on the strip.

xzEm3Fh9812wQWk-o2dYXQ.text: I went to SW Steakhouse at the Wynn last night ( I will post a review shortly) and Echo & Rig was so much better, I felt I owed it to them to post a review.  First, it has been a long time since I have received service like we did at E&R. The hostess was very polite and friendly, but at the time I just assumed she was bubbly. Little did I know that the entire staff was going to be that way. Although it was packed, our waiter came over taking drink orders and introducing himself. Water and bread were there immediately. The manager came over, introduced himself, thanked us for coming, and told us to let him know if we needed anything. And the service didn't stop. Suffice it to say the waiter and bus people were as attentive as any, without bothering us--meaning they kept an eye on us to make sure we didn't need anything, and to get it if we did. For starters, we my wife had baked brie. It was delicious. I had crab cakes. They were good; my wife thought they were some of the best she's had. We also shared an order of Portobello fries--they were addicting. Definitely get them. My wife had the butterfish for her entree. She thought it was going to be like sea bass, very flaky and buttery, but thought it was much closer to halibut in taste and texture. She enjoyed it, thought it was prepared perfectly, but was expecting something else-not E&R's fault. I had rib-eye cap which was great and cooked perfectly. We also had broccolini--very tasty--and garlic mashed potatoes--just right. For dessert we had ice cream that was as good as any you will have anywhere.  Finally, the manager returned, thanked us again, gave us his card, and told us to call if we ever need anything. It really felt like an old style Vegas gourmet room where they treat everybody like a high roller. It was awesome.

D5Qgq2M3GmsyDWNWKh3GTQ.text: We went to Echo & Rig for the first time last weekend after frequent recommendations from friends, and it was just as fantastic as everyone said! The atmosphere upstairs was lovely, and the staff was attentive and knowledgeable. There were incredible options on the menu for anyone (not being a red meat eater I was a little worried at first) and the pricing is excellent.  Being a GM myself I most appreciated the personal touch of the management staff with Chris at the helm. You could see them stopping in to tables all over the restaurant to check in with their guests (us included) and assisting their staff in everything from setting tables to clearing. I've struggled recently with the level of service around town, but my experience at Echo & Rig was flawless. We will definitely return, and have already begun telling all of our friends.

1dEQdLPWdvjyoStMPHolFw.text: About time Vegas got an old school butcher shop! Well walking at tivoli I noticed echo and rig. The previous day I went to my local grocery store and asked if they could cut me some thin slices of sirloin so I could make cheese steaks. They lacked the equipment so I was out of luck. When I walked up to echo and rigs window the first thing I noticed where the pigs hanging from hooks and then there was rack of lamb and strings of sausages. I knew I had to walk in to check it out. Inside, it's a two story restaurant. Rustic looking but really cool none the less. I went to the butcher counter after looking at all the beautiful meats. I asked if they could shave sirloin for cheese steaks. They said absolutely and brought me out two choice cuts of steak to choose from.  I made my selection and it was shaved so beautifully thin. They packaged it and I paid. For those of you who dread cooking at thanksgiving they make thanksgiving dishes and turkeys if you like. Just FYI :) I'll definitely be back for more custom cuts!

mjZIrHFPIZHJd_yY2vx_Qw.text: I have never liked these anonymous reviews but after 40 years in the restaurant industry I have to write one. After a long week of a trade show in Sacremento we were dubius about staying in the restaurant due to noise. We were thrilled we stayed. First let me mention the human element. Hostess Lauren, server Michele and my feeble brain cannot remember dining room manager but they did all they could plus more. Watching team work in front of house was a ballet. I had interaction with at least 10 employees and each one had an answer, a smile and great attitude.   Now for food. Each course primo. Steaks rate in top 5 I have consumed in my life. We tried all 5 dipping sauces, watermelon salad, octopus and bone marrow. I cant remember a past dining experience that was so near perfect in ALL aspects! They should be very proud of what they are doing for the hospitality industry!!

bQroFOL069IsHnqD8cP5SQ.text: Easily my favorite steakhouse. Hugo was welcoming and answered all our questions and helped us pair the right sauce for our steaks. The food is a solid 11/10 and the view from the balcony is beautiful. Prices are just right and the quality is top notch. The ambience of this restaurant is amazing and I can't recommends this place enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q7dc41F6JEydt0hPEl_Z6g.text: Let's just say my last 2 Birthdays have been enjoyed here. Great steaks and fish. Wonderful appetizers and plates to share. Most Steak places in Vegas are going to cost you $50 just for the steak no sides that's it. Here you get amazing shareable sides at a wonderful 0ric3! Beautiful location and setting with upstairs patio available to enjoy the Sunset. By yourself? No worries downstairs they have a bar where you can sit by yourself and order food whilst enjoying the Sports Game on TVs at the bar.  Looking for a great place to take a date to impress without breaking the bank... Echo & Rig is your spot!

kaFZfjQyvyDNYQcdjOS31Q.text: We were treated to a date night here for our anniversary.  I can honestly say I wasn't thrilled at first because I had brunch there a hear or so back and wasn't in love.  I can say this time changed it all!!   The server was AMAZING which makes it start off in the right direction, than the food was hot fresh and very tasty!!   It was a pleasant surprise.

dBM4uu0nU2ckdFudvDVIww.text: Located in a fairly quiet Las Vegas suburb, Echo & Rig is just as good as any steakhouse on the Strip, minus the exorbitant prices. The ambiance is modern, open, relaxing, and somewhat minimalist. The balcony overlooks the Tivoli Village shopping center, making you almost forget that you're dining in the Nevada desert.  Being part-butcher shop, Echo & Rig offers several unconventional cuts of meat. You can order a ribeye cap (the best part) on its own for less than $30! Where else can you find that? Each steak comes with a choice of sauce, but we found these to be totally unnecessary. Our steaks were well-seasoned and cooked to a nice medium rare.  As far as side dishes go, the creamed kale was my favorite by far. Imagine creamed spinach with a more complex, springier taste. Very unique and delicious. On the other hand, the white cheddar garlic mashed potatoes were just OK.  Our server, Hugo, took very good care of us throughout the night. My girlfriend and I celebrated our double birthdays here, and they were very generous by offering each of us a complimentary dessert! Overall, we were blown away. Check this place out for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White cheddar garlic mashed potatoes and creamed kale
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye steak with homemade chips and a mushroom Rockefeller

G0o2htxb3O3x5Yao_G3Adg.text: Dined at Echo & Rig last evening with another couple. The environment is noisy but adds to the ambiance. Service is first class. While their wine list is just OK, THEY DON'T CHARGE CORKAGE! Woo hoo! I had the Portobello fries (killer), a Caesar salad (fresh and tasty) and a spencer steak medium rare. The entrees also come with a stuffed mushroom and home made potato chips! My wife had a crab cake and a salad which she enjoyed.Our friends split a pizza, which they liked. Al in all, a wonderful dining experience!

eyw0hz2tkKscI_B5t6dNfA.text: I'm surprised by all the 5 star reviews.   We wanted to celebrate a birthday and decided to give this place a try. There were some good points but some big misses. I just think if your price point is this high your food needs to be amazing and service perfect.  The service felt stiff and pretentious.  Our server was a bit too aggressive with selling and slow to serve.  We had to ask for a lot of items and he took forever.  He over-explained the meat and menu and it felt like buying a used car.  There was not one ounce of sincerity and the service felt awkward.  We seemed to wait quite a bit for everything and the food was completely average.  We ordered a bit of everything - rib eye, filet, pork chop, chicken and lasagna.  It was all okay nothing great.  Our server made a hard sell on the fried portobellos, they were yuck. Aioli dip was so Mayo based it was gross.  The Mac n cheese and gnocchi was good but I can get those anywhere.  My least favorite thing...dessert.  They only have sundaes.  Fancy overdone sundaes that were not good.  The shortbread sundae was disgusting.  Dry hard shortbread, hated the texture of the ice cream and there was a weird dried fruit on top that was not palatable.  Sour taste with beef jerky texture.  Our bill was $500 for 6 people and it was not worth it.  Honestly...at this price point we could gone to a really amazing steak house on the strip and that's probably what we will do next time we celebrate something.

Zr_d_00P-NgmP7cE56tM6w.text: Came here for brunch and all I can say is WOW! The wait was alittle long to sit down but very well worth the wait! You have the option to sit inside or outside, and during my wait I sign up for the bottomless mimosas, which for $16 it is well worth it! The food was incredible! The salmon, crab cakes Benedict, and the fried muchrooms (portabella) was the best thing I had! This is a prefect place for Sunday brunch! By the way you can self park which is not far away or valet park right in front of restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottomless Mimosas
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZNKc5kJ-75nvRP8Pjp57Fw.text: Best steaks in Vegas. I ALWAYS take my women there for her birthday. Very good service and great steaks and mac n cheese.

S-ESyOgdK0WETAh0_SuaNw.text: Just adding 5 more stars, see previous review!  Came for brunch, namely bottomless mimosas. What a deal!  Good champagne, and the waitstaff never stopped pouring-  served my favorite style with a small kicker of OJ on the side. Did I mention that the glass was never empty? Day drinking has never been so choice!  Pick a meal, they've added a steakhouse twist to most of the dishes. Delicate hollandaise, bold smoked meats, perfectly poached eggs. Seems like it's hard to go wrong with this menu.   Reservations a must here in the heart of Summerlin, don't be afraid to wait a little longer to get a plush seat on the balcony overlooking the obelisk fountain and continuous parade of super cars at the valet. Our server Adam was a real professional.   Can't wait for my next free Sunday!

wF7U-0yyW_Lb7GWXIdGcpw.text: Oh Echo & Rig you have disappointing once again. I said I would never come back her again, but my husband wanted to try it out one more time. Once again this restaurant cannot cook a medium well steak. Its crazy. They must have a new cook. My first 3 visits to this restaurant were amazing and the last 2 have both been bad. Also, we were seated very fast but the service took 2 1/2 hours and you could tell no one knew what was going on. It was so unorganized. Unfortunately this will definitely be my last time eating here. Outback can cook a better steak for 1/3 of the price.

R6Yzzhx2w72uWYvZVzA3XQ.text: We had the greatest experience here today. While doing a "celebration of life" Austin and the rest of the staff were beyond accommodating. Service was quick and friendly. We couldn't have been happier.

QK-lS_y_IOVvmjKi4bw8fw.text: I don't like to give negative comments about anything but I just couldn't pass this one. It was a huge let down, shock is the right word to describe the filet mignon I ordered. I was with a big group for dinner on a Tuesday night. Four of us ordered the filet. I wanted my steak cooked medium and a friend ordered exactly the same thing.   The minute I saw my plate, the meat didn't look like a filet. It wasn't round but  shaped like a cone and I knew they served me the end of a tenderloin meat.  As I was cutting the "filet"  it was cooked medium well instead of medium as I wanted it,  charred pretty good on the outside that it had some bitter taste to it. My friend who ordered the same thing had the filet, it was round, plump the way it should be but they served it medium rare.  I had high expectations for this restaurant and my first as well. I love to cook and I buy the whole beef tenderloin cut them up into filets and  at the end of that is a cone shape left over meat that should never be served as filet.  When I grill my filet at home I made sure I tie a cooking string around it so it retains the round shape.  I was really shock that they served the end piece of a tenderloin and calls it a "filet" , charging my plate 38.00 and it wasn't even grilled medium, and probably weighed less than 4 ounces. My suggestion,  the sous chef should be keeping an eye  on the details from the meat, grill, temperature before it goes out!!! So disappointing!!! I wish I had the chance to take a photo of it, but no one took any shots of all the food we ordered so I skipped it. On a positive note, I would give the side dishes a 10 !!! Fried spinach salad, Mac n cheese, portobello fries, Calamari, cauliflower, beef tartare , mash potato, even the warm bread was good! The dips hit high marks for me!  The service was really, really good, the crew that waited on us were very attentive!!! This is a butcher shop, a steak house, where meat is the star of this joint and tonight the side dishes was truly the star!

DxjKfnTtWeLaf-USQrJOUQ.text: I can't even remember how many times I've been to Echo & Rig. Yes, it's that good!  Today, I visited there for a lunch meeting. I knew they served Sunday brunch, yet didn't know they also served that delicious menu on Saturday.  Regardless, my main focus was on their mouth-watering burger, which I've have many times, as well as their salt & pepper fries.  As usual, the burger was cooked to perfection!  Even though they normally have great service, it seemed like they really stepped up their game. When I was half way done with my iced green tea, they quickly gave me another glass (I'm a heavy drinker). Nan was our server today and she rocked!  To say that I enjoyed my experience today was an understatement!

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GYXHHIAejl5q3rUzHlklBg.text: Great steak restaurant great service and very good prices. Like this place and recommend to all the foodies how like meat

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iAjIdeZ2pb-IBhreEnROHg.text: My friend had been raving about this place.  I enjoyed it so much so I Google about this place.  It was created by Sam Marvin. I didn't realize Bottega Louie in downtown LA is also one of his creation.  The cost of the steak is reasonable... Tomahawk steak was $106ish... it's the sides and appetizers that enhanced the experience.  You go to those steakhouses in the casino and the sides alone could be at least $20 each.... here there's options for $7/$8/$9!  Avocado toast, portobello mushrooms fries, mussels, French onion soup.... there's more! Gotta come back to try em' all!  Coke or lemonade, free refills for $2... no corkage fee for bottle wine (I'm not a wine drinker, just FYI for you... and in the plaza there's a place you to buy wine!) Give you an idea of how their good service doesn't mean fancy pricing.  Valet parking is free (when we went..Ask for an update when you go..)  You must plan to visit this place on your next Vegas trip... call ahead to make reservations.  They will return your voicemail. About 30 mins local drive from the strip... well worth it. (There is a verbal kids menu...ask them and free dessert for birthdays...)

l1OOZM3y-roucsaO5YtlFw.text: I most recently went here for dinner to celebrate my friend's birthday. This is one of those restaurants that is just ok. An average restaurant. The food is not bad, but not too memorable either. I've been here a couple times before for brunch. The reason I go for brunch here is not because of the food, but because they have bottomless mimosas (for $16. Bottomless bloody mary for $22) and they're not stingy with the champagne :) Also, the place is nice and easily accessible, so it makes a good place to meet up with friends. I tried their short rib hash and steakhouse scramble for brunch. Both were ok. Not special enough for me to want to order again. I do really like their portobello fries!   For my friend's birthday dinner, I shared a 48 Oz. tomahawk steak with 3 other people. I think the steak was cooked a bit too charred on the outside, but the inside was a nice medium. However, the steak was bland and not tender. It was so bland that I had to eat it with a sauce. I recommend the brandied mushroom and the red wine demi (they offer 7 different sauces). The fact that I had to eat the steak with a sauce is quite sad. To me, a sign of a good steak is when you can eat it by itself and you can savor that juicy meaty taste alone, not covered by some sauces. For sides, I tried the cauliflower (this is good), brussels sprouts (just ok), and mashes potatoes (again, just ok). I also tried the steak tartare for appetizer. Nothing wrong with it, but I've had better. Service was kind of on the slow side that night.   Side notes: you can bring your own bottles of wine and they don't charge a corkage fee. If you have a big party, they automatically add a 20% tip.   Overall, this is a nice place away from the strip to have some drinks and appetizers (portobello fries!). If you're looking for a good steak though, there are other local places that offer better tasting steaks.

photos.caption: Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak tartare
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cauliflowers are good!
Photo of Echo & Rig - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium

zbZW3nXw4uPJnSPDv8Xl4Q.text: Unfortunately, I'm changing my 4 star review to a 1 star. The service here is usually great and I take my family here every time they are in town. However, the past two times we have made a reservation, my family and I waited 30 minutes before being seated. I checked in with the hostess 3 times and she told me that they did not have a table for 5 people after just taking a party of 5 that had just walked in. What is the point of taking a reservation if you are not seated on time? Reservations should be seated on time and should NOT be put in line behind a walk-in party. This was very disappointing and I will not be back for quite a while.

z5u4AZ_bK4SWxi3Td4i-1A.text: I have always heard great reviews about this restaurant but have never been up until today. It was my friends birthday and we wanted to try out a new special place that we haven't been to before. The service was on point and the food was equally amazing! We enjoyed a great bottle of wine, rib eye steaks and the most delicious Mac n cheese on earth. Try the steak with the mushroom sauce that was my favorite!

SfNh9X5TO-lzFC64wrbr3A.text: I had an amazing experience at this steakhouse, by far the best steak ever. My lyft driver recommended this place while we were driving around the strip. The best service from our waitress Beth to the manager who would come by to make sure we were doing well. I will make sure to always stop by when  in Las Vegas. Thanks for such a great experience. The filet mignon was delicious and so were the Brussels sprouts. Also, try their oysters!!!

F1DqVOEQDpM9YDf6po3OhA.text: Best Steakhouse in Summerlin, arguably the whole town. Expensive butcher shop but beautiful place with wonderful food. If you're lucky enough to get Nick as your server - you'll have the best dinner experience of your life.

sr3uiEUXJc9WnGu6oPn7HA.text: First Time here, went here for happy hour with a friend. Delicious meat! Had the steak and egg and the shrimp cocktail happy hour specials and we shared the baked Brie and a special meat cut not on most menus. It was delicious. Loved the ambiance and it was great being able to look at the cuts of meat!!  Want to come again for dinner

f_6QNRj_PKYVoAnv8e52NQ.text: Great place for lunch, and love the butcher shop.

FiXZezItIX9kD9NMI5hNeg.text: An amazing place. Great prices.  Grass fed meat and a real butcher area down stairs. This place is a definite must check out!!

PLAN0JMn4l4T_YiNnvZfvQ.text: Overall this restaurant is pretty clean, stake was cold and way too salty. Wait for 15 minutes for the horseradish and mushroom sauce to arrive which make the stake even colder.....  Ordered claim linguini for my father, he only ate 1/4 and quit. Guess he doesn't like it either.   Only thing was great tonight was the wine we brought ourself.

TflmMMKVm79oG97AkoJIDw.text: This place is cute and quaint and in a great location. The waiters and waitresses are phenomenal and it has a great vibe to it. It's nice to sit on the outdoor patio and they keep it pretty well ventilated so you're not feeling the scorching Vegas heat. The only thing I have to complain about is that the food is subpar. There wasn't anything extra special about it and its really something I could make at home. I had the short rib grilled cheese and the waiter raved about it but it was no different than any other grilled cheese and the short ribs lacked in flavor. The pancakes had too much lemon zest which some may like but it wasn't our thing. I would love to give more stars because the service was wonderful and they kept my bottomless mimosa full at all times but just didn't enjoy the food as much as we would have liked.

kS6cz5R1_VI3iycjtosfIQ.text: I'm not sure there are words that can sufficiently express how fantastic this restaurant was, but I'm going to give it my best shot.   First, I must say, I only gave this 5 stars because that's the most you can give. If I was able to give 10 stars out of 5, I would.  I found this restaurant from other reviews on Yelp. My friends and I were looking for a good steakhouse without spending an arm and a leg. They were hesitant at first due to the location (it's a good 20 min off the strip; $50 cab ride). I convinced them you could go to any steakhouse on the strip and of course it's going to be great, why not try somewhere different.   When you arrive you pull up to the most expensive cars you'll ever see in your life in person. The plaza this restaurant in is gorgeous. When you walk in you're greatest and welcomed by the hostess, who checked to see if our table was ready. To the right is the Butcher shop, which was closing. We then made our way upstairs to our table.   The restaurant was mostly empty; only two other tables had people. Our waitress, Ally I think, was AMAZING! Super attentive and quickly broke down the way they do things there. They recommend you go "family style" and order everything you'd like separately. They brought out a platter of steaks. There was a 64oz Tomahawk, then it progressed smaller. They recommend you order one and split it amongst your table. My friend and I ordered the 32oz off the platter and split it.   The food was beyond words. Everything was amazing, and the price was surprisingly not as bad as you'd expect for a place like this. If you're looking for a phenomenal steakhouse and awesome experience, GO HERE!!!

vCCMvXBMt_3KPteLl2DXsA.text: Best steakhouse in the Fucking world! Blows your tastebuds faces off like Arnold Schwarzenegger in terminator. Like that one scene where that douche bag liquid dude keeps coming back and Arnold loads up that big motherfucking shotgun and blows his shit in. That kind of good!!!!! The steaks are so god dam good it brought a tear to my eye, like when I watch Fox news and they show the highlight reel of a JDAM bomb blowing Isis the fuck up and you get so pumped you forgot you live in the suburbs and go outside and start racking off AR15 5.56 rounds into your dickhead neighbors car!!! Don't even get me started on the sides.... Jesus Christ the fucking sides are so good I almost got in my fucking car and did donuts in the valet line while screaming the United States anthem at the top of my lungs.

xeQwVxPdzNw4HeqIKuPTaA.text: My best visit yet! I have been to this steak house several times but Luis made this experience better than all the rest. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and suggested the best steak I have ever had. He was also very friendly. George and Eric helped with the table as well and they were extremely personal-able. Overall 10 out of 10 experience.

l4Vc9LSjCDZQ_0Ym7kd-Hw.text: Decently yummy. Avocado bread. Get it!  I had quinoa salad stuff. It was good. Little bland but I realize it was a healthier option. Fiance got short rib hash, which was very tasty. Having both was a good balance. Wait staff pretty attentive. They were quick to refill the teas and coffees. Clean! Bright!
